detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented three bedroom terraced house, perfect for family living. Upon entering the home, you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway which conveniently leads to all the ground floor rooms including the fitted kitchen which is located at the front of the plan. The kitchen has been well fitted with a good selection of storage, appliance space and ample worktop space. Moving through the property, you will find a 17ft living room, offering a pleasant space for the family to enjoy with neutral carpets and double-doors opening to the rear garden. Offering ample versatility, the living rooms offers space for a large dining table and chairs making for the perfect space to entertain. Completing the ground floor is a useful W.C and spacious porch with fitted shelving. Stairs rise to first floor, where there are three spacious bedrooms. The master bedroom measures at an impressive 15ft and has the additional benefit of fitted storage. Completing this home is a modern family bathroom and a large, fully insulated and boarded loft with a pull-down ladder offering a mass of storage. An ideal space for first time buyers, the growing family and downsizes alike, take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a superb property located in a most desirable neighbourhood, close to schools and sought after green space.

Directions

From our Pinner office, turn right onto Bridge Street and continue to Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Road and proceed to the roundabout. At the roundabout, take the first exit and turn onto Joel Street. Proceed down Joel Street at take a left onto Middleton Drive which leads to Chamberlain Lane, the property is located on the left hand side.

Situation

This property on Chamberlain Lane is conveniently located between Northwood Hills and Eastcote and Pinner extensive high streets offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines are easily accessible at Eastcote Station which offers swift access into London, as well as many bus routes towards Harrow, Ruislip and Northwood. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. The charming village pub The Case is Altered and Eastcote Cricket club are a short walk away. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools including Coteford Infant and Juniors and Haydon Senior School along with the convenience of a number of leisure facilities including Highgrove Gym and Swimming Pool.

address: Carlton Place, Rickmansworth Road, Northwood, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
A bright and spacious two bedroom top floor apartment.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots, Costa Coffee and Baskin Robbins. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

Located on the second floor of an attractive, gated, purpose built block, this beautifully presented apartment has very spacious and well-proportioned rooms and the benefit of two private balconies.

A well maintained communal hallway, with lift, leads to the apartment door and in turn the reception hall. This has doors to all major rooms and two large storage cupboard one of which is large enough to be used as a study area. The sitting room is of great size and has doors leading to a private balcony that has stunning Westerly views onto the communal gardens and fields thereafter.

The kitchen is separate and has been redesigned to incorporate a spacious dining area. There are extensive cupboards, plenty of granite worktop space and built-in appliances to include a double oven and gas hob, extractor, fridge freezer and integrated dishwasher and washing machine. The kitchen further boasts an Easterly facing balcony overlooking the front of the development.

The master bedroom is of good size with built in wardrobes, views overlooking the gardens to the rear and recently fitted, modern en suite shower room. The en suite has a shower cubicle, vanitory unit with sink and underfloor heating. The second bedroom is again a spacious double room with built in wardrobes.

Externally the development is accessed through electric gates. The development has communal gardens with a large, gated lawn area and well-tended flower and shrub borders.

There is also one allocated parking space and a garage.

Square Footage: 1213 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 124 years remaining

detailedDescription:
This house is ideally positioned on one of Ickenham's most sought after roads and is ready to move straight into boasting luxury living whilst maintaining the relaxed, cosmopolitan ambience for which Ickenham is renowned. This stunning detached home will immediately impress having been finished to a high standard and enjoys a flexible floorplan with generously sized rooms throughout. This beautiful character family home provides four bedrooms, an open plan kitchen/dining room, large reception room, immaculate garden, and ample off street parking. For the commuter West Ruislip and Ickenham tube stations are also nearby. Alternatively the A40/M25 provides access into London and the Home Counties.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, proceed left and continue on Swakeleys Road. At the traffic lights, turn left on Thornhill Road. At the end of the road, turn right then, immediately left onto Warren Road.

Situation

Warren Road is a stroll to the Ickenham village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with it's direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40/M25. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Junior School and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure areas and facilities including Swakeleys Park, Ruislip Golf Course and Uxbridge Lesuire Centre which has a modern gym and swimming pool. Uxbridge Town Centre is a short drive, bus or train journey away and offers an extensive range of shops, restaurants and bars.

Description

A fabulous detached family home nestled on Warren road, one of the area's most sought after and prestigious locations. Offering expansive living and multiple entertaining space arranged over two floors, this gorgeous and substantial detached house of over 2009 sq ft has been designed and built to the highest quality.
On the ground floor, there is an entrance porch opening to the hall which leads to all the primary reception space including: A fabulous open plan kitchen with access to a large family room to the rear which impressively has bi-folding doors opening on to the garden. The bi-fold doors also have remote controlled electric blinds so you can choose to have light coming in or closed off. The family room flows through into the dining room. A separate study room can be found to the front of the house and can be accessed from a door in the hallway, this room also enjoys a large shower room. Completing the ground floor is a spacious lounge to the front of house. On the first floor the landing area leads to all four double bedrooms, the family bathroom and a separate w.c. There is also the benefit of an en-suite to bedroom two.
Beautifully appointed and with a continued elegance throughout this residence is ready made for a luxury lifestyle.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a welcoming driveway offering ample off street parking. To the left of the property there is lean to offering good storage space, and this also leads to the garden. To the rear there is a substantial private and secluded landscaped garden with a decked area to enjoy summer days and evenings.

This home is ideal for those that enjoy entertaining with two of the reception room opening to the south facing garden and substantial patio, whilst being ideally placed for those using public transport and access to Douay Martyrs & Vyners secondary schools as well as local shops at Hillingdon Circus. All in all a fantastic opportunity to secure a move into this sought after road.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This fabulous family home is a must see and one not to be missed. The fantastic decorative order makes it a superb choice for anyone seeking low maintenance living - ideal for the first home buyers, those looking to down size or a landlord looking to add to their portfolio. This property also has the added benefits of a self contained annex to the rear.

The house is in good condition throughout and features to the ground floor a welcoming porch, a front aspect living room that’s a great place for the family to retreat and spent time together, an open plan modern kitchen diner with plenty of space for a dining table and ideal for the chef of the house to conjure up any culinary delight and a timber framed conservatory/utility area to the rear. To the first floor you will find two double bedrooms, a very comfortable single bedroom and a family bathroom. Externally the property benefits from a front garden that has been converted into a driveway and a private rear garden with paved patio area, ideal for having family and friends over for those summer barbecues, having a more intimate dinner party, or simply unwinding after work with a good book. The property also has an out building that has been converted into a self-contained annex ideal for and elderly relative or an older child looking for a little independence.

This family home is perfectly located just off of Wood End Green Road and close to the Uxbridge Road in Hayes. Its also within walking distance to bus links and schools. In addition Hayes and Harlington Station is a short drive away and with Crossrail due to arrive in the very near future there are excellent rail connections to Paddington, Reading and beyond. Hillingdon Hospital, Brunel University, Heathrow Airport and Motorway connections are also within easy reach. Uxbridge town centre with its comprehensive collection of shops, restaurants, transport links and sports facilities is also close by.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Period semi detached house with garden room.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

This attractive Victorian semi detached house is located in a favoured road within the "Old Northwood" area of special local character and offers practical family accommodation internally. For those spending more time working from home, there is a recently installed "Green Retreats" garden office, but for the times Northwood Metropolitan Line tube station is required, it is conveniently situated approximately 0.3 miles away.

The house is approached through a storm porch with period balustrade. The reception has stairs and storage under and leads through to the family/dining space and in turn back round to the sitting room with bay window. The kitchen breakfast room is located to the rear with French doors to the garden. The kitchen cabinets are white with wooden work surfaces and integrated gas hob, extractor and oven. There is a guest cloakroom located off the breakfast room area.

The first floor offers a large main bedroom to rear with fitted wardrobes and an en suite shower room. The second and third bedroom share a family bathroom.

The rear garden is a real feature of the house and has patio to rear, a lawn area bordered by mature and varied shrubs and flower beds and side pedestrian access. To the rear of the garden is a recently installed garden office which features a large deck area to front, sliding double glazed doors, power, light and heating. Although used for work at present, it could also function for leisure pursuits or a gym as desired.

The front garden is mainly block paved for off street parking.

There is also a lapsed planning application 11093/app/2018/1178 which expired 30/05/20 for a part double storey, part single storey extension

Square Footage: 1463 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A beautiful, well maintained one bedroom apartment in a convenient location, nearby local shops, schools, transport links and motor way links.

Description

One bedroom first floor apartment found on the sought after 'Drayton Garden Village' development. The apartment offers great space and a very convenient location. That consists of entrance hallway, an open plan 23ft kitchen/living/dining room, an equally spacious 15ft bedroom with fitted wardrobe as well as a sublime three piece bathroom suite and ample storage space.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises of, hallway, an open plan kitchen/living/dining room, an equally spacious double bedroom with fitted wardrobe as well as a sublime three piece bathroom suite and ample storage space.

Sitution

West Drayton's position on the western edge of the Capital means that it is superbly placed to access Central London with ease, with frequent services to London Paddington in less than 25 minutes from the West Drayton Mainline Station. The property is situated in one of the most popular locations and offers the convenience of an excellent local bus service which is accessed on the main road. The station is within walking distance which is due to benefit from Crossrail and offers excellent access to London's Paddington. Other benefits include good access to West Drayton High street, Yiewsley and Uxbridge with their wide range of shopping facilities and amenities. Conveniently located close to Stockley Business Park, local bus routes, London International Heathrow Airport, M4, M40 and M25 motorways.

A town centre setting of consummate convenience, this one bedroom ground floor maisonette is immensely appealing to market newcomers, downsizers and investors alike. The property comes to the market benefitting from a private rear garden.

The accommodation briefly comprises of a private front door leading to the kitchen/dining room, a three-piece bathroom and a hallway with access to storage cupboards. Leading off the hallway is the reception room with a bay window flooding the room with natural light and a spacious double bedroom with a single door accessing the rear garden. Externally, there is a front garden which is mainly laid to lawn with access to the entrance of the property. To the rear aspect is a private garden area perfect for dining and entertaining during the warm summer months with a shed for extra storage.

Potter Street is ideally situated close to the vast array of shops, restaurants and transport facilities of Northwood Hills town centre.

detailedDescription:

Excellent potential to extend to the side, rear and into the loft (stpp) for this very well presented 3 bedroom semi detached house charmingly maintained by the present owner for over 60 years!
The property is located in a much sought after residential road just a short walk to Hayes Town shopping centre, a choice of schools and Hayes & Harlington station with Cross Rail anticipated 2022/23.
The accommodation comprises entrance hall lounge/dining room, fitted kitchen/breakfast room, upstairs has 3 good sized bedrooms + a bathroom, outside you have own driveway parking space in the front & to the side of an attached garage + a pretty front and rear garden.
Your earliest viewing is strongly recommended!

Full description:
This one bedroom Freehold house is ideal for couples and professionals looking for a location with great access to West Drayton High Street and Train Station (Cross Rail).
Downstairs, there is a spacious reception room leading to the re-fitted open plan kitchen.
Upstairs benefits from a a double bedroom with built in storage and a spacious fitted bathroom. Externally there are 2 allocated off-street parking spaces and an attractive enclosed garden which has been laid with decking, patio and astro-turf providing a high degree of privacy. The property also benefits from ownership of additional land by the side of the house.
This property presents a superb opportunity for commuters, first-time buyers and investors.

Situated in a quiet close, there are 2 off-street allocated parking spaces.
There is an enclosed front patio area leading to the property.

Outside the Property
The rear garden has new decking, astro-turf and a patio pathway, it also includes a storage shed. There is secure access.
Looking at the front of the property, to the right is an additional piece of land which belongs to the property.

title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial three bedroom semi-detached family home set in a popular road close to some of the areas sought after schools including St Swithun Wells, Deanesfield and Queensmead.

The accommodation comprises; Located off the hallway is a downstairs shower room with wc, a spacious lounge leading into the large kitchen which has ample space for a family dining table. Double French doors open out to the rear garden.

Rising to the first floor there are three bedrooms, two doubles and a single. A fresh fully tiled bathroom suite completes the first floor.

Outside the secluded rear garden has a paved patio adjacent to the property for dining out in the summer months, with a lawned area and pathway. While the front offers off street parking for multiple vehicles.

Long Drive is a popular location close to South Ruislip with its array of great shops and transport links (Central/Main line) providing swift access in to Central London, for the motorist the A40/M25 is also in close proximity. The property is ideal for families close to good schools, parks and leisure facilities.
title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This very well presented one bedroom top floor apartment is situated in the much sought after Rabournmead Drive development. The property has modern accommodation, parking and a long lease in excess of 250 years.

There is a secure communal entrance and stairs to the upper floors. The property has an entrance hall with two built-in storage cupboards and doors to all the rooms. The living room is light & bright with windows to dual aspects. The kitchen is well appointed with modern units & work surface areas, there is a modern bathroom and the double bedroom has wardrobes that will be remaining in the property.

Outside, there is a communal bin store, communal grounds and ample residents and visitor parking.

Rabournmead Drive is within a short walk of the central line station at Northolt, as well as within easy reach of the Met/Picc line stations at Eastcote & Ruislip Manor. The A40/M40/M25 road network is also easily accessible, as well as the local shops and a number of good schools.

This stunning apartment consists of hallway, open plan 22ft living room and fitted kitchen, 11ft bedroom with fitted wardrobe and is finished off with an attractive bathroom suite.

Directions

From West Drayton train station proceed left through West Drayton High Street and take your fifth left into Porters Way. Continue down Porters Way and take the fifth turning on the left into Wintergreen Boulevard. Brecon Lodge can be found on the right hand side.

Situation

Heathrow Airport, Stockley Business Park and the M4 are all within easy reach.

Description

Providing an excellent investment opportunity to acquire this stylish one bedroom apartment, located on the first floor which is currently let out until November 2021 and achieving £1050pcm. detailedDescription:
A well presented and spacious two bedroom ground floor apartment that is located within a small block on a sought after road in Ruislip. The accommodation itself comprises of a hallway, kitchen/diner, light filled living room and a family bathroom. Externally, the property is surrounded by well-maintained communal grounds and benefits from a garage in block and ample parking for all residents. Kestrel Court is located within Bembridge Gardens and is situated a short walk from both West Ruislip and Ruislip Station, with Ruislip High Street and its array of amenities also within walking distance.

Direction

From leaving our office on Ruislip High Street proceed right to the traffic lights. Proceed straight over the bridge to the mini roundabout and take your second exit right into Wood Lane. Take your first left into Chichester Avenue and Bembridge Gardens is the second turning on your left. Merlin Court is the last apartment block on the left hand side.

Situation

Merlin Court is a small sought after block of apartments located in Bembridge Gardens which is a popular tree lined residential road in Ruislip situated a short walk from both West Ruislip Central line station and Ruislip High Street with its array of amenities including Waitrose, Pizza Express, Cafe Rouge, Coffee shops and Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station. The property is also well appointed for a number of local schools and the A40 with its links to London and the Home Counties.

Description

A well presented and spacious two bedroom ground floor apartment that is located within a small block on a sought after location in Ruislip. The property is accessed via a well-kept communal entrance and comprises of a hallway which leads to a separate kitchen, living room, two well-proportioned bedrooms, a family bathroom and the kitchen is also fitted with integrated appliances . The living room offers an abundance of light and space with multiple large windows that provide views out to the communal garden areas, the property further benefits from a new boiler and windows. Ready to move in and conveniently located, the accommodation is well suited for first time buyers or presents a rewarding investment opportunity.

Outside

The property is surrounded by well maintained communal grounds and benefits from a garage in block and ample parking for all residents.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Coopers are delighted to market this stunning four bedroom detached character home. Offering scenic views across the central London landscape set on a prestigious road in Ickenham. This detached home offers versatile living for the growing family and is situated to nearby highly regarded schools and great transport links to the city center and home counties.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn left onto Swakeleys Road. At the first roundabout continue straight on. At the next roundabout take the second exit onto Harvil Road. The property is on your left hand side as you turn into Harvil Road

Situation

Harvil Road is a tree lined residential road that is regarded as one of Ickenham's sought after locations offering scenic views to a fantastic London outlook. The property is a stroll to the village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with it's direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear and Vyners Senior School.

Description

As you enter this imposing four bedroom detached home you are welcomed by a large entrance hall. Starting to the right hand side of the property you have a study overlooking the driveway, this can also be used as a playroom or fifth bedroom. To the rear of the property you have the large kitchen breakfast room offering a wonderful view onto the large rear garden. From the kitchen there is internal access to the garage. From the hallway to your left hand side you are welcomed by the substantial through lounge offering great space for the growing family to enjoy. From here you can access the garden via patio doors. Completing the downstairs accommodation you have a utility room, and following on from here is a shower room with w/c. As you proceed upstairs you have four good size bedrooms. The master bedroom offers fitted wardrobes and an en suite. There are two further double bedrooms and one single bedroom. Concluding with a large three piece family bathroom.

Outdoors

To the front of the property you have a large driveway providing off street parking for numerous vehicles. There is also access to the garage and the rear garden. To the rear of the property is a beautiful garden surrounded by eye catching greenery offering all round seclusion for privacy. Extending to approximately 250 ft it offers fantastic space for the growing family.

detailedDescription:
A three-bedroom "Warren" built semi-detached house that has been extended creating a spacious and flexible family home on one of Hillingdon's most sought-after roads and is within walking distance to Bishopshalt Secondary School. To the ground floor the property benefits from a porch and generous hallway with doors leading into the separate 14ft living room, 18ft kitchen/diner, 13ft conservatory downstairs W/C and utility room with a door leading to the 16ft garage. On the first floor, there is a landing that leads into the 13ft master bedroom, 12ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom. Outside there is off street parking and private rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and take the first turning on your left into Vine Lane.

Situation

Vine Lane is a much sought after, tree lined, residential road in Hillingdon Village offering easy access to local shops, sought after schools including Bishopshalt and Swakeleys School for Girls and numerous recreational facilities such as Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park and the fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Piccadilly/Metropolitan Line Station is a short distance away along with the A40/M40/M4 and M25 giving access to London and the Home Counties along with Heathrow Airport.

Description

A rare opportunity to purchase a three bedroom semi-detached house that was built by "Warren" who are renowned for their solid family homes and period features which include parquet flooring and high ceilings. The property has been extended creating both a spacious and flexible family home. To the ground floor the property benefits from a porch and generous hallway with doors leading into the separate 14ft living room, 18ft kitchen/diner, 13ft conservatory downstairs W/C and utility room with a door leading to the 16ft garage. On the first floor, there is a landing that leads into the 13ft master bedroom, 12ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property, there is a driveway creating off-street parking whilst allowing access to the 16ft garage. To the rear is a generous, west-facing garden with a patio across the rear of the property which leads on to a large lawned area with a variety of shrubs, plants, and high hedging for a sense of seclusion.

A Three Bedroom End of Terraced Family House which has the potential to extend (subject to planning permission)- EPC D

Description
Situated in a sought after location, tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac, this three bedroom end of terraced family home has a wealth of potential to modernise and refurbish to stamp your own mark and unlock the property's full potential with the additional benefit of the potential to extend (subject to planning permission). The well planned accommodation is arranged over two floors and is well worthy of your early inspection. To the ground floor there is an entrance hall, front aspect living room, dining room which then flows through in to the kitchen. From the kitchen there is access to the garden and outbuildings. Stairs from the entrance hall lead to the first floor landing which provides access to three good sized bedrooms (two doubles and a generous single) and a family bathroom.
Outside

Front: Low level brick wall to front boundary and one side boundary. A dropped kerb provides vehicular access to an own driveway/parking.
Rear: There is a good sized garden to the rear which requires landscaping to return it to its former glory.
Location

Within easy reach of Brunel University, Hillingdon Hospital and numerous well-regarded schools. Uxbridge and West Drayton centres are close by with a multitude of shopping facilities, restaurants, bus links and tube/train stations. The A40/M40 and M4 are a short drive away offering access to London, Heathrow, Stockley Park and the Home Counties.

Heating & Hot Water

A gas fired boiler serves the radiator system and provides the domestic hot water. Electric immersion heater in hot water cylinder.

We understand that the current council tax band is D.

Tenure

Freehold.

Services

Mains gas, electricity water and drainage.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive detached home located in a quiet residential road in the heart of Ickenham. This is a great family home briefly compromising a fitted kitchen, utility room, living/dining room, downstairs study room, four bedrooms, family bathroom and separate shower cubicle to the master. There is a secluded garden to the rear, driveway for off street parking and there is potential to extend subject to planning permission. Breakspear Junior school and Vyners secondary school is within walking distance whilst Ickenham Village is also a short stroll away.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn left and continue straight. Take your first right turning onto Rectory Way and the property is located around the corner on the left hand side.

Situation

Rectory Way is a quiet residential road in the heart of Ickenham Village offering easy access to local shops, restaurants, bus/road links and train stations. Ickenham Metropolitan and Piccadilly Line station is close by and West Ruislip station is within close proximity and offers the Central/ British Rail lines. For families there are a number of highly regarded local schools for all ages.

Description

On the ground floor there is a welcoming entrance hall with doors leading into all reception rooms, kitchen and W.C. The study room and w.c are located to the front of the property, the living/dining area is situated to the rear enjoying a featured fireplace and French doors opening onto the garden. The well presented kitchen is also to the rear overlooking the garden, there is ample work top and storage space, room for appliances and there is also a convenient utility room off the kitchen. On the first floor there are four bedrooms. The master bedroom is to the rear of the property and is a good size also benefiting from fitted wardrobes and a shower room. The second double bedroom is also to the rear and bedroom three and four are located to the front of the house, both nearly equal in size. Completing the first floor is the family bathroom.
Well presented throughout and offering well sized rooms over two floors the property is ready to move into and enjoy.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a driveway providing off street parking and a well maintained lawn area to the right. There is access to the rear garden via both sides of the house, the garden is secluded, with a large patio area closest to the house, a manicured lawn, shrub borders and a shed providing invaluable storage.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Seaford Close is set on a quiet road and perfectly located moments from local shops, schools and transport links. Ready made for relaxed living and boasting spacious rooms and an homely interior the residence is a perfect choice for comfortable living. The property briefly comprises four bedrooms, two reception rooms, one bathroom, a kitchen, garage, utility room, conservatory, study, own drive and private rear garden.

Directions

From our office on Ruislip High Street, turn right and continue to the end of the High Street. Turn right into Kingsend at the traffic lights. At the mini roundabout take the first exit onto Wood Lane. Take the first right into Chichester Avenue and then immediately right into Seaford Close. The property is a drive down on the left hand side.

Situation

Seaford Close is a quiet cul de sac in one of the most sought after residential roads in the heart of Ruislip Town Centre, offering easy access to all of Ruislip's trendy eateries, transport and amenities. Ruislip Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station is a short walk away. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip, serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to M40/M25 motorways, Central London and the Home Counties. detailedDescription:
Enjoy, relax and retreat to a terraced family home situated in the heart of Harefield. Boasting an idyllic and peaceful location the home enjoys breathtaking panoramic views of The Colne Valley whilst the well presented interior makes this home an enviable choice. Conveniently Uxbridge Town Centre, Rickmansworth and Gerrards Cross are a short drive away. For the family there is an excellent selection of both state and private schools nearby to include Harefield Academy, Harefield Junior school, Merchant Taylors, St.Helens. And St Clement Danes School.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High street turn left. At the mini roundabout take the first exit onto Bury street. Take the second left onto Ladygate lane continuing straight to the end of the road and turn left on to Breakspear Road South and continue to the end of the road and at the roundabout take the second exit onto Park lane. Take the first right onto Mount Pleasant and continue along the road, the property is on the right.

Situation

Mount Pleasant backs directly onto greenbelt common, offering stunning panoramic views across the Colne Valley with its lakes, country fields and The Chiltern Hills on the horizon. It is beautifully positioned in the peaceful Avenue that conveniently adjoins direct access to 'Belfry Open Spaces' and the bluebell woods of Park Wood Nature Reserve. Enjoy amazing views, beautiful walks and breath taking scenery. Within walking distance (0.6 miles) to Harefield Village and its extensive shops and amenities, it is well placed for flying, sailing, fishing, horse riding, football, cricket, shooting, golf and health & social clubs. London by tube is accessible via the Metropolitan line is at Northwood, Rickmansworth and Uxbridge. There is also the Chiltern Railway Line at Denham and Rickmansworth, with bus routes towards Uxbridge, Ruislip and Rickmansworth, and easy motorist access to the A/M40 and M25 offering connections to London and the home counties. Educationally Harefield is renowned for its Academy and Harefield Junior School was judged as 'outstanding' by Ofsted. There is also an excellent selection of both state and private schools nearby including Merchant Taylors and St.Helens.

Description

Upon entering the property through the porch, you immediately reach the main living room with stairs rising to the right hand side. The kitchen and dining area are located at the rear of the property with access to the rear garden. The first floor consists of three bedrooms and a family bathroom. This property offers a perfect opportunity to create your dream home in an ideal location within Harefield.

Outside

The rear garden is a low maintenance patio space.

Substantial 5 bedroom extended semi detached family home situated in a most sought after area of North Hayes close to a choice of favoured schools and walking distance to the main Uxbridge Road with its many shopping facilities and main bus route links for Uxbridge, Heathrow, Southall, Northolt, Ealing & Hayes Town (hayes & harlington station with cross rail anticipated 2022/23).
The property is well presented throughout with the accommodation comprising extended double glazed porch, entrance hall, lounge with 2 entrance doors, large kitchen/diner, family room, downstairs shower room/wc + downstairs double bedroom with en-suite shower room/wc.
The 1st floor has 3 good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom with a loft conversion providing a spacious Master bedroom with a separate toilet.
Outside has a easy maintained concrete rear garden with a large outbuilding divided into 3 rooms + a shower room/wc (currently used a Gym). The front has a gated own drive for 2 cars.
This property provides tremendous family accommodation and must be viewed to be fully appreciated.

detailedDescription:
River views / no upper chain: A 2 bedroom house situated in the sought after location of Longford Village with its two local public houses, petrol station and 24hr McDonalds drive through restaurant. Ideal for Terminal 5 and easy access to London Heathrow Airport. This spacious house is also convenient for the Bath Road and gives easy access to the M4/M25 motorway networks.

The property features a spacious living area with fitted kitchen, 2 double bedrooms, three piece fitted bathroom and conservatory.

Other features include gas central heating and double glazed windows. Outside is a private garden and residents parking.

Ground Floor

Entrance Porch

Laminate flooring and storage.

Lounge Area

13' 8'' x 15' 10'' (4.17m x 4.83m) Laminate flooring, radiator and double glazed window.

Kitchen / Diner

14' 0'' x 9' 8'' (4.27m x 2.95m) Laminate flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a butler sink unit, cooker point, gas hob, extractor fan hood, space for fridge/freezer, plumbing for washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed doors to aspect

Conservatory

Stone tiled flooring and radiator.

First Floor

Bedroom 1

10' 11'' x 12' 0'' (3.33m x 3.68m) Wooden flooring, radiator and double glazed window.

Bedroom 2

9' 6'' x 8' 6'' (2.9m x 2.6m) Wooden flooring, radiator and double glazed window.

Bathroom

Tiled flooring and radiator. Three-piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed bath, pedestal hand basin, low level W.C. And fully tiled walls and splashbacks. Frosted double glazed window.

Exterior

Outside

Front and rear gardens, both low maintenance with wooden shed.

Tenure

Freehold

About Longford

Longford is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the north western perimeter of London Heathrow Airport. Longford village is a linear development astride the original Bath Road and as such close to the M25/ M4 motorway networks with the newer Junction 14 of the M25 for Terminal 5 airport roads only.
There are several hotels, a McDonalds fast food restaurant and a petrol service station just on the outskirts of the Village and two Public Houses within the Village centre.
The area is characterized by an historic village core and similar-sized green buffer zones and much of the land surrounding the village of Longford is within the Metropolitan Green Belt.

Many of its buildings are included in the Longford Village Conservation Area which includes seven listed buildings. An old building, Yeomans, which has been subdivided into three flats is listed. Other listed buildings include Longford Cottage, Queen River Cottage and adjoining Willow Tree Cottage and King's Bridge which is the name of the 1834-built main bridge by the very last building at the west end of the (old) Bath Road street, which crosses the nearby siphoned off Longford River, which Charles I had constructed — this feeds Bushy Park and Hampton Court Gardens.

detailedDescription:
A superb three/four bedroom semi-detached house boasting bright and spacious rooms with beautifully appointed interior and features throughout, situated on this sought after residential road close to Eastcote and Ruislip Manor.

The ground floor comprises: A welcoming hallway that provides access to a spacious interconnecting living/dining room with a feature fireplace and double doors into the garden. The stylish kitchen offers a range of fitted units and integrated appliances with another door to the garden. From the kitchen, there is access into the additional reception room/fourth bedroom and completing the ground floor is the cloakroom.

To the first floor there are two double bedrooms, both with fitted wardrobes, a single bedroom and a modern family bathroom with a walk-in shower.

Externally the property boasts a large, private mature garden that is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area perfect for outdoor dining in the summer months. To the front there is a paved driveway providing multiple off-street parking.

Collins Drive is a quiet residential road in close proximity to Eastcote’s multiple shopping and transport facilities including the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines providing frequent services to London. There are also numerous local bus links. The area is well served by highly regarded primary and secondary schooling, children's play areas and recreational facilities.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional detached family home positioned on a commanding plot of .432 of an acre (dimensions taken from pro map) set behind private gates on one of Northwood’s most sought after private roads. This substantial residence offers detached triple garaging, a generous sized driveway and gated off street parking for multiple vehicles to the front. Heated outdoor pool in the large private and secluded rear garden. Internally the property is intelligently arranged over 3 floors with accommodation approaching 5650 sqft. Comprising of 7 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, 5 reception rooms, cinema room/games room, larger kitchen breakfast room and two w/c's.

The property is presented to a modern finish throughout and is brought to the market with the benefit of no onward chain. Internal viewing is highly recommended.

Northwood provides a range of shopping facilities, a Waitrose supermarket, numerous restaurants offering a wide choice of cuisines and multiple coffee shops. Nearby recreational centres include football, golf, cricket, tennis clubs and gyms. The area also offers a range of quality state and private schools, libraries and places of worship. Major motorway links to the M25 and M1 are nearby as is the Metropolitan line station providing access to Baker Street and the city beyond.

The property briefly comprises of 20ft living/dining room, 9ft kitchen, 9ft bedroom and a family bathroom. Outside there is off street parking and communal gardens.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill, take your first left on Vine lane, continue straight down and Vine Lane merges into Honey Hill and at the bottom turn right onto Hercies Road. Follow Hercies Road down to the end and take your last turning right into Auriol Drive where Magnolia court is situated on your left hand side.

Situation

Magnolia Court is a quiet development located on Hercies Road, a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon. There are a number of recreational facilities nearby including Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park with its tennis courts and bowls club and the newly opened fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars is a short distance away along with the A40 giving access to London and the Home Counties. Hillingdon train station with its direct links to Baker Street and the City is a short walk away along with a number of local shops.

Description

A rarely available one bedroom ground floor retirement home that has been updated and modernised throughout. The property briefly comprises of 20ft living/dining room, 9ft kitchen, 9ft bedroom and a family bathroom.

Outside

Outside the property has off street parking as well as well maintained communal gardens.

Location

detailedDescription:
A charming three bedroom detached house located on The Ridgeway which is in close proximity to both Eastcote High Street and Ruislip Manor shops, cafés, restaurants and transport facilities. Beautifully presented throughout the property briefly comprises of entrance hall, living room, kitchen and dining room, garden room, w.c cloakroom with shower, three bedrooms, and a family bathroom. Further benefits include a driveway and well maintained private rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office in Ruislip High Street, proceed left until you reach the mini roundabout. Turn right onto Eastcote Road. Continue down Eastcote Road and go straight over the mini roundabout. Take the next right into The Ridgeway and the property is a short drive on the right.

Situation

The Ridgeway is located between Ruislip Manor and Ruislip High Street with a selection of shops, cafés, restaurants and transport facilities. Ruislip tube station (Metropolitan / Piccadilly line) with links to the city and west end is at the end of the High Street. Ruislip Manor station is a short walk away at the top of Victoria Road and West Ruislip or Ruislip Gardens (Central / br) stations are located a short distance away. For the motorist the A40/M25 providing access London and the Home Counties is nearby. This house is In the catchment area for a number of highly regarded schools including Bishop Ramsey.

Description

A beautiful detached house, providing an ideal setting for contemporary family living. With generously proportioned rooms, and a choice of multiple living areas, this three bedroom residence will impress those seeking space and character. Upon entering the residence, you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway providing access to all ground floor rooms. The the front, a large living room which benefits from a large window bringing in excellent lighting. The rear of the property offers a kitchen and dining room which provides amazing views, and direct access to the rear garden. The ground floor is complete with a garden room at the rear and a bathroom. The first floor comprises of three bedrooms and a family bathroom with a bath, shower, hand wash basin and a separate W.C.

Outside

The front driveway has been paved to provide plenty of off street parking for multiple cars. The rear of the property consists of an attractive garden laid to lawn with a variety of shrubs and trees with separate paved patio towards the property. There is also a storage shed.

detailedDescription:
Nestled away in the heart of almost 5 acres of serene sanctuary-like space is this stand alone large, detached residence surrounded by endless tranquillity offering the height of privacy to welcome its new occupants.

In addition to the main residence, the masses of open space envelopes a variety of outbuildings to include a large, sheltered barn, several fitted stables, detached garages and outhouses.

The versatility of this property needs to be seen to be absorbed and appreciated in its fullest.

Currently set up as a functional and well-equipped equestrian centre, the scope to continue and expand the current facility is strong.

Alternatively, on offer is the potential for further development or an inviting opportunity for any business venture that would require or be complimented by acres of green space such as a wedding venue or garden centre / nursery or an exclusive restaurant premises (subject to the relevant planning permissions). In any case, this property is guaranteed to open avenues of unimaginable grandeur in the years to come.

Located striking distance away from the ever-popular Uxbridge Road, the convenience this site has to offer is completely disguised by the sheer scale of space.

What can only be described as an utterly Unique Opportunity, this is a once in a lifetime chance to acquire a site that may not be available again for decades to come.

The brief outline of the site and outbuildings encompass:

The Main Residence
A large double fronted detached house comprising of an inviting entrance hallway leading to a lounge which runs the full depth of the property which is mirrored by a diner on the opposite side, separated by a modern fitted kitchen, ground floor bathroom with separate WC and various storage units. The first floor has a large open landing leading to three sizeable bedrooms including an en-suite to the master bedroom and a separate fitted WC.
External


There is a four sided garden with the house leading to a double detached garage

Double garage
Sitting in the shadows of the main residence is a large detached double garage with up and over doors

Stables
There is a collection of 13 individual horse stables as part of the opening detached building with fitted stable doors which have the potential to be rented offering an income stream.

Stables Two
A second detached outbuilding comprises a further 8 stables with a separate tack room, fitted kitchen and feed store. The kitchen is fully fitted with eye and base level units and rolled edge work surfaces incorporating stainless steel sink drainer unit and space and plumbing for washing machine, part tiled walls, fully tiled flooring.

Barn
Large shielded barn

Storage
There is a detached storage facility comprising of 5 individual units

There are a collection of various sheds and garages placed throughout the site

Open Land
Far reaching span of land laid to lawn

detailedDescription:
A much loved three bedroom detached family home perfectly placed at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac with stunning views overlooking fields - EPC D

Description
Nestled in a sought after cul-de-sac and enjoying attractive views overlooking fields. A rare opportunity to purchase this much loved three bedroom detached family home offering a wealth of potential for a buyer to stamp their own mark and boasting easy access to all amenities including local shops, schools and bus links to Hillingdon Hospital, Brunel University, Uxbridge College and Uxbridge Town Centre. The well proportioned accommodation comprises of porch, hallway, generous sized open plan living room/dining room and a conservatory looking out on to the rear garden. The galley style kitchen has an array of base and eye level units and flows in to the breakfast room which also has access to the garden. The garage completes the downstairs accommodation. From the first floor there is a stunning outlook over open space with far reaching views as far as Harrow on the Hill. There are two good sized double bedrooms, both with ample fitted wardrobe space and a generous single bedroom complete with a built in wardrobe. The substantial family bathroom includes both a jacuzzi-style bath and separate shower enclosure. To complete the accommodation, there is a well insulated, substantial sized loft perfect for your storage needs.
Outside

Front: Low level brick wall to front boundary and mature shrubbery surround. A dropped kerb provides vehicular access to an own driveway/parking which leads to the garage.
Rear: Patio area to the side of the conservatory which flows to mainly laid to lawn with beautiful mature borders on both sides. Mature trees towards the end of the garden and a generous sized outbuilding for further storage.
Location

Within easy reach of a number of schools, local shops, Hillingdon's Metropolitan/Piccadilly line tube station, Hillingdon hospital and Brunel University. The A40/ M40 and M4 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away along with Uxbridge Town centre and its multitude of shopping facilities.

Windows

Double glazed sealed unit windows.

Heating & Hot Water

A gas fired boiler serves the radiator system and provides the domestic hot water. Electric immersion heater in hot water cylinder.

Council Tax Band

We understand that the current council tax band is F.

Tenure

Freehold.

Services

Mains gas, electricity water and drainage.

Viewings

Strictly by appointment with R Whitley & Co.

detailedDescription:
A substantial five bedroom detached residence that will immediately impress with its spacious rooms, living spaces and elegant, beautifully appointed interior throughout. The property boasts five bedrooms, four bathrooms along with a wonderful kitchen with additional breakfast room. Two large living rooms finish the ground floor with ample room to relax. The garden is a fantastic space which perfectly suitable for a family with an artificial lawn and beautiful patio. Further benefits include a large carriage driveway.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High Street, turn left and continue to the end. At the mini roundabout turn left onto Bury Street. The property is a short drive down on the left hand side on the corner of St Catherines Road.

Situation

Bury Street leads straight to Ruislip's bustling High Street where a vast number of shops, restaurants and transports links can be found including Waitrose, Tesco Express, various restaurants and coffee bars. Alternatively the Duck Pond and Library are 2 minutes’ walk away. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to Central London via the M25 and the M40. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area. Ruislip Station is only half a mile away making travelling into the City via the Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines swift and easy. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip which is serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including bwi, Whiteheath and Sacred Heart Primary schools and Bishop Ramsey Secondary school. Ruislip Woods, Highgrove and Riverside Health club are all nearby.

Description

The front door of the property opens up to the porch and then the impressive hallway with stairs rising to the left and access to ground floor rooms ahead. Leading to the back of the property you enter the family room with access to the garden as well as the kitchen. The large, modern kitchen is part of the properties extension which stretches from the front to the back of the home with a dining area and bi-folding doors heading out to the rear garden patio. The kitchen is wonderfully appointed with a range of worktop and storage space as well as integrated appliances, the kitchen is finished with a separate utility room. Also off of the hallway is the relaxing living room boasting size in excess of 28ft with views of the garden. To the far side of the home is the imposing, self contained annexe with its own double bedroom, en suite bathroom and integrated kitchen. Completing the ground floor is the w.c in the hallway. The first floor includes four double bedrooms all of which benefit from built in storage and two include en suites. The first floor is complete with a further family bathroom that consists of a shower, bath, basin and w.c.

Outside

The front of the property is a large carriage driveway offering an abundance of off street parking. The rear garden is wonderfully appointed

detailedDescription:
Perfectly arranged, this substantial four bedroom detached residence boasts a stunning, high quality finish throughout making it perfect for modern, family living. Offering grand proportions and both indoor and outdoor entertaining space. The property comprises of four bedrooms, en-suite to the master room, family bathroom, modern fitted kitchen, large living room and a double garage.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High Street, turn left and continue to end. At the mini roundabout turn left onto Bury Street. The property is a short drive up past Miller & Carter, on the left hand side.

Situation

Bury Street is a 5-10 minute walk from the bustling High Street where a vast number of shops, restaurants and transports links can be found to include Waitrose, Tesco Express, numerous pizza outlets and coffee bars. Alternatively the Duck Pond and Library are also at the end of the road. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area. Ruislip Station only half a mile away, travelling into the city via the Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines couldn't be easier. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip, serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including bwi, Whiteheath, Sacred Heart and Bishop Ramsey. Ruislip Woods, Highgrove, Ruislip Bowls club are all 5 minutes walk away.

Description

A beautiful double fronted four bedroom detached house which blends traditional themes with smart modern additions providing an ideal setting for family living. Briefly comprising a magnificent entrance hallway, which leads to the naturally lit living area with double doors leading into the dining room; with direct access to the garden through patio doors. The dining room flows through into a modern kitchen which has tiled flooring and splash back and breakfast bar. There is also a guest cloakroom and direct access into the garage which has been transformed into a gymnasium with a range of fitted units. On the first floor there are four bedrooms, a stylish family bathroom. The master bedroom benefits from its own deluxe en suite. This superb residence offers flowing interiors and private outdoor areas delivering the ultimate family haven.

Outside

The property offers off street parking for multiple cars via own gravel driveway. Although the garage is currently used as a gymnasium it could be used for secure off street parking. To the left is a gate providing side and rear access. Gate to the right of the property leads to a shed which provides invaluable storage. The rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with separate raised decked area to enjoy those summer months.

A well-presented, one bedroom apartment situated in a popular development in Hayes. The property comprises an entrance hall, 18ft kitchen/ living area, 18ft bedroom, and family bathroom. The property boasts two private balconies, gated allocated parking, well-kept communal gardens, and a children's play area.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and at the traffic lights turn right onto the Harlington Road. Continue straight down over the two mini-roundabouts and once you reach the West Drayton Road traffic proceed straight over. Take the fifth turning on your left onto Judge Heath Lane. Continue over the roundabout and Varcoe Gardens is the first turning on your left. Turn left and continue on Varcoe Gardens until you reach Batford House on your left.

Situation

Varcoe Gardens is a popular new build development constructed in 2010 and is positioned just off Judge Heath lane offering easy access to local shops, schools, and bus/road links including the M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties. Hayes town centre with its National Rail Station (Crossrail 2019) is just over a mile away while Stockley Park, Heathrow Airport, and Uxbridge town centre with its multitude of shops, bars, restaurants and Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station are just a short drive away

Description

A one bedroom, second floor apartment that has been modernised throughout and would be ideal for both first-time buyers and investors alike. The property is accessed via a communal entryphone system with stairs leading to the second floor. There you will find a private front door that provides access into the hallway with doors leading to the 18ft kitchen/ living area, 18ft bedroom and bathroom.

Outside

The property boasts two private balconies, gated allocated parking along with well-kept communal gardens and a children's play area.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are very excited to be marketing this beautiful three bedroom semi-detached home, located in a peaceful cul-de-sac and presented in excellent condition throughout. The home also boasts a generous rear garden and potential to extend subject to planning/building regulations. The property is a short walk from Hillingdon Hospital and moments away from regular bus services toward Uxbridge, West Drayton and Hayes. This spacious home comprises of an entrance hallway and stairs to the first floor, a light and airy front living room and double doors into the dining room, a modern galley kitchen, two large double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a modern bathroom with separate shower.

To the rear, a large lawn and a tidy lawn front garden with potential for off street parking subject to planning.

This property will be sold with no onward chain.

Location

The property can be found a short distance from Hillingdon Hosptial and Brunel University, located just off Peel Way and Pield Heath Road, making the property a stand out opportunity from a rental prospective and ideal for professionals and families.

The property is positioned on a quiet and peaceful side road. The area is also densely populated with many primary and secondary schools such as Bishopshalt Secondary school. Additionally the property is only a few minutes walk from the nearest bus routes which can connect you to Uxbridge (Met and Piccadilly Line), West Drayton (Crossrail) and an array of shops, restaurants, bars, pubs, clubs, banks and more.

The first floor includes a landing with loft access, a three-piece family bathroom and two double bedrooms with an en-suite shower room off the main bedroom.

West Ruislip and South Ruislip Stations are also a short drive or bus ride away if the Central or Chiltern Lines are required. detailedDescription:
Coopers present this impressive, top floor, two double bedroom apartment that is immaculately presented with nothing to do but move in and enjoy. The Island Apartments is adjacent to the Grand Union Canal in Coppermill Lock. Denham Railway Station is 2.2 miles away with under a 30 minute journey to Marylebone and is about 5 miles from Junction 17 of the M25 at Chorleywood with its connections to the M1, M4 and M40. Rickmansworth Aquadrome and Denham Waterski Club are also close by.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High street turn left. At the mini roundabout take the first exit onto Bury street. Take the second left onto Ladygate lane continuing straight to the end of the road and turn left on to Breakspear Road. Turn left onto Breakspear road south and continue to the end of the road then take the second exit onto Park lane. Take the seventh right turn onto Longroom and the property can be found on the left hand side over the bridge.

Situation

The Island Apartments are adjacent to the Grand Union Canal in Coppermill Lock. Harefield village is just over a mile away and provides a selection of local shops and country pubs with Rickmansworth High Street offering a good selection of shops and supermarkets. Denham Railway Station is 2.2 miles away with under a 30 minute journey to Marylebone and is about 5 miles from Junction 17 of the M25 at Chorleywood with its connections to the M1, M4 and M40.

Description

A beautiful apartment with a stunning specification set beautifully on the Grand Union Canal. The front door opens into a wide hallway with generous storage cupboards on the right and a utility cupboard on the left hand side. The living/dining/kitchen is a fabulous open plan living space with tranquil views over the canal and the kitchen is beautifully appointed with integrated appliances. There are two balconys and an abundance of light flooding the room through the windows. There are two double bedrooms, both benefitting from built in storage with the master boasting an en suite and private balcony. Completing the property is a stunning bathroom complete with bath, basin and w.c.

Outside

The communal ground are well maintained with the lawns being cut and the shrubbery boarders being looked after. There are two allocated parking spaces for this property.

A one bedroom first floor apartment located in a prime location close to Hillingdon Hospital and Heathrow airport. An Ideal Investment or first time purchase

The accommodation comprises of entrance hallway with storage cupboard, living room with front aspect windows, kitchen breakfast room, bedroom and family bathroom.

Outside
the 1980's built block is surrounded by communal gardens and attractive boarders. The property has an allocated parking bay.

Clarkes Drive is a residential road by Hillingdon hospital and just a short walk from Brunel University. There are a number of bus/road links close by creating easy access to the M4 and M25 along with Uxbridge town centre with its multitude of shops, restaurants, bars and Piccadilly/Metropolitan line train station.

address: Nine Acres Close, Hayes, Middlesexx UB3
detailedDescription:
Stones welcome to the market this Barrett built family home ideally placed close to shops, schools & Hayes & Harlington Crossrail station, this semi-detached family home offers ample space throughout with a converted garage and conservatory.

The property is comprised over three floors with the ground floor benefiting from a large lounge, fully fitted kitchen, a glass built conservatory, downstairs W/C & a converted garage currently being used as a bedroom with an shower en-suite.
To the first floor are three bedrooms and family bathroom with fitted wardrobes throughout. The second and final floor includes the master fifth bedroom which covers the entire floor. This too has an en-suite with built in wardrobes for plenty of storage.

Other benefits include a low maintenance garden and a driveway for at least one car.

Nine Acres Close is within easy reach of Hayes Town with its array of shops, eateries and bus routes. Hayes and Harlington station offers access into Central London and beyond. Within the local area are schools including Pinkwell Primary School and Harlington School.

address: Fairfield Road, Yiewsley, West Drayton UB7
detailedDescription: This turn of the century end of terrace dwelling is situated just off Yiewsley High Street and within half a mile of West Drayton Main Line Station. This link is on the planned Crossrail route and services London Paddington. Good road links are easily accessible including the A4, M4, A40, M40 and M25. The property is currently a four bedroom dwelling with a spacious plot to side and a double garage to rear. The site offers scope for conversion of the main dwelling into flats and potential for a new build house on the side, subject to obtaining any necessary consent that may be required. We understand historically this property did have permission granted for conversion although this has now expired. The house is currently let on an assured shorthold tenancy at £2000 pcm (£24,000 pa) and is sold with the benefit of this income.

address: "Plot 17" at Provident Industrial Estate, Pump Lane, Hayes UB3
detailedDescription:
**new london help to buy available**

Fairview New Homes – NewHayes

A collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom duplexes in Hayes, UB3.

Plot 17

Plot 17 is a stylish and modern two bedroom, two bathroom, first floor apartment with a private balcony. Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes features landscaped gardens and family-friendly woodland areas and a choice of open green spaces. It comes complete with an open-plan living area and a fully-fitted kitchen with integrated appliances.

The Area

Being able to escape to a choice of open green spaces is what makes NewHayes
a unique place to live. Here youll find a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens with social and quiet areas to a family-friendly woodland area, with plenty of space to play in. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green
oasis for the whole community to enjoy.

Travel Options

Hayes & Harlington Station is just an 8 minute walk away, meaning you can be at London Paddington in 29 minutes. By car, you can be on the M4 in as little as 4 minutes, while quick journeys to Heathrow Airport bring the whole world closer.

Lifestyle

You’ll quickly discover that Hayes offers more than just a new address. Just a short distance away are supermarkets, high street shops, cafes and bars. Plus there are a number of gyms and The Beck theatre is just over a mile away.

For families, there are Ofsted-rated schools for all ages and if you want to step away to somewhere more tranquil, enjoying outdoor space is simple too. Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. Other open spaces within a short drive of NewHayes include Northala Fields, Lake Farm Country Park and Kew Gardens, which is just a 17 minute drive. Plus, the Grand Union Canal is nearby for whenever you want a waterside walk.

The future of Hayes

Hayes & Harlington Station which currently operates Great Western services and is only an 8 minute walk away from NewHayes, will benefit from major improvements in preparation for the new Elizabeth line services.

Once complete, Crossrail will run from Reading in the West to Shenfield in the East and bring journey times for NewHayes residents to a multitude of central London locations down significantly.

  • Separate kitchen, floor tiled – Boulevard Grey
Beautiful Bathrooms

Relaxing Bedrooms

About Newhayes

A well-connected place to call home

Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes is an exciting new development. With a brand new selection of modern, well-designed studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, including wheelchair accessible apartments and parking. Youll easily find the one youll want to come home to.

Close by are a good range of amenities, Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. For commuters, Hayes & Harlington Station is within an 8 minute walk for journeys to Heathrow Airport (Terminals 2 & 3) in 6 minutes, Ealing Broadway in 9 minutes and London Paddington in 21 minutes.

With much regeneration in Hayes, including an entertainment and leisure complex, our new development offers buyers a home in a well-connected part of West London.

  • Something for everyone with supermarkets, high street shops, cafs and bars within walking distance. There are also a number of gyms if you want to keep fit and healthy, and for live music or comedy fans, The Beck Theatre is just over a mile away.
  • Getting around the Capital and beyond perfect for commuters, you can easily reach Hayes & Harlington Station within an 8 minute walk for journeys to London Paddington in 21 minutes and Heathrow airport is just a 26 minute walk or bus journey.
  • Relax into a new way of life – a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens to a family-friendly woodland area. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green oasis for the whole community to enjoy.
  • Education for all ages just a short distance away is a range of Ofsted-rated schools, all offering good levels of education for children of all ages.

title: 3 bed detached bungalow for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on one of Eastcote’s most sought after roads, with easy access to the shopping amenities and transport links of Eastcote we are delighted to present this semi detached two bedroom bungalow within the catchment area of several highly sought after schools including Field End Infant and Junior Schools.
The accommodation is comprised of a spacious reception room, fitted kitchen, two good sized bedrooms, a shower room and conservatory. Externally there is ample off street parking to the front of the property and it has a low maintenance private garden to the rear.
Perfectly positioned just a short distance from Eastcote’s shopping and transport facilities including the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Line Station which offers services into London in less than thirty minutes. Central line services are also available a short driveway and for the motorist the A40, M40 and M25 are easily accessible.

address: Bridgwater Road, Ruislip Manor, Ruislip HA4
detailedDescription:
Ideally situated for access to Ruislip Gardens station (Central Line) as well as the A40 for the motorist, is this beautifully presented comfortable two bedroom terrace house with a large conservatory to the rear. The house is in good decorative order and benefits from a kitchen / diner, double glazed windows, plus a large conservatory and a private garden to the rear. Both the gas boiler and electrical installation have been checked and certified with a new fuse board been installed in the last month.

Accommodation is arranged over two floors, on the ground floor there is a front reception room with a bay window to the front aspect. To the rear is a kitchen / diner which is fitted with a modern kitchen with an integrated fridge / freezer, dish washer, double oven and hob. There is a large conservatory to the rear opening into the rear garden.

On the first floor there are two double bedroom an the bathroom with is modern and comprised of a panel enclosed bath with an overhead shower, a low level wc and a wash hand basin.
Outside


There is a small paved garden to the front while to the rear is a garden laid to lawn with a paved patio area for garden furniture.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Robsons is pleased to present this first class detached family residence situated on Ickenham’s most exclusive private road, this property has been completed to the highest standard throughout boasting five bedrooms and living accommodation across three impressive floors. To the ground floor is a marble tilled entrance lobby with access to three spacious Georgian styled reception rooms all flooded with natural light from the sash windows, a bespoke kitchen/breakfast room featuring a center island as well as a range of integrate appliances, a study, guest cloakroom and basement. The lower ground floor hosts a substantial open plan entertainment suite complete with a solid granite bar as well as space for seating for a cinema and games area. Further to this floor is a gymnasium, a unique sauna room, utility room and two guest cloakrooms.

To the first floor is a master bedroom suite with French doors opening onto a balcony, a dressing room and a deluxe bathroom. Four further bedrooms can be found on this floor (three complete with en-suites). The property is set on stunning grounds, to the rear of the property is an outdoor fully heated and self-cleaning swimming pool surrounded by a patio area leading to steps onto a well-manicured lawn area featuring trees and shrubbery providing ultimate privacy. Scenic views of the golf course can be seen in the distance. This residence is approached by a sweeping gravel driveway with a grand pillared entrance. Finally this spectacular home boasts ample off street parking with the security of electric gates.

The Drive is the most prestigious private road in Ickenham just over a mile from the picturesque village where shops, restaurants and transport links can be found. There are excellent train links which include the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station at Ickenham and Hillingdon where there is a swift and regular service to Baker Street. There is a good selection of Schooling both state and private.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
An impressive four bedroom detached home offering an abundance of space for the growing family to enjoy, with the potential to maximise the ground floor living space by converting the double garage. The property is situated on a highly sought-after road close to local amenities, schools and transport links.

The ground floor comprises an entrance hallway with a guest cloakroom, a bright and welcoming through lounge that provides access to the garden, a separate dining room and a conservatory. Completing the ground floor is a kitchen/breakfast room featuring a range of fitted units and a breakfast bar. To the first floor there is an impressive master bedroom benefiting from fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, three further bedrooms with two of them also having fitted wardrobes, and a modern family bathroom. Externally the property offers a well-kept garden that is laid to lawn with a patio area. To the front there is a driveway providing off-street parking and a double garage

Dukes Ride is one of the areas premium roads located off The Drive in a peaceful location. Ickenham Village is close by and offers a variety of shopping facilities and restaurants, with Uxbridge town Center just a short distance away offering a wider variety. For commuters, Ickenham train station provides the Metropolitan and Piccadilly line services into London, and there is easy access to the A40/M40 for motorists. The area is well served by highly regarded primary and secondary schooling including Vyners Secondary School and Breakspear Primary School

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market chain free, this sensationally placed three bedroom home boasts bright and spacious living accommodation throughout and is ideally located only foot steps from Uxbridge Town Centre.

The property briefly comprises of an entrance hall, an open plan refitted kitchen/diner with appliances and a spacious reception room with access to the rear garden. To the first floor are three spacious bedrooms, a two piece family bathroom suite, a W/C and a store cupboard. To the rear is a private garden backing onto the canal, perfect for alfresco dining in the summer months. To the front of the property there is allocated parking.

Braybourne Close is situated at the bottom of Uxbridge High Street, within very easy reach of the shopping centre, bars, restaurants and the Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line Station which provides a frequent service into the heart of London. Brunel University and Hillingdon Leisure Centre are also close by.
