detailedDescription:
This two bedroom purpose-built apartment boasts space, style and a well-considered design and offers high quality features and fittings throughout. Upon entering the home, you are immediately greeted by the hallway providing access to the spacious 16ft living room with a mass of natural light via a row of large windows and a balcony. To the left, there is a contemporary kitchen. The kitchen itself is modern and offers ample worktop space and storage. Heading towards the rear of the home is second hallway providing direct access to all other rooms. The property is completed by two spacious bedrooms and a family bathroom. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a great apartment within the heart of Pinner Green.

Directions

From our Pinner office on Bridge Street, head towards Chapel Lane and continue straight for 0.1 miles before reaching the roundabout. Take the second exit onto West End Lane and then your first left onto High View. Proceed straight before turning right onto Cuckoo Hill. Nursery Road can be located a short distance up on the right hand side.

Situation

Tulip Court is situated in a popular location and only moments to both Pinner and Northwood Hills High Street. These high streets benefit from an array of restaurants, shops, cafés and bars. The Metropolitan Line can be accessed from Pinner and Northwood Hills Station and this line commutes into the heart of Central London within approx 30 minutes and easy access towards Watford and Rickmansworth. Harlyn Primary School and Haydon Secondary School can also both be found just moments from this property making it well suited for families. This home offers a fantastic opportunity to be both private and convenient.

Description

This two bedroom purpose-built apartment boasts space, style and a well-considered design and offers high quality features and fittings throughout. Upon entering the home, you are immediately greeted by the hallway providing access to the spacious 16ft living room with a mass of natural light via a row of large windows and a balcony. To the left, there is a contemporary kitchen. The kitchen itself is modern and offers ample worktop space and storage. Heading towards the rear of the home is second hallway providing direct access to all other rooms. The property is completed by two spacious bedrooms and a family bathroom. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a great apartment within the heart of Pinner Green.

Outside

The property benefits from residence parking, well-maintained communal gardens and a garage.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stylish and contemporary semi detached family home is a must see and one that's not to
be missed, as it has been tastefully decorated and maintained by the current owner with attention to
detail and a high standard throughout. The property offers a wealth of space throughout,
a modern finish whilst maintaining character features and enjoying a peaceful position within one of Hillingdon Village's premier Cul-De-Sac's

To the ground floor there is a spacious and welcoming entrance hallway, a front facing open plan living/dining room with a focal fireplace, a spacious modern fitted kitchen ideal for the chef of the house to conjure up any culinary delight, a handy utility room and downstairs W/C. The ground floor is finished off with a delightful conservatory with panoramic views of the garden. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms, a comfortable single bedroom that could also be used for a study and the family bathroom with a free standing bath and separate shower. Finishing off this fantastic home is the converted loft space that is now a perfect master bedroom with its own en-suite shower room. Externally the property benefits from a front garden that has been partially convert into a large driveway for many cars and a private rear garden with an amazing decked seating areas, ideal for having family and friends over for those summer barbecues, children to play or simply unwinding after work with a glass of wine and good book.

Bishops Close is situated just off Vine Lane in Hillingdon Village which is moments from Uxbridge, with its vast array of shops, restaurants and bars. Uxbridge Underground Station has access to both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly line, and the A40 and M25 are a short drive away. There are many well regarded schools in close proximity. Also Brunel University, Uxbridge College, Uxbridge Common and Hillingdon Leisure Centre with its popular lido and sports grounds are nearby..

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Sentis Court, 8 Carew Road, Northwood HA6
detailedDescription:
Bright and spacious first floor apartment with large South facing balcony.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

A conveniently located and very well presented three double bedroom, first floor apartment with large private balcony overlooking communal gardens and the added benefit of a garage en bloc.

Located to the rear of the development in a block with just two other apartments is this extremely well presented, three double bedroom first floor flat. The communal hallway has stairs to the first floor.

The apartment itself has a bright and spacious reception hallway with two large storage cupboards and window to side. The spacious sitting room is situated to the rear of the property with a dual aspect and sliding doors onto a large private balcony. The balcony has a South facing aspect with lovely views onto the secluded and well maintained communal gardens. An abundance of storage cupboards run along one side, with one housing a tumble dryer. The kitchen and dining room are separate to the sitting room with the dining area served by air conditioning. The kitchen is fully fitted with contrasting wooden effect base and cupboard units and darker stone work surfaces. The appliances are integrated with a gas hob and the kitchen has views onto the communal gardens.

The principal bedroom is situated to the front of the property with a vast array of built in wardrobes, air conditioning and access to a fully tiled en-suite bathroom with sink, WC, bidet and bathtub. On the opposite side of the apartment to the main bedroom are two further double bedrooms with bedroom two housing built in wardrobes and bedroom three that is currently arranged as a study. The apartment is complete with a shower room located off the hallway.

The apartment is situated in attractive gardens with well-tended lawns and borders. There is a garage located en bloc and additional visitor parking.

Square Footage: 1295 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Set in a peaceful and private setting within close proximity of Uxbridge town centre this attractive property combines period charm with modern interiors and features a stunning Kitchen breakfast room.

Description

A very attractive period property positioned in this superb location laid out over three spacious levels.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises, open plan living and dining space with laminate flooring, front aspect double glazed window, cast iron fireplace, built in storage double, there are stairs to the first floor and double doors that open into the superb kitchen dining room with a vaulted ceiling, being fitted with a very good range of storage units and drawers, ample quartz work surfaces, inset ceramic sink integrated twin Neff ovens with integrated plate warmers, induction hob above and extractor over, integrated dishwasher and space for a fridge freezer, tiled flooring and double glazed doors overlooking and opening onto the rear garden, the luxurious bathroom features a large enclosed bath with shower over, vanity wash basin, WC, front aspect double glazed window, partly tiled walls and tiled flooring.

detailedDescription:
Positioned on a beautiful tree lined road is this four bedroom detached home. The property offers fantastic living space and is presented in excellent condition throughout making it the ideal home for a family to move straight into and enjoy. It is located Copthall Road West which is a stroll to Ickenham village and it's selection of shops, trendy eateries and transport connections. The local schools are in close proximity and include The Breakspear School and Vyners Secondary School with sixth form college.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn left. Continue up Swakeleys Road until you get to the set of traffic lights. After these, take the u-Turn, then take the first left onto Derwent Avenue. At the end of the road, follow around to the left and the property is located on the left hand side.

Situation

Copthall Road West is an aesthetically pleasing tree lined road in one of Ickenhams popular locations. Close to local transport links such as the A40, M40 and M25 where you can get into Central London and the home counties very easily. Alternatively, bus links are approximately a 10 minute walk away taking you to Ickenham, Ruislip and Uxbridge. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Breakspear and Vyners Secondary School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Uxbridge and Ruislip Golf Club, Fusion gym and leisure centre as well local parks such as Breakspear and Swakeleys.

Description

This beautiful detached character home is pleasing on the eye and comes with an abundance of space for a growing family. The ground floor comprises; an entrance porch and hallway, front reception room with bay window, a through lounge with access to the garden, a fourth bedroom with access to a shower room, and the kitchen. The kitchen is a fantastic size and comes with ample worktop space, base and eye level units, and space for all your required appliances including an american style fridge/freezer. There is also a breakfast bar overlooking the garden. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a single third bedroom. Bedroom one is front facing and has a bay window. Bedroom two is to the rear and comes with fitted wardrobe space. Completing the upstairs accommodation is the family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a driveway providing off street parking. To the rear there is a large garden with a decking area and lawn for the family to enjoy. The garden is surrounded by eye catching greenery which also offers privacy and seclusion, and it also backs on to the River Pinn. For storage there is a garage, and in addition to this there is a summer house to the rear of the garden.

A door from the reception room leads into a double bedroom with a dressing room and en-suite. Completing the ground floor is a further bedroom and bathroom. The first floor holds two bedrooms and a four piece bathroom suite. Externally there is off street parking, a garage and a low maintenance rear garden.

Three Oaks Close is located in close proximity to the picturesque Ickenham Village where a good selection of local shops can be found alongside excellent transport links to include the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station.

title: 4 bed bungalow for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented throughout and enjoying a superb location is this three bedroom town house. Boasting two bathrooms, a modern open plan kitchen with dining area, living room, family room, balcony and private garden, this is a great choice for the family with nothing to do but move in and enjoy.

Directions

From our office, turn left onto Ruislip High Street and at the first mini-roundabout take the second exit onto Eastcote Road. Continue straight on Eastcote Road until you reach a second mini-roundabout and take the second exit to stay on Eastcote Road. Follow the road straight and Azalea Walk can be located a short distance down on the right-hand side.

Situation

Azalea Walk is a quiet cul-de-sac located within walking distance to both Eastcote and Ruislip High Streets, offering an array of shops and restaurants including Waitrose, Pizza Express and Cafe Rouge. Transport links include either Eastcote, Pinner or Ruislip train station on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line providing a reliable service into Central London within thirty minutes. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip, serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just twenty-five minutes, with regular trains every fifteen minutes. There are a number of bus routes as well as the A40/M25 road links providing access into London and the Home Counties. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Coteford Infant & Junior School, Haydon Secondary School and Bishops Ramsey CofE School. Ruislip Woods, Eastcote Cricket Club and Ruislip Bowls club are all merely a short walk away.

Description

Upon entering the property you are immediately welcomed with storage on the right hand side, following on in the hallway is the downstairs cloakroom which includes a basin, shower and w.c. At the rear of the property is the open plan kitchen and dining area with access to the private garden via double doors. To the front of the property passed the dining room is a store room. The first floor comprises of the main living room at the front with access to the private balcony overlooking the street. Finishing the first floor is the family room at the rear with views of the garden. The second and final floor boasts two double bedrooms, a further single bedroom as well as the fully tiled family bathroom with basin, bath, shower and w.c. Both bedroom one and bedroom three benefit from built in storage.

Outside

The front of the property offers space for off street parking. The rear garden is mostly covered by a well maintained lawn with a patio area to the rear and a decking space towards the property.

Tenure

Freehold.

About Uxbridge

Uxbridge is a town in west London and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Hillingdon. It is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan and has formed part of Greater London since 1965. It is a significant retail and commercial centre, a cinema, leisure centre, Middlesex cricket ground and an athletics stadium and is the location of Brunel University. The town is close to the boundary with Buckinghamshire, which is locally the River Colne.

Several historical events have taken place in and around the town, including attempted negotiations between King Charles I and the Parliamentary Army during the English Civil War. The public house at the centre of those events, since renamed the Crown & Treaty, still stands. Uxbridge also houses the Battle of Britain Bunker, from where the air defence of the south-east of England was coordinated during the Battle of Britain.

Historically, the name of the town is derived from "Wixan's Bridge", which was sited near the bottom of Oxford Road where a modern road bridge now stands, beside the Swan and Bottle public house.

The wards of Uxbridge North and Uxbridge South are used for the election of councillors to Hillingdon Council and for statistical purposes. The 2011 Census recorded population figures of 12,048 for Uxbridge North and 13,979 for Uxbridge South.

Full description:
Oakwood Estates brings to market this three bedroom, mid-terrace family home. Located in the convenient location of Harmondsworth, with scope for extend (stp), it is the ideal purchase for both families and investment buyers.
The large, paved driveway provides parking for 2 cars.
The large entrance hall leads onto the front room and rear dining room. The galley kitchen is situated next to the dining room providing potential to knock through and make a larger, open-plan space.
Upstairs, the property offers thee bedrooms - 1 single, 2 doubles - and a family bathroom. There is also access to the loft.
To the rear of the property is a South-facing garden, currently laid to lawn and patio. The garden can also be access from the rear.



Front of the Property
A paved driveway has space for up to 2-3 cars.

Ground Floor
The entrance hall leads to the front living room (currently used as a fourth bedroom) and the rear dining/living room. There is also access to the galley-style kitchen.

The front room has a large bay window and could easily be used as a sizeable living space. There would also be the possibility of knocking through to the rear dining room to create a large open-plan space.

The kitchen, situated next to the dining room, could also be knocked through to create one, large space for living and entertaining and to make the most of this versatile downstairs space.

The rear garden - south-facing - is laid to patio and lawn.

Location

Situated just moments (1 mile) away from Heathrow Terminal 1,2 & 3 and the property is ideally placed for those who work in or around the airport. Accordingly, it also offers great potential as a "Buy to Let" investment to cater for those who are employed in Heathrow.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom Victorian cottage situated between Pinner Green and Northwood Hills with parking for two cars.

This attractive two bedroom home still retains some of its original character. The ground floor including a 21ft family reception/dining room with double aspect windows, continues into a bright kitchen that has ample work surfaces with a utility area, and additional ante room leading onto the back garden via double French doors. Stairs rise to the first floor, where a landing provides access to a spacious family bathroom containing a three piece suite with overhead shower and two bright bedrooms.

The front of the property offers off-street parking for two cars. To the rear, there is a good sized private garden with multiple areas to enjoy, including a patio space perfect for outdoor dining in the summer months.

Located between Pinner and Northwood Hills, this property is conveniently close to a number of shopping facilities, restaurants, coffee houses and popular supermarkets. For commuters, the Metropolitan line is available at both Northwood Hills (0.5 mile) and Pinner (1 mile) tube stations providing frequent services to London, there are also numerous local bus links. The area is well served by highly regarded primary and secondary schooling, children's play areas and recreational facilities.

detailedDescription:
A fabulous three-bedroom "Warren" built semi-detached house that has been extended creating a spacious and flexible family home on one of Hillingdon's most sought-after roads and is within walking distance to Bishopshalt Secondary School. The ground floor of the property comprises a generous hallway with doors leading into the separate 13ft living room, 12ft dining room, 15ft kitchen/breakfast room, 11ft study/fourth bedroom, and downstairs W/C. To the first floor, there is a landing that leads into the 13ft master bedroom, 12ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom. Outside there is off-street parking and a private rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and take the first turning on your left into Vine Lane.

Situation

Vine Lane is a much sought after, tree lined, residential road in Hillingdon Village offering easy access to local shops, sought after schools including Bishopshalt and Swakeleys School for Girls and numerous recreational facilities such as Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park and the fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Piccadilly/Metropolitan Line Station is a short distance away along with the A40/M40/M4 and M25 giving access to London and the Home Counties along with Heathrow Airport.

Description

A rare opportunity to purchase a three/four bedroom semi-detached house that was built by "Warren" who are renowned for their solid family homes and period features including high ceilings and parquet flooring. The property has been extended creating both a spacious and flexible family home. To the ground floor the property benefits from a generous hallway with doors leading into the separate 13ft living room, 12ft dining room, 15ft kitchen/breakfast room, 11ft fourth bedroom/office, and downstairs W/C. On the first floor, there is a landing that leads into the 13ft master bedroom, 12ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property, there is a paved driveway creating off-street parking while to the borders are a variety of evergreen shrubs. To the rear is a generous, west-facing garden with a patio across the rear of the property which leads on to a large lawned area. There is a paved pathway leading to the rear of the garden where you have a seating area, two storage sheds, and a pond surrounded by a variety of shrubs, plants, and high hedging for a sense of seclusion.

About Hayes

Hayes is a town in west London. Historically in Middlesex, Hayes became part of the London Borough of Hillingdon in 1965. Hayes has an abundance of retail parks, shopping centres and a modern leisure centre with swimming pool completed in 2010. Stockley Business Park and Championship Golf course, set in 240 acres of rolling countryside, border Hayes to the west.
Hayes adjoins Harlington which borders London Heathrow Airport to the south and shares a railway station with the smaller district on the Great Western mainline to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2020. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The Uxbridge Road runs directly through the centre of Hayes to Shepherds Bush and the town offers other excellent transport links with the M4/M25 motorway networks being linked via the Hayes-By-Pass to the A40(M) into Central London and M40 to Birmingham.
Hayes has a long history. The area appears in the Domesday Book of 1086.

Landmarks in the area include the Grade II listed Parish Church, St Mary's - the central portion of the church survives from the twelfth century and it remains in use (the church dates back to 830 A.D.)- and Barra Hall, a Grade II listed manor house. The town's oldest public house - the Adam and Eve, on the Uxbridge Road - though not the original seventeenth-century structure, has remained on the same site since 1665.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Boasting four bedrooms this spacious detached chalet bungalow is ideal for the large or growing family looking for extra space. The family home offers an abundance of space, a flexible floor plan and an excellent opportunity to personalise into the perfect home. This property is the perfect choice with it's convenient location close to tube lines, the A40, and local amenities.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn left. Proceed up Swakeleys Road until you reach the set of traffic lights. After this, take the right hand u-turn and then take your first left onto Derwent Avenue. The property is located up on the right hand side.

Situation

This residence is located on one of Ickenhams sought after roads and is in close proximity to Ickenham High street offering trendy eateries, shops and transport links. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the A40 and the M40. Commuters are well suited with a number of train stations nearby and a wide variety of underground and overground lines. Ickenham station is a short stroll from this residence offering the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines into Central London. About 20 minutes away is West Ruislip station offering both the Central underground line and the Chiltern Railways, getting commuters into Central London in 25 minutes. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Breakspear and Vyners.

Description

As you enter the property there is a porch leading to the entrance hall. To the front of the property there are two double bedrooms both benefiting from bay windows. One of the bedrooms is currently being used as the dining room. Moving back to the hallway and on your right is another bedroom, and on the left is the family bathroom and separate w/c. To the rear of the property is the kitchen and living room both overlooking the garden. You can also access the garden from the living via patio doors. On the first floor you will find two further bedrooms and ample eaves storage space.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a lawn area and a driveway providing off street parking, this leads to the garage. To the rear there is a good size garden and lawn area for the family to enjoy. The garden has direct access onto the green with riverside walks.

title: 4 bed detached bungalow for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market chain free and well-presented both inside and out, this two-bedroom first floor maisonette boasts spacious interiors throughout and its own private garden. This property is ideally situated in a quiet cul-de-sac close to Ruislip’s bustling high street and excellent transport facilities.

The accommodation comprises of an entrance hall, a south facing lounge, two double bedrooms, a fitted kitchen and a family bathroom. The property also benefits from a large loft space which could potentially be suitable for conversion STPP. Externally, the property offers a beautifully maintained rear garden that’s laid to lawn with shrub borders and a patio area perfect for outdoor dining.

Meadway Gardens is conveniently placed for Ruislip High Street offering a most convenient lifestyle being within walking distance of multiple shopping facilities, varied restaurants and coffee bars.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in Newlyn Close, Uxbridge is this immaculate five bedroom semi detached family home offered to the market in brilliant condition throughout. The property is moments away from Hillingdon Hospital, Stockley Park and the Uxbridge Road.

The property comprises large entrance hall, open plan reception room, modern fitted kitchen, two ground floor bedrooms, ground floor shower room, three first floor bedrooms, three piece bathroom suite and ample storage throughout. Externally the property has its own driveway with parking up to six cars along with a garage and to the rear a well presented garden with side access.

Newlyn Close is situated in Uxbridge off Pield Heath Road and is within close proximity to transport links, local schools, Stockley Park, Heathrow Airport and the Hillingdon Hospital. You are a short drive from the Uxbridge Road connecting you to surrounding locations along with further access to the A40/A312/M40/M25 motorway links. Viewings are highly recommended, contact Hunters on !

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Bluebell House, 89 Ducks Hill Road, Northwood, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
Three bedroom ground floor apartment with enclosed private garden.

Description

Located in a modern gated development on Ducks Hill Road, this larger than average three bedroom apartment has a fabulous private rear garden making it ideal for young families, those with pets or simply those that enjoy sitting out in their own space.

The property is accessed though a stylish communal hallway with video entry phone and the reception hall has a storage cupboard. Flooring is wooden in all areas except the bathrooms which are tiled.

The living room is located to the front and has a door to the separate kitchen which is fitted with off white cabinets and quartz work surfaces. Integrated appliances by Siemens include ceramic hob, electric oven, microwave, dishwasher and fridge freezer. There is a utility room with further sink and cabinets.

The three bedrooms face to the rear overlooking the garden. The main bedroom has fitted wardrobes, an en suite shower room and bi fold doors giving access to the garden. There are two further double bedroom s each with fitted wardrobes. The family bathroom is fully tiled and has a shower over the bath.

The private garden is fenced and has a raised patio with retaining railings, lawn area and gated access top side which leads to either the communal gardens to rear or the parking area to the front where there is an allocated parking space.

Square Footage: 1303 sq ft

detailedDescription:

The property is perfect for first time or investment buyers as its been recently modernised, ready to move in.

The property comprises entrance hall, modern fitted kitchen, large reception room, balcony, two double bedrooms, three piece bathroom suite and ample storage throughout. Externally there is parking on the street along with local parks and communal gardens.

Webbs Road is situated in North Hayes and is moments away from local amenities, transport links, local schools and access to the A40/A312 motorway links. Viewings are highly recommended - Contact Hunters today on .

address: Milner House, Webbs Road, Middlesex UB4
detailedDescription:
Bonus buyer cash back if this property is purchased via us!
A spacious and very well presented 2 double bedroom, purpose built split level 1st floor flat. Located within a popular residential area close to a choice of favoured schools and wonderful open spaces within large public recreation grounds and playing fields. Public transport provides main bus route links for Northolt Station, Ealing, Southall, Heathrow, Uxbridge & Hayes & Harlington Station (Cross Rail anticipated 2022/23).
The property is Leasehold with 104 years remaining and has recently been redecorated throughout + refurbished with a re-fitted kitchen and bathroom + new carpets. It has a spacious lounge with private balcony, 2 double bedrooms + communal gardens & a private shed.

Reverse View



Reverse View

16' 0'' x 11' 6'' (4.88m x 3.53m) Double radiator and double glazed sliding patio doors onto a private balcony.

detailedDescription:
A stunning penthouse duplex apartment that epitomizes modern living offering sleek and stylish interiors throughout setting the benchmark for the contemporary lifestyle delivering clean crisp lines. The accommodation briefly consists of entrance hallway, utility room, 20ft living/dining room, fitted kitchen, 10ft third bedroom with en-suit and cloakroom WC. Upstairs is the 14ft second bedroom, 20ft master bedroom and the family bathroom.

Directions

From West Drayton train station proceed left through West Drayton High Street and take your fourth left into Porters Way. Parkwest will be on your left hand side.

Situation

Hurley House is situated within the highly prized Parkwest development just a short distance from West Drayton High Street with its range of independent shops, various restaurants and local schools. West Drayton train station (Crossrail) can also be found close by as can Stockley Business Park, Brunel University and Heathrow Airport whilst for the motorist the M4 is just a short drive away.

Description

A stunning penthouse duplex apartment that epitomizes modern living offering sleek and stylish interiors throughout setting the benchmark for the contemporary lifestyle delivering clean crisp lines. The accommodation briefly consists of entrance hallway, utility room, 20ft living/dining room, fitted kitchen, 10ft third bedroom with en-suit and cloakroom WC. Upstairs is the 14ft second bedroom, 20ft master bedroom and the family bathroom.

Outside

The property has its own private balcony accessible from the living room. There is also an allocated parking space for one car. Park West is the only condominium in West Drayton that offers facilities such as a concierge and gym on the development.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Within a short distance to local sought after schools and accessible transport links, Summer Gardens would be an ideal purchase for all types of purchasers looking to move straight into an already made up home, we would recommend an internal inspection.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hall with plenty of storage and downstairs W.C, bright and airy kitchen diner with access to the rear garden. The ground floor is complete with access to the integral garage. The first boasts two well proportioned bedrooms, four piece family bathroom with shower and a sun lit lounge with two Juliette balconies over looking the garden, on the third floor the property features two double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and en-suites. Outside boasts own drive for two vehicles and secluded rear garden with patio area, lawn and pedestrian access.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham's most prestigious developments, Summer Gardens is only moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners and Breakspear. Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

detailedDescription:
A two bedroom first floor maisonette that is presented to the market in great condition throughout. This well appointed property has fresh neutral tones and is situated in an ultra convenient location with easy access to transport links. Upon entrance the stairs lead to the first floor, the spacious double aspect living room is filled with natural light and leads through to the fitted kitchen with a storage cupboard, modern three piece family bathroom and finally two bedrooms with cupboard space.

Directions

From leaving our office on Tavistock Road proceed right onto Station Road. Proceed directly onto Harmondsworth Road and continue straight until you reach the A3044 roundabout. Take the first exit on to A3044 and continue straight for approximately 0.5 miles until you reach the roundabout and take the third exit onto Sipson Road. Continue on Sipson Road for approximately one and a half miles where the property can be found just on the right hand side just before Sipson Way.

Situation

Sipson Road is extremely well situated for a variety of amenities including local shops, bus links, Heathrow Airport, Stockley Business Park, whilst for the motorist the M4 motorway with its links to London and The Home Counties is just a short drive away.

Description

address: Willow Gardens, Ruislip Manor, Ruislip HA4
detailedDescription:
Set in a great location, within walkable distance to stations and amenities, is this four bedroom Semi-detached chalet bungalow. Boasting spacious, light filled rooms, great living, dining and entertaining space, the home has everything needed for ready made, relaxed living and benefits from a lovely private garden and off street parking.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn right and take the first left into Shenley Avenue. At the bottom turn left onto Eversley Crescent. At the end turn left onto West End Road. Take the second turning on the left into Willow Gardens and the bungalow comes up on the left hand side.

Situation

Willow Gardens is a tranquil road set back from the main road but enjoying its setting close to parks, transport and amenities at Ruislip and Ruislip Manor. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to Central London via the M25 and the M40. Commuters are well suited with five London underground stations in the area. Ruislip station or Ruislip Manor both only half a mile away making travelling into the city via the Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines swift and easy. Other nearby stations include Ruislip Gardens (Central line) or South Ruislip, serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Lady bankes, Ruislip High and Sacred Heart Primary School. Shenley Park and Ruislip Rugby Fields are all 5 minutes walk away.

Description

This charming and secluded bungalow starts with the porch leading into the hallway, which offers access to all of the ground floor accommodation and stairs that lead to the first floor. The living room is spacious for those that like to entertain, and boasts a feature fireplace and wood flooring. A doorway leads through to the kitchen which offers a vast array of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances, as well as space for a dining table. The first floor offers three generous sized bedrooms, with stairs leading to the loft room for the fourth bedroom. The family bathroom boasts a white suite, vanity units and tiled throughout.

Outside

The front of the house has a driveway providing off street parking for multiple vehicles. Access to the rear garden can be gained to the right of the home, where you will also find the garage. To the rear is the beautifully manicured garden, providing peace and tranquility. The patio area is ideal for alfresco dining and leads onto the lawned area. The garden is awash with vibrant colours and plants, with shrubs and trees throughout the garden. This oasis really is a place to enjoy on those long summer evenings.

About Hayes Village

Discover art deco design and green open space at west london's newest village.

Set on the site of the former Nestle Factory we're building over 1,300 homes as part of an area undergoing significant regeneration in Hayes.
Nestle Apartments is set within the original, stunning Art Deco factory building. With these unique features preserved, homes will come with up to 4-metre high ceilings and beautiful large windows, offering flexible living spaces.
With Crossrail to serve Hayes & Harlington Station, the area will have faster connections than many Zone 2 locations.

Residents' will enjoy cafes and a private gym, set along the Grand Union Canal.

Discover art deco design and green open space at west london's newest village.

Set on the site of the former Nestle Factory we're building over 1,300 homes as part of an area undergoing significant regeneration in Hayes.
Nestle Apartments is set within the original, stunning Art Deco factory building. With these unique features preserved, homes will come with up to 4-metre high ceilings and beautiful large windows, offering flexible living spaces.
With Crossrail to serve Hayes & Harlington Station, the area will have faster connections than many Zone 2 locations.

Residents' will enjoy cafes and a private gym, set along the Grand Union Canal.

Mon 12:30 - 17:30, Tues & Wed closed, Thurs - Sun 10:00 - 17:30

About Ickenham

Ickenham is an area in Greater London, forming the eastern part of Uxbridge and within the London Borough of Hillingdon.

The village was originally split into four manors, but later there were two: Ickenham and Swakeleys. The old manorial home of Swakeleys, a 17th-century Jacobean mansion Swakeleys House still stands, and much of the Swakeleys estate was sold for housing in the 1920s. Ickenham's manorial home, Manor Farm, now forms part of Long Lane Farm.

At the 1901 Census, Ickenham had a population of 329; at the 2001 Census the population had reached 9,933, although census figures show a marked population decline during the 1960s and 1970s. By the 2011 Census, the population had reached 10,387. When Ickenham obtained a railway station on the Metropolitan Railway's line between Harrow and Uxbridge, a great deal of residential development started in the village, and it gradually became part of the London commuter belt. Ickenham expanded with the sale and development of much of the Swakeleys estate in 1922 and became part of what was later termed "Metro-land".

About Harlington

Harlington is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport. The district adjoins Hayes to the north and shares a railway station with the larger district, which is its post town, on the Great Western Main Line to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking the Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The village is surrounded by Green Belt land and open fields and also contains a parade of shops to include a Pharmacy, Co-operative Convenience store, Newsagents, a variety of restaurants and fast food outlets and a Post Office. There are also four public houses: The Great Western, The Pheasant, The Wheatsheaf, and The White Hart. The village also boasts two churches, a Baptist church and a Church of England church, St Peter & St Paul's and William Byrd School. The village High Street is also home to the Harlington Locomotive Society and West London Models.

The earliest surviving mention of Harlington appears to be in a 9th-century charter in which land at Botwell in Hayes was said to be bounded on the west by "Hygeredington" and "Lullinges" tree. The first of these must be Harlington; the second has not been identified. The boundary between Hayes and Harlington, which may have been defined by the date of this charter, was later marked by North Hyde Road and Dawley Road.

detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • Freehold
  • Detached garage
  • Downstairs W/C
  • Utility shed with power

Full description:
Oakwood Estates brings to market this well-proportioned 3 bedroom family home in the convenient locations of Harmondsworth. Close to Heathrow this is the perfect home for families or investors alike.
The small entrance porch leads to a spacious hallway. The large, open-plan living and dining room allows for a large family entertaining space. The living space also features a working fireplace. The dining space has patio doors which lead out onto the rear garden. The galley-style kitchen is extended and fitted with plenty of storage. There is a large utility cupboard which houses the regularly serviced boiler. There is a downstairs W/C.
The first floor of the property provides 3 bedrooms - 2 double and 1 good-sized single. The second bedroom includes floor to ceiling built-in wardrobes. From the landing there is access to the loft.
Outside, the front garden is laid to lawn and is of a generous size. The rear garden comprises of a patio and lawned area. There is also a utility shed which has power. The large, detached garage, at the back of the garden, is accessed by a side road and is fully secure with a remote door.



Front of the Property
To the front of the property, the plot is laid to lawn, providing plenty of space for the property to be set back from the road.

The porch leads through to the large hallway where there is access to the downstairs W/C, living/dining area and kitchen.

Living and Dining Area
The combined areas total approximately 27ft in length and provides plenty of space for large furniture and entertaining space.
The East facing, bay window frontage makes for plenty of natural light flooding into the living area and right through to the back of the house.

Kitchen
The fitted kitchen comprises of a utility area, with cupboard housing the boiler, and the main, galley-style kitchen. With gas hob and plenty of storage space, this kitchen is in perfect working order and offers ample preparation space.

Upstairs
Master bedroom - 10'5" x 14'1" (3.2m x 4.3m)
Large master bedroom with bay window overlooking the front aspect

Second bedroom - 11'5" x 12'5" (3.5m x 3.8m)
A large double, with floor to ceiling fitted wardrobes, is at the rear of the property

Third bedroom - 7'2" x 8'10" (2.2m x 2.7m)
A good-sized single, could fit a small double

Family bathroom
The fitted bathroom is of a good-standard and comprises of a shower over bath, W/C and hand basin, with room for additional freestanding storage.

There is access to the loft.

Rear of the Property
The rear garden has a patio area with the rest mainly laid to lawn. The utility shed has full power and acts as a utility space.
The garage, currently operating as a workshop, is large and has a remote door opening. Access to the garage is down a side road providing complete security.

Additional Information
Location

Situated just moments (1.9 miles) away from Heathrow Terminal 1,2 & 3 and the property is ideally placed for those who work in or around the airport. It also offers great potential as a "Buy to Let" investment to cater for those individuals employed at Heathrow.
Schools & transport

Hatch Lane is located in a convenient area, with easy access to:

Harmondsworth Primary School 0.5 Miles

Heathrow Primary School 0.9 miles

M4 Motorway (Junction 4) 1.7 Miles
Council tax

Council Tax Band D - £1603

detailedDescription:
Set in a great location, within walk-able distance to stations and amenities, is this Three/four bedroom Semi-detached chalet bungalow. Boasting spacious, light filled rooms, great living, dining and entertaining space, the home has everything needed for ready made, relaxed living and benefits from a lovely private garden and off street parking.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left and continue to the end of the High street. Continue on Victoria road continuing straight over two roundabouts. Continue straight over the first set of traffic lights and at the second traffic lights turn right onto Station Approach. Continue on Station approach and take the fourth turning on the left into Deane avenue. The house is a short drive up on the left hand side.

Situation

Deane Avenue is a quiet residential road enjoying its setting close to parks and amenities at South Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Eastcote. Local transport links are available from nearby South Ruislip train station offering the Chiltern line and Central lines into London. Ruislip Manor station is a short drive or stroll away and is useful for the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away whilst for families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including St Swithun Wells, Ruislip High, Newnham Primary and Queensmead Secondary school.

Description

This charming home offers spacious living and is neatly presented throughout. A large hallway greets you as you enter the home allowing access to all of the ground floor accommodation and stairs leading to the first floor. There is also ample understairs storage. To the front of the home is a dining room, perfect for hosting large dinner parties, and can also be used as a fourth bedroom. The back of the house boasts a large open plan reception and kitchen, creating a fantastic family space. The kitchen has a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances, as well as an island counter which is perfect for a breakfast dining space. The living room overlooks the garden, which can be accessed via bi-folding doors. The downstairs is also complete with a utility room which could act as a second kitchen and features a sink, hob and an oven which helps for catering big events such as Christmas or parties. The downstairs is complete with a bathroom including a walk in shower. To the first floor are three generous sized bedrooms, with two of the rooms offering space for free standing wardrobes as well as further storage within the eaves for all of the bedrooms. The family bathroom is complete with a white suite and tiled throughout. Other key features in the house which include: Wifi speakers in the downstairs bathroom, sensor lighting on the upstairs landing area, roller door for the garage which is controlled by a remote control and security cameras overlooking the front and rear of the property.

Outside

There is off street parking for multiple vehicles via a paved driveway. To the rear of the property is a beautiful garden that is full of bright colour which makes it a great setting for families and entertaining. There is a patio area, which is ideal to enjoy in those summer months, which leads down to a lawned area, and a summer house to the rear providing rest bite from the sunshine.

A 1-bedroom apartment on the ground floor with plenty of storage space. The open plan living/dining area includes a fully fitted kitchen with appliances. This apartment is west-facing, with double-height ceilings of up to 4m throughout. Further benefits include a comfort cooling system. Reserve with a deposit of £14,950 with London Help to Buy.
Barratt London is building over 1,300 homes on the site of the former Nestle Factory in Hayes, an area undergoing significant regeneration. With Crossrail set to serve Hayes & Harlington Station from 2021, the area will be better connected than ever before.

The development will include a new public park, gym, running track and lots of green open spaces and play areas. A previously inaccessible part of the canal will be opened up for the public to enjoy and there will be space for a shop or cafe.

address: Park Lane, Harefield, Uxbridge, Middlesex UB9
detailedDescription:
Grade II listed cottage by the Grand Union Canal.

Location

Black Jack's Cottage (soon to be known as The Thatch Cottage) is situated at the end of a private road in a tucked away position adjacent to the Grand Union Canal.

It offers the chance to enjoy a rural location yet within approximately 16 miles of London – a rare find and a fabulous bolt hole ready for you to put your own stamp on.

There are lots of country walks close by as well as The Old Orchard country pub is at the top of the lane and Harefield village centre is approximately 0.8 miles with local shops and schools.

The house is approximately 3 miles from Rickmansworth which offers a comprehensive shopping centre with the foods halls of Marks & Spencer, Waitrose and Tesco.

Rickmansworth Station offers a frequent service to London, Baker Street and the Chiltern Turbo, a fast Main Line service to Marylebone.

The property is also well connected with the A40, M40, M25, Uxbridge town centre and Heathrow, all within approximately a 10-20 minute drive.

Description

This wonderful character detached home reputedly dates back to 1635 and offers buyers the opportunity to restore this home to its original glory and has a wealth of beams and latched doors throughout.

The house opens into the hall and the sitting room is triple aspect and features a deep fireplace – ideal for those cosy winter evenings. The dining room features a biomass wood burner for the heating
and a door out to the garden.

The kitchen has a range of built-in cupboards and is double aspect and there is a separate utility room.

On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and both are double aspect. The shower room has recently been refitted and there is a separate WC.

Outside
The cottage is approached via a five bar gate and has a driveway with parking for several cars. The rest of the garden is laid to lawn and features an old well. There is access out onto the footpath by the Grand Union Canal.

Nb: Possible private mooring available for a narrow boat.

Square Footage: 1180 sq ft

Directions

From the roundabout in the centre of Harefield take Park Road and proceed down the hill, and take the left turn into Park Lane sign posted The Old Orchard and follow the road down past the Old Orchard and continue through the country lane and bear round to the right and towards the end you will find the five bar gate with access to Black Jacks Cottage soon to be known as Thatched Cottage

Help to buy

Make the most of this Government-backed scheme for Help to Buy homes. You could borrow up to 40% of the purchase price from the Government and move into your Redrow new build home with as little as a 5% deposit.
Help to Buy: Equity Loan is a great incentive that allows you to buy a brand-new home much sooner than you may have thought.

How does it work?
* You will only need a 5% deposit
* The Government will lend you up to 40% of the value of your property through an equity loan
* The loan is interest free for 5 years and can be repaid anytime or on the sale of your home
* You can move into a Redrow home up to the value of £600,000
* You will only require a 55% mortgage

detailedDescription:
A truly immaculate three bedroom detached character home. This house sits on a good size plot set back from the road, within close proximity to the village shops, Ickenham station and within the catchment area of well-regarded schools. With off street parking and a good sized garden, it comes to the market with the potential to create extra space and a lovely family home. Transport links are available from nearby West Ruislip (Central line) or Ickenham tube stations (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) providing reliable links into the City and West End.

Directions

From our Ickenham office turn left and proceed to the end of Swakeleys Road. At the first roundabout, turn right using the second exit onto Breakspear Road South. The property is located on the right hand side.

Situation

Breakspear Road South is a stroll to the Ickenham village shops, restaurants and Metropolitan / Piccadilly line train station with it's direct links to The City and Baker Street, while London and road links towards Oxford are easily accessed via the A40/M25. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Junior School and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Uxbridge Golf Club, bowls club and Virgin active Health Club which has a modern gym, tennis and squash courts and swimming pool.

Description

As you enter the property you are welcomed a by a wonderful large entrance hallway. To your right is access to the through lounge which consists of a dining area, sitting room, and sunroom to the rear that overlooks the garden. From here there are patio doors leading to the garden. Just off of the sun room there in an additional room that is currently being used as a study/office. Again this room overlooks the garden. Moving back to the hallway and to the rear is the kitchen. Here you will find ample worktop and storage space, and a range cooker. From the kitchen there is a door to the side path leading to the garden. Completing the downstairs accommodation is a w/c. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and a single third bedroom. Bedroom one is front facing and has the benefit of a bay window and fitted wardrobes. Bedroom two is to the rear and also come with fitted wardrobe space, as does bedroom three that is located to front of the property. Finally there is the family bathroom and a separate w/c.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a paved driveway for off street parking, this leads to the garage. To the left of the driveway there is a small lawn area, and a side gate for access to the rear garden. The garden is a good size and is presented in immaculate condition making it a lovely space for the family to enjoy. There is a patio accessed directly from the rear of the property, this leads to a decking area with ample space for a table and seating. In addition to this there is a perfectly manicured lawn which is surrounded by eye catching greenery.

detailedDescription:
An attractive three bedroom semi-detached home set in the heart of Ickenham. The property boasts an expansive garden extending to approximately 200 ft making it the perfect space for a family to enjoy, and also bringing the potential to enhance the property (STPP). It is located in a desirable location in Ickenham situated within close proximity to a number of highly regarded schools, the A40 and Ickenham Village with its shops, bars and restaurants. The Central/Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line stations are also within walking distance.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham turn left and proceed onto Swakeleys road. Continue and the property can be found on the left hand side.

Situation

The property is well positioned standing on the south side of Swakeleys road adjacent to and opposite the entrance to Wallasey crescent. The property is situated within close proximity to well-regarded schools such as Breakspear Primary, Douay Martyrs and Vyners Secondary. There are excellent transport links with the A40/M40 a short drive away providing access to London and the M25. Ickenham Village is a short walk away where there are a vast range of local shops, restaurants and bars. Ickenham Station offers the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines whilst West Ruislip Station is serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station. Also excellent bus services provide links to Ruislip, Uxbridge and beyond. There are a number of leisure facilities nearby including Ruislip and Uxbridge Golf Course, also there is Ickenham Cricket club.

Description

As you enter the property there is a porch leading you to the hallway. To your right is the dining room facing to the front of the property, this has the benefit of a bay window and its original fireplace. Beyond the dining room is the living room, which also has the original fireplace, this then leads to the full width conservatory. Here you have wonderful views overlooking the garden and it can be access via patio doors. Moving back to the hallway and completing the downstairs accommodation is the kitchen. You can also access the garden from here. On the first floor there are three good size bedrooms and the family bathroom. Bedroom one is front facing with a bay window, and bedrooms two and three are to the rear overlooking the garden. A sizeable loft also provides other development opportunities. This really is a superb family property with excellent potential to create the perfect home.

Outside

To the front of the house there is a large driveway providing off street parking, which then leads to the garage and a side gate providing access to the garden. Beyond the garage there is an outside utility room, w/c, and small workshop. To the rear is a beautiful and secluded expansive garden with a perfectly manicured lawn that is surrounded by eye catching greenery. There is also a wonderful patio area to entertain and enjoy in the summer months.

The Area

Being able to escape to a choice of open green spaces is what makes NewHayes
a unique place to live. Here youll find a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens with social and quiet areas to a family-friendly woodland area, with plenty of space to play in. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green
oasis for the whole community to enjoy.

Travel Options

Hayes & Harlington Station is just an 8 minute walk away, meaning you can be at London Paddington in 29 minutes. By car, you can be on the M4 in as little as 4 minutes, while quick journeys to Heathrow Airport bring the whole world closer.

Lifestyle

You’ll quickly discover that Hayes offers more than just a new address. Just a short distance away are supermarkets, high street shops, cafes and bars. Plus there are a number of gyms and The Beck theatre is just over a mile away.

For families, there are Ofsted-rated schools for all ages and if you want to step away to somewhere more tranquil, enjoying outdoor space is simple too. Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. Other open spaces within a short drive of NewHayes include Northala Fields, Lake Farm Country Park and Kew Gardens, which is just a 17 minute drive. Plus, the Grand Union Canal is nearby for whenever you want a waterside walk.

The future of Hayes

Hayes & Harlington Station which currently operates Great Western services and is only an 8 minute walk away from NewHayes, will benefit from major improvements in preparation for the new Elizabeth line services.

Once complete, Crossrail will run from Reading in the West to Shenfield in the East and bring journey times for NewHayes residents to a multitude of central London locations down significantly.

About Newhayes

A well-connected place to call home

Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes is an exciting new development. With a brand new selection of modern, well-designed studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, including wheelchair accessible apartments and parking. Youll easily find the one youll want to come home to.

Close by are a good range of amenities, Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. For commuters, Hayes & Harlington Station is within an 8 minute walk for journeys to Heathrow Airport (Terminals 2 & 3) in 6 minutes, Ealing Broadway in 9 minutes and London Paddington in 21 minutes.

With much regeneration in Hayes, including an entertainment and leisure complex, our new development offers buyers a home in a well-connected part of West London.

  • Something for everyone with supermarkets, high street shops, cafs and bars within walking distance. There are also a number of gyms if you want to keep fit and healthy, and for live music or comedy fans, The Beck Theatre is just over a mile away.
  • Getting around the Capital and beyond perfect for commuters, you can easily reach Hayes & Harlington Station within an 8 minute walk for journeys to London Paddington in 21 minutes and Heathrow airport is just a 26 minute walk or bus journey.
  • Relax into a new way of life – a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens to a family-friendly woodland area. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green oasis for the whole community to enjoy.
  • Education for all ages just a short distance away is a range of Ofsted-rated schools, all offering good levels of education for children of all ages.

detailedDescription:
A characterful four bedroom semi detached house located on Morford Way which is in close proximity to Eastcote High Streets shops, cafés, restaurants and transport facilities. The property briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hall, living room, kitchen, dining room, cloakroom, four bedrooms and a bathroom. Further benefits include a large driveway, garage own drive and private south facing rear garden.

Direction

From our Ruislip office turn right and proceed to the traffic lights. Turn left into Pembroke Road and continue on to Park Way. Take the fifth left into Hawthorne Avenue and Morford Way is the first road on the right.

Situation

Morford Way is a quiet tree lined residential road which is a highly sought after location in the Eastcote area. It is a very short stroll to Eastcote or Ruislip Manor shops, trendy eateries and transport options. Commuters are well suited with London Underground stations in the area as Eastcote station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) is a short walk away, whilst South Ruislip Station - a mile away is serviced by both tube (Central) and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 20 minutes, with regular trains. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools including Newnham Junior School, Haydon School and Bishop Ramsey.

Description

A beautiful four bedroom semi detached house, providing an ideal setting for contemporary family living with potential to extend subject to planning in the future. This residence will impress those seeking space and character. Upon entering the residence, you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway providing access to all ground floor rooms. The the front, a large living room which benefits from a bay window bringing in excellent lighting as well as a feature fireplace. The rear of the property offers a seperate dining room, with views across the garden and flows into the large fitted kitchen. The kitchen further benefits from a range of integrated appliances and direct access to the rear garden. The ground floor is complete with a W.C. The first floor comprises of three bedrooms, all of which are well sized with the master on that floor measuring 16'1ft x 15'9 ft, and boasts a feature bay window. There is a family bathroom with a bath, hand wash basin and a separate W.C. The final fourth bedroom is on the second floor, with a walk in wardrobe and en-suite shower room.

Outside

The front of the property offers off street parking for multiple cars and a garage own drive. The rear garden is mostly laid to lawn with a patio area and a shed.

This will bring the West End and City of London within 22 minutes and 29 minutes journey time.

Help to buy

Make the most of this Government-backed scheme for Help to Buy homes. You could borrow up to 40% of the purchase price from the Government and move into your Redrow new build home with as little as a 5% deposit.
Help to Buy: Equity Loan is a great incentive that allows you to buy a brand-new home much sooner than you may have thought.

How does it work?
* You will only need a 5% deposit
* The Government will lend you up to 40% of the value of your property through an equity loan
* The loan is interest free for 5 years and can be repaid anytime or on the sale of your home
* You can move into a Redrow home up to the value of £600,000
* You will only require a 55% mortgage

**terms and conditions apply, available to qualifying help to buy applicants only.

detailedDescription:
Next to the newly renovated South Ruislip library, Coopers & Hillingdon first are proud to bring to the market this brand new development of 31 newly built apartments. The development is made up of 2 separate buildings aptly named Kipling House & Burnett Court after novelists Rudyard Kipling & Frances Hodgson Burnett as a tribute to the long standing library next door. The apartments back onto neighbouring Queensmead schools sports fields giving fantastic views out of the huge windows. The properties boast a location so convenient it would be difficult to rival. You'll find Sainsburys directly opposite and South Ruislip station just a few minutes walk away giving you immediate access to the central and chiltern lines. You have multiple retail parks all just a short walk away; The Old Dairy site hosts Cineworld, the gym, Nandos and Asda where as a few minutes in the other direction you'll find everything for the home, Lidl, Bensons for beds, argos, homebase, curry's & tk Maxx. There are a number of Ofsted rated Outstanding schools locally along with local parks and sports facilities. Ruislip high street is a brief 5 minute drive away as is the a40 to take you directly into Central London.

All 31 of the properties within Victoria Place have been designed and finished to a very high standard and specification. There is a variety of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with the vast majority of those properties all boasting balconies other than the 3 bedrooms on the top floor which both showcase their own roof terrace. The properties vary from 540 square feet right through to 1,027 square feet. The kitchens are fully fitted with Zanussi appliances and elegant flush fitted cupboard units and sunken sinks. To complete the flooring choices of wood laminate in the living areas and kitchen, carpet in the bedrooms and tile in the bathrooms each property is the height of luxury with under floor heating. There are 3 apartments in 1 of the blocks on the ground floor specifically designed to cater for disabilities along with a brand new lift in each block. Please contact Coopers to arrange your viewing and discuss your move.

detailedDescription:
A spacious and well presented three bedroom semi detached family house situated in the sought after north uxbridge area within easy walking distance of Uxbridge town centre. The property offers numerous features, such as three double bedrooms, two reception rooms, fitted downstairs cloakroom, white bathroom suite, detached garage with ample off road parking and a good size rear garden. The property has scope for extension, subject to usual consents and is offered with no onward chain.

Situation

Maylands Drive is situated on the North side of Uxbridge, a short walk to the High Street that offers two shopping mall's, numerous restaurants such as Nando's and Wagamama, cocktail bar's and for the commuter, Uxbridge Tube Station offers Metropolitan and Piccadilly line services into Central London. Other amenities close by include Brunel University, Hillingdon Hospital and Stockley Business Park. The area is also served by a selection of well-regarded infant, primary and secondary schools.

Description

A three bedroom semi detached family house situated in a sought after cul-de-sac on the north side of Uxbridge. The property is well presented and offers scope for extension, subject to the usual consents. The accommodation comprises: Entrance hall, fitted cloakroom, sitting room, dining room, kitchen, utility room and a large conservatory to the rear. Spacious landing, three double bedrooms and a modern white bathroom suite.

Outside

Externally the property benefits from a good size rear garden which is laid to lawn with patio area and numerous shrubs and trees. There is a smaller enclosed front garden and a block paved driveway providing ample off street parking and a detached garage.

Sat Nav

UB8 1BH

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market with no onward chain, this extended four bedroom end terrace property offers buyers the perfect opportunity to purchase this beautiful abode, on one of Ruislip Manor's premium roads. This property is just a few minutes walk from several schools and handy tube links. A viewing of this wonderful home is recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip Manor continue on Victoria Road. Go straight over two roundabouts and take the first right into Tiverton Road, the house is a short drive up on the right hand side.

Situation

Tiverton Road is perfectly positioned just moments from Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Ruislip Gardens shopping and transport facilities. Ruislip Manor Train Station offers the Piccadilly and Metropolitan lines whilst Ruislip Gardens Station provides the Central Line and British Rail Connections. Alternatively for the motorist the A40/M25 is just a short drive away. The property is ideally located nearby to a selection of highly regarded schools and is just a short stroll to the local parks.

Description

This charming manor home, which has been extended in recent years, offers buyers the perfect family home. The property's entrance hall offers access into the living room and stairs that lead to the first floor. The living room is bright and spacious, perfect for those who love to entertain. The family bathroom, which is located downstairs, offers a white suite, vanity units and is partly tiled. The kitchen to the back of the house boasts a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. The kitchen opens onto the dining area, which is spacious enough for the largest of dining tables. Two sets of double doors allow access to the garden. The downstairs is complete with a bedroom, which could also be used as a home office or kids playroom. To the first floor are three bedrooms, all boasting built in wardrobes. The master bedroom also feature an ensuite bathroom.

Outside

The front of the property offers a block paved driveway providing off street parking for multiple vehicles. The driveway is surrounded by a low brick wall and bedding. The rear garden is a secluded oasis boasting a large lawned area, surrounded by fencing and a patio area, ideal for alfresco dining. To the back of the garden is a shed for storage.

detailedDescription:
A four bedroom detached house that has been modernised and updated creating a lovely family home on one of North Hillingdon finest roads close to a variety of amenities. Accommodation to the ground floor boasts an entrance hall, 16ft lounge, 22ft dining room, 10ft kitchen, utility room and downstairs W/C. To the first floor you have a 10ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 9ft second bedroom, 10ft third bedroom, 8ft fourth bedroom and family bathroom with separate shower room. Outside there is off street parking for several cars with access to the 18ft garage and private rear garden with access to the 33ft garden studio.

Directions

From our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left to the second set of traffic lights. Turn left onto Long lane and Parkway is the eighth turning on your left.

Situation

Parkway is a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon. There are well regarded schools in close proximity including St Helens private school, St Bernadettes, Oak Farm and Vyners along with a number of recreational facilities also nearby including Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park with its tennis courts and bowls club and the fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Hillingdon Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station is within walking distance and both the A40/M40 with their links to London and the Home Counties and Uxbridge Town centre with its variety of shops, restaurants and bars are located under a mile away.

Description

A fabulous opportunity to purchase a four bedroom detached house situated on a generous plot that backs directly onto Court Park on one of North Hillingdon finest roads that offers the potential to develop or extend (S.T.P). Currently the property benefits from an entrance hall, 16ft lounge, 22ft dining room, 10ft kitchen, utility room and downstairs W/C. To the first floor you have a 10ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 9ft second bedroom, 10ft third bedroom, 8ft fourth bedroom and family bathroom with separate shower room.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a large, block paved driveway creating off street parking for several cars and allowing access to the 18ft garage. The immaculately kept private rear garden has a wooden decked area stretching across the rear of the property, whilst the remainder of the garden is mainly laid to lawn which in turn leads you to the 33ft garden studio. To the foot of the garden there is a gate into Court Park.

detailedDescription:
Haydon Drive is conveniently located nearby to Northwood Hills high street offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan line at Northwood Hills is easily accessible from the property and offers swift access into London, Watford and Harrow on the Hill. This two double bedroom apartment is ready to move into and presents a great opportunity for first time buyers or investors with its great location and well presented interior.

Directions

From our office on Bridge Street, turn right onto Chapel Lane and at the roundabout at the end of the road, take the second exit onto West End Lane. Turn left onto High View and continue until you reach High Road. Follow on until the mini roundabout, and turn right onto Joel Street. Haydon Drive can be found a short distance up on your right hand side.

Situation

Haydon Drive is conveniently located nearby to Northwood Hills high street offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan line at Northwood Hills is easily accessible from the property and offers swift access into London, Watford and Harrow on the Hill. There is also a number of bus routes available offering access to Ruislip, Mount Vernon Hospital, Ealing and Harrow. The charming village pub The Case is Altered and Eastcote Cricket club are a short walk away. Both Haydon and Bishops Ramsey Secondary schools are also within walking distance.

Description

This two double bedroom apartment is ready to move into and presents a great opportunity for first time buyers or investors with its great location and well presented interior. Peacefully positioned in a quiet residential cul-de-sac, surrounded by woodland and leafy open spaces the accommodation is situated on the ground floor and comprises of a modern fitted kitchen, a bright light filled 16ft lounge, two double bedrooms one with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom. Benefiting from gas central heating, double glazing and well maintained communal gardens, this is a great home at a valuable price in the sought after Pinner area.

Outside

The property is surrounded by well presented communal grounds and a mass of residence parking.
