detailedDescription:
A fantastic three bedroom semi-detached home that has been finished to a high standard, and has been well looked after by it's current owners creating an ideal space for the growing family.

Directions

From our office on Ruislip High Street, turn left and continue down the High Street. At the mini roundabout, turn left onto Bury Street. Proceed down Bury Street, then take your fourth left onto Ladygate Lane. Follow the road to the end and take a left turn onto Breakspear Road. Take the first left into Glovers Grove, and Greystoke Drive can be located a short distance down on the left hand side.

Situation

Greystoke Drive is a quiet residential road in a sought after part of Ruislip. Ruislip High Street is in close proximity with it's choice of shops, restaurants and cafes, including Tesco, Waitrose, Pizza Express and Café Rouge. Breakspear Road offers easy access to the A40 and it's road links into London and the Home Counties. The property also falls within the catchment area for Whiteheath Nursery, Infant and Junior School. There are many bus routes near by and Ruislip is located on the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines.

Description

A beautifully presented three bedroom semi-detached home perfect for family living. Upon entering the ground floor, you are immediately greeted by a hall providing direct access to the 26ft, light-filled lounge/diner with ample room for a large dining table and chairs. The ground floor also offers a contemporary fitted kitchen which has been equipped with a good selection of storage, appliance space and ample worktop room. The kitchen also benefits from tiled flooring and double doors providing access to the rear garden. Completing the ground floor is a fully-functional, separate office and 14ft conservatory. Stairs rise to the first floor, which provides three larger than average bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. The home has been finished to a high standard and has been well looked after creating an ideal space for the growing family.

Outside

A large paved driveway to the front of the house creates off street parking for multiple vehicles and leads to the entrance of the house. To the rear of the property, there is a private garden which enjoys a sun lit patio area and the garden is mostly laid to lawn.

detailedDescription:
An extended and well maintained three bedroom semi-detached house located on a popular residential road in Hillingdon. Accomodation comprises a porch, entrance hall, downstairs w/c, 13ft living room, 10ft kitchen, 10ft dining room, 14ft garden room, 13ft master bedroom, 11ft second bedroom, 9ft third bedroom and family bathroom. Outside of the property there is well kept front garden with potential for off street parking, a garage and a beautifully maintained rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and at the first set of traffic lights turn right onto Harlington Road. Proceed straight over the mini roundabout and at your first set of lights proceed straight over. Daleham Drive is the second turning on your right.

Situation

Daleham Drive is a residential road in Hillingdon which is conveniently located for local shops, schools and within easy reach of Uxbridge Town Centre with its variety of shops, restaurants, bus links and Metropolitan/Piccadilly train station. Heathrow airport, Stockley Park, Brunel University and the M4 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away.

Description

The ground floor of the property comprises a porch, entrance hall, downstairs w/c, 13ft living room, 10ft kitchen, 10ft dining room and 14ft garden room. To the first floor there is a 13ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 11ft second bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a 9ft third bedroom with a fitted wardrobe and a family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property there is a shared driveway leading to the garage and generous front garden that is mainly laid to lawn with a variety of plants and flowers at the boarders. To the rear of the property there is a private and beautifully maintained garden that is mainly laid to lawn with a patio across the rear of the house. There is a pathway leading to the garage which continues to the rear of the garden where there is a peaceful secluded retreat, boasting flower beds, shrubs, trees and a patio area.

detailedDescription:
Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a beautiful, two bedroom apartment in the heart of Northwood. Offering superb space and a modern, stylish interior throughout this property occupies a convenient location being moments from shops, transport and greenery.

Directions

From our office on Bridge Street, continue straight for 0.4 miles onto Elm Park Road. From Elm Park Road, continue straight until the road becomes Pinner Hill Road and bare left onto Potter Street. Continue on Potter Street until the road become Hillside Road, and eventually Northwood Way. At the next roundabout continue straight over onto Green Lane. Continue on Green Lane before taking a right turn onto Watford Road. Frithwood Avenue can be located a short distance up on the left hand side.

Situation

Frithwood Avenue is a prestigious, sought after road located within walking to Northwood High Street and it's array of amenities including Waitrose supermarket, a selection of restaurants, bars and the Metropolitan Line Station providing access to Baker Street and the City as well as Harrow on the Hill, Watford and Rickmansworth. The area has a range of both highly sought after private and state schools including Frithwood Primary School and St.Helens Independent School for Girls. For the motorist, direct links to the M25 and M1 are nearby.

Description

Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a beautiful, two bedroom apartment in the heart of Northwood. Offering superb space and a modern, stylish interior throughout this property occupies a convenient location being moments from shops, transport and greenery. Upon entering the residence via the well-maintained communal areas, you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway offering direct access to all rooms. To the right, the 15ft second bedroom awaits. Beyond this there is a contemporary, fitted kitchen which has been designed to a high standard, boasting ample worktop space alongside a range of appliances. The apartment also offers a contemporary three-piece family bathroom, tiled from floor to ceiling with high quality sanitary ware throughout. Completing this home is a 14ft master bedroom and ample storage space under the eaves.

Outside

Maintained communal grounds and one allocated parking space.

detailedDescription:
Enjoying a quiet cul-de-sac location, is this three bedroom detached home offering generously proportioned interiors throughout, an attractive rear garden, off-street parking and a garage. The property is ideally located close to a number of amenities, schools and excellent transport facilities.

The ground floor comprises an entrance hall allowing access to a front aspect lounge, a separate dining room with access to the garden, a kitchen, and a guest WC. To the first floor there is a master bedroom with an en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally the property offers a beautifully maintained, secluded garden that is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area and a garden shed for storage. The private garage is also accessible via the garden. To the front there is a driveway providing off-street parking and access to the garage.

Situated off Joel Street, this property is within easy reach of Northwood Hills, Pinner and Eastcote high streets all of which provide a variety of shops, restaurants, coffee houses and popular supermarkets. title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Coopers is delighted to present this immaculate four bedroom two bathroom detached family home set in the heart of Ickenham. This property has been tastefully designed and updated to a high specification throughout, making it the perfect home to move straight into and enjoy. Boniface Road is a quiet residential road moments from the shops and local facilities at Ickenham Village.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham on Swakeleys Road. Turn left and take the first right onto Rectory Way. Then turn right into Boniface Road.

Situation

Boniface Road is ideally located close to Ickenham village restaurants, cafes and local shops along with both West Ruislip and Ickenham Station which are serviced by the Metropolitan Piccadilly or Central Lines. Access to the A40/M40/M25 is nearby which gives great access into the City, Ealing, Oxford Heathrow and Uxbridge. For families there are a number of highly regarded schools within walking distance including Breakspear Primary, Glebe Primary and Vyners Secondary which also offers Sixth form level education. Uxbridge Town Centre is a short drive bus or train journey away and offers a wide selection of retailers, bars and restaurants.

Description

As you enter the property you are welcomed by an entrance hall, immediately to your left is the downstairs shower room, and to your right is the kitchen/breakfast room. The kitchen has been recently updated and has the benefit of ample granite worktop space and a breakfast bar. There are base and eye level units providing lots of storage, and in addition to these there are integrated appliances. From the kitchen you lead to the dining area where there are patio doors to access the garden. To the left of the dining room is the bright and spacious living area that overlooks the immaculate garden. From the living room there is an opening leading back to the hallway. To the side of the hallway is a large cloak room, and at the end of the hallway is the utility room which leads to the boiler room. Moving to the first floor you will find four bedrooms and the family bathroom. Bedroom one is rear facing and has the benefit of fitted wardrobe space, as does bedroom two which is located to the front of the property. Bedrooms three and four are also to the rear. Bedroom four has currently been converted to use an at home office. Finalising the upstairs accommodation is the immaculate family bathroom that comes with a bathtub and large separate shower cubicle. The property also comes with a full perimeter CCTV system.

Outside

To the front of the property is a paved driveway providing off street parking for two/three cars. This leads to the garage which has an electric shutter and benefits excellent storage space. To the right of the property there is a side gate for access to the rear garden. To the rear is a beautifully presented garden with a patio area for entertaining, and a perfectly manicured lawn. There is an additional patio and seating area to the rear to enjoy in the summer months.

The South facing rear garden has a decked area closest to the house with a water feature, there is an area laid to artificial turf with the remainder being laid to lawn with some shrub borders. To the rear there is a workshop/garage with power, light and a remote controlled roller shutter door as well as a 16amp power supply, the garage that measures approximately 5m x 3m with rear access.

Directions

From our offices in West Drayton head north through the High Street towards Uxbridge and proceed past the junction with Falling Lane into High Road. Continue along the road and take the fourth turn on the left into New Peachey Lane.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Newly converted 3 bedroom ground floor maisonette with extensive private garden to rear.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

This three bedroom ground floor maisonette has recently been substantially rebuilt and remodelled and is presented in "brand new" condition with new roof, windows, flooring, heating system as well as new kitchen and bathroom. The property benefits from an enclosed south facing private garden to rear making the property suitable to families, pet owners or simply those who enjoy sitting outside in the sunshine.

The property has its own private front door which gives access to the reception hall. The open plan living space is located to the rear and comprises living are and kitchen to rear well lit by sliding patio doors that lead out onto a terrace. The kitchen is fitted with sleek grey and white units with integrated Bosch electric oven with ceramic hob and extractor over.

There are three bedrooms and a fully tiled bathroom with panel enclosed bath, wc and vanitory unit sink.

To the front there is an off street parking space and bin storage area. To the rear the private garden has a paved terrace and a lawn area that leads to a rockery and water feature.

Square Footage: 861 sq ft

title: 3 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Immaculate and charming 2 double bedrooms apartment located in a sought after area in Eastcote, close to high street shops, restaurants and bars. It is situated within walking distance to the tube station (Metropolitan Line and Piccadilly Line) and in the vicinity of very good primary and secondary schools (Warrender Primary School, Bishop Ramsey ce School).

Newly built in 2014, this modern 1st floor apartment comes with an allocated parking space (and extra visitors parking) and it is located within beautifully maintained communal grounds.

This apartment has its own character and quirkiness given by the large kitchen window sill feature and the balcony with quadruple French doors and large balcony. It is located in a well maintained and secure building and has its own security video entry system.

The accommodation comprises a large L-shaped hallway leading to:

· 2 double bedrooms - both with enough space to accommodate a double or king-size bed and 2 wardrobes (one double and one triple door)

· Modern tiled bathroom fitted with wash hand basin, WC and bath with overhead shower

· Large open plan fitted kitchen flowing into the modern living room with French doors opening into a big balcony; the large French doors and 2 windows provide lots of natural sun light into the kitchen and living space

· 2 large storage cupboards with shelves for shoes and rails for clothes located in the hallway

· The apartment comes with high quality wool carpets throughout the hallway, cupboards and bedrooms and modern tiles in the bathroom and kitchen

The flat can be sold with or without furniture, depending on the buyer's specific circumstances. No chain.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
***available on london help to buy scheme***

New Hayes is a brand new development situated in the heart of Hayes Town on Pump Lane and offers a mixture of studio, one, two and three bedroom apartments all to be completed by November 2023. This exciting new development is being built by Fairview Homes and offers luxury living, spacious homes and modern etiquette throughout.

The apartments comprise brand new fitted kitchens with salt and pepper Quartz worktops, fully integrated 'Zanussi' appliances, Amtico Spacia wooden flooring throughout, premium painted doors, usb charging points in kitchen and living areas, external balconies/terraces, secure cycle storage and a mix of under croft and on street designated parking.

New Hayes is a great opportunity for first time buyers to get on to the property ladder or for long term investment with great rental returns. Do not miss this opportunity and enquire within - Call or email .

The Area

Being able to escape to a choice of open green spaces is what makes NewHayes
a unique place to live. Here youll find a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens with social and quiet areas to a family-friendly woodland area, with plenty of space to play in. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green
oasis for the whole community to enjoy.

Travel Options

Hayes & Harlington Station is just an 8 minute walk away, meaning you can be at London Paddington in 29 minutes. By car, you can be on the M4 in as little as 4 minutes, while quick journeys to Heathrow Airport bring the whole world closer.

Lifestyle

You’ll quickly discover that Hayes offers more than just a new address. Just a short distance away are supermarkets, high street shops, cafes and bars. Plus there are a number of gyms and The Beck theatre is just over a mile away.

For families, there are Ofsted-rated schools for all ages and if you want to step away to somewhere more tranquil, enjoying outdoor space is simple too. Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. Other open spaces within a short drive of NewHayes include Northala Fields, Lake Farm Country Park and Kew Gardens, which is just a 17 minute drive. Plus, the Grand Union Canal is nearby for whenever you want a waterside walk.

detailedDescription:
Brought to the market in The Larches, Hillingdon is this well presented and chain free two bedroom ground floor maisonette. The property is perfect for first time or investment buyers and has the benefit of no onward chain.

The property comprises entrance hall, fitted kitchen, large reception room, two bedrooms and a three piece bathroom. Externally the property has off street parking and to the rear a private garden.

The Larches is situated on the Oak Farm estate and is a short walk/drive from Long Lane providing transport links, amenities, local highly regarded schools and access into other locations. The Uxbridge Road and A40/A312 links are a short drive along with the Hillingdon train station connecting you to inner/outer London and Heathrow Airport. Contact Hunters today on to view.

Leasehold 160 years remaining
No service charge
Ground rent - peppercorn

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are very proud to introduce this stunning two bedroom, ground floor maisonette to the market boasting a huge front garden and driveway, paved rear garden and brand new lease!

The property has been completely refurbished throughout, with a new contemporary kitchen and bathroom, re-plastered and decorated interior walls, new flooring throughout, new electrics and a modern gas central heating system.

The property, being a ground floor maisonette, offers direct access to a large paved rear garden and a fantastic sized front driveway capable of holding many vehicles.

This two bedroom home would ideally suit a professional couple, or small family with a good choice of public transport, main road networks and schools nearby.

All windows are double glazed and the property is gas central heated throughout with underfloor heating, a garage can be found en-bloc opposite the front door and the property will be sold with no onward chain.

Location

The property is located on a quiet crescent shaped road, just off Willow Tree Lane, near Yeading Lane and just minutes away from the Hayes bypass.

The property is also just seconds away from bus services heading towards Hayes and Harlington station, Northolt station, Heathrow, Hatton Cross, Feltham and the Uxbridge Road which connects with an even larger choice of bus routes. For the motorist, the Hayes Bypass/Parkway is at the end of the road, further connecting with the M4 and M25. Local amenities including shops, a post office and a handful of restaurants which can be found a few minutes down the road, as well as Heathrow Aiport being a short drive from the property.

Crossrail from Hayes and Harlington station:
From December 2019*, when the full route opens, up to ten Elizabeth line services an hour will allow passengers from Hayes & Harlington to travel to Reading or Heathrow in the west or through the central London tunnels to Essex and southeast London. Journey times to Bond Street will be cut from 35 minutes to 20* minutes, Liverpool Street from 47 mins to 27* mins and Canary Wharf from 52 mins 34* mins.

Local schools include the popular St Raphael's Catholic Primary School, Downe Manor Primary School, Viking Primary School, Yeading Infant and Nursery School, Yeading Junior, Barnhill Community High School and Greenford High School which has recently been extended.

Lease Information

New lease upon completion.

detailedDescription:
A well proportioned apartment positioned on the third floor of this modern gated development.

Description

Ideally located just moments from Uxbridge town centre this modern apartment is an ideal investment property or first home.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises of, entrance area with a large built in storage cupboard, there is a superb open plan living space with a Juliet balcony, the kitchen is fitted with a range of storage units and drawers with stone work surfaces with an inset induction hob and instant boiling water tap, there is also an integrated electric oven, dishwasher and fridge freezer, the shower room has an enclosed shower, wash basin and w.c. Tiled walls and heated towel rail.

Outside

There are attractive communal gardens adjacent to the Grand Union Canal and the benefit of allocated parking.

Situation

Waterloo Wharf occupies a striking position and has stunning views of the Grand Union Canal, yet is situated just a few minutes’ walk from Uxbridge High Street and it’s vibrant array of shops, restaurants, culture and entertainment. When you want to venture further afield, you have the Piccadilly & Metropolitan lines on your doorstep, getting you to Baker Street in as little as 36 minutes. If you really want to spread your wings further, Heathrow, by road, is less than 6 miles away.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

detailedDescription:
A truly stunning home set on Windmill Hill and boasting a beautifully appointed interior, generously sized rooms and stylish features throughout. There are three bedrooms, a stylish kitchen, living room, dining room and family bathroom. The property also benefits from a driveway, garage and a beautifully maintained garden.

Direction

From leaving our office on Ruislip High Street turn right and continue to the end of the High Street. At the traffic lefts turn left onto Pembroke Road. At the next set of lights turn left onto Windmill Hill.

Situation

Windmill Hill is within walking distance of both Ruislip High Street and Ruislip Manor and their variety of shops, amenities, and schools including Sacred Heart, Lady Bankes and Bishop Ramsey. Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Ruislip Gardens tube stations are nearby offering access to the City and West End on the Central/Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines. This home is conveniently located to the A40/M25 with it's access into London and the Home Counties. Highgrove gym and swimming pool are also only a short walk away

Description

Full of character and charm with stylish interiors and a choice of generous living areas, this superb three bedroom residence will impress those seeking space, luxury and a convenient address. Beautifully presented throughout and including a fitted kitchen and bathroom the property has been well looked after. Upon entering throught the porch, the ground floor offers an abundance of space with a welcoming hallway leading to the kitchen and through lounge including a living room and dining room. The double reception room offers a dining area to the front aspect which flows through into the living room area with direct access to the rear garden. The kitchen has been well fitted with a wealth of storage space and appliances. The first floor boasts two large double bedrooms and a single bedroom, of which the master bedroom includes fitted wardrobes. Completing this impressive home is a family bathroom.

Outside

The front of the property is paved offering space for off street parking with access to the garage. The rear garden is an amazing suntrap with a patio area towards the property and a large lawn area towards the back. At the very end of the garden there is another patio area, perfect for relaxing.

auctioneer: Phillip Arnold Auctions

About Sipson

Sipson is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport adjacent to the Bath Road and offers easy access to the M4/M25 motorway network. The district adjoins Harlington to the east and West Drayton to the north which benefits from a mainline station on the Great Western Main Line to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking West Drayton to Canary Wharf is due for completion in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 37 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars is a short distance away along with the A40/M40/M4 and M25 giving access to London and the Home Counties along with Heathrow Airport.

Outside

description
Barnard Marcus are pleased to present to the market this fantastic 3 bedroom semi- detached bungalow located in Hayes.

The property is conveniently situated close to the Willow Tree Roundabout providing excellent transport links with access straight onto the A312 which leads up to the A40 with London within easy reach by car.
It is also situated within a short distance to the Willow Tree Retail Park, providing restaurants, home stores and Tesco Superstore. The Lombardy retail park is also just a short drive away providing access to Sainsbury's Superstore and various other High Street shopping.

Hayes is a town in West London, situated 13 miles (21 km) west of Charing Cross. Historically in Middlesex, Hayes became part of the London Borough of Hillingdon in 1965. The town's population was recorded as 95,763 in the 2011 census.

Hayes is best known as the erstwhile home of emi. The words "Hayes, Middlesex" appear on the reverse of The Beatles' albums, which were manufactured at the town's Old Vinyl Factory. The town centre's "gold disc" installation marks the fiftieth anniversary on 1 June 2017 of the Beatles' Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band album, manufactured in Hayes in 1967. The town is the location of the U.K. Headquarters of companies including: Heinz, United Biscuits, Fujitsu, and Rackspace U.K.
Notable historical residents include the early modern "father of English music", William Byrd, and a pre-eminent figure of twentieth-century English literature,

Offered to the market with the benefit of a new lease on completion, this one bedroom first floor maisonette is situated in the most convenient location for West Drayton High street and mainline train station.

Description

This well proportioned one bedroom first floor maisonette with separate kitchen and lounge, situated in a convenient location this apartment would make an ideal first home or investment purchase. The property is offered to the market chain free.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises, entrance hall with built in storage cupboards, living room with two front aspect double glazed windows, double bedroom, with two front aspect double glazed windows, fitted kitchen with a range of storage units and drawers, work surfaces with an inset gas hob and inset stainless steel sink, integrated electric oven, space for appliances and rear aspect double glazed window, the tiled bathroom has an enclosed bath, wash basin and w.c.

Outside

There is residents parking to the rear.

Situation

The property is located in this very popular location which is well suited for easy access to West Drayton, Yiewsley and Uxbridge with their wide range of day to day shops and amenities. Conveniently located with access to Stockley Business Park, local bus routes, London International Heathrow Airport, M4, M40 and M25 motorways, and West Drayton Main Line Train Station providing quick and easy access in to London Paddington Station which is also subject to Crossrail development bringing Liverpool Street to within 30 minutes and Canary Wharf to 37 minutes of West Drayton.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold
Local Authority: London Borough Of Hillingdon
Council Tax Band: B
Current EPC Rating: C

Lease: Extended to 99 years on completion.
Ground Rent: £25.00 per calendar month
Service charge: Nil

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Cameron Group are proud to present this stunning, top floor, two bedroom apartment located in the ever popular Drayton Garden Village development.

Description

Cameron Group are proud to present this stunning, top floor, two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located in the ever popular Drayton Garden Village development.

Accommodation

A modern integrated kitchen which is open plan to the spacious living room leading on to a large balcony with stunning views. Two double bedrooms, bathroom, en suite to the main bedroom, double glazed windows, balcony, lift access to all floors, landscaped communal gardens.

Situation

West Drayton's position on the western edge of the Capital means that it is superbly placed to access Central London with ease, with frequent services to London Paddington in less than 25 minutes from the West Drayton mainline station. The property is within walking distance to local shops, local bus routes and a short bus ride to West Drayton Main Line Station which is subject to the Crossrail upgrade, which will bring West Drayton to within a 40 minutes train journey to Canary Wharf and will give excellent regular access to the centre of London. The property also has excellent access to the M25 and M4 motorways.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease: 121 years
Local authority: London Borough Of Hillingdon
Council Tax Band: D
Current EPC Rating: B

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Russell Gardens, Sipson, West Drayton UB7
detailedDescription:
Superb 1 bedroom house / popular cul-de-sac location: An well presented 1 bedroom home perfect for easy access to London Heathrow Airport, the M4/M25 motorway network and the Bath Road. West Drayton mainline station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022) is only a short bus ride away.

This superb modern freehold property is nicely tucked away and has been well cared for and boasts a private garden front garden, a well fitted kitchen, superb fitted bathroom and double bedroom with built in cupboard.

Other benefits include an entrance large porch, double glazed windows, loft space and gas central heating.

Ideal for either the first time or investment buyer.

Ground Floor

Entrance Porch

Tiled flooring.

Living Room

Fitted carpet, radiator, feature fireplace and double glazed windows.

Kitchen

Ceramic tiled flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, cooker point, gas hob, extractor fan hood, electric oven, integrated fridge, integrated dishwasher and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to aspect

First Floor

Double Bedroom

Fitted carpet, radiator, fitted wardrobe and double glazed window.

Bathroom

Tiled flooring. Three-piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed corner bath, wall mounted hand basin, low level W.C. And part tiled walls and splashbacks. Frosted double glazed window.

Exterior

Outside Front

Low maintenance front garden with patio area.

Tenure

Freehold.

Garage In Block



About Sipson

Sipson is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport adjacent to the Bath Road and offers easy access to the M4/M25 motorway network. The district adjoins Harlington to the east and West Drayton to the north which benefits from a mainline station on the Great Western Main Line to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking West Drayton to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 37 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The village is surrounded by Green Belt land and open fields and also contains a select number of shops and restaurants. There are also two public houses: The Plough and The King William IV. The latter being a Grade II listed building originally built in the 16th century. Heathrow Primary school is located in Sipson Lane.

The 222 bus route runs regularly through the village connecting Sipson to West Drayton, Uxbridge, Heathrow Airport, the Bath Road and Hounslow.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on a highly desirable road in Northwood 0.4 miles from Northwood station sits this beautiful period, well maintained, three bedroom, three bathroom completely renovated and extended family home retaining many original features.
The property comprises an entrance hallway, front reception room, dining room, high specification kitchen with all integrated appliances and granite worktops with a side door to the rear garden. Also on the ground floor is an added benefit of a WC. On the first floor is the master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom, the second bedroom has fitted cupboards and an ensuite shower room. The second floor accommodates the large third bedroom which also has an ensuite shower room. There is surround sound speakers to the kitchen, master bedroom and en suite, and CAT5 cabling to all rooms. To the front is a driveway with off street parking for two cars and a side access gate leading to the rear garden. At the rear of the property is a large private garden.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

address: Chaucer Court, Glebe Avenue, Ruislip HA4
detailedDescription:
Enjoy a contemporary lifestyle of comfort and convenience in this executive apartment, ready made for an exceptional lifestyle. Ideally situated, it's a short walk to South Ruislip station and High Street. The property includes cutting edge design, and high quality finishes. A contemporary open plan kitchen/living room which boasts a Juliette balcony. The apartment benefits from a fresh décor throughout, and is most conveniently located making it a great investment opportunity with strong rental returns.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office, turn right and take a left into Shenley Avenue. At the bottom of Shenley Avenue follow the road to Eversley Crescent, and then take a right on West End Road. Continue along West End Road for around one mile, and Glebe Avenue comes up on the right hand side. Chaucer court is immediately on the left hand side.

Situation

Chaucer Court is one of two apartment buildings built in c.2007 on Glebe Avenue in South Ruislip, Glebe Avenue is situated just off West End Road, which is a popular residential road that runs through the heart of Ruislip, and is in close proximity to Ruislip and Ruislip Gardens, with its array of shops and restaurants. Ruislip offers Marks and Spencer, Waitrose, Pizza Express, Zaza and Cafe Rouge. The property is ideally located for those seeking transport links. South Ruislip Station is only 0.7 miles away, and is serviced by the Central Line and Chiltern Railways Service. The Chiltern Railways line offers quick access into London Marylebone, with trains on average twice an hour. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a stone's throw away, providing easy access into London and the Home Counties.

Description

Ready-made for relaxed, easy living and superbly convenient, this spacious two bedroom executive apartment is stylish throughout, and is great for those looking to buy their first home or investment in an exceptionally advantaged location. Upon reaching Chaucer Court, there is an entry system. Upon entering the private communal entrance hall the property is on the first floor. Once through the front door there is a large hallway, which offers access to all rooms. The lounge is decorated in crisp contemporary tones, with hard wood flooring, which flows seamlessly onto an elegantly appointed, contemporary kitchen. The kitchen has integrated appliances, and stylish cream units. There is ample space in the reception room for a dining table. The room is also flooded with natural light, from several windows and even has a Juliette balcony, great to open on those long summer evenings. The master bedroom is a great size, with fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower room. The second bedroom is also a good size. The family bathroom is modern, with a stylish tile pattern and white suite. For further convenience, there are storage cupboards for all your necessary bits and bobs.

Outsdie

There is an allocated parking for this apartment. Further, there is a well maintained communal rear garden for the use of all residents.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A two bedroom, 2 bathroom, second floor apartment situated in a convenient and popular development built approx 15 years ago on the Uxbridge Road. The property is accessed via a secure communal entry phone system with stairs leading to the second floor. A private front door leads into the hallway with built in storage and open plan lounge leading to a modern fitted kitchen. The master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and fitted wardrobes. The apartment also benefits from a good sized second bedroom and family bedroom. Outside there is an allocated undercover parking space and well kept communal gardens.

Directions

From our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left to the second set of traffic lights at the Long Lane junction continue down the Uxbridge Road proceed through two further sets of lights and past hsbc bank on your left hand side. Proceed in the right hand lane and take the next U turn available opposite Connaught Heights.

Situation

Connaught Heights is a modern development located just off the Uxbridge Road, Hillingdon offering easy access to bus/road links including the M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties along with Hillingdon hospital, Stockley Park and Heathrow Airport. Uxbridge town centre with its multitude of shops, bars, restaurants and Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station is a short drive away.

Description

A two bedroom, 2 bathroom, second floor apartment situated in a convenient and popular development built approx 15 years ago on the Uxbridge Road. The property is accessed via a secure communal entry phone system with stairs leading to the second floor. A private front door leads into the hallway with built in storage and open plan lounge leading to a modern fitted kitchen. The master bedroom has an en-suite shower room and fitted wardrobes. The apartment also benefits from a good sized second bedroom and family bedroom

Outside

The property benefits from an undercover, allocated parking space and well kept communal gardens.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Situated in a private gated development, this attractive mid-terrace mews house is deceptively spacious and built to exacting standards throughout. The property presents three double bedrooms, three bathrooms (two en suite), two reception rooms, kitchen dining room and a large single garage. Externally there is a private rear garden with store room, to the front is off street parking and access to the single garage. The property is offered to the market with the benefit of no onward chain.

Northwood provides a range of shopping facilities including Waitrose supermarket, a variety of restaurants and other amenities with the Metropolitan Line station providing access to Baker Street and the City. There is a plethora of state and private schooling together with a wide choice of recreational facilities, which include golf courses and fitness centres. The M1, M40 and M25 motorways are also accessible.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Extended four bedroom semi-detached house offers good size living accommodation set over two floors. Located in a popular road close to shops, amenities and transport links.

Entering via a porch which leads to the hallway, you have stairs to the first floor and doors to the ground floor rooms. The lounge is decorated in soft warm tones and has attractive wood flooring, a feature fire place with surround and a large bay window allowing natural light to flood the room. From the lounge there is direct access to the kitchen and glass doors open out to the garden. The main focus of this property is the spacious modern kitchen, with a range of wall and base units, breakfast bar with seating, ample work surfaces and space for appliances. This property also benefits from a guest shower room and downstairs office/bedroom.

To the first floor are three comfortable bedrooms two of which boast fitted wardrobes. Completing the first floor is a fresh family bathroom with separate shower.

Outside, the rear garden has a patio and a grassed area as well as a brick built storage shed. The front of the property provides off street parking for multiple vehicles.

Perfectly positioned for convenience, Lea Crescent is just moments from Ruislip Gardens shopping and transport facilities. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to Central London via the M25 and the M40. Commuters have the ease of Ruislip Gardens tube line Central/Main line, also offering quick service into Central London. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Ruislip Gardens Infant & Juniors and Ruislip High secondary school; as well as leisure facilities and local parks.
title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: "Plot 23" at Provident Industrial Estate, Pump Lane, Hayes UB3
detailedDescription:
**show home & marketing suite now open**

**new london help to buy available**



Fairview New Homes – NewHayes

A collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom duplexes in Hayes, UB3.

Plot 23

Plot 23 is a stylish and modern one bedroom, one bathroom, third floor apartment with a private balcony. Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes features landscaped gardens and family-friendly woodland areas and a choice of open green spaces. It comes complete with an open-plan living area and a fully-fitted kitchen with integrated appliances.

Dimensions (Metric)

Kitchen/Living/Dining

5.46m x 4.08m

Master Bedroom
3.90m x 3.48m

Total Floor Area
50.1 sq m / 539 sq ft

Total Outside Area
7.0 sq m / 75.3 sq ft

East facing balcony

The Area

Being able to escape to a choice of open green spaces is what makes NewHayes
a unique place to live. Here youll find a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens with social and quiet areas to a family-friendly woodland area, with plenty of space to play in. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green
oasis for the whole community to enjoy.

Travel Options

Hayes & Harlington Station is just an 8 minute walk away, meaning you can be at London Paddington in 29 minutes. By car, you can be on the M4 in as little as 4 minutes, while quick journeys to Heathrow Airport bring the whole world closer.

Lifestyle

You’ll quickly discover that Hayes offers more than just a new address. Just a short distance away are supermarkets, high street shops, cafes and bars. Plus there are a number of gyms and The Beck theatre is just over a mile away.

For families, there are Ofsted-rated schools for all ages and if you want to step away to somewhere more tranquil, enjoying outdoor space is simple too. Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. Other open spaces within a short drive of NewHayes include Northala Fields, Lake Farm Country Park and Kew Gardens, which is just a 17 minute drive. Plus, the Grand Union Canal is nearby for whenever you want a waterside walk.

The future of Hayes

Hayes & Harlington Station which currently operates Great Western services and is only an 8 minute walk away from NewHayes, will benefit from major improvements in preparation for the new Elizabeth line services.

Once complete, Crossrail will run from Reading in the West to Shenfield in the East and bring journey times for NewHayes residents to a multitude of central London locations down significantly.

Computer generated images depict the interior and exterior at NewHayes and are indicative only. *Travel times sourced from TfL and Google Maps. Your home may be repossessed if you do not keep up repayments on your mortgage or any other debt secured on it. *Terms and conditions apply, please refer to the Fairview New Homes website or speak to a Sales Advisor for full details. Details and prices are correct as of March 2021. Journey times approximate. *Source: National Rail. Source: Google Maps.

Specification

General
  • Amtico Spacia ‘Sun Bleached Oak’ flooring to kitchen/living/dining area and hall
  • Standard hanging pendant to living/dining area, hallway and bedrooms
  • Walls painted in Timeless white and ceilings in white
  • Premium painted doors with polished chrome/satin finish handles
  • Usb charging points in kitchen/living area and all bedrooms
  • Audio video phone handset
  • TV/FM/Sat/Telephone socket to living area with playback connection to master bedroom
  • External balcony/terrace wall mounted stainless steel light fitting (where applicable)
  • Smoke and heat detectors fitted
  • Fully landscaped podium level amenity levels (all secure and only accessible to residents)
  • Extensive character landscaped areas throughout the site
  • A mix of secure under-croft and on-street designated car parking
  • Secure cycle storage
Modern Kitchens
  • Gloss grey handleless wall and base units
  • Soft close doors and drawers
  • Quartz ‘Salt & Pepper‘ worktops
  • Wall units in hob area fitted with surface mounted lights
  • Integrated Zanussi stainless steel electric oven, black frameless induction hob and combi microwave
  • Smeg integrated canopy cooker hood
  • Integrated Zanussi fridge/freezer
  • Integrated Zanussi 450 or 600 dishwasher
  • Free-standing Zanussi washer dryer
  • White downlights with white light LED bulbs
  • Amtico Spacia ‘Sun Bleached Oak‘ flooring to open plan kitchen/living/dining area
  • Separate kitchen, floor tiled – Boulevard Grey
Beautiful Bathrooms

• White sanitaryware by Ideal Standard with chrome finish fittings

• Full height tiling around bath and shower enclosures‡

• Future Stone white porcelain wall tiling and flooring in bathrooms and ensuites (where applicable)

• White downlights with white light LED bulbs

• Chrome heated towel rail

• Shaver socket

Relaxing Bedrooms

• Fitted ‘New Dublin Twist’ grey carpets

• Secondary telephone socket to master bedroom

• TV socket to master bedroom

About Newhayes

A well-connected place to call home

Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes is an exciting new development. With a brand new selection of modern, well-designed studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, including wheelchair accessible apartments and parking. Youll easily find the one youll want to come home to.

Close by are a good range of amenities, Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. For commuters, Hayes & Harlington Station is within an 8 minute walk for journeys to Heathrow Airport (Terminals 2 & 3) in 6 minutes, Ealing Broadway in 9 minutes and London Paddington in 21 minutes.

With much regeneration in Hayes, including an entertainment and leisure complex, our new development offers buyers a home in a well-connected part of West London.

  • Something for everyone with supermarkets, high street shops, cafs and bars within walking distance. There are also a number of gyms if you want to keep fit and healthy, and for live music or comedy fans, The Beck Theatre is just over a mile away.
  • Getting around the Capital and beyond perfect for commuters, you can easily reach Hayes & Harlington Station within an 8 minute walk for journeys to London Paddington in 21 minutes and Heathrow airport is just a 26 minute walk or bus journey.
  • Relax into a new way of life – a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens to a family-friendly woodland area. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green oasis for the whole community to enjoy.
  • Education for all ages just a short distance away is a range of Ofsted-rated schools, all offering good levels of education for children of all ages.

  • Relax into a new way of life – a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens to a family-friendly woodland area. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green oasis for the whole community to enjoy.
  • Education for all ages just a short distance away is a range of Ofsted-rated schools, all offering good levels of education for children of all ages.

detailedDescription:
Situated within a quiet location and easy reach of The Green and West Drayton Train Station, this beautifully presented and extended four bedroom, detached bungalow offers bright and spacious living throughout.

The property comprises an entrance porch, a welcoming entrance hall, a three piece bathroom suite, a fully fitted kitchen with a range of units and integrated appliances, four well-sized bedrooms and a sitting/dining room which benefits from access to the rear garden. Externally, there is a private rear garden with lawn and patio area, a garage and a driveway providing off-street parking for multiple cars.

Roseary Close is located close to local shops, schools, The Green, West Drayton High Street and West Drayton Train Station. There are also bus links to Uxbridge College, Hillingdon Hospital, Brunel University and Uxbridge Town Centre with its multiple shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line Station.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A four bedroom very well-presented residence arranged over three floors, appealing perhaps to the growing or larger family. Located on a popular road within 0.6 miles from Eastcote Station. Many well-regarded schools are situated in the area, Definitely worth internally viewing this property.

Description
Offering good-sized accommodation over three floors, this four bedroom semi-detached home could suit the larger or growing family. Having been extended to the ground floor the welcoming entrance hall gives access to guest cloakroom, a bay-fronted reception room which flows effortlessly through to the dining room leading then onto the sizeable, bright and modern kitchen which benefits from patio doors leading out to a lovely low maintenance rear garden with a brick built outbuidling, patio and lawn areas, perfect for relaxing on entertaining on a warm summers evening. To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom and the second floor comprises of the master bedroom with en-suite facilities. The property features off road parking facilities to the front via a block paved driveway. There are a number of local amenities such a shops and restaurants along with recreational grounds and schools within a mile radius. Eastcote Station is within 0.6 miles from the property which facilitates the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines providing access to The City and the A40 is not too far away, perhaps appealing to those commuters needing to drive. This well-presented and sizeable family home is well worth an internal viewing and is ready to move straight into.

address: Duval House, High Street, Harmondsworth UB7
detailedDescription:
Duval House is a superb collection of 19 one bedroom and 6 studio apartments located in the desirable Harmondsworth village and within easy reach of transport links for access to West Drayton, Uxbridge, Heathrow and the motorway network

Description

Each apartment is designed to be both comfortable and make good use of the space available. The contemporary handle less kitchen features composite stone worktops with full height composite stone splashback, stainless steel sink with chrome lever tap
integrated Bosch induction hob, oven and extractor, integrated washer/dryer and fridge/freezer kitchen, the living and dining area is open plan to create a light and spacious place to relax with oak effect timber flooring, the luxurious fully tiled bathroom has a walk in shower, wash basin and w.c. Chrome heated towel rail and recessed back lit mirror.
There is an 8 passenger lift which accesses all floors, as well as stairways for those who prefer to walk. The communal areas are all carpeted and well maintained.
The apartment building has a CCTV security system covering the entrance lobby and the development as a whole, and each apartment has its own video phone entry system for added security.

Outside

The communal gardens ensure the development has some privacy and can be enjoyed by all residents. Each apartment has an allocated parking space available and there is also a bicycle storage area.

Situation

Duval House is located in desirable Harmondsworth village and within easy reach of transport links for access to West Drayton, Uxbridge, Heathrow and the motorway network.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold: 150 years
Service Charge: £2 per sqft
Ground Rent: 0.1% of purchase price

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: High Street, Yiewsley, West Drayton UB7
detailedDescription:
This stunning studio apartment been thoughtfully designed and is offered for sale fully furnished with bespoke fitments.

Description

Quad are transforming Kirk House to create a new landmark in the heart of West Drayton. The building’s original façade has been retained and enhanced, new landscaping is softening the streetscape and to the rear of the building, private parking is provided for all apartments. This is your opportunity to be a part of this exciting urban revival.
Quad is an award-winning residential developer led by architects combining bold design with finishes of the highest quality, making imaginative use of space to create homes that redefine contemporary living. Quad control every aspect of the design and quality of our buildings, displaying meticulous attention to the finest of details. Our passion for design results in new homes that stand the test of time, enhancing the lives of those who make their home in them.

Accommodation

Each apartment has been designed to maximise space and to create light, airy living spaces. Contemporary finishes have been specified throughout, allied to robust specifications for kitchens and bathrooms to ensure longevity and good looks.
Kitchens at Kirk House have been thoughtfully designed to perfectly blend form and function with a comprehensive range of integrated Bosch appliances, complimented with stylish grey Zenith worktops and oak wood flooring. Shower rooms have walk in showers with thermostatic controls and glass shower screens, electric towel rails, ceramic tiled floors and showers, bespoke built in cabinetry with under mounted wash basins with Zenith Magma vanity tops. Bedrooms have built in wardrobes and there is programmable lighting to living rooms, Virgin Media & BT cabling in place for fibre optic broadband & satellite TV connections
There is electric underfloor heating and Megaflo cylinders to ground and first floor apartments and gas boilers and flat panel radiators to the penthouse level.

Situation

As well as being within a minimum journey time of just 20 minutes from Paddington, Kirk House is just a few miles from lively Uxbridge. So, whether it’s work or play inthe capital or a night out with friends locally you won’t be short on choice. West
Drayton also has a great choice of restaurants in addition to supermarkets and independent stores. Uxbridge is also a great retail destination, with the Intu shopping centre complemented by a host of independent retailers. There’s an eclectic mix of restaurants with flavours from all corners of the globe, a multi-screen Odeon cinema, leisure facilities and Brunel University campus. If you’re seeking breathing space you won’t be disappointed. West Drayton is just moments from Colne Valley Regional Park and its green space and waterways, or Stockley Park, with its golf club.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold
Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon

Lease term: 150 Years
Service charge: £2 per sqft
Ground rent: 0.1% of purchase price per annum

detailedDescription:
Calling all cash buyers!

In need of full renovation and modernisation - priced below market value.

A large and imposing six bedroom detached house situated within a quiet cul-de-sac road in the popular Glencoe Park development in Yeading, Hayes.

This spacious property benefits from six well-proportioned bedrooms, three bathrooms (one ensuite), a large open plan reception room, a kitchen/breakfast room and a utility room. Further benefits include a driveway for two cars, a front and rear garden, downstairs W/C and scope for further extension (Subject To Planning Permission).

Located close to the delightful Yeading Marina, as well as Yeading Retail Park with plenty of local amenities such as Tesco Extra, Starbucks and Burger king among others.

Boasting excellent transport links in to Central London and Heathrow airport including the M4 motorway, as well as local bus links.

This property is an ideal project for an investor or developer looking to add value to a property or someone looking to create their ideal home.

Call for more information or to book a viewing!

address: Brookdene Drive, Northwood, Middlesex, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
Tucked away in a quiet and pleasant cul-de-sac, this four bedroom, two bathroom detached house is perfect for the family with bright and airy accommodation and conveniently placed for Northwood town centre.

The accommodation comprises an entrance porch, welcoming entrance hallway, a bright and spacious reception room with French doors into the garden, and a fully functional fitted kitchen with a range of units, integrated appliances and ample space for a dining table with seating. Completing the ground floor is a bathroom and garden room. The first floor holds four inviting, double bedrooms and a freshly presented family bathroom. Three of the bedrooms benefit from fitted wardrobes. Externally, there is off street parking via own drive and a neatly presented rear garden with an outbuilding.

Northwood town centre is close by offering a Waitrose supermarket and Metropolitan Line Station and a very high standard of education provided with both private and state schools.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Breakspear Road North, Harefield, Uxbridge UB9
detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented two bedroom first floor apartment situated in the very heart of Harefield Village over looking the village Green and duck pond. Having been built in 2013 by the reputable Clearview Homes this property is within walking distance of all local amenities, bus routes and Harefield Hospital.

The property briefly comprises; entrance hallway via secure phone entry system, with doors leading into an open plan lounge/kitchen with modern fitted kitchen and appliances, two good sized bedrooms both benefitting from built in wardrobes and white suite family bathroom. There is also access to own private loft via ladder and loft hatch. To the rear of the property via gated access you have an allocated parking space and well maintained communal gardens.

Situated in Swan Lodge on Breakspear Road North which is within walking distance of Harefield village and local amenities. For the commuter, Denham’s Chiltern Line and Rickmansworth's Metropolitan Line are just a short distance away and provide regular links into London, as does the A40 which is easily accessible.

Lease - 117 Years
Service charge - £122 Approx a month
Ground rent - £395 p.a

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Key features:
  • Freehold
  • Private courtyard garden
  • Convenient location
  • Off street parking
  • Plenty of storage
  • All electric
  • 15ft living room
  • Perfect starter home

Full description:
This delightful one bedroom freehold starter home is situated in a popular residential development nearby the Grand Union Canal and off the Cowley High Road. It would make the perfect purchase for first-time-buyers and investors alike.
With off-street parking for one car, plus visitors spaces, directly in front of the property, there is a small lawned area to the front of the property.
The front door leads into the entrance-way and kitchen area. The L-shaped fitted kitchen offers space for white goods, plenty of storage space and a view to the front of the property. The 15ft living space is large enough to house a large 3 seater sofa and fit in a dining table/desk. There are double-glazed patio doors leading to the courtyard garden - a real perk of this property!
Upstairs, the bedroom is a good-sized double with built in cupboard space, allowing for a clutter-free space. The family bathroom has an electric shower over the bath, W/C and hand basin. Next to the bathroom is a large storage cupboard.
Viewings are highly recommended on this highly desirable one bedroom property!



Downstairs
The open-plan kitchen into living space is spacious and light.
The kitchen provides plenty of storage space and a pleasant view to the front of the property.
The living space provides space for both a dining table/desk and a large 3-seater sofa. The patio doors lead out to the courtyard garden, which is laid to patio with a border which could be transformed by those who are green-fingered!

Upstairs
The bedroom is of a good size - 10'1" x 9'9" - and has built-in wardrobes.
At the rear of the property it is a quiet and peaceful room.
The bathroom is of a good size at the front of the property.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
**join our summer showcase event - Friday 23rd July - 10am - 4pm - book your place today!** A fantastic one bedroom retirement apartment for the over 70s situated close to local amenities.

Summary

Constructed by renowned retirement home specialists McCarthy and Stone, Lysander House is purpose built for Retirement Living Plus. Located in a beautiful old village in Greater London Lysander House has excellent transport links and beautiful surrounding areas This is a ‘retirement living plus’ development providing a lifestyle living opportunity for the over 70’s and designed specifically for independent living with the peace-of-mind provided by the day-to-day support of our excellent staff and Estate Manager who will oversee the smooth running of the development.

Homeowners benefit from one hour of domestic assistance each week and there are extensive domestic and care packages available to suit individual needs and budgets. All apartments are equipped with a 24-hour emergency call facility and sophisticated intercom system providing both a visual and verbal link to the main development entrance. There is also the excellent guest suite widely used by visiting family and friends for which a small charge per a night. The property enjoys excellent communal facilities including a home owners lounge, restaurant with a fantastic, varied daily table-service lunch, laundry, scooter store, library, hairdressing salon, hobbies room and communal gardens and terrace with seating areas.

This spacious one bedroom apartment is situated on the first floor. There is a double bedroom, lounge, a well fitted kitchen complete with integrated appliances and a modern wet room with a level access shower the property also benefits from underfloor heating.

Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops and restaurants. Bus routes include access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

Entrance Hall

Front entrance door with spy-hole, security intercom system that provides both a visual (via the home-owners TV) and verbal link to the main development entrance door. Emergency pull cord, a large storage/airing cupboard with light and shelving housing the Gledhill boiler supplying domestic hot water and the concealed ‘Vent Axia’ heat exchange unit providing an economic heat recovery system utilising the hot air generated within the property, filtering and recirculating this back into the principle rooms. Doors to the living room, bedroom and shower room.

Living Room

Spacious living/dining room with feature fire surround and decorative electric heater. Raised power points, TV point. Partially glazed doors opening to the kitchen.

Kitchen

Modern fully fitted kitchen with a good range of wall and base units with contrasting laminate worktops and incorporating a stainless steel inset sink unit. Integrated neff appliances include; a four-ringed hob with stainless steel chimney extractor hood over, waist-height oven with integrated microwave oven above and concealed fridge and freezer, integrated slimline dishwasher. Ceiling spot light fitting, splash-backs and tiled floor. Electrically operated window.

Bedroom

A well-proportioned double bedroom with power points and TV point. With a feature walk-in wardrobe with auto-light, hanging rails and shelving.

Shower Room

Modern white suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted furniture surround including storage below, fitted illuminated mirror, shaver point, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower. Partly tiled walls and wet room flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light.

Service Charge (Breakdown)

Cleaning of communal windows
• Water rates for communal areas and apartments
• Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas
• 24 hour emergency call system
• Upkeep of gardens and grounds
• Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas
• Contingency fund including internal and external redecoration of communal areas
• Buildings insurance
The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your Estates Manager, your water rates, our 24 hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of all communal areas and all external window cleaning, exterior property maintenance and gardening. Under floor heating for the apartment is also included within the service charge. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or Estates Manager.

Leasehold

Lease 999 Years from 2016
Ground Rent £435.

Car Parking

Parking is by allocated space subject to availability. The fee is £250 per annum, permits are available on a first come, first served basis. Please check with the Estate Manager on site for availability.

Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops and restaurants. Bus routes include access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

Entrance Hall

Of a good size with plenty of space for hall style furniture. Front entrance door with spy-hole, security intercom system that provides both a visual (via the home-owners TV) and verbal link to the main development entrance door. Emergency pull cord, a large storage cupboard/walk-in boiler cupboard with light and shelving housing the boiler supplying domestic hot water and the concealed ‘Vent Axia’ heat exchange unit providing an economic heat recovery system utilising the hot air generated within the property, filtering and recirculating this back into the principle rooms.

Living/Dining Room With Roof Terrace

Spacious living/dining room benefitting from a glazed patio style door with adjacent window opening onto a large, decked private roof terrace. Feature fire place with electric fire. Power points, TV and BT point.

Kitchen

Excellent range of wall and base units with contrasting laminate worktops and incorporating a stainless steel inset sink unit. Integrated neff appliances include; a four-ringed hob with stainless steel chimney extractor hood over, high level double oven and concealed fridge and freezer. Ceiling spot light fitting, tiled splashbacks and tiled floor.

Bedroom

A well-proportioned double bedroom with power points and TV point. With a feature walk-in wardrobe with auto-light, hanging rails and shelving.

Shower Room

Modern white suite comprising of; close-coupled WC, vanity wash-hand basin with fitted storage below, fitted mirror, shaver point and down lights over, walk-in level access shower with thermostatically controlled shower. Fully tiled walls and wet room flooring, electric heated towel rail, emergency pull cord and ceiling spot light.

Service Charge (Breakdown)

Cleaning of communal windows
• Water rates for communal areas and apartments
• Electricity, heating, lighting and power to communal areas
• 24 hour emergency call system
• Upkeep of gardens and grounds
• Repairs and maintenance to the interior and exterior communal areas

The Service charge does not cover external costs such as your Council Tax, electricity or TV, but does include the cost of your Estates Manager, your water rates, our 24 hour emergency call system, the heating and maintenance of all communal areas and all external window cleaning, exterior property maintenance and gardening. Find out more about service charges please contact your Property Consultant or Estates Manager.

Parking is by allocated space subject to availability. The fee is £250 per annum, permits are available on a first come, first served basis. Please check with the Estate Manager on site for availability.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market in immaculate condition, this extended four bedroom semi detached home is full of charm and character, ready for any buyer to simply move into. The property is a short walk from handy tube links into London and highly rated local schools. A viewing of this property is recommend as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left on Victoria Road. At the roundabout continue straight over. At the next roundabout continue straight over remaining on Victoria Road. At the traffic lights turn right into Long Drive/Station Approach. At the next set of traffic lights turn left onto West End Road. Masson Avenue will be the second turning on the left.

Situation

Perfectly positioned for convenience, Masson Avenue is just moments from South Ruislip shopping and transport facilities. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40, making it a popular choice for city bankers and professionals. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area and with tube and National Rail services from South Ruislip Station which is only half a mile away, travelling into the city via the Central or alternatively via the br line couldn't be easier - Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. Other nearby stations include Ruislip or Ruislip Manor on the Piccadilly/Metropolitan. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity as well as leisure facilities and local parks.

Description

This four bedroom semi detached home offers spacious ready made living in the heart of South Ruislip and provides an ideal setting perfect for a family. Upon entering the home, a welcoming hallway provides access to the ground floor accomodation and stairs rising to the first floor. To the front aspect is the spacious living room which boasts a large window filling the room with an abundance of light. To the rear of the property is the dining area and a utility room with a shower room which also offers access to the garden. The utility room can be converted into a ground floor bedroom. The dining room can be accessed via the living room, which benefits from views overlooking the well maintained garden. The kitchen is well equipped with ample storage and worktop space, it also offers access leading to the garden. On the first floor, the landing area leads to four bedrooms and family bathroom. The master bedroom benefits from a naturally bright space with a large window and built in wardrobes. The remaining three bedrooms are all good size doubles. The larger than average bathroom offers a well fitted space with a seperate bath, shower and w.c.

Outside

To the front there is a private garden with pathway leading to the front door. The rear garden offers a low maintenance oasis, with block paving throughout, to enjoy all year round. The garden is surrounded by a wall to add seclusion and security. Off street parking can be accessed from the back of the garden via a secured gated driveway.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful three bedroom detached bungalow perfectly located close to the area's local shops, transport facilities, schools and parks. Well presented throughout and offering light filled, well proportioned rooms this home has everything needed for a convenient lifestyle and presents a great opportunity to personalise and further enhance. Summary of approved planning applications - Option 1 - Approved plans to build a new 5 bedroom house, Option 2 - Approved planning for Rear and side extension and Option 3 - Approved planning for Dormer / loft conversion to make 5 bed house.

Directions

From our Ruislip office turn right. At the traffic lights, turn left into Pembroke Road. Continue on to Park Way. Take the third left into Acacia Avenue.

Location

Acacia Avenue is a quiet, highly sought after residential location. Eastcote and Ruislip Manor tube stations are a short walk away and offer the Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines towards Baker Street and Central London or Uxbridge and Harrow on the Hill. High Streets in Eastcote, Ruislip Manor and Ruislip, offer a variety of shops, cafes, banks and restaurants. There are a number of highly regarded schools, both primary and secondary in the local area, including Warrender, Newnham, Bishop Ramsey Church of England School and Ruislip High. The M40/M4/M25 are a short distance away providing connections into central London, Oxford and Heathrow.
Acacia Avenue also enjoys being nearby to a selection of great local leisure and outdoor activities including Highgrove Pool, Ruislip Lido and Ruislip Woods. The property is also located within close proximity to places of worship at both Ruislip Manor, Ruislip Eastcote.

Description

A detached bungalow full of charm and character and ideally located to an array of local amenities. This wonderful home makes a great choice for those seeking convenient low maintenance living across one easy single level. Inside the property there is a well proportioned entrance hallway with access to the loft, there are two double bedrooms to the front of the house, a kitchen/breakfast room to the rear with access to the garden and a good size lounge overlooking the garden with patio doors opening to the outside. The garage of the property has been converted to a double bedroom with a seperate dressing room. There is also a bathroom with a separate w.c. Further benefits include gas central heating and double glazing to the property. Additionally, the property has approved planning permissions for a Rear Extension and Dormer.

Outside

To the front of the house is a beautiful garden area, laid to lawn and with a selection of plants and shrubbery. There is off street parking via own driveway. A pathway leads to the entrance of the house at the side of the property and there is gated side access to the rear garden where there is a pleasant, well sized garden which has been beautifully kept and maintained by the current owners.
