detailedDescription:
Boasting space and style throughout, this four bedroom end terrace property offers buyers the perfect family home. The house is situated within walking distance to highly rated local schools and several tube links into London. The property is perfect for those looking to simply move their furniture into a new home. A viewing of this wonderful abode is recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office, turn left on Victoria Road and continue straight over both roundabouts. After the second roundabout take the second turning on the left which takes you into Whitby Road. The property is situated on the left hand side.

Situation

Whitby Road is a residential road, enjoying its setting close to parks and local amenities at Ruislip Manor, South Ruislip and Eastcote. The property is located within close proximity to a number of local schools including St Swithun Wells, Sacred Heart, Newnham, Field End Primary and Queensmead and Bishop Ramsey Secondary Schools. It is also within easy reach of a number of tube stations offering access to the City and West End on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly and Central lines. For the motorist the A40/M25 and its access into London and the Home Counties is a short drive away.

Description

This wonderful home has been extended in years past to maximise the living and bedroom space to present the perfect family abode. The home starts with a welcoming hallway offering access to all of the ground floor accommodation and stairs that lead to the first floor. With a open plan design, the living room, dining room and kitchen flow into each other to create a wonderful family space for everyone to interact in. The living room has a cosy feel to it and features a large bay window, which floods the room with light. The dining space has ample space to house the largest of dining tables. Ideal for those that love to entertain. The kitchen area also has space for a dining table and overlooks the garden. The kitchen offers an array of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. Off of the kitchen is a handy utility room and WC. The ground floor is complete with a study, perfect for those working from home currently. The room could also be used as a fifth bedroom. To the first floor are four generous sized bedrooms, all capable of housing a double bed. Bedroom four is currently used as a walk in wardrobe, and the master bedroom boast an ensuite bathroom. The first floor is complete with a family bathroom offering a white suite and tiles throughout.

Outside

To the front of the home is a driveway providing off street parking for several vehicles. A gate to the side of the property provides access to the rear garden. The garden is vast and perfect for those who enjoy their time in the sun. A large decking area offers space for alfresco dining. The luscious green lawn is flanked by bedding and small hedges taking you halfway up the garden. The second half of the garden has previously been used as vegetable patch, ideal for those with green fingers. To the back of the garden is a detached garage for storage.

43 Thornton Avenue, West Drayton, Greater London, UB7 9JU

Walking distance from the West Drayton High Street, where you will find all the high street amenities, including services such as High Street Banks/ cash point machines, coffee shops, takeaways/restaurants, Butchers, all the large supermarkets including Tesco and Morrisons which is only across the road. Off license, book makers, grocers plus lots more as well as to the West Drayton National Train Station – home to the Queen Elizabeth Line

U3 service to Heathrow Bus station or U5 – towards Hayes & Harlington via Yiewsley Health Centre, Stockley Park and Dawley Road. Further Bus routes include the 222 towards Hounslow via Heathrow North, Bath Road, Cranford and Hounslow Heath.

583 towards Uxbridge via Richings Park and Iver lane, as well as the opposite way towards Slough Town Hall via Slough station and Wrexham park Hospital.

Located close by to Primary schools/High schools/ Colleges and Brunel University.

Close by to dentist, Dr. Surgeries, clinics and Pharmacies. More amenities include being near parks, fields and social clubs.

Close to M4/ A4 Motor way and close to Uxbridge centre.

As you enter the property the stairs are on the right side of the passageway with the open plan reception room on the lefts side. The floor is laminated throughout with an Oak finish, the walls have been painted, ceilings painted in White Emulsion.

The kitchen has fitted units, hanging cupboards with matching draws. There is plenty of space for the white goods under the counter. Furthermore, there is a granite effect hard wood worktop in a dark colour which sits above the fitted units. There are rectangle tiles in Grey forming a back splash between the work top & hanging cupboards. The floor has been tiled in a dark colour.

As we go up the carpeted stairs, this house boasts two double bedrooms, a single bedroom & a W/C.

The bedrooms have hardwood doors in White, carpets, all the walls have been painted in bright White Emulsion and complete with wooden skirting boards also in White. The ceilings are painted White with matching covings all the way around. There are double glazed windows with UPVC frames. The double bedrooms have built in wardrobes, the box room is large enough for a bed & cupboard.

Further storage is in the loft which accessible via ladder. Subject to local planning permission the loft space could be developed further to accommodate an additional bedroom which would be on the second floor.

This property is achieving £1550.00 per calendar month on an AST.

The owners of the property have replaced the roof in 2020.
There is the option to convert the roof by adding a dormer & another room - STPP

Option at the rear for a single storey infill extension. - STPP

Option to add a rear garage. The garden is just over 70' feet.

Ideal property for any budding developers or experienced buy to let landlords who are ready to upgrade, modernise & add value to the house.

This property is achieving £1550.00 per calendar month on an AST.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

Something different! Simple Estate Agents present to the market this large five bed extended house, with some unique features. The property benefits from ample off street parking with electric gates, custom made bespoke hand built oak porch, two reception rooms, 2.5 bathrooms, large office space created in loft and two out buildings to name a few. The property is located a short walk to local schools, bus stops, Stockley Park and other local amenities. The property has the potential to further extend or develop (STPP). The property also has a south facing 4.2 Kilowatt solar power system to generate electricity and store in a battery storage system. We highly recommend a viewing to truly appreciate this unique property, give us call to get this arranged asap..

detailedDescription:
A stunning and exclusive collection of just four contemporary homes built to exacting standards setting the benchmark for modern living. Offering versatile accommodation with clean and crisp lines throughout these fantastic homes are perfect for the growing family. Plot 2 is a four bedroom semi detached home arranged over three levels with the ground floor comprising of entrance porch, hallway, cloakroom, open plan kitchen/living/dining room and a separate reception. To the first floor are three of the bedrooms, master with en-suite and dressing room in addition to the family bathroom. To the second floor is the fourth bedroom.

Description

A stunning and exclusive collection of just four contemporary homes built to exacting standards setting the benchmark for modern living. Offering versatile accommodation with clean and crisp lines throughout these fantastic homes are perfect for the growing family. Plot 2 is a four bedroom semi detached home arranged over three levels with the ground floor comprising of entrance porch, hallway, cloakroom, open plan kitchen/living/dining room and a separate reception. To the first floor are three of the bedrooms, master with en-suite and dressing room in addition to the family bathroom. To the second floor is the fourth bedroom.

Situation

The development is incredibly well placed being found on a highly sought after road that's located just under a mile from the village itself with its range of independent shops and eateries. Ickenham tube station is also within easy reach and there are also well regarded schools that can be found close by. For the motorist the A/M40 and M25 are also just a short distance away.

Outside

There are two parking spaces per property whilst each garden has a patio area found closest to the house, the rest of the garden being laid to lawn.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip head south on the High Street and at the traffic lights turn right into Kingsend and continue along the road. At the roundabout take the second exit into High Road and continue along the road passing West Ruislip station. Continue down the road and once you get to the village center turn right into Swakeleys Road and then follow the road all the way to the end and at the mini roundabout take the first exit staying on Swakeleys Road. At the next roundabout take the second exit into Harvil Road.

Disclaimer

This brochure, and the description and measurements herein, do not form part of any contract. Whilst every effort has been made to ensure accuracy, this cannot be guaranteed. Site layouts, floor plans and specifications were taken from plans which were correct at the time of print. All plans contained within this brochure are not to scale. Room dimensions contained within this brochure were taken off plans in metric and are subject to tolerances of +/- 50mm. Imperial measurements are for guidance purposes only. The information & imagery contained within this brochure is for guidance purposes only and does not constitute a contract, part of contract or warranty. Photos are representative of a similar Kearns Development finished to a similar specification. Details correct at time of print June 2021. All images remain the property of Kearns Residential.

Situated in a quiet and secluded cul de sac in the heart of Harefield Village is this charming five bedroom detached house offering immaculately presented interiors and a versatile floorplan. Other benefits include two family bathrooms, two staircases, a beautifully presented rear garden and countryside views.

Located close to Harefield Village with its central village green surrounded by shops, library and public houses and due to the semi rural location as well as the close proximity of the Grand Union Canal there are some quite spectacular walks and scenery. For extensive shopping facilities Uxbridge Town Centre is just 10 minutes by car and offers a number of famous high street names, numerous restaurants, fitness centre and a multi screen cinema complex.

Accommodation boasts, entrance hallway with doors leading to; well presented kitchen and comprising of several base & eye level units for storage and food preparation, large reception room with patio door to communal gardens, family bathroom with separate W.C., and three double bedrooms, two of which have fitted wardrobes. Benefits to the property includes a audio entry system, private patio and ample residents parking.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning one bedroom apartment overlooking the canal with a large private balcony forming part of this stylish modern development.

Description

Offering well proportioned accommodation this stylish apartment offers well proportioned accommodation and benefits from allocated parking and attractive communal gardens.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises of, entrance hall with a large built in storage cupboard with plumbing for the washer dryer, there is a superb open plan living space with a large private balcony overlooking the Grand Union Canal, the kitchen is fitted with a range of storage units and drawers with stone work surfaces with an inset induction hob and instant boiling water tap, there is also an integrated electric oven, dishwasher and fridge freezer, the bedroom is a generous size with built in wardrobes and the bathroom has an enclosed bath with shower over, wash basin and w.c. Tiled walls and heated towel rail.

Outside

There are attractive communal gardens adjacent to the Grand Union Canal and the benefit of allocated parking.

Situation

Waterloo Wharf occupies a striking position and has stunning views of the Grand Union Canal, yet is situated just a few minutes’ walk from Uxbridge High Street and it’s vibrant array of shops, restaurants, culture and entertainment. When you want to venture further afield, you have the Piccadilly & Metropolitan lines on your doorstep, getting you to Baker Street in as little as 36 minutes. If you really want to spread your wings further, Heathrow, by road, is less than 6 miles away.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold
Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon
Council Tax Band: C
Current EPC Rating: B

Lease: 122 years unexpired
Service Charge: £1,500 per annum
Ground rent: £330 per annum

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this One Bedroom First Floor Apartment – all interest and offers are invited.

*Guide Price £400,000 - £420,000*

internal:
Entrance Hallway - Front door opens to. Fitted storage cupboards. Security intercom system. Emergency pull cord.
Reception Room - Ample space for a range of furniture. Fitted carpet flooring. Double French doors to Juliette balcony. Opens to;
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of modern high gloss wall and base units with complimentary worktop. Integral eye level ovens, electric hob and overhead extraction fan. Fitted tile flooring. Space and plumbing for appliances and integral fridge freezer.
Bedroom - Double sized bedroom, master suite. Ample space for a range of furniture. Fitted carpet flooring. Rear aspect window. Fitted walk-in wardrobe with ample storage space and rear aspect window.
Shower Room - Suite comprising; overhead shower fitting, low level WC and wash hand basin within vanity unit. Partly tiled walls and fitted tile flooring. Heated chrome towel rail.

Communal Lounge
Restaurant
Wellness Suite
Laundry Room
Guest Suite

Estate Manager

external:
Communal Landscaped Gardens

Lysander House is purpose built for Retirement Living Plus. Located in a beautiful old village in Greater London Lysander House has excellent transport links and beautiful surrounding areas This is a ‘retirement living plus’ development providing a lifestyle living opportunity for the over 70’s and designed specifically for independent living with the peace-of-mind provided by the day-to-day support of our excellent staff and Estate Manager who will oversee the smooth running of the development.

Homeowners benefit from one hour of domestic assistance each week and there are extensive domestic and care packages available to suit individual needs and budgets. All apartments are equipped with a 24-hour emergency call facility and sophisticated intercom system providing both a visual and verbal link to the main development entrance. There is also the excellent guest suite widely used by visiting family and friends for which a small charge is payable per night. The property enjoys excellent communal facilities including a home owners lounge, restaurant with a fantastic, varied daily table-service lunch, laundry, scooter store, library, hairdressing salon, hobbies room and communal balcony/terrace as well as communal gardens sitting areas.

Please enquire for further breakdown of maintenance costs.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.

title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
This stylish and contemporary family home is a must see and one not to be missed. The fantastic decorative order makes it a superb choice for anyone seeking low maintenance living - ideal for the first home buyers, those looking to upgrade or a landlord looking to add to their portfolio.

The house is in good condition throughout and features to the ground floor a large welcoming hall, a rear aspect living room with doors out onto the garden, a modern good sized kitchen diner, a versatile downstairs double bedroom and a modern shower room. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms, one single bedroom, en-suite shower room off the master bedroom and the family bathroom. Externally the property benefits from two allocated parking spaces and a private rear garden with patio area, ideal for having family and friends over for those summer barbecues, children to play or simply unwinding after work with a good book.

Evergreen Drive is situated in the popular Drayton Garden Village development off Porters Way and within easy reach of West Drayton High Street with its selection of shops, restaurants, bars and transport links including West Drayton's future Crossrail link scheduled to be launched early next year. There are also a number of good local schools near by. Access to the M4, M25, Heathrow Airport, Hillingdon Hospital and Stockley Business Park is just a short drive away.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

detailedDescription:
Spacious maisonette in North Hillingdon just two minutes from Hillingdon underground station serving Piccadilly and Metropolitan lines with bus stops outside the door servicing major routes into Heathrow and Brunel University.
The maisonette is situated in a convenient location with various amenities including shops, a gp surgery, dental surgeries, butchery, post office, bakery, Kebab shop and pub right outside. The schools are highly rated.
Spanning over 1,200 sq ft, this maisonette offers versatile accommodation with three double bedrooms and two big size reception rooms (which can also be converted into further bedrooms). Making the property rentable to up to 5 separate tenants. A dream for any investor.
The first floor which is currently used as a living room and a separate dining room, it has beautiful exposed floorboards, an impressive fireplace and an open plan kitchen.
The second floor features two double bedrooms. One of the bedrooms is huge with fitted wardrobes. The other double bedroom is also good sized. There is also a 3 piece bathroom suite with a convenient separate shower room.
The third floor has a spacious double sized loft room. Its a hidden gem with far-reaching views and plenty of storage eaves and a fitted wardrob.
Outside is a recently decked private rooftop terrace that measures 11m by 6m, perfect for entertaining, bbq, urban gardening or sunbathing.
If turned into HMO, this property can fetch over £3000 pcm
Long Leasehold with 149 years. Ground Rent £60 annually and £190 Building insurance. No service Charge. Free parking permit.

detailedDescription:
Bradley and Co are delighted to offer to the market this extremely well-presented A' type three bedroom terraced home, with two good size reception rooms. Situated in a convenient location within easy walking distance to the shopping amenities and transport facilities of Ruislip Manor serviced by both Metropolitan / Piccadilly line providing services into London within forty minutes.

Upon entering this three bedroom terraced home, you are greeted with an light and airy hallway with wood stripped floors, to the left is the doorway to the first reception that is a good size with front aspect and the second reception looks out to the rear garden with double glazed French doors, for additional access. At the rear of the garden is a brick built garage which can be accessed as well via the gated service road.

The kitchen is a galley style and also has a doorway to the rear garden.

Upstairs you have two double size bedrooms, with an exceptionally large single third bedroom, there is a family bathroom with separate WC, this property has great potential to extend and modernize allowing the new owner to really apply their own individual mark and taste.

Also within the area are reputable schools for all ages and popular local parks and bus links.

Viewing Highly Recommended.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market with no onward chain, this extended two bedroom terrace home is full of charm and character, ready for any buyer to simply move into. The property is a short walk from handy tube links into London and highly rated local schools. A viewing of this property is recommend as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left and continue to the roundabout. Turn right into Cornwall Road and continue to the end. Turn right onto Torrington Road and then left on to West End Road. Continue until you reach the iron bridge. Proceed under the bridge and take the first right into Bedford Road and Clyfford Road is immediately on your left.

Situation

Perfectly positioned for convenience, Clyfford Road is moments from Ruislip Gardens shopping and transport facilities. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40, making it a popular choice for city bankers and professionals. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area and with tube and National Rail services from South Ruislip Station which is only half a mile away, travelling into the city couldn't be easier - Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. Ruislip Gardens (on the Central line) is a 5 minute walk away. Other nearby stations include Ruislip or Ruislip Manor on the Piccadilly/Metropolitan. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Ruislip Gardens Infant & Juniors and Ruislip High Secondary School; as well as leisure facilities and local parks.

Description

Generously proportioned throughout, this superb two bedroom terraced house will immediately impress with it’s spacious, open plan design and homely feel. Having been extended in past years the property presents a fantastic opportunity for young families to transform this house into a dream home. The entrance porch leads onto the hallway which offers access to all of the ground floor accommodation, and stairs that lead to the first floor. The living room boasts a bay window to flood the room with light, and a feature fireplace which acts as the focal point in the room. The kitchen, which overlooks the garden, offers a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. There is also space for an ample sized dining room. To the first floor are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom which is tiled throughout and boasts a white suite.

Outside

The front of the property offers a block paved driveway offering off street parking for multiple vehicles. The rear garden is partly laid to lawn, with raised bedding and a pathway leading to the garage at the back of the garden.

The kitchen can be accessed via the private dining room and leads to the garden via a side door. To the right of the property are two large reception rooms both with individual quaint fireplaces as well as excellent natural light. The first floor boasts a large landing area that splits off into three large double bedrooms. Bedroom four is a single size and completing this impressive home is a family bathroom with separate w.c.

Outside

The front of the property boasts a large driveway for off street parking with side access. The west facing rear garden is beautifully appointed with a well maintained lawn and foliage either side. The detached garage can be found at the bottom of the garden.

address: Field End Road, Eastcote, Pinner HA5
detailedDescription:
This property was extended approximately 7 years ago by the currently owners and has almost been doubled in size to over 1800sq.ft. Accommodation comprises, welcoming entrance hallway, separate WC, front aspect sitting room, double length living/family room with solid oak floor, full length shutters over French doors leading to the rear garden, original fire place and bespoke alcove cupboards, German engineered bespoke kitchen including Neff appliances, granite work tops, glass splash back, Franke sink and taps, roof lantern, floor to ceiling bifold doors leading to the rear garden, dual zone wine fridge, wet underfloor heating and imported continental European tiles. Laundry room.

To the first floor there are four bedrooms comprising; Master bedroom with solid pine flooring, fully fitted wardrobes and an en suite shower room with aqualisa shower. Bedroom two has a stunning vaulted ceiling, fully fitted wardrobes, velux windows, solid wood floor, en suite wet room with aqualisa shower, underfloor heating and imported continental European tiles/ Bedroom three with an original fireplace, fully fitted wardrobes, hardwood floor and en suite wet room with free standing bath, underfloor heating and imported continental European tiles. Bedroom four has solid pine flooring.

Outside the property has an attached garage and off street parking on a gravelled driveway for 5 cars. The wide rear garden is ideal for entertaining, with a large lawned and decked area.

The property is conveniently situated within a short walk of Eastcote and Pinner, with their underground links to Central London in 30 minutes. The area's leading primary and secondary schools are located within walking distance.

Offered for sale with no upward chain.

detailedDescription:
A collection of 1 and 2 bedroom apartments available through Shared Ownership coming soon - register your interest today

Located within the historic Randalls development, with the iconic converted former department store at its heart, Eves House is a superb collection of thoughtfully designed 1 and 2 bedroom apartments available through Shared Ownership. Offering a high specification throughout these new apartments are ideally placed for Uxbridge town centre and its excellent transport links.

Local Area

Today, Uxbridge has become a desirable destination for modern living with a lively town centre vibe complemented by tranquil award-winning green open spaces and the waterways of the Grand Union Canal.

Your new apartment at Randalls will put you within just a few steps of everything Uxbridge has to offer. Intu shopping centre plays host to a plethora of high street names and a multiscreen Odeon. In Windsor Street, part of the Conservation Area, historic buildings are home to a variety of independent retailers.

There's an amazing choice of restaurants in Uxbridge with tastes to suit all palates from all corners of the globe, in addition to coffee shops, pubs and bars.

If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of town centre living you'll find green space on your doorstep at Fassnidge Park, winner of the coveted Green Flag Award regularly since 2005. Designed by the same architect responsible for the art deco Randalls building, Fassnidge Park covers 4 acres and was opened in 1926. Today, this tranquil spot is a pleasant retreat and home to a bowling green, tennis courts and the popular Rusty Bike Café.

Transport

One of the great advantages to life in Uxbridge is connectivity.

Underground services operate via either Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines to the heart of the capital, with Baker Street accessible within as little as 39 minutes, while sport and music lovers will appreciate services to Wembley with a travel of time of around 25 minutes.

The nearest Crossrail station is nearby West Drayton, where forthcoming services will get you to Tottenham Court Road in 25 minutes and Canary Wharf in 38 minutes.

For wider world connections, Heathrow is just 6.5 miles away and is served by bus services from right outside your door on Vine Street.

Travel Times

From Uxbridge Station

32 minutes to Finchley Road*
39 minutes to Baker Street
43 minutes to Bond Street*
47 minutes to Westminster*
58 minutes to Liverpool Street*

From Randalls

1 minute to Intu Uxbridge
2 minutes to Odeon Cinema
3 minutes to Uxbridge Station
7 minutes to Tesco Metro
8 minutes to Fassnidge Park

2.5 miles / 4-7 minutes to M40
3 miles / 7-12 minutes to M25
5 miles / 9-15 minutes to M4
1.5 miles / 8 minutes to Brunel University
5.5 miles / 15-20 minutes to Heathrow

What is Shared Ownership?

Shared ownership properties are sold through housing associations. You purchase a share between 25% and 75% of the property using a deposit and mortgage.

Shared ownership properties are leasehold properties, meaning you will own the lease on them for a fixed period of time, typically 125 years. You also have to pay a service charge for the property, which is usually charged on a monthly basis.

*Source: - minimum journey time /

Internal photography depicts a typical Rosewood Housing interior and is indicative only. Computer generated illustration is indicative only.

**Shared Ownership terms and conditions apply.

detailedDescription:
Offering a superb opportunity to unlock the full potential of this this three bedroom semi detached home.

Description

A three bedroom semi-detached property that is offered for sale with the benefit of having approved plans for a double storey extension.

Accommodation

The accommodation on offer briefly comprises of, entrance hall, spacious double aspect living room, the kitchen is fitted with a range of storage units and drawers which is great for a family, the door leading to the south facing garden at the back of the property, there is also a large bathroom offering a light and airy feel with cupboard space available for your toiletries. The property is double glazed with the exception of the upstairs bathroom and kitchen with ample storage.

With stairs to the first floor with two double bedrooms and a large single bedroom

Situation

West Drayton's position on the western edge of the Capital means that it is superbly placed to access Central London with ease. The train line has frequent services to London Paddington and can reach in less than 25 minutes from the West Drayton Mainline Train Station. Subject to the Crossrail upgrade, you will be able to commute within a 40 minute train journey to Canary Wharf and will give regular access to the centre of London. The property also has convenient access to the M25 and M4 motorways and is also within walking distance to local shops, great schools, local bus routes and a short bus ride to West Drayton Town Centre.

Outside

There is an attractive south facing garden to the rear of the property that is mainly laid to lawn with a paved patio area and a large shed to the rear.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

detailedDescription:
A modern and stylish one bedroom first floor apartment located within a luxury, sought after development situated just a short walk from Hillingdon tube station. There is a communal entryphone system that leads into a communal entrance with lift access to the first floor. Once inside the apartment there is a hallway with doors leading to the generous 23ft living area which is open plan to the 11ft kitchen, 16ft master bedroom and family bathroom. Outside there is residents parking space and well kept communal gardens.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill, take your first left on Vine lane, continue straight down and Vine Lane merges into Honey Hill and at the bottom turn right onto Hercies Road and Chestlands Court can be found at the end of the road on the left hand side.

Situation

Chestlands Court is a quiet development located on Hercies Road, a sought after, tree lined, residential road in North Hillingdon. There are well regarded schools in close proximity including St Bernadettes and Oak Farm and a number of recreational facilities also nearby including Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park with its tennis courts and bowls club and the newly opened fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars is a short distance away along with the A40 giving access to London and the Home Counties. Hillingdon train station with its direct links to Baker Street and the City is a short walk away along with a number of local shops.

Description

A modern and stylish one bedroom first floor apartment located within a luxury, sought after development situated just a short walk from Hillingdon tube station. There is a communal entryphone system that leads into a communal entrance with lift access to the first floor. Once inside the apartment there is a hallway with doors leading to the generous 23ft living area which is open plan to the 11ft kitchen, 16ft master bedroom and family bathroom.

Outside

Outside offers residents parking and communal gardens.

detailedDescription:
This charming three bedroom older type semi-detached house offers generous proportions offering plenty of space for everyone and making it the ideal home for family living - EPC D.

Description
no upper chain. This charming three bedroom older type semi-detached house offers generous proportions offering plenty of space for everyone and making it the ideal home for family living.

The property is located in sought after 'Money Lane' within the conservation area and just a short walk to the 'The Green' and town centre with mainline railway station which will benefit from Crossrail.

To the ground floor there is an inviting entrance hall which leads to an impressive and easy flowing space perfect for day to day living and for more formal occasions such as entertaining. There is a living room with imposing bay window, dining room and a wide opening to the kitchen/breakfast room with a cloakroom/WC and french doors leading out to the rear garden.

Stairs from the dining room lead to the first floor where you will find a 14'8 wide principal bedroom with two windows flooding the room with natural light, second double bedroom, larger than average third bedroom and a family bathroom.
Outside

Front: Wall to both sides and the front boundary with opening to pathway leading to the front door. Shared driveway to garage at rear.
Rear: A concrete path from the kitchen leads to an area of lawn and fish pond. Mainly fenced boundaries.
Location

Located within a short walk of 'The Green'. The town centre of Yiewsley and West Drayton (with mainline railway station which will benefit from Crossrail), bus routes (with service to London Heathrow and Uxbridge) and schools are all within walking distance. London Heathrow Airport, the motorway network, Stockley Business Park and the town centre of Uxbridge are all within easy motoring distance.

Heating & Hot Water

A gas fired combination boiler serves the radiator system and provides the domestic hot water.

Windows

White UPVC double glazed sealed unit windows.

Council Tax Band

We understand that the current council tax band is E.

Services

Mains gas, electricity, water and drainage.

Tenure

Freehold.

Viewings

Strictly by appointment with R Whitley & Co.

detailedDescription:
A modern four double bedroom, three bathroom detached home within in a private development over looking Court Park. Benefiting from Garage via own drive way two en suites and a 25x18ft living room.

This fine modern home was constructed circa 10 years ago and offers spaces over three well appointed floors with accommodation that currently offers, entrance hallway, downstairs w.c., bright and wide living room with doors leading to the gardens, kitchen breakfast room complete with appliances. The first floor has three double bedrooms one with en suite shower room and the family bathroom. The top floor enjoys the master suite with beautiful views over court park and en suite bathroom.

Outside
The front enjoys a garden area and driveway with parking that leads to the garage. The rear garden is easy to maintain approx. 30ft and offers a lawn and patio area

Monterey Close is a modern and private development of just four Houses situated off Holm Grove, just off Sweetcroft Lane and within easy reach of local shops, Court Park and the London Underground Station. There are also bus links to Brunel University and Uxbridge Town Centre with its multiple shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line.

detailedDescription:
Chain free - Orchard Property Services are delighted to present this bright and airy two double bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment in excellent condition, perfectly located moments away from both Ruislip Gardens station and the A40. With modern interiors and fitted kitchen, this spacious property would be ideal for all types of purchasers looking to move into the local area. Added benefits include en-suite to master bedroom, fitted wardrobes, allocated parking and communal garden areas. We would recommend an internal inspection.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall with storage space, sun lit lounge with Juliette balcony and modern fitted kitchen. There are two double bedrooms with the master having an en-suite and a family bathroom. Outside consists of communal garden area and parking bays.

Location

Chaucer Court, Glebe Avenue is located only a short distance from the vibrant Ruislip High Street, where all shopping needs can be met in the form of Banks, local Post Office and the department store, John Sanders. There are also many restaurants, cafes and supermarket (Waitrose) as well as convenience stores including Tesco Express, Sainsbury’s Local and M&S Simply Food.

Recently built and only moment away is the ever popular ‘Old Dairy’ development with an array of different restaurants, supermarkets including Asda and also a cinema complex.

This property is also ideal for clients requiring proximity to tube stations, South Ruislip & Ruislip Gardens stations (Central & overhead Chiltern Line) are with short distance as well as bus stops walking distance from the property.

Chaucer Court, Glebe Avenue also offers easy access to Uxbridge, the A40/M40, M25 and therefore all major motorways.

detailedDescription:
An attractive four bedroom semi-detached home that is arranged over three floors creating a spacious home for the growing family. It is located in a desirable location in Ickenham situated within close proximity to a number of highly regarded schools, the A40 and Ickenham Village with its shops, bars and restaurants. The Central/Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line stations are also within walking distance.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham on Swakeleys road turn left and continue along the road the property is further up the road on the left hand side.

Situation

The property is situated within close proximity to well-regarded schools such as Breakspear Primary, Douay Martyrs and Vyners Secondary. There are excellent transport links with the A40/M40 a short drive away providing access to London and the M25. Ickenham Village is a short walk away where there are a vast range of local shops, restaurants and bars. Ickenham Station offers the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines whilst West Ruislip Station is serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station. There are a number of leisure facilities nearby including Ruislip and Uxbridge Golf Course, also there is Ickenham Cricket club.

Description

Offered to the market this generous size four bedroom semi detached home offers great potential and versatility for the growing family. As you proceed through the hallway to the right hand side you are welcomed by a bright and airy kitchen/breakfast room leading through to a good size separate utility room. Returning back to the entrance hall on the left side you have a storage cupboard and to the right hand side you have the downstairs cloakroom. To the rear of the property you have a spacious living room offering both living and dining space. Concluding the downstairs is a fantastic conservatory with direct access to the rear garden. On the first floor, you have three well proportioned bedrooms, two of which offer fantastic storage with fitted wardrobes. Concluding the first floor is the family bathroom. As you proceed upstairs to the second floor you have the fourth bedroom, which also has the benefit of eaves storage space.

Outdoors

To the front of the property you have a large driveway offering off street parking for numerous vehicles. To the rear of the property you have an immaculate private garden. The rear garden has been newly landscaped offering great outside space for a family to enjoy. The property also offers side access from front to rear.

detailedDescription:
A lovely residence set in the heart of Eastcote and close to an array of amenities including a selection of local shops, Eastcote and Ruislip Manor train stations and a choice of leisure facilities and woodland areas. The property offers an ideal home full of wonderful features and charm and is set in a quite cul-de-sac.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High street, turn left and continue to the end of the high street, at the mini roundabout take the third exit onto Eastcote Road. Continue on Eastcote Road and go straight over the roundabout, pass the zebra crossing and continue on the road which shortly becomes High Road Eastcote. At the next roundabout take the second exit onto Field End Road and then take the second exit at the next roundabout continuing onto Field End Road. Take the first right onto The Sigers.

Situation

This property is conveniently situated only a short walk away from Eastcote High street which offers an array of shops, cafés and restaurants. Pinner, Ruislip and Ruislip Manor's high streets are all also nearby and has a range of cafes, restaurants and shops to offer. Eastcote is surrounded by beautiful woodland parks and fields whilst Ruislip nearby has a selection of parks to enjoy and also The Lido. Eastcote, Ruislip and Ruislip Manor stations provide the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines whilst the Central line is available from South Ruislip Station. For the motorist, the A40 leading to London and the Home Counties is easily accessible. For families there are a number of highly regarded schools and nurseries within close proximity.

Description

As you head into the property through the porch you are greeted with the entrance hall with access to all ground floor rooms. Initially on the left is the large living room with a wealth of space to relax. At the rear of the property is the modern fitted kitchen with room for appliances as well as further storage. Access to the garden is available from both the living room and kitchen, completing the ground floor is a guest cloackroom. Stairs rise to the first floor with two double bedrooms, both with private en suites. This property offers easing living at a convenient address in the heart of Eastcote.

Outside

The outside of the property boasts a private garden which is laid to lawn as well as artificial grass following the boundary.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are humbled to present this incredibly spacious and well maintained, modern family home to the market. This bright and spacious four bedroom chalet-bungalow offers four good sized bedrooms, a large open plan living and kitchen space, a separate dining room or guest room, two bathrooms, off street parking and a modest sized garden. The property has been maintained and kept to an excellent standard throughout and the home is located on a quiet residential street with bus services and schools in close proximity.

Location

The property is located on Fairholme Crescent, just off Lansbury Drive. It is nestled on a quiet residential road just moments away from several desirable primary schools, secondary schools, local amenities, several parks and recreational grounds.

The property is also just seconds away from the nearest bus routes heading towards Hayes and Harlington station, Northolt station, Heathrow, Hatton Cross, Feltham and the Uxbridge Road which connects with an even larger choice of bus routes.

Crossrail from Hayes and Harlington station; when the full route opens, up-to ten Elizabeth line services an hour will allow passengers from Hayes & Harlington to travel to Reading or Heathrow in the west or through the central London tunnels to Essex and southeast London. Journey times to Bond Street will be cut from 35 minutes to 20* minutes, Liverpool Street from 47 mins to 27* mins and Canary Wharf from 52 mins 34* mins.

Local schools include the popular Hayes Park School located along Raynton Drive, Grange Park Junior School, St Raphael's Catholic Primary School, Downe Manor Primary School, Viking Primary School and Barnhill Community High School.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Property Details

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.

This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.

Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.

The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.

The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.

Referral Arrangements

The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted.

Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you.

Situation

Westholme Gardens is well located being only a short walk to Ruislip Manor Shops and Metropolitan and Piccadilly line tube station. Ruislip High Street is also within easy walking distance. Along with local parks and access to both Ruislip Lido and Woods. For the motorist, the property is ideally situated for the A40/M40 and M25 road links which are within a short drive away, offering easy and swift access into London and towards Heathrow, Ealing, Watford and Oxford.

Description

This property offers an exceptional opportunity to enjoy a lifestyle of comfort and convenience in this 1st floor maisonette. Westholme Gardens is well located to local amenities making it a great choice for first time buyers or as a good investment choice with strong rental returns. The property itself briefly comprises a private entrance on the first floor to landing area, living room, kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms both of which are comfortable doubles. There is a superb opportunity to further enhance and personalise the property.

detailedDescription:
Set over three floors, this extended four bedroom terrace property boasts space and style throughout, offering the perfect family home. Neatly nested away, this secluded abode is just minutes walk from Ruislip Gardens underground station, as well as local shops and highly rate local schools. A viewing of this radiant retreat is recommend as soon as possible.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip Manor turn left. At the roundabout take the third exit onto Cornwall Road. At the end turn right and through the width restriction then turn left onto West End Road. Turn left after Ruislip Gardens tube station onto Bridgwater Road, and then left again onto Carmichael Close. The house is on the right hand side.

Situation

Carmichael Close is a quiet residential road, conveniently located for commuters using the central line as Ruislip Gardens station is a 5 minute walk away providing a reliable service into London by both tube and train. The property is about a mile from Ruislip High Street which offers a more extensive range of shops, trendy eateries and cafés including Marks & Spencer, Waitrose, Cafe Rouge The Duck House and Pizza Express. Ruislip Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station is at the end of the High Street and provides regular connections into Baker Street and the City. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away. The open fields of Ruislip Rugby Fields and Yeading Brook Green are both a 5 minute walk away.

Description

This well presented home has been extended and renovated in recent years to offer buyers a spacious and streamlined home for any family to simply move their furniture into. The property starts with a large welcoming hallway offers access to all of the ground floor accommodation and, stairs that lead to the first floor. The kitchen to the front of the house boasts base and wall units, stylish worktops and space for integrated appliances. The living room is bright and commodious, with room for a dining space for those that like to entertain. The conservatory overlooks the garden and is currently used as a playroom. The downstairs is complete with a handy WC and plenty of storage under the stairs. To the first floor are two double bedrooms, both benefiting from built in wardrobes. The family bathroom boasts a white suite and tiled splashback around the bath and behind the sink. Further storage can be found under the stairs that lead to the second floor. Upstairs, Two further bedrooms can be found, both with additional storage. The top floor is complete with a en-suite shower room to the third bedroom.

Outside

The property benefits from allocated parking to the front of the house. The petite front garden is gated and offers a space to house the bins. The rear garden is a secluded oasis boasting a decked area for alfresco dining and a artificial lawn to enjoy all year round. The garden is surrounded by shrubs and fencing. To the back of the garden is an office space, ideal for anyone working from home or looking for a studio space away from the home. There is also a large storage cupboard in the garden office.

detailedDescription:
Apartment 5 harefield place house, The Drive, Ickenham

A glorious three bedroom, three bathroom ground floor apartment set in the Georgian mansion house boasting a large South facing terrace.
With a spacious kitchen/dining area and drawing room and en-suites and fitted wardrobes to the Master and bedroom two.

Private residents' leisure suite and set amongst acres of private grounds and gardens.

The development also benefits from an estate manager.

Harefield Place is an exquisite ensemble of just 25 two and three bedroom luxury apartments, nestling amidst 8.5 acres of verdant greenbelt countryside, yet within easy reach of central London. Ideally located in Ickenham, off one of the most desirable private roads in Middlesex, this magnificent development offers nine spectacular homes in an original Georgian mansion house, with a further 16 superb apartments in an adjacent purpose-designed new building. These exceptional apartments sit within extensive, beautifully landscaped grounds, enjoying the exclusive use of private leisure facilities and a secluded lake, with unparalleled views over South Buckinghamshire and beyond.

Residents leisure amenities - At Harefield Place, you can take the time to truly look after yourself, with exclusive access to luxury wellness facilities including an indoor pool, fully-equipped gym, sauna & steam room and hot tub. Plus, with a tennis court within the grounds you can polish up your serve or take a relaxing stroll around the beautiful gardens and relax by the lake.

Once a gentleman stately country residence, Harefield Place is a historic Grade II listed house that has been lovingly restored to its former glory. Behind the elegant Georgian façade, original features abound, from the imposing entrance hall to the high ceilings and tall sash windows that every apartment offers. Complementing this understated grandeur is an exquisite modern masterpiece, which offers more contemporary open-plan layouts along with private balconies and terraces. Whether modern or traditional, each space has been creatively conceived as a perfect backdrop to your lifestyle.

Despite its tranquil setting and old world charm, Harefield Place is surprisingly well connected: Whether heading to the West End, the City, Europe or further afield, road, rail and air travel are all easily accessible. With three of the ten most in-demand Tube stops all within less than 3 miles, travelling into central London is speedy and direct, taking just over 30 minutes. Ickenham station (6 minutes), Hillingdon station (8 minutes) and Ruislip station (9 minutes) are on the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines, while West Ruislip station (8 minutes) is on the Central line. West Ruislip station also provides rail travel into London. By car, the M40, M25 and M4 are each a short drive; the proximity of Stockley Park and Uxbridge Business Park (both within a 15 minute drive) enhance the prospect of a work-life balance.

Covid-19 update:
While we continue to operate within government guidelines, the housing market remains open for business. We continue to take customer calls and our sales team remain available. The safety of both our staff and our customers remains paramount. We have strict measures in place and viewings are available on an appointment only basis. Social distancing measures must be adhered to at all times.

If you prefer not to visit, we are also available over the phone and we can offer virtual tours of many of our homes.

The A40/ M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away along with Uxbridge Town centre with is multitude of shopping facilities, bars and restaurants.

A fabulous and flexible three bedroom semi-detached house that has been modernised and extended creating a generously proportioned and modern family home with a separate 32ft annexe that benefits from a shower room and private front door access. The ground floor of the property offers an entrance hallway, ground floor shower room, utility area, a modern 16ft kitchen/dining room, 11ft living room and 12ft family room. To the first floor, you have a generous landing area, 12ft second bedroom, 11ft third bedroom and a family shower room. Outside

The private garden is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area stretching across the rear of the garden along with a variety of shrubs and bushes along the borders.

detailedDescription:
Extended two bedroom detached home.

Location

Pinner provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Marks & Spencer Food Hall, Sainsbury’s, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine, including an award winning restaurant and several coffee/snack bars. Also a charming French Market takes place once a month offering locally made arts/crafts and fantastic foods.

The schooling, both state and private, is well recommended and there are convenient links to Central London via the Metropolitan Line station at Pinner (Baker Street 26 minutes approx.) The Piccadilly Line station at Eastcote (approx. 2.9 miles).

Description

A bright and spacious detached family residence with a lovely, secluded private garden, situated in an enviable and convenient location in Pinner.

The property is accessed via an internal storm porch that leads in turn to the entrance door and thereafter the extremely spacious entrance hallway. There is access to the large double sitting room in excess of 27 ft. In length with a large square bay window to the front of the property. The kitchen/dining area connects to the sitting room and runs across the width of the property with double doors and views onto the rear garden. The kitchen area is finished with wooden effect base and wall units and plenty of worktop space. There is an integrated dishwasher, washing machine, oven and a five ring gas hob. Adjoining the kitchen/diner is another room that could be used as a home office, ground floor bedroom or client room for anyone that consultants from home as there is side access from the garden. The ground floor is complete with a guest cloakroom.

To the first floor a bright staircase and landing with window to side provides access to two bedrooms and the family bathroom. Bedroom one is situated to the front of the house with extensive wardrobes across one wall providing much storage space. Bedroom two is also of good size with direct access to the eaves providing an abundance of further storage space. The family bathroom is fully tiled throughout and has an integral bathtub, separate shower cubicle, WC and basin.

To the front, the property has a crazy paved front garden with a variety of small trees and shrubs and a low brick built garden wall on the border

To the rear the garden is very secluded. It is mainly laid to lawn with flagstone patio area bordering the house and high hedges to the back of the plot providing a significant amount of privacy.

Square Footage: 1447 sq ft

title: 2 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Now launched with Help to Buy - Reserve now and receive a free parking space!

Welcome to The Venue, an exciting new development with rich musical heritage. As part of the former Old Vinyl Factory, known for being the home of emi and pressing ground-breaking records under His Master’s Voice record label. The Venue will feature 181 one, two and three bedroom apartments, surrounding a central private podium garden, just a short walk from Hayes and Harlington train station.

Located on the 7th floor of The Venue is this 783sft 2 bedroom apartment. The apartment will offer an open-plan living and dining area with terrace offering easterly views, and a master bedroom with ensuite bathroom, one further bedroom and a family bathroom.

Each apartment will benefit from a choice of flooring to the hallway and living spaces and forest oak doors with polished chrome ironmongery. The kitchen will offer a wide choice of designer units by Oakwood Kitchens, a choice of quartz stone worktops, fully integrated Zanussi appliances and under unit LED lighting. All bedrooms come with a choice of carpets, with all master bedrooms offering fitted wardrobes. The main bathroom is fitted with a choice of ceramic porcelain floor and wall tiles, Fascino smart shower and tap, and vanity units with integrated storage space in a choice of three finishes. All apartments also come with an audio/visual entry system and Hyperoptic Broadband.

Set to complete between spring 2022 and spring 2023, The Venue will also offer landscaped gardens and a concierge service.

With its convenient location under a mile from Hayes Town Centre filled with vibrant cafés, bars and restaurants, The Venue is in a prime location for people looking to be part of an exciting community at one of London’s most iconic musical landmarks. As part of the refurbishment of the Old Vinyl Factory, a three-screen cinema and live music venue will accompany the eight-acre site, with regular interactive exhibitions to celebrate the history of the complex. You can reach Hayes and Harlington train station in just a 10-minute walk, which offers services to London Paddington in just 20 minutes. London Heathrow is also only a 10-minute drive away.

Coming soon – please contact the sales team to book your appointment.

detailedDescription:
Now launched with Help to Buy - Reserve now and receive a free parking space!

Welcome to The Venue, an exciting new development with rich musical heritage. As part of the former Old Vinyl Factory, known for being the home of emi and pressing ground-breaking records under His Master’s Voice record label. The Venue will feature 181 one, two and three bedroom apartments, surrounding a central private podium garden, just a short walk from Hayes and Harlington train station.

Located on the 3rd floor of The Venue is this 792sqft 2 bedroom apartment. The apartment will offer an open-plan living and dining area with terrace offering easterly views, and two bedrooms both with ensuite bathrooms.
Each apartment will benefit from a choice of flooring to the hallway and living spaces and forest oak doors with polished chrome ironmongery. The kitchen will offer a wide choice of designer units by Oakwood Kitchens, a choice of quartz stone worktops, fully integrated Zanussi appliances and under unit LED lighting. All bedrooms come with a choice of carpets, with all master bedrooms offering fitted wardrobes. The main bathroom is fitted with a choice of ceramic porcelain floor and wall tiles, Fascino smart shower and tap, and vanity units with integrated storage space in a choice of three finishes. All apartments also come with an audio/visual entry system and Hyperoptic Broadband.
Set to complete between spring 2022 and spring 2023, The Venue will also offer landscaped gardens and a concierge service.
With its convenient location under a mile from Hayes Town Centre filled with vibrant cafés, bars and restaurants, The Venue is in a prime location for people looking to be part of an exciting community at one of London’s most iconic musical landmarks. As part of the refurbishment of the Old Vinyl Factory, a three-screen cinema and live music venue will accompany the eight-acre site, with regular interactive exhibitions to celebrate the history of the complex. You can reach Hayes and Harlington train station in just a 10-minute walk, which offers services to London Paddington in just 20 minutes. London Heathrow is also only a 10-minute drive away.
Coming soon – please contact the sales team to book your appointment.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A well presented three bedroom semi detached house conveniently situated between Uxbridge and West Drayton centres. The property offers excellent family size accommodation in great condition with a contemporary kitchen and laminate flooring throughout the ground floor. Other noteworthy features include: No onward chain, 18ft Main bedroom with en-suite and sauna as well as an upstairs bathroom, driveway parking and a large rear garden.

Situation

Barlee Crescent is situated close to a number of local amenities including Hillingdon Hospital, Brunel University, Stockley business park and well-regarded schools. There are a number of bus/road links close by creating easy access to Heathrow Airport, the M4 and M25. Uxbridge Underground station is just a short drive away along with its high street full of a multitude of shops, restaurant and bars. The property is also within close proximity to West Drayton High Street which has the added advantage a mainline station and Crossrail due for completion in 2020.

Description

A well presented three bedroom semi detached house situated between Uxbridge and West Drayton. The accommodation comprises: Entrance hall, 13 ft living room, contemporary kitchen/dining room with laminate flooring. On the first floor are two double bedrooms and a modern bathroom suite, on the second floor is a converted 18tft main bedroom with ensuite and sauna.

Outside

The property has driveway parking and is enclosed by gates. The rear garden is larger than average and has an area of lawn, a good size decking area and side pedestrian access.

Sat Nav

UB8 2EX

address: Bunting House, Coyle Drive, Ickenham UB10
detailedDescription:
Bunting house is located in the ever popular Ickenham area. It is 40% shared ownership and is highly advised to arrange a viewing. Ickenham is serviced by the Chiltern, Central, Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines providing the area with excellent transport options.

The remaining 60% is paid in rent per month at £412.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham turn right and at the end of the road turn left onto Ickenham high road. Take the third left onto Aylsham drive and the first left onto Josiah drive. Bear right at the end of the road onto Coyle drive, Bunting house is on the left.

Situation

This apartment, occupies an enviable position being located a short walk away from Ickenham village which offers a superb range of fashionable shops, cafes and restaurants. West Ruislip station is within walking distance and is serviced by both tube (Central line) and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes. Ickenham station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines) is a short walk away providing reliable links into the City and West End. Alternatively For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties.

Description

A modern and spacious two bedroom third floor apartment being offered for sale on a 40% shared ownership basis. The property is well presented throughout and is ideally located within a popular development in Ickenham and situated close to West Ruislip Central Line station and Ickenham Metropolitan/ Piccadilly Line station. Further benefits include two double bedrooms, 22.6" open plan kitchen living area, modern bathroom, double glazing, gas central heating and secure allocated parking.

address: West End Road, Ruislip, Middlesex HA4
detailedDescription:
Conveniently positioned this five bedroom end of terrace family home in need of some modernisation is situated in an ideal location close to the shopping amenities and transport links of Ruislip. Within the catchment area of several highly regarded schools including Sacred Heart, Ruislip Gardens Primary and Ruislip High School.
The accommodation is comprised of a porch which open into an entrance hallway off of which the doors lead to a spacious front aspect reception room, a rear aspect dining room, and fitted kitchen. Completing the ground floor is a guest w/c and through the kitchen is a room which could be used as a utility room or office space. To the first floor there are five bedrooms, two which have fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom. Externally there is a driveway offering off street parking and access to the garage and the private garden to the rear has borders of mature shrubs and bushes and is mainly laid to lawn.

Completing the ground floor is a double bedroom and a bathroom. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and a stylish bathroom. Externally the property offers a secluded south facing garden that is laid to lawn with a decking area .

detailedDescription:
A one bedroom, second floor retirement apartment offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Northwood. Accessed is granted via a well-maintained communal entrance and stairs rise to the second floor where the property offers a light-filled, 19ft lounge offering direct access to a fitted kitchen with ample room for integrated appliances.

Directions

From our Pinner office on Bridge Street, head towards Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Green and proceed for 0.8 miles. At the roundabout, take the second exit onto Pinner Road. Continue down Pinner Road for 0.2 miles before turning right onto Addison Way and then turn right onto Acre Way. Neal Close can be located a short distance down on the right hand side.

Situation

Neal Close is a desirable cul-de-sac ideally located off of Rickmansworth Road, conveniently placed between Pinner and Northwood Hills extensive high streets offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan line is easily accessible at Pinner Station and Northwood Hills Station which offers swift access into London, as well as many bus routes towards Harrow, Ruislip and Northwood. For the motorist the M1, M40 and M25 motorways are also accessible providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. There are a number of highly regarded schools including Pinner Wood School and Northwood School in close proximity, along with the convenience of a number of leisure facilities including Better Gym and Highgrove Leisure Centre.

Description

A one bedroom, second floor retirement apartment offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Northwood. Accessed is granted via a well-maintained communal entrance and stairs rise to the second floor where the property offers a light-filled, 19ft lounge offering direct access to a fitted kitchen with ample room for integrated appliances. Completing this residence is a spacious master bedroom and a modern bathroom. There are a number of additional benefits including an on site warden, 24-hour emergency cords, secure entry-phone system, residents lift and maintained communal areas.

Outside

The property benefits from beautifully maintained communal grounds, an allocated parking space and ample visitor parking bays.

The accommodation comprises security entry phone system, entrance hall, fitted kitchen/reception/bedroom and a three piece bathroom. Outside, there is residential parking and direct access to the communal gardens.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located, this three/four bedroom semi detached home is situated within walk distance for highly rated local schools and handy tube links into London. The property offers an abundance of space and makes for the perfect family home with three generous bedrooms and the potential for a fourth bedroom downstairs. A viewing of the wonderful home is recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office, turn left on Victoria Road and continue straight over both roundabouts. After the second roundabout take the second turning on the left which takes you into Whitby Road. The property is situated on the left hand side.

Situation

Whitby Road is a residential road, enjoying its setting close to parks and local amenities at Ruislip Manor, South Ruislip and Eastcote. The property is located within close proximity to a number of local schools including St Swithun Wells, Sacred Heart, Newnham, Field End Primary and Queensmead and Bishop Ramsey Secondary Schools. It is also within easy reach of a number of tube stations offering access to the City and West End on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly and Central lines. For the motorist the A40/M25 and its access into London and the Home Counties is a short drive away.

Description

This well presented family abode offers buyers just under 1,200 square feet of floor space, perfect for the ever growing family. The home has been renovated in recent years making it ideal for any families looking to simply move their furniture in. The property starts with a handy porch, ideal for storing coats, shoe and buggies, not to mention keeping out the cold. The open plan living/dining room is bright and spacious. Perfect for those that like to entertain. Stairs lead to the first floor, while door doors lead out to the rear garden. The kitchen offers a range of stylish base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. Grey splash-back tiles surround the kitchen which boasts views of the garden from the window. The downstairs is complete with a large reception room which is currently used as a study, but could easily be used as a fourth bedroom. From this room there is a shower room with a WC. To the first floor, there are three generous sized double bedrooms, all with built in wardrobes. The family bathroom offers a white bathroom suite surround by white tiles.

Outside

The front of the property has been block paved to provide off street parking. The front is surrounded by fencing and a small wall. A locked gate to the side of the property provides access to the rear garden, which offers a low maintenance oasis for the family to enjoy throughout the year. The garden is block paved and surrounded by fence panels, with a raised up decking area to the back of the garden.

Situated in the heart of Uxbridge, this one bedroom apartment ideally suited for the first time buyer or those looking to start or add to an investment portfolio, given strong and constant demand for rental property in the area.

The accommodation of apartment briefly comprises, entrance hall with a built in storage cupboard housing the washer dryer, open plan living space featuring handle-less fitted kitchen with stone worktops and instant hot water tap, integrated appliances to include, electric oven, induction hob, microwave and refrigerator, there is a double bedroom and shower room with contemporary white sanitaryware, including storage, shaver socket point, chrome single lever tap to basin, heated towel rail, wall tiles by Porcelanosa, thermostatically controlled shower with minimal frame shower door.

Situation

Lovell House couldn’t be better placed if you want a lifestyle that offers you the best of everything. Just moments from your door, Intu shopping centre plays host to a superb selection of retailers, while an extensive choice of restaurants to suit every palate are just a short stroll away. For a breath of fresh air there’s also acres of green space at your disposal as well as canal-side towpaths for walking, running or cycling.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic opportunity to buy this two double bedroom detached bungalow, sitting on a good size plot of around 0.12 acres and has a fantastic West facing garden, with huge potential for extensions to create a much larger family property. Close to shops, schools and tube stations and no onward chain.

There is an entrance porch, leading to the hallway. The living room has patio doors leading out to the rear garden and a door to the kitchen and the outer lobby, that in turn accesses the bathroom. The kitchen has been recently re-fitted with a range of modern units at eye & base level with ample work surface areas and a door leading to the rear garden. There are two double bedrooms - both having fitted wardrobes and there is a bathroom at the rear of the bungalow.

Outside, the beautiful West facing rear garden is a real feature and a good size, therefore, any large rear extension will not compromise the garden. The garden is mainly laid to lawn with an array of flower & shrub borders. There is a patio area and access into the garage. There is multiple off road parking on the driveway to the front of the property, with an up & over door into the garage.

Lime Grove is a popular road, equidistant to Eastcote, Ruislip & Ruislip Manor - all with a good selection of shops, bus routes and amenities. Tube stations at all locations are easily reached, with the Met/Picc line providing access into London and Heathrow airport. There are a number of highly regarded local primary and secondary schools in the area as well as parkland and leisure facilities. For the motorist, the A40/M40 road network is within a short drive.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
This spacious three-bedroom apartment is located in the quiet and peaceful Drayton Garden Village development, ideal for both first-time buyers and investors. Located a short walk away from West Drayton train station which benefits from direct trains into London Paddington and Reading within 25 minutes. Heathrow Airport, Stockley Business Park and the M4/M25 are all within easy reach. Further, Crossrail services (planned to commence in 2022) will provide direct connectivity to the City and Canary Wharf in about 30 minutes.

The property boasts an open plan kitchen/living and dining area, private terrace, 3 bedrooms with the master benefiting from fitted wardrobes and an en suite shower room, a modern family bathroom fitted with WC, washbasin and a bath with an overhead shower. Heating and domestic hot water are provided by a communal boiler system.

The property is located on the 3rd floor, comes with a south-facing terrace that stretches the full width of the apartment and provides excellent open views. The property also benefits from 2 covered, allocated parking spaces in a private gated car park. The property is not on the Heathrow flight path.

Kew Apartments is a modern apartment block situated on the much sought after Drayton Garden Village Development, located just a short distance from West Drayton High Street with its range of independent shops, restaurants and excellent transport links.

detailedDescription:
Brought to the market in Pikestone Close, Yeading is this first floor studio apartment offered with no chain.

The property comprises entrance hall, shower room, studio room/living space and a fitted kitchen. There is storage space in the flat and is also has the benefit of double glazing and electric heating. Externally there is allocated parking for one car.

Pikestone Close is a cul de sac in Yeading within close proximity to transport links, amenities and motorway links such as the A312/A40/M40/M4. Contact Hunters to organise an appointment on .

detailedDescription:
*virtual viewings are available*

A rare opportunity to acquire a stunning three/four bedroom semi detached home located within close proximity of Hillingdon Hospital, Stockley Park and Heathrow Airport, with Uxbridge town centre being easily accessible. The property has gone through major improvements from the current owners and has been extended to the rear of the property to offer ample living accommodation spread across two floors. The property benefits from a downstairs w.c, 20ft living room and driveway parking space. Viewings are highly recommended to capture what this property has to offer.
