title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: West End Road, Ruislip, Middlesex HA4
detailedDescription:
A three bedroom, two bathroom semi detached family home with garage enjoying an ultra convenient location close to schools, shops, transport links and parks.

Once inside the welcoming hallway doors lead to all principle rooms and stairs to the first floor. There are two generously sized reception rooms, one to the front with a bay window flooding plenty of natural light into the room and one to the rear overlooking the garden. The kitchen has a range of wall and base units, ample work surfaces with space for appliances. Off the kitchen is a door providing direct access to the garden. The property has the added benefit of a downstairs guest shower room.

Rising to the first floor there are three comfortable bedrooms, two doubles and one single. A family bathroom and separate wc complete the first floor.

The well tendered rear garden has a patio area and a lawned area bordered with colourful flowers, bushes and shrubs. There is also a brick built outbuilding and a storage shed.

West End Road is a popular residential road that leads into Ruislip High Street. It is within close proximity to Ruislip Manor although Ruislip High Street is a short stroll to cafes, trendy eateries and shops. Local transport links are available nearby from either Ruislip or Ruislip Manor station for the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line providing good links into the City and West End. Alternatively South Ruislip station is serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties.
title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautifully designed, four bedroom family residence boasts bright and spacious interiors throughout. Ideally set over three floors making it perfect for family living. The property is in catchment for sought after schools and is just over half a mile from the local amenities.

The ground floor comprises of a spacious entrance hall, fitted kitchen, a generously sized open plan reception room benefiting from double doors opening out to the rear garden and a WC. The first floor comprises of a double bedroom with an ensuite shower room, a further bedroom with access to a balcony and a family bathroom. On the second floor you have the master bedroom offering fitted wardrobes and an ensuite. Completing the second floor is a further double bedroom.

To the rear of the property there is a lovely secluded garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a small patio area. There is allocated parking to the rear of the property.

detailedDescription:
This generously proportioned three-bedroom mid terraced house is located a stone's through away from Hillingdon Village. The ground floor of the property comprises of hallway, 16ft lounge, 8ft Kitchen, leading onto the 8ft dining room. On the first floor, there is a 13ft master bedroom, 10ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and take your first left into Vine Lane. Take your first right into Chetwynd Drive and at the end of the road turn right into Cedars Drive. Buckingham Grove is the first turning on your left.

Situation

Buckingham Grove is a sought after, tree lined, residential road set within Hillingdon Village offering easy access to Hillingdon Hill with its bus links and local shops. There are well regarded schools in close proximity including Bishopshalt senior school and recreational facilities also nearby such as Hillingdon Golf and Cricket Club, Court Park and the newly opened fitness and leisure centre in Uxbridge. Uxbridge Town Centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Piccadilly/Metropolitan Line Station is a short distance away along with the A40 giving access to London and the Home Counties.

Description

This generously proportioned three-bedroom mid terraced house is located a stone's through away from Hillingdon Village. The ground floor of the property comprises of hallway, 16ft lounge, 8ft Kitchen, leading onto the 8ft dining room. On the first floor, there is a 13ft master bedroom, 10ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom, and family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property, there are a number of communal parking spaces and a low maintenance rear garden.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented throughout and enjoying a superb location, this three bedroom property boasts a modern kitchen, living/dining area, two bathrooms, a garage and private garden. The garage has an upper level which could be used for storage, or converted into an additional room (STPP). This house is a great choice for a family who wants a house without needing any work, and start enjoying living in a beautiful home.

Directions

From our Ruislip office, turn left onto Ruislip High Street and continue until you reach the mini roundabout. At the roundabout take the second exit onto Eastcote road. Continue on Eastcote road, and at the mini roundabout take the second exit to remain on Eastcote road. Continue straight until Lidgould Grove can be located on your right hand side. Follow the road round onto Flowers Avenue, and then turn left onto Blagrove Crescent. Once the gates have opened, follow the road round at the property can be found on your right hand side.

Situation

Blagrove Crescent is situated in the Sandringham Grange development, built by Taylor Wimpey and is within walking distance of Eastcote and Ruislip Manor shops, underground stations, cafés and restaurants. Both Ruislip & Eastcote stations are on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line. Field End Road provides a regular bus service to Northwood, Ruislip and Northolt and for the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away providing access to London and the Home Counties. This property is within the catchment area of some highly sought after primary and secondary schools, including the well renowned Bishop Ramsey School. A number of leisure facilities including Highgrove and Ruislip Golf Club are also nearby.

Description

A superb three bedroom home boasting light filled, generously proportioned living space arranged over three floors. On the ground floor the hallway leads to the modern fitted kitchen at the front of the property which benefits from a good amount of storage and worktop space. There is a guest cloakroom and the spacious living/dining area in the centre of the home. The rear end of the room is filled with an abundance of light with there being a glass panelled roof and patio doors opening to the outside patio area. On the first floor there is one double bedroom complete with fitted wardrobes as well as a family bathroom and a further bedroom. The top floor offers a large double bedroom with an impressive en suite consisting of w.c. Hand basin, bath and seperate shower. This is a stunning residence, flawlessly presented and designed to radiate a relaxed, effortless lifestyle.

Outside

To the side of the property is ample parking infront of the garage. At the rear is an attractive garden laid to lawn with a patio area.

detailedDescription:
A well presented one bedroom first floor apartment situated in a highly sought after modern building in Hillingdon. Briefly comprising; entrance hall with video entry phone system, large lounge with Juliet balcony over looking communal gardens, spacious modern fitted kitchen with gas hob, double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a modern tiled bathroom with overhead shower. Also benefiting from neutral décor throughout, gas central heating, double glazing, well maintained communal gardens and an allocated off street parking space. Within close proximity of excellent road and rail links providing access to Uxbridge, Heathrow, Stockley Business Park, Brunel University and Hillingdon Hospital.

detailedDescription:
*** coming soon ***
*** help to buy ***
Set on the borders of Uxbridge, Hillingdon and Hayes is this prestigious development comprising of six lavish brand-new apartments forming this private residence set for completion in early 2021. With a refreshing expert design completed to an exemplary standard throughout, the apartments will be offered to the market with a virtual freehold (based on 125 year lease term) and with the added benefits of security entry phone system, communal gardens and ample allocated parking.

The generously proportioned apartment options include a choice of ground floor two bedroom, two bathroom garden apartments, two bed, two bathroom first floor dwellings and Manhattan apartments housed on the top floor.

The development is located within easy reach of Hayes & Harlington station which is currently being regenerated and undergoing major improvements in preparation of the exciting and upcoming Crossrail venture with the Elizabeth line providing links further west to Reading to East London via the city. Heathrow Airport, Hillingdon Hospital, Stockley Park the M4 and M40 motorway and Uxbridge Town centre are also all accessible within minutes of the development via local transport links offering fantastic accessibility options.

Two Bedrooms
The property offers entrance into a large central hallway leading to a spacious lounge area with an open plan high-end fitted kitchen complete with integrated appliances, two double bedrooms with an en-suite shower room to the master bedroom and a contemporary fitted shower room.

Manhattan Apartment
The property offers entrance into a hallway leading to a spacious lounge and kitchen area with a divided sleeping area and additional full sized storage room. The kitchen is fitted with integrated appliances and a contemporary fitted shower room completes the apartment.

Full plans are available and site appointments can be arranged by appointment, please call or email to register your interest

detailedDescription:
Rodgers Estate Agents are delighted to offer this superb two double bedroom house for sale, situated in a popular quiet residential development, just moments walk to Harefield High Street and the centre of the village. The accommodation comprises of an entrance hallway with a built in storage cupboard, downstairs cloakroom, living/dining room, kitchen, two double bedrooms and bathroom. The house also benefits from a good sized rear garden and off street parking to the front for two cars. A viewing is highly recommended, please call the Harefield Office to arrange a viewing.

Ground Floor

Entrance Hallway
Front door with double glazed opaque panel. Carpet and radiator. Doors to the cloakroom and living/dining room. Open to the kitchen.

Storage Cupboard
Built in storage cupboard.

Downstairs Cloakroom
Low level WC and vanity hand wash basin with tiled splash back. Radiator and extractor.

Kitchen
8' 1" x 6' 8" (2.46m x 2.02m) Front aspect window with double glazed panels. Range of wall and base units. Built in oven and gas hob with extractor above. One and a half bowl stainless steel sink and drainer unit. Tiled flooring and part tiled walls. Cupboard housing the boiler. Spaces for washing machine and fridge/freezer.

Living / Dining Room
15' x 12' 8" (4.57m x 3.85m) Rear aspect double glazed sliding doors leading to the garden. Carpet and radiator. Carpeted stairs leading to the first floor.

First Floor

First Floor Hallway
Carpet. Loft access hatch. Doors to the bedrooms and bathroom.

Bedroom One
12' 7" x 8' 1" (3.84m x 2.46m) Front aspect window with double glazed panels. Carpet and radiator.

Bedroom Two
12' 7" x 8' 2" (3.84m x 2.48m) Rear aspect windows with double glazed panels. Carpet and radiator. Built in cupboard with hanging rail and shelving.

Bathroom
Panel enclosed bath with shower attachment and glazed shower screen. Vanity hand wash basin and low level WC. Part tiled walls. Extractor.

Outside

Rear Garden
Good sized rear garden, mainly lawn with paved patio area. Wooden shed. Secure rear access gate.

Front Of The Property
Lawn area of front garden. Storage cupboard housing meters.

Parking
The house also benefits from two parking spaces.

detailedDescription:
A stunning and beautifully presented ground floor flat, constructed in 2013 by the reputable Clearview Homes, located in the heart of the village with local amenities just moments away.

Overlooking Harefield village green and duck pond to the front, the location is excellent and would suit any first time buyer or those looking to downsize. Swan Lodge is a development of just six apartments and the accommodation briefly comprises of spacious and bright lounge, double bedroom and modern fitted kitchen and bathroom Features include gated off-street residents parking to the rear, visitor spaces to the front. A long lease (approx. 118 years) and no onward chain. Viewings are thoroughly recommended.

Outside
The development is surrounded by landscaped communal gardens and there are allocated parking bays.

Location
Harefield is within approximately 5 miles from Rickmansworth, Northwood, Ruislip and Uxbridge. There are good rail links to London from nearby Denham, Northwood (Metropolitan Line) and Rickmansworth. The M40, A40, and M25 (Junctions 16 & 17) are easily accessible with connections to major airports.
The location provides plenty for those yearning for the outdoors such as nature walks to the lakes and canals. There are horse riding, golf and sailing clubs only a short distance away as well as a local cricket and football club.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located in Ruislip Gardens, this two bedroom terrace property has been extended to the rear to offer buyers a spacious family home in a convenient location and can be sold chain free. The property, which has a fresh and modern feel throughout, is within the catchment for highly rated schools and just a few moments walk from Ruislip Gardens Underground Station. A viewing of this wonderful home is recommended.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip Manor turn left onto Victoria Road. At the roundabout take the third exit onto Cornwall Road. At the end turn right, driving carefully through the width restriction and turn left onto West End Road. Continue under the iron bridge and turn right onto Bedford Road and the property is a short drive down on your right hand side.

Situation

Bedford Road is a residential road, conveniently located for commuters using the central line as Ruislip Gardens station is a few minutes walk away, providing a reliable service into London by both tube and train. The property is about a mile from Ruislip High Street which offers a more extensive range of shops, trendy eateries and cafés including Co-operative, Waitrose, Cafe Rouge and Pizza Express. Ruislip Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station is at the end of the High Street and provides regular connections into Baker Street and the City. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away. The open fields of Ruislip Rugby Fields and Yeading Brook Green are both a 5 minute walk away.

Description

Immaculately presented throughout, this extended two bedroom terrace house will immediately impress with its fresh, modern design and character features. Having been well maintained over the years, the property presents a fantastic opportunity for young families, with its spacious rooms and extended floor-plan. When entering the home, there is a welcoming hallway which offers access to the ground floor accomodation and stairs which are located on the right hand side providing access to the first floor. The lounge and dining area benefits from the charm of a large window, parquet flooring throughout and is decorated in neutral tones. Ideal for anyone looking to relax in the evenings. There is also a space for anyone looking for a study or place to work from home. The kitchen, which is located in the extended part of the house, offers a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. There is also space for a large dining table. To the first floor are two spacious double bedrooms and a modern, tiled family bathroom.

Outside

The front garden boasts a lawned area and block paving offering off street parking for multiple vehicles. The rear garden has been landscaped to offer a low maintenance retreat to enjoy all year round there is a patio area to the front and back of the garden to offer a spot in the sun throughout the day. The garden is mainly laid to lawn with a young tree planted in the middle. To the back of the garden is a large shed for storage and a pergola to enjoy a drink or al fresco dining on those long summer evenings.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are excited to present this very spacious, five/six bedroom detached family home to the market. The property boasts an incredible floor space comprising over 2,300 ft², including five spacious bedrooms, two generous reception rooms, a downstairs study/sixth bedroom, a large newly fitted open plan kitchen with island and breakfast bar, two full bathroom suites and a huge conservatory which opens onto a huge rear garden.

The property has a plethora of features which includes a large double fronted garage via own private driveway, a downstairs W.C, utility room off of the kitchen, marble flooring within the entrance hallway, double glazing, gas central heating and a large secluded rear garden. The kitchen and dining room has just been opened up to create the perfect dining and entertaining space, with granite worktops and integrated appliances including refrigerator, freezer, dishwasher and ovens.

The second floor accommodation is made up by three larger double bedrooms, two generous single rooms, one large family bathroom and an en-suite bathroom to the master bedroom, both containing baths and separate showers.

Outside

To the front, a quiet residential street with no thru-access and a private driveway leading up to the front of the property and the double garage.

To the rear, a sprawling rear garden which is mostly laid to lawn with potential to extend (STPP/pd).

Location

Portman Gardens is a beautiful residential street in a highly sought after location in North Uxbridge, just off Sweetcroft Lane and Blossom Way.

The property is ideally situated in close proximity to several highly regarded primary and secondary schools such as; Oak Farm, St. Helens College, Vyners School, John Locke Academy and The Douay Martyrs Catholic School to name a few.

Additionally, the home is within a few minutes walk/drive from a number of open spaces, golf courses and fitness facilities. The property is also located in excellent proximity to Uxbridge Town Centre with a fantastic variety of shops, bars, banks, restaurants and entertainment.

In terms of transport, Uxbridge and Hillingdon stations each offer a Metropolitan and Piccadilly Line service, while Hillingdon station also offers a direct overground service to Marylebone. The A40 is also a short drive away and connects with the M40, M25 and Central London and the Home Counties.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A spacious two double bedroom top floor purpose built apartment situated in a popular cul-de-sac, just minutes from the shops and central line/mainline station at South Ruislip. The property has a balcony, no onward chain and a long lease.

The building has a secure communal entrance and this apartment is located on the second (top) floor. There is a good size hallway that provides access into all rooms. The spacious living room has a door leading out to the balcony that overlooks the green. The kitchen has been recently re-fitted and has a range of units and integrated appliances such as a dishwasher, washing machine, oven & hob and fridge/freezer. The master bedroom is a large double and there is a second smaller double and completing the property is the bathroom. As an additional benefit, the property has a long lease, residents permit parking and a garage.

Rydal Way is a very popular location, being within such a short walk from the shops and station at South Ruislip where you can take the Central line or Mainline into London. There are a number of local schools - all within easy reach and the A40/M40 road network is within a few minutes’ drive.

detailedDescription:
A ground floor, two bedroom retirement apartment offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Ruislip. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a lounge with separate kitchen, two double bedrooms, one with fitted wardrobes and a large bathroom.

Directions

From our office on Ruislip High Street proceed right to the set of traffic lights. Proceed straight over the bridge to a mini roundabout and take your second exit right onto Wood Lane. Take your first right into Sherleys Court which is the building on the left hand side.

Situation

Sherleys Court is located a stone's throw from Ruislip High Street and all it has to offer including Waitrose and Sainsburys shops, a number of coffee shops and bars as well as Café Rouge, Zaza and The Duck House restaurants. Ruislip Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station with its links to Baker Street and The City is located within a couple of minutes walk away.

Description

This is a beautiful ground floor, two bedroom retirement apartment offering the ideal life style for any potential purchaser looking to downsize. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a bright spacious lounge with french doors leading to the patio, a modern fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms and bathroom with shower. There are a number of added benefits including on site warden, 24 hour emergency cords in each room, security entry phone system, lifts, communal lounge, communal laundry room and guest suite for visitors.

Outside

The property benefits from beautifully maintained communal grounds with its own patio space directly through the living room. There are also plenty of parking bays in the car park.

detailedDescription:
Apartment 3 harefield place house, The Drive, Ickenham

A stunning two bedroom, two bathroom ground floor apartment set within the Georgian mansion house. Offering a spacious kitchen/dining room and a feature bay window with views of the grounds from the large drawing room.
En suites to both bedrooms and a dressing area to the Master.

Set amongst acres of private grounds and gardens. Residents can enjoy the leisure suite with pool, gym and more.

The development also benefits from an estate manager.

Harefield Place is an exquisite ensemble of just 25 two and three bedroom luxury apartments, nestling amidst 8.5 acres of verdant greenbelt countryside, yet within easy reach of central London. Ideally located in Ickenham, off one of the most desirable private roads in Middlesex, this magnificent development offers nine spectacular homes in an original Georgian mansion house, with a further 16 superb apartments in an adjacent purpose-designed new building. These exceptional apartments sit within extensive, beautifully landscaped grounds, enjoying the exclusive use of private leisure facilities and a secluded lake, with unparalleled views over South Buckinghamshire and beyond.

Residents leisure amenities - At Harefield Place, you can take the time to truly look after yourself, with exclusive access to luxury wellness facilities including an indoor pool, fully-equipped gym, sauna & steam room and hot tub. Plus, with a tennis court within the grounds you can polish up your serve or take a relaxing stroll around the beautiful gardens and relax by the lake.

Once a gentleman stately country residence, Harefield Place is a historic Grade II listed house that has been lovingly restored to its former glory. Behind the elegant Georgian façade, original features abound, from the imposing entrance hall to the high ceilings and tall sash windows that every apartment offers. Complementing this understated grandeur is an exquisite modern masterpiece, which offers more contemporary open-plan layouts along with private balconies and terraces. Whether modern or traditional, each space has been creatively conceived as a perfect backdrop to your lifestyle.

Despite its tranquil setting and old world charm, Harefield Place is surprisingly well connected: Whether heading to the West End, the City, Europe or further afield, road, rail and air travel are all easily accessible. With three of the ten most in-demand Tube stops all within less than 3 miles, travelling into central London is speedy and direct, taking just over 30 minutes. Ickenham station (6 minutes), Hillingdon station (8 minutes) and Ruislip station (9 minutes) are on the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines, while West Ruislip station (8 minutes) is on the Central line. West Ruislip station also provides rail travel into London. By car, the M40, M25 and M4 are each a short drive; the proximity of Stockley Park and Uxbridge Business Park (both within a 15 minute drive) enhance the prospect of a work-life balance.

Covid-19 update:
While we continue to operate within government guidelines, the housing market remains open for business. We continue to take customer calls and our sales team remain available. The safety of both our staff and our customers remains paramount. We have strict measures in place and viewings are available on an appointment only basis. Social distancing measures must be adhered to at all times.

If you prefer not to visit, we are also available over the phone and we can offer virtual tours of many of our homes.

From our office on Ruislip High Street turn right, and at the traffic lights turn right into Kingsend. The property can be located a short distance down on the right hand side.

Situation

Kingsend is a sought after road located just off Ruislip High Street and is within walking distance to it's array of shops and restaurants such as Waitrose, Pizza Express and Cafe Rouge. Transport links include Ruislip train station on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line, West Ruislip station on the central line/br chiltern line and many bus routes as well as the A40 with it's road links to London and the Home Counties.

Description

A character and generously proportioned ground floor apartment offers a wealth of charm and character, and is flawlessly presented throughout. Comprising of an entrance hallway which leads to the lounge which is bright and airy with separate dining area. The kitchen is modern, sleek and stylish with some integrated appliances. There are two superb bedrooms, and a white family bathroom. Tucked away from the road in a peaceful garden complex, this bright and airy apartment promises a quiet lifestyle of supreme convenience. It enjoys a low maintenance layout and lovely leafy outlooks.

Outside

There is a private area of garden laid to lawn to the front of property, and private garden to the rear which is mainly laid to lawn with shrub borders and a patio area. There is a private garage which is large enough to house a car.

About Sipson

Sipson is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport adjacent to the Bath Road and offers easy access to the M4/M25 motorway network. detailedDescription:
Over 55's only / retirement apartment: A first floor studio plus retirement apartment located in this sought after development built in the 1980's and available for sale for those over the age of 55. Boasting its own access to communal grounds the flat benefits from a lift to all floors, laundry room (on the first floor), guest bedroom (bookable in advance) delightful and well maintained communal gardens and residents shared parking. The flat, which has 'Piper Tunstall' telecom monitoring system, has well planned accommodation boasting an entrance hall, good sized living room open plan to the kitchen, sleeping area with fitted wardrobe and modern shower room.

First Floor

Entrance Hall

Living Area

11' 8'' x 11' 0'' (3.58m x 3.37m) Fitted carpet, electric heater and double glazed rear aspect window.

Kitchen

7' 10'' x 6' 6'' (2.4m x 2m) Vinyl flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, cooker point, space for fridge/freezer, washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks.

Exterior

Tenure

Leasehold: 125 years from 25 December 1986 although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

Service Charge: Approximately £152.06 per annum / per calendar month to include buildings insurance although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact charges levied.

Ground Rent: (to be confirmed by Vendors solicitor)

About Uxbridge

Uxbridge is a town in west London and the administrative headquarters of the London Borough of Hillingdon. It is one of the major metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan and has formed part of Greater London since 1965. It is a significant retail and commercial centre, a cinema, leisure centre, Middlesex cricket ground and an athletics stadium and is the location of Brunel University. The town is close to the boundary with Buckinghamshire, which is locally the River Colne.

Several historical events have taken place in and around the town, including attempted negotiations between King Charles I and the Parliamentary Army during the English Civil War. The public house at the centre of those events, since renamed the Crown & Treaty, still stands. Uxbridge also houses the Battle of Britain Bunker, from where the air defence of the south-east of England was coordinated during the Battle of Britain.

Historically, the name of the town is derived from "Wixan's Bridge", which was sited near the bottom of Oxford Road where a modern road bridge now stands, beside the Swan and Bottle public house.

The wards of Uxbridge North and Uxbridge South are used for the election of councillors to Hillingdon Council and for statistical purposes. The 2011 Census recorded population figures of 12,048 for Uxbridge North and 13,979 for Uxbridge South.

Full description:
Oakwood Estates brings to market this two double bedroom park home, situated on a large, riverside plot in Mayfield Park with off street parking.
The accommodation includes lounge/dining area, fitted kitchen, master bedroom with en-suite and walk-in wardrobe, second bedroom and bathroom refitted with a large shower cubicle. The private garden wraps around the entire property and includes lawn and gravelled areas.

Mayfield Park is a mobile home park exclusively for the over 45's, located within close proximity of West Drayton High Street with its wide range of amenities, schools and West Drayton station. Heathrow Airport, Brunel University, Stockley Park business centre and golf course, Hillingdon Hospital and Uxbridge Town centre all within a short drive/bus journey. Accomodation

The family bathroom is refitted with a large shower cubicle.

Outside

There is a large, wrap around garden plot, situated next to the picturesque Bigley Ditch stream.

address: High Street, Yiewsley, West Drayton UB7
detailedDescription:
This contemporary collection of studios and 1 bedroom apartments has been thoughtfully designed by award-winning Quad to bring new levels of stylish living to the heart of West Drayton.

Description

Quad are transforming Kirk House to create a new landmark in the heart of West Drayton. The building’s original façade has been retained and enhanced, new landscaping is softening the streetscape and to the rear of the building, private parking is provided for all apartments. This is your opportunity to be a part of this exciting urban revival.
Quad is an award-winning residential developer led by architects combining bold design with finishes of the highest quality, making imaginative use of space to create homes that redefine contemporary living. Quad control every aspect of the design and quality of our buildings, displaying meticulous attention to the finest of details. Our passion for design results in new homes that stand the test of time, enhancing the lives of those who make their home in them.

Accommodation

Each apartment has been designed to maximise space and to create light, airy living spaces. Contemporary finishes have been specified throughout, allied to robust specifications for kitchens and bathrooms to ensure longevity and good looks.
Kitchens at Kirk House have been thoughtfully designed to perfectly blend form and function with a comprehensive range of integrated Bosch appliances, complimented with stylish grey Zenith worktops and oak wood flooring. Shower rooms have walk in showers with thermostatic controls and glass shower screens, electric towel rails, ceramic tiled floors and showers, bespoke built in cabinetry with under mounted wash basins with Zenith Magma vanity tops. Bedrooms have built in wardrobes and there is programmable lighting to living rooms, Virgin Media & BT cabling in place for fibre optic broadband & satellite TV connections
There is electric underfloor heating and Megaflo cylinders to ground and first floor apartments and gas boilers and flat panel radiators to the penthouse level.

Situation

As well as being within a minimum journey time of just 20 minutes from Paddington, Kirk House is just a few miles from lively Uxbridge. So, whether it’s work or play inthe capital or a night out with friends locally you won’t be short on choice. West
Drayton also has a great choice of restaurants in addition to supermarkets and independent stores. Uxbridge is also a great retail destination, with the Intu shopping centre complemented by a host of independent retailers. There’s an eclectic mix of restaurants with flavours from all corners of the globe, a multi-screen Odeon cinema, leisure facilities and Brunel University campus. If you’re seeking breathing space you won’t be disappointed. West Drayton is just moments from Colne Valley Regional Park and its green space and waterways, or Stockley Park, with its golf club.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Leasehold
Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon

Lease term: 150 Years
Service charge: £2 per sqft
Ground rent: 0.1% of purchase price per annum

This stylish and contemporary top floor apartment is a must see and one that's not to be missed, situated in a quiet location in the ever popular Old Dairy Development in in Ruislip, surrounded by green space, and within easy reach of many local amenities, this fantastically decorated flat is a superb choice for any buyer or investor looking to add to their portfolio.

Recently built in 2017, this apartment is well maintained and includes the benefit of 7 years remaining on the NHBC certificate.

The apartment is accessed via a secure communal entrance with entry phone system and comprises an entrance hallway with two built in storage cupboards, two double bedrooms with one boasting fitted wardrobes, an en-suite shower room off the master bedroom, a three-piece family bathroom, a spacious open plan living room-diner with doors out to a private balcony and a modern fully fitted kitchen with plenty of space for a table. Externally, there are communal gardens and an allocated parking bay.

The property is located within 5 minute’s walk of South Ruislip Train Station, providing access to both the Central and Chiltern Line services leading into the heart of London and beyond. If you require the Metropolitan or Piccadilly Lines, Ruislip Manor Station is a short drive or bus ride away too. A variety of shops, restaurants and grocery stores such as Sainsburys, asda and aldi are also a short walk away. Drivers will enjoy the benefit of being a short drive from the A40 and M25 motorways and for families, the property is located close to playing fields, parks, The Gym, Queensmead Sports Centre and several popular infant, junior, secondary and high schools.

From our office on Hillingdon Hill, proceed left along the Uxbridge Road towards Hayes for approximately a mile and a half. Just after Hayes police station turn right onto Angel Lane at the end of the take the first exit off the mini roundabout onto Wood End Green Road.

Situation

Wood End Green Road is a residential road in Hayes which is conveniently located for local shops, schools and within easy reach of the Uxbridge Road, which benefits from bus routes providing effortless access to Uxbridge Town Centre. With its variety of shops and restaurants. Also Metropolitan/Piccadilly train station, Heathrow airport, Stockley Park, Brunel University and the M4 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away.

Description

A well presented and spacious two bedroom end of terrace house located on a convenient residential road in Hayes. The ground floor of the property comprises an 11ft living room which leads into an 11ft dining room, 11ft kitchen and family bathroom. To the first floor there is a 11ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a 10ft second bedroom with fitted storage cupboards.

Outside

To the front of the property there is front garden that has been paved for low maintenance. To the rear there is a private garden that half patio and half gravelled for low maintenance with flower beds along the boarders. There is a large summer house at the rear of the garden and gated side access from the front of the property.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional 9 bedroom detached home set in one of Northwood's finest locations.

Location

Linksway is a highly sought after location comprising some of Northwood’s finest homes. The road adjoins Northwood Golf course and Copsewood protected forest and is situated about 0.8 of a mile from the town centre and underground railway station.

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

The property comprises an individually designed family house providing extensive accommodation arranged over three floors.

The property features a high quality specification and generous room sizes throughout. There is a wide enclosed entrance porch with double doors into the central reception hall with galleried landing extending to about 29ft deep x 17ft wide. The principal reception rooms are accessed from the hall including the elegant drawing room, dining room and 19ft library.

There is an extensive fitted kitchen/breakfast room which opens up into the family room with velux windows and glazed double doors to the rear garden. Leading off the kitchen is a 20ft games room, utility room and access to the double garage.

On the first and second floors there are nine generous bedrooms, six bath/shower rooms and five dressing rooms.

To the front of the property is a carriage driveway and gated entrance providing extensive parking space.

The rear gardens have been landscaped and feature, large terraced areas and split levels, including neat lawns and an ornamental flower bed.

The whole plot is very private and extends to about 0.45 acre.

Square Footage: 7389 sq ft

Acreage: 0.45 Acres

Directions

From Northwood railway station proceed west towards Rickmansworth along Green Lane. At the traffic lights turn left into Rickmansworth Road then first right into Copse Wood Way, first left again into Linksway, the property can then be found on your right hand side.

detailedDescription:
The last remaining home in this unique development, situated just moments from Eastcote Station, and specified to meticulous standards. This two bedroom mews home features an excellent new homes specification throughout along with thoughtfully designed spaces for functional living.

Set over two floors, an open plan living, dining and kitchen area forms the heart of the home and is complimented by oak herringbone effect flooring with underfloor heating. Light and airy with generous ceiling heights, the two bedroom property features a skylight which bathes the living areas in natural light, while the focal point is the premium German kitchen by Hacker finished in a matt white and grained wood effect. The kitchen also benefits from stone worktops, integrated black Bosch appliances, a smoked mirrored splashback and soft closing doors and drawers with undercounter lighting. The bathrooms are luxuriously appointed, with porcelain tiles, Grohe sanitaryware and wall hung vanity units. Each bedroom features pendant lighting and luxuriously soft carpets, while the master bedroom also includes a Juliette balcony.

Eastcote and its surrounds house an eclectic mix of cafes, brunch spots and restaurants, plus an array of amenities and green space. Well-located for commuters, the development is moments from Eastcote Underground, with the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines providing journeys into central London in just 25 minutes. The nearby A40 also connects drivers within easy reach of Central London, Brent Cross, Westfield, the M40 and M25.

detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom second floor apartment with a balcony. The apartment has an open-plan living room/kitchen with glazed external walls, two large double bedrooms with walk in wardrobes and an en-suite and well presented throughout. The property is located on the sought after St Andrew's Park development within easy reach of Uxbridge town centre and comes with a parking space.

Situation

St. Andrews Park is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 37 acre new public park.

Description

A stunning two bedroom apartment on the sought after St Andrew's Park development. The property has a secure entry system leading to well-kept communal areas with stairs and a lift to the second floor. The apartment comprises a hallway leading through to a fantastic living area featuring an expanse of glass windows and doors that provide access on to a superb balcony. The kitchen is open-plan to the living area and has a range of white units and built-in appliances. The main double bedroom comes with built in wardrobes and an en-suite and the second double bedroom also comes with built in wardrobes. A white contemporary bathroom suite completes the accommodation.

Outside

There is a balcony directly off the main living area

address: Pembroke Road, Moor Park Estate, Northwood HA6
detailedDescription:
Occupying a plot of just under a quarter of an acre in one of Moor Park’s most prestigious roads, is this 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom detached family home with views and access to the golf course at the rear. The ground floor comprises an entrance hall with downstairs shower room and WC, four reception rooms, a modern fitted kitchen and a utility room. To the first floor is a master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and an ensuite bathroom, three further bedrooms, a family bathroom and useful eaves storage rooms. The second floor provides space for a cinema/playroom. Outside, to the front of the property is a carriage driveway providing ample off street parking and access to the integral garage. To the rear the Westerly facing garden comprises a paved terrace, lawn and well stocked borders with a variety of shrubs, trees and rose garden. There is a gate from the garden to the golf course at the rear. Planning permission was granted in November 2015 Reference 15/1897/ful. We have been advised by our vendor/client that this has been partly implemented and therefore extant (Plans are available to view by appointment at our Moor Park Office). However, any buyer(s) are advised to obtain verification from their own advisers, be that solicitor or surveyor.

Pembroke Road is conveniently located for Moor Park shops, restaurants and the Metropolitan Line train station. Forming part of the 294 acres of the Moor Park Private Gated Estate, bordering Middlesex and Hertfordshire, surrounded by rolling countryside and two championship golf courses. The local area is well served for state and private schools, which includes Merchant Taylors Junior and Senior Schools which are both on the estate. Leisure facilities include five golf courses, cricket and football clubs as well as fitness centres.
Major motorways and airports are also within reach.

This property falls within the Moor Park Conservation Area. We recommend that prospective purchasers wishing to extend or alter this property in any way should make enquiries with Three Rivers Planning Department and also Moor Park (1958) Limited whose approval for alterations and extensions is also required under the covenants of the Estate.

This superb, two bedroom purpose-built apartment boasts space, style and a modern design with high quality features and fittings throughout. To the right, there is a contemporary kitchen. The kitchen itself is modern and offers ample worktop space and storage. Heading towards the rear of the home is another hallway providing direct access to all other rooms. The property is completed by two spacious bedrooms and a family bathroom. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a great apartment within the heart of Pinner Green.

Directions

From our Pinner office on Bridge Street, head towards Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Green and take the first exit at the mini-roundabout which will lead you to Cuckoo Hill. Proceed for 0.10 miles before turning left onto Nursery Road. Take your first left and follow the bend to another left, and Hyacinth Court is located a short distance on the right hand side.

Situation

Hyacinth Court is situated in a popular location and only moments to both Pinner and Northwood Hills High Street. These high streets benefit from an array of restaurants, shops, cafés and bars. The Metropolitan Line can be accessed from Pinner and Northwood Hills Station and this line commutes into the heart of Central London within approx 30 minutes and easy access towards Watford and Rickmansworth. Harlyn Primary School and Haydon Secondary School can also both be found just moments from this property making it well suited for families. This home offers a fantastic opportunity to be both private and convenient.

Description

A three-bedroom semi-detached house that is situated on a popular and sought after residential road on the Oak Farm. The property has recently undergone major improvements such as double glazed windows and an updated heating system but still offers buyers the opportunity to add some finishing touches and extend (S.T.P). The ground floor of the property comprises of a hallway, 12ft lounge, and 15ft kitchen/dining room, 13ft conservatory with french doors that open onto the rear garden. To the first floor, there is a 12ft main bedroom, 10ft second bedroom, 6ft third bedroom and modern family bathroom. Outside there is off street parking and private rear garden.

Directions

From our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left to the second set of traffic lights then turn left onto Long Lane and take the second right onto Clifton Gardens.

Situation

Clifton Gardens is located on the ever popular Oak Farm offering access to a number of local amenities including local shops, Hillingdon's Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station and a number of highly regarded schools including St Bernadettes, Oak Farm, Swakeleys school for girls and Bishopshalt senior school. The A40/ M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away along with Uxbridge town centre with its array of shops and restaurants.

Description

A three-bedroom semi-detached house that is situated on a popular and sought after residential road on the Oak Farm. Outside

The rear garden benefits from a large decked area that ideal for entertaining with a small paved section to the rear.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stylish and contemporary top floor, corner apartment is a must see and one that's not to be missed. The apartment features large East and South facing windows and captures a wealth of natural light. Situated in a quiet location in the ever popular St Andrews Park Development in Uxbridge, surrounded by green space, and within easy reach of Uxbridge Town Centre, this fantastically decorated flat is a superb choice for any buyer or investor looking to add to their portfolio.

The apartment is accessed via secure communal entrance with entry phone system and comprises a welcoming entrance hallway with two built in storage cupboards, two bedrooms, a three-piece family bathroom, a spacious open plan living room-diner and a modern fully fitted kitchen with plenty of space for a table. Recently built in 2019, this apartment is well maintained and includes the added benefit of 8.5 years remaining on the NHBC certificate and an allocated parking bay.

Percival House is located a stone’s throw away from Uxbridge, with its vast array of shops, restaurants and bars. Uxbridge Underground Station has access to both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly line, and the A40 and M25 are a short drive away. Brunel University, Uxbridge College, Uxbridge Common and Hillingdon Leisure Centre with its popular lido and sports grounds are also nearby..

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Brought to the market in West Walk, Hayes Town is this well presented, spacious three bedroom semi detached family home. With fantastic potential to extend and develop this home is ideal for first time or investment buyers.

The property comprises entrance hall, open plan reception room, modern fitted kitchen, three first floor bedrooms and a modern four piece bathroom suite. Externally you have off street parking and to the rear a large, matured rear garden.

West Walk is fantastically located within a close walking proximity to Hayes Town which provides an array of transport links, amenities, shopping centres and more. The Hayes and Harlington Station is just under a mile walk which is soon to be transformed into Crossrail connecting you to London in circa 20 minutes. You are also a short drive away from the A312/A40 motorway links allowing great access to inner/outer London and Heathrow Airport.

detailedDescription:
A Luxury third floor two double bedroom apartment. This stylish apartment is set on a development located off Ruislip Road with enviable views of the canal. Offering a relaxed, modern & low maintenance living.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left and continue to the roundabout. Take the second exit remaining on Victoria Road. Turn right at the traffic lights onto Station Approach and at the lights turn left onto West end road. At the roundabout take the second exit to continue on West end road which then goes into Old Ruislip Road. When you come to White Heart Roundabout, you take the second exit. Continue onto Ruislip Road for about half a mile the property is a short drive on your right hand side.

Situation

This apartment is set in a highly convenient location in Grand Union Village which has both great views, parks and shops. The house is a short walk to the Grand Union Marina and canal. There are also schools close by with outstanding Ofsted grades including Gifford Primary School which is 0.6 miles away and Greenford High School. It is also 2-3 miles to a potential Crossrail station. There are several good connections in the area to include bus routes and three tube stations within 2 miles.

Description

This trendy apartment, offers style and space in a convenient location, with everything you could need just a short walk away. The leasehold property has a entry phone for security which allows you into the building. Up three flights of stairs or use the lift and there is the entrance to the property, which has a large hallway allowing access to all of the properties accommodation. The open plan living room is spacious and has large windows that flood the room with light. A door leads out to the balcony which offers space for a table and chairs. The living room opens onto the kitchen. The kitchen has a range of base and wall units, work tops and integrated appliances. The apartment boast two double bedrooms, with the master bedroom befitting from a corner window providing views onto the canal. The family bathroom offers a white suite with a shower over the bath, and is finished in stylish white tiles. The property further benefits from large cupboards in the hallway.

Outside

The property benefits from resident parking, Situated on the canal with the balcony enjoying wonderful views, and communal grounds provide a great excuses to get out of the house for a walk on those long summer evenings.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Attractive period semi detached house with many character features.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

6There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

Located approximately half a miles walk from Northwood Metropolitan Line station, this attractive Edwardian period house has characterful accommodation laid out over three floors.

Most of the ground floor has wooden floorboards, high ceilings with cornice detail. There is a staircase, and a guest cloakroom. The front reception room has a bay window, a cast iron fireplace with tiled surround and fitted cabinets / bookshelves to alcoves. Period stripped wooden glazed double doors lead through to the rear reception with marble fireplace. From here there are stripped wooden french doors to a conservatory. The kitchen is fitted with a range of painted wooden units, butler sink, range oven with extractor and there is a side aspect window overlooking a courtyard area. To the rear is the dining area with a cast iron radiator, well lit by three skylight windows and full height bi-fold doors to patio. There is also a utility room with butler sink with separate entry, great for dogs or muddy boots.

There are four bedrooms and a bathroom on the first floor. The top floor is given over to the main bedroom with built-in wardrobes, eaves storage and en-suite shower room. Some of the landing and bedroom windows have double glazed period sash windows.

The rear garden faces west and is split between large flagstone patio and lawn.

The front garden is mainly laid out as parking behind double gates and there is an attached garage suitable for storage.

Square Footage: 1915 sq ft

address: The Dairy, Long Lane, Hillingdon UB10
detailedDescription:
Besides being handy for the capital, with the Underground station and the A40 just moments from The Dairy,
Hillingdon has become a highly attractive destination for modern living

Description

This stunning brand new apartment is set on the first floor of this prestigious gated development built by the award winning Howarth Homes.

Accommodation

The accommodation on offer briefly comprises, entrance hall with built in storage, open plan living space with a Juliet balcony and built in storage cupboard housing the combination boiler, Architecturally designed handleless kitchen with soft close hinges, contemporary worktops, upstands and splashback to hob, appliances to include oven, four ring modern induction hob and integrated extractor Integrated appliances to include fridge freezer and dishwasher, stainless steel sink and chrome monoblock mixer tap, the stylish shower room features contemporary white sanitaryware including back to wall pan with soft close seat, dual flush concealed cistern, basin with chrome taps, shower tray with thermostatically controlled polished chrome shower with adjustable height multi function shower head, shaver socket, large format Porcelanosa tiling and a heated towel rail.

Outside

With access via remotely controlled vehicle and pedestrian gates, The Dairy is set in landscaped communal grounds. Parking is provided for all residents with the added convenience of electric car charging points to selected bays.

Situation

Set midway between Uxbridge and Ruislip’s vibrant town centres and their array of shopping and leisure amenities, The Dairy presents plenty of opportunities to enjoy a fulfilling lifestyle. Despite its urban setting there’s acres of green space, including
Hillingdon Court Park, benefitting from tennis courts and outdoor gym, while Hillingdon Sports and Leisure Complex, with its pool, gym and additional sports and athletics facilities is just 1.5 miles away. For a taste of the beach closer to home, Ruislip Lido is just 3.5 miles away. One of the biggest attractions of The Dairy though is the accessibility it provides to central London. The A40 can take you to the centre of town or west to the M25, Oxford and Birmingham, while Underground services via the Piccadilly and Metropolitan lines give you a wealth of destination options, whether for work or leisure. Heathrow is also easily accessed, being just 5.5 miles away and the U2 bus service passes The Dairy, linking with Uxbridge and Brunel University.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon

Lease term: 150 years
Service charge: £800 per annum
Ground rent: 0.1% of purchase price

detailedDescription:
This delightful two bedroom, end-of-terrace residence is located on Burlington Close, a highly sought after road within close proximity to Pinner Green and Northwood Hills with it's array of amenities and train station offering easy access to Central London.

Directions

From our Pinner office, turn right onto Bridge Street and continue to Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Green and proceed to the roundabout. At the roundabout, take the first exit and proceed onto Cuckoo Hill. Take a right onto Chamberlain Way, followed by another right onto Tolcarne Drive. Another right turn will bring you to Burlington Close.

Situation

Burlington Close is situated in a popular location and only moments to both Pinner and Northwood Hills High Street. These high streets benefit from an array of restaurants, shops, cafés and bars. The Metropolitan Line can be accessed from Pinner and Northwood Hills Station and this line commutes into the heart of Central London within approx 30 minutes and easy access towards Watford and Rickmansworth. Harlyn Primary School and Haydon Secondary School can also both be found just moments from this property making it well suited for families. This home offers a fantastic opportunity to be both private and convenient.

Description

This delightful two bedroom, end-of-terrace residence is located on Burlington Close, a highly sought after road within close proximity to Pinner Green and Northwood Hills with it's array of amenities and train station offering easy access to Central London. This attractive two-bedroom home is arranged over two levels, with the ground floor including a 14ft family living room, which leads into the kitchen diner. Through the kitchen is the conservatory with double doors to the right, offering immediate access and superb views of the beautiful, contemporary rear garden. Completing the ground floor is a useful downstairs W.C. Stairs rise to the first floor, where a landing provides access to a family bathroom and two bright bedrooms. The 11ft master bedroom also has the additional benefit of an en-suite shower room. Take advantage of this rare opportunity to acquire a beautiful home in the heart of an extremely sought after road within Pinner.

Outside

The front of the property offers off-street parking. To the rear, there is a good sized private garden with multiple areas to enjoy including patio space and a secluded area to the end of the garden with a deck and summer house.

Outside there is an allocated parking space and a south west facing rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office proceed left and at the first set of traffic lights turn right onto Harlington Road. At the roundabout turn left onto Lees Road and take your first right into Aldenham Drive. At the end of the road turn left into Hambledon Close.

Situation

Hambledon Close is a sought after residential close located just off Lees Road offering easy access to a number of local amenities including local shops, bus links, Hillingdon Hospital, Stockley Business Park, Heathrow Airport, Brunel University and a number of road links including the M40, M25 and M4 with their links to London and the Home Counties. There are a number of sought after schools including Hillingdon Primary, Bishopshalt Senior School and Swakeleys School for Girls in close proximity while Uxbridge Town Centre with its numerous shops, restaurants, bars and Piccadilly/Metropolitan line train station is located approximately a mile away.

Description

A two bedroom end of terrace home that is positioned on a quiet cul-de-sac and is presented in good condition throughout. The ground floor of the property comprises a 7ft study and 16ft living area. To the first floor is a 12ft master bedroom, 12ft second bedroom and family bathroom.

Outside

To the front is a small garden. To the rear of the property is a private south west facing garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a variety of bushes and shrubs. There is an allocated parking space.

detailedDescription:
An ideal investment or for first home buyers seeking an unbeatable and convenient lifestyle. Located above a commercial property in the heart of Northwood Hills a most stylish and convenient location, this spacious two bedroom apartment has shops, cafés and transport at its doorstep.

Directions

From our Pinner office, turn right onto Bridge Street and continue to Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Green and proceed to the roundabout. At the roundabout, take the second exit and proceed onto Rickmansworth Road. Continue onto Pinner Road then turn left onto Oakdale Avenue just before the roundabout, the property is located a short distance down on the right hand side.

Situation

Windsor Close is conveniently located a stone's throw away from Northwood Hills High Street offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines are easily accessible from the property offering swift access into the City, West End, Watford and Harrow on the Hill, as well as many bus routes. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away and Pinner and Eastcote are also nearby and a short drive, train or bus journey away.

Description

An ideal investment or for first home buyers seeking an unbeatable and convenient lifestyle. Located above a commercial property in the heart of Northwood Hills a most stylish and convenient location, this spacious two bedroom apartment has shops, cafés and transport at its doorstep. On entering the property you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway offering direct access to all rooms. To the right the kitchen awaits, and is fitted to a good standard with plenty of space for appliances including a washing machine, fridge and dishwasher. Continuing down the hallway is the stylish 12ft living room, featuring large windows allowing for a mass of natural light. The property is completed by two spacious bedrooms and a family bathroom. From our office in Ickenham turn right and proceed to the end of the road. Turn left onto Ickenham High Road and take the third right turn onto Aylsham Drive. Cranston Close is a short drive down at the end of the road on the left hand side.

Situation

Cranston Close is a popular residential cul de sac located within walking distance to both West Ruislip and Ickenham tube stations, on the Central/br and Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines with easy access into central London, as well as the Chiltern Railway which runs from West Ruislip to Marylebone. detailedDescription:
Offered to the market with no onward chain, this three bedroom corner ground floor maisonette is spacious and ready for any buyer to simply move in to. The property is situated in a peaceful location, just a short walk from local shops, schools and tube links into London. A viewing of this charming abode is recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip Manor, turn left on Victoria Road and at the roundabout take the third exit onto Cornwall road. At the end of the road turn right onto Torrington then right onto West end road. Take the third right onto Willow Gardens, follow the road round then take the second left onto Raleigh Close where Ruislip Court can be found.

Situation

Ruislip Court is located within close proximity to Ruislip High Street, offering trendy eateries, shops and transport links. Ruislip tube station provides the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines and is at the end of the High Street. Ruislip Gardens Central and British Rail station is also nearby and either a walk of 10-15 minutes or a short bus/car drive away. For the motorist, the A40/M40 and M25 road links offer easy access to London and the Home Counties. For families with children of school age it is set perfectly nearby to excellent local schools and nurseries.

Description

Situated on the ground floor, this well presented corner maisonette is nestled away, offering buyers the luxury of seclusion of local amenities and transport links. The property opens onto a large and welcoming hallway, boasting parquet flooring and allowing access to all of the homes accommodation withing the hall are two ample sizes storage cupboards. The rooms are spacious and versatile, allowing owners to use rooms as bedrooms or reception rooms. In its current configuration, the living room is down the corridor to the right. The room is bright, airy and offers views of a secluded part of the communal grounds. The kitchen has a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. A door from the kitchen leads out to the communal grounds. The maisonette boasts two double bedrooms and a larger than average single bedroom which benefits from a storage cupboard. The property is complete with a family bathroom with a white suite and fully tiled throughout.

Outside

The road offers plenty of resident parking. Ruislip Court boasts communal, lawned grounds surrounding the property to both the front and to the rear.

detailedDescription:
Reserve in June and receive £3,000 in john lewis or ikea vouchers*

£93,750 for a 25% share.

Why buy at midland house?

  • Own a two-bedroom apartment for as little as £1,000 per month
  • It’s cheaper to own than to rent*
  • High specification homes with integrated appliances
  • Take advantage of all the local amenities and minutes to West Drayton station (Elizabeth Line extension arriving in 2022)
  • No stamp duty to pay*
  • Ready to move into apartments


Reserve in June and receive £3,000 in john lewis or ikea vouchers*

*T&Cs apply - please speak to the Sales Team for further information

Enjoy the best the city has to offer with fast commutes without compromising on a stunning apartment to come home to at Midland House. This stunning collection of one and two bedroom apartments in West Drayton are minutes away from the train station so you can connect with home, whilst getting where you need to be. Pick up everyday essentials from several local supermarkets and takeaways and cafes on Yiewsley High Street, or visit nearby Uxbridge for a fantastic choice of shopping and restaurants.

Finished to a high specification so you can move in hassle free and put your own stamp on your new home, all homes feature a modern kitchen with Zanussi appliances, sleek high gloss handleless units with an upstand matching the worktop, a contemporary bathroom suite and carpeted living areas and bedrooms. Light and airy bedrooms create peaceful spaces to escape to whilst open plan living spaces are flexible to meet your lifestyle, whether you need a place to work, relax or entertain. Balconies extend your space bringing the outdoors in, to fill with plants or an ideal space to catch up with friends and family.

Midland House features a landscaped courtyard with a children's playground, but follow the nearby canal paths along the Grand Union Canal to be rewarded with green open spaces at Colne Valley Regional Park.

Whether you're cozying up at home or out exploring, connect with Midland House to find the perfect home for you in this great location with fast commutes without any of the compromise.

detailedDescription:
No upper chain. Situated in the heart of Ruislip is this one bedroom first floor retirement apartment for the over 60s offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a bright and spacious lounge with separate kitchen, one double bedroom and modern shower room. There are a number of added benefits including an on site warden, 24 hour emergency cords in each room, security entry phone system, lifts, communal lounge, communal laundry room, overnight guest suite, residents parking and well kept communal gardens. Situated on Wood Lane within a stones throw of Ruislip High Street with it's local shops and amenities, Waitrose supermarket, doctors surgery, bus routes and rail links (Metropolitan and Piccadilly).

Communal Entrance

Secure entrance which is well maintained and has lift access to all floors. There is access to the residents lounge, residents laundry room and overnight guest suite.

Entrance Hall

Front door, electric storage heater, emergency intercom and security door entry system, door to large cloakroom/airing cupboard housing tank, doors to:

Lounge

Rear aspect double glazed South facing window, coved ceiling, decorative fireplace, doors to kitchen.

Kitchen

Rear aspect double glazed window, range of base and eye level units, space for fridge and freezer, part tiled walls, coved ceiling, integrated oven and electric hob, extractor hood, stainless steel sink and drainer.

Bedroom

Rear aspect double glazed South facing window, coved ceiling, electric storage heater, range of built in wardrobes.

Shower Room

Large walk in shower, vanity unit incorporating wash hand basin, low level wc, tiled walls, extractor fan.

Outside

The property benefits from a patio area with well maintained communal grounds and ample residents and visitor parking bays.

Outgoings

Service charge - £3191 per annum payable in two half yearly instalments to First Port

Ground rent - £513.80 per annum payable in two half-yearly instalments to Estates and Management Ltd

N.B. We recommend your solicitor verifies this before exchange of contracts.

Council Tax

London Borough of Hillingdon - Band D - £1,603.38 - If you are a single person then you should receive a 25% discount.

N.B. We recommend your solicitor verifies this before exchange of contracts.

Distance To Stations

Ruislip (0.1 Miles) - Metropolitan/Piccadilly
Ruislip Gardens (0.9 Miles) - Central line

Nb

It is a condition of purchase that residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years. There is also a Development Manager on site who is available during the week.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This charming bungalow enjoys the unique setting of the sought-after Willowbank Village on an island development nestled between the River Colne and the Grand Union Canal. Within walking distance from Uxbridge town centre and with access to private walkways, a nearby nature reserve and a marina, this is a hidden gem.

Description

This charming bungalow has plenty of character with bay windows, a bright and airy kitchen-diner and good outdoor space. Featuring two bedrooms, one reception and one bathroom, the house is accessed via a walled front garden.

The spacious kitchen-diner features plenty of storage space and appliances, opening up to a large outdoor patio which can also be accessed via doors from the adjacent reception room.

The rear garden is fenced, featuring some mature shrubs and a lawn accessible from either side of the house. A shed provides further storage. There is parking for one car at the front, plus additional parking in the garage.

Key features

• Sought-after location
• 2 bedroom bungalow
• Good sized garden with patio
• Driveway and garage
• Access to private walkways for residents
• 2 minutes from M40 /M25
• Walking distance to Uxbridge town centre & Tube
• South Bucks catchment

A note from the vendors

"My parent's moved to Willowbank village in the '80s, and it's where I grew up before moving out to get married. We were lucky enough to move back here six years ago to Hawthorn Drive.

With it being an island (the River Colne is on one side and the Grand Union Canal on the other, joining at the top), there's a beautiful nature walk around the outside along the water's edge that's only for residents. There is also a large private field behind Willow Crescent West, which hosts the annual island fireworks display on 5 November.

We love the village feel of the area and how quiet it is. The residents of the island are so friendly, and people always say hello. We'd love to stay here, but with the birth of our first child, we're looking to get a bigger property."

Location

Willowbank Village is just a 7-8 minutes' walk from Uxbridge town centre or 2 minutes from the M40/M25. The town centre has an array of shops, restaurants and leisure facilities, including The Chimes shopping centre. Uxbridge Underground Station is also located in the town, with the Metropolitan line taking you to London in just 40 minutes.

Viewings - By appointment only with Fine & Country Gerrards Cross. Please enquire and quote rj<br /><br />

address: Willow Crescent East, Denham, Buckinghamshire UB9
detailedDescription:
*video tour* Backing the Grand Union Canal this spacious circa 2400 sq ft 4 bedroom (1 ground floor) home encapsulates the true essence of luxury living providing seamless light-filled spaces designed for relaxing, entertaining and family life. The property was designed and built by renowned firm "Oakwrights of Hereford" 11 years ago. The house is located in a tranquil waterside setting with private canal frontage. The construction provides strength and security using green oak, with frames that gradually dry out or ‘season’ over time to produce a naturally stronger structure that will last for hundreds of years. The house is light and airy throughout courtesy of the amount of structural glass throughout.

Outside
To the front there is ample parking on the private gravelled driveway. The house is situated on this much sought after development, enjoying a prime position on Willow Crescent East with moorings and private canal frontage. The rear garden is ideal for entertaining with a large area of high specification decking (a generous size of 0.16 acres in all) and is otherwise laid to lawn enjoying a sunny south westerly aspect. There is an attractive timber cabin complete with large hot tub as well as a selection of flower beds and shrubs. The rear garden enjoys fantastic views, secured gate leading out to the private towpath by the side of the Grand Union Canal affording lovely walks along to the lock which benefits from private mooring rights. There is access to approximately 2 acres of land owned privately between all the houses on Willow Bank Village.

Situation
The property is extremely well placed providing excellent access to Uxbridge town centre with its extensive shopping facilities and public transport links with the A40 / M40 nearby and the M25 within easy reach. The village of Denham is located in a convenient setting, close to Uxbridge and Gerrards Cross, and nestled in the beautiful countryside surrounds of the Colne Valley Regional Park. The village has several pubs, a village hall and an infant school, and is positioned close to the superb Buckinghamshire Golf Club and Denham Golf Club. There are plenty of walking, cycling and riding routes in the local area, with plenty of stunning countryside to explore and enjoy. Local amenities are close-at-hand in either Uxbridge or Gerrards Cross. Transport links from Denham are excellent, with the A40 nearby and the M40 within easy reach, while London Marylebone is just a 22-minute train ride from Denham mainline station.

Additional Information
South Buckinghamshire is renowned for its excellent range of schooling for boys and girls both state and independent - further information can be sourced via , , or (using the Postcode UB9 4).
