detailedDescription:
This well-laid-out, two-bedroom mid-terrace house is located on a quiet cul-de-sac in North Hayes. The ground floor of the property has a large entrance hall, 21ft kitchen/dining room, and 14ft lounge. On the first floor you have a 13ft master bedroom, 11ft second bedroom, and a family bathroom.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and continue for approximately one mile to the West Drayton Road traffic lights. Proceed straight over and turn left at the second set of lights into Lansbury Drive. Once on Lansbury Drive you then need to take your second right onto Balmoral Drive, then in 0.1 miles take the first exit at the roundabout onto Burns Close.

Situation

Burns Close is a quiet residential road located in North Hayes, not far from the Uxbridge Road and all its amenities including shops and bus links. Hayes Town centre with its expanse of shops, banks, restaurants and British Railway train station is under a mile away, while the M4 and its links to London and the Home Counties is just a short drive.

Description

This well-laid-out, two-bedroom mid-terrace house is located on a quiet cul-de-sac in North Hayes. The ground floor of the property has a large entrance hall, 21ft kitchen/dining room, and 14ft lounge. On the first floor you have a 13ft master bedroom, 11ft second bedroom, and a family bathroom.

Outside

The front of the property has a small front garden, ample on-street parking. The private rear garden is mainly laid to lawn, with a patio area stretching across the rear of the house. There is also rear access to the garden via Melrose Close.

detailedDescription:
Enjoying a commanding position in a highly desirable and peaceful setting, this impressive residence is bursting with character, timeless elegance and substantial proportions creating a home of unquestionable distinction.

This property comprises of a superb entrance hall, three elegant reception rooms one of which boasts double doors opening out to the stunning rear garden, a generous fitted kitchen enjoying an island and entrée to the warm and welcoming conservatory, a utility room, a study, a downstairs shower room and an internal garage completes the ground floor. The first floor displays a roomy landing with doors accessing all four-double bedrooms with two en suites, one being shared and a family bathroom specifically designed for relaxing.

The front aspect presents a carriage driveway offering extensive parking and entrée to the double garage. The beautifully established garden (of approximately 1.64 Acres of land) provides privacy with towering mature trees.

detailedDescription:
An attractive three bedroom semi detached home that has a versatile floorplan and generous amounts of living space. Set on a quiet residential road close to local shops, stations and well regarded schools. It makes for a brilliant family home in a fantastic location.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn right. Take your first right onto Long Lane and then take your second left. Once on Glebe Avenue, proceed straight past the station and follow the road around to the left. Once you reach the fourth left turning, take it onto Sussex Road. The property is located towards the end of the road on the right hand side.

Situation

This property is located footsteps from Ickenham village which offers a range of shops, restaurants and well-regarded schools. Ickenham station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines) is a short walk away providing reliable links into the City and West End. Alternatively West Ruislip station is serviced by both tube (Central line) and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools including Glebe Primary, Breakspear Infant and Juniors and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Swakeleys Park, Fusion Leisure Complex and Uxbridge Golf Course.

Description

When entering this family home you head through the porch which then leads into the entrance hallway. There is door off the hallway leading you into the open plan living/kitchen area. The kitchen comes with all units built in and a lovely finish with an abundance of countertop space. This rooms over looks into the garden letting in large amounts of natural light to brighten the room. Also to the downstairs is the living room with a bay window and also enjoys a shower room. Upstairs, you have the three bedrooms, bedroom one situated to the front with a shower en-suite and built in wardrobes, bedroom two and three located to the rear, completing upstairs there is a family bathroom.

Outside

To the front there is a brick paved driveway providing off street parking. Down the shared driveway there is access into the garden via a double gate. There is a large patio area closest to the house making a perfect seating area for outdoor entertainment. The remainder of the garden is laid to lawn and looks out onto secured fields and greenery.

detailedDescription:
Two double bedroom, first floor maisonette perfectly located only moments away from Ruislip and Ruislip Manor High streets. Priory Close is a peaceful and sought after residential cul de sac which is located nearby to a selection of High streets, transport links and parkland. The property briefly comprises of two double bedrooms, a lounge/diner, a fitted kitchen, family bathroom and a seperate WC. There is a private garden to the rear of the property.

Direction

From our Ruislip Office turn right into Brickwall Lane. Follow the road around to the right. At the end is Manor Way. Turn right and first left into Piory Close.

Situation

This striking residence is located on one of Ruislip's sought after roads and is in close proximity to Ruislip High Street and Ruislip Manor offering trendy eateries, shops and transport links. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40, making it a popular choice for city bankers and professionals. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area. Ruislip or Ruislip Manor stations are approximately equally distanced less than a mile away making travelling into the city via the Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines swift and convenient. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip which is serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes (with regular trains every 15 minutes.) For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Warrender, Sacred Heart and Bishop Ramsey.

Description

Two bedroom first floor maisonette presents a rewarding opportunity for first time buyers, investors or those purely seeking a relaxed, comfortable home in an ultra convenient location. The property is entered through its own private entrance where the hallway splits off to all rooms.You are first greeted to the left hand side with a larger than average living room with large front aspect windows. Opposite the living room is the 8'11 X 12'6 fitted kitchen, with a range of applicance and direct access to your private rear garden. The two double bedrooms are on the opposite side of the property, which offer front and rear aspect windows along with plenty of wardrobe space. The property is complete with the fully tiled bathroom along with a seperate WC and spacious boarded loft.

Outisde

To the rear there is a private rear garden which you can accessed direct from the kitchen.

detailedDescription:
Cul-de-sac near bath road / investment only: This spacious 1 bedroom flat is situated perfectly for the Bath Road giving easy access to London Heathrow Airport and the Parkway and connection to the M4/M25 motorway network. Hayes & Harlington mainline station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022) is a short drive away.

This first floor property features a spacious lounge, well fitted kitchen with hob and oven, extractor fan, washing machine and fridge/freezer, double bedroom, built in storage cupboards and fitted bathroom.

Other benefits include double glazed windows, electric heating, easy well kept communal garden and allocated residents parking.

Highly Recommended.

Ground Floor

Entrance

Communal lockable door at street level. Stairs to first floor.

First Floor

Hall

Front door into hall. Fitted carpet, built in storage cupboard and a built in airing cupboard.

Lounge

15' 4'' x 10' 9'' (4.7m x 3.3m) (maximum sizes) Fitted carpet and electric heater. Double glazed window to rear aspect.

Kitchen

7' 10'' x 7' 2'' (2.4m x 2.2m) Vinyl flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, electric hob, concealed extractor fan, electric oven, fridge/freezer, washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to aspect

Bathroom

Vinyl flooring. Three-piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed bath, pedestal hand basin, low level W.C. And part tiled walls and splashbacks.

Bedroom

14' 1'' x 8' 10'' (4.3m x 2.7m) (maximum size into recess). Fitted carpet and wall mounted electric heater. Double glazed window to front aspect.

Exterior

Outside

Numbered allocated residents parking and communal gardens. Pedestian access to Bath Road

Tenure

Leasehold: Approximately 960 years although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

Service Charge & Ground Rent: Approximately £53.33 per calendar month to include buildings insurance although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact charges levied.

About Harlington

Harlington is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport. The district adjoins Hayes to the north and shares a railway station with the larger district, which is its post town, on the Great Western Main Line to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking the Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The village is surrounded by Green Belt land and open fields and also contains a parade of shops to include a Pharmacy, Co-operative Convenience store, Newsagents, a variety of restaurants and fast food outlets and a Post Office. There are also four public houses: The Great Western, The Pheasant, The Wheatsheaf, and The White Hart. The village also boasts two churches, a Baptist church and a Church of England church, St Peter & St Paul's and William Byrd School. The village High Street is also home to the Harlington Locomotive Society and West London Models.

The earliest surviving mention of Harlington appears to be in a 9th-century charter in which land at Botwell in Hayes was said to be bounded on the west by "Hygeredington" and "Lullinges" tree.

address: Alexander Court, 91 Ducks Hill Road, Northwood, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
Modern two bedroom, two bathroom flat with private balcony.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx.) Watford (4 miles approx.), and Harrow (6 miles approx.) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

There is a good choice of schools in the area both state and private including: St Helen’s and Northwood College for girls, St Martin’s, St John's and Merchant Taylors’ for boys.

Description

A superb, contemporary apartment with the unusual benefit of its own substantial private balcony directly to the rear of the living room and main bedroom. There are fine Southerly views of further immaculate communal garden beyond. The property has a high specification with under floor heating, Villeroy & Boch sanitary ware and “Draks” fitted wardrobes.

The flat has a stylish communal entrance hallway with lift and staircase to all floors. The spacious reception hallway has three storage cupboards and doors to all principle rooms. The sitting/dining room has bi fold doors giving access to the terrace and a window to side. The kitchen is semi-open plan and fitted with contrasting base units and light composite work surfaces, Siemens appliances to include oven, gas hob with extractor, wine cooler, dishwasher and fridge/freezer.

The principal bedroom has bi fold doors, fitted wardrobes and a four piece en suite bathroom with porcelain marble tiling, bath and separate shower cubicle, vanity sink unit and wc.

Bedroom two is also a very spacious double bedroom, in excess of 15 foot in length with fitted wardrobes. The family bathroom has a walk-in wet room, shower cubicle with vanity sink unit and wc.

This flat further benefits from built in ceiling speakers and an Alpine security system.

The property has a substantial and secluded decked balcony to the rear with glass balustrade with a Southerly aspect. Beyond this lie the larger and well maintained communal gardens.

There are two allocated parking spaces on the block paved driveway to the front of the development.

Square Footage: 1073 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Enjoying a tranquil setting this outstanding executive residence sits on Ickenham's most prestigious private road. This impressive detached home offers generous and well-appointed accommodation. Offering a versatile floor plan, bright accommodation and well-presented interiors.

The property consists of a welcoming entrance hallway, front aspect reception room, open plan dining room which opens onto the kitchen, enjoying three sets of doors that open out to the garden patio. The modern kitchen includes a comprehensive range of units and work surfaces, as well as a breakfast bar, further dining space and access to the second spice kitchen. detailedDescription:
Chain free - Orchard Property Services are delighted to market this impressive extended four bedroom two bathroom semi-detached family home situated in the desirable Ickenham village location, moments away from local sought after schools. This property boasts key features including a double aspect through lounge, 19ft kitchen diner with separate utility room/office which could also be utilised as a fifth bedroom or additional reception room. It is within a short distance from both Ickenham and West Ruislip stations. It also offers own drive with off-street parking for two cars, a spacious rear garden and is well presented throughout. We would highly recommend an internal inspection.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall leading on to a plus 20ft double aspect through lounge with access to the rear garden, spacious kitchen diner with eye and base level units, fitted appliances including a Kinetico water softener, downstairs W.C and a utility room/office space which could also be utilised as a fifth bedroom or additional reception room. The first floor boasts four well proportioned bedrooms, two of which have fitted wardrobes, and a family bathroom. The sizeable master bedroom has a four piece en-suite and airing cupboard. The extensive loft is fully boarded and has a Velux window and power supply, with potential to convert to living accommodation. Outside offers own drive with parking for two cars and a well presented and secluded rear garden with patio area, timber shed, greenhouse, a range of mature trees, shrubs and lawn.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham's most premier and prestigious roads, tree lined Almond Avenue is only moments away from local sought after schools including Breakspear Primary, Vyners and The Douay Martyrs secondary schools. It is walking distance to the scenic views of Swakeleys Park, Swakeleys Tennis Club and Swakeleys House. Ickenham village is also nearby with its array of local shops, cafés, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge and with the added benefit of nearby Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

Larger than average this property offers real spacious accommodation and features a fitted kitchen, large through lounge, 3 double bedrooms and modern bathroom.

The property is conveniently placed for public transport to Heathrow Airport and offers easy access to the M4/M25 motorway networks. West Drayton mainline station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2021) is also only a short distance away.

Other benefits include own driveway to garage, private rear garden, double glazed windows and doors and central heating.

Ground Floor

Tenure

About Harmondsworth

Harmondsworth is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon to the north of London Heathrow Airport and near Junction 4 of the M4 giving access to the M25. Harmondsworth is just south of West Drayton which benefits from a bus station and a mainline station to Paddington and will be part of the Crossrail project due for completion in 2022 linking West Drayton to Canary Wharf. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 37 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The historic village has a Post Office and two convenience stores, Harmondsworth Primary school and two public houses, The Crown and The Five Bells. Buildings of significant historical interest are The Great Barn, dating back to 1425, a Grade I listed building and a Scheduled Ancient Monument (the largest extant timber-framed building in England) and the church of St Mary which has parts dating back to the 12th century.

It is also home to the international head office of British Airways called The Waterside, and beside the huge office complex is Harmondsworth Moor, an area owned and managed by British Airways that was brought to its current state as part of the process to turn the open land into the complex and surrounding park.

Harmondsworth was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086, its name coming from the Anglo-Saxon "Heremodes worp", meaning "Heremod"s enclosure", or Heremundes worþ, meaning "Heremund's enclosure". Harmondsworth remains an ecclesiastical parish, with the name first recorded in ad 780 when King Offa granted land to his servant Aeldred.

detailedDescription:
Chain free - Situated in the heart of South Ruislip, this one bedroom ground floor apartment is a ready made home for any buyer. Perfect for commuters, the property is just a few strides from South Ruislip tube station, as well as the many local shops. This wonderful home is presented in a fantastic condition inside and a viewing is very much recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office, turn left and continue to the end of the High street. Continue on Victoria road, continuing straight over two roundabouts. Go straight over the first set of traffic lights and at the second traffic lights turn right onto Long drive. Continue on Station approach and the property is a short drive down on your left hand side.

Situation

Vincent Court on Station Approach is set close to parks and amenities within South Ruislip, Ruislip Manor and Eastcote. Local transport links include South Ruislip Train Station offering access to the Central Line into London and the Chiltern Railway service into London Marylebone. Ruislip Manor Station is a short bus ride away and is useful for the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line, both providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40/M25 is nearby whilst for families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Bourne Primary School, St Swithun Wells Catholic Primary School, Ruislip High Comprehensive School, Deanesfield Primary School and Queensmead Secondary school. Amenities within 10 minutes walk of the property include the recent Old Dairy Lane development including restaurants, Cineworld, Sainsburys and the Asda supermarkets.

Description

This charming property is ideal for both first time buyers and downsizers, as well as buy to let investors. The property is presented in a great condition throughout and ready for any buyer to simply move into. The property starts with a communal entrance with a phone entry system for security. As you enter the property, the hallway allows access to all of the apartments accommodation and benefits from a handy storage cupboard. The living room is bright and spacious, with french doors leading to the rear of the property that flood the room with light. The reception room is multifunction with space for seating and dining, ideal for those that like to entertain. The kitchen offers a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. The master bedroom is a double and boasts built in wardrobes, as well as space for freestanding storage. The apartment is complete with a family bathroom, with a white suite and finished in white tiles.

Ouside

The apartment has secure allocated parking to the rear of the property. There is also a private garden which is currently shingled for low maintenances, but could be relaid with lawn or artificial turf should you wish at a later date.

Outside

To the rear of the property a lovely well maintained and secluded rear garden. Offering a fantastic size lawn space and a patio space for entertaining and dinning alfresco. Concluding the outside of the property is the garage which is great for storage purpose.

detailedDescription:
Set in a great location in the sought after North part of Ruislip is this four bedroom Semi-detached bungalow. Boasting spacious, light filled rooms and great living, dining and entertaining space the home has everything needed for ready made, relaxed living and benefits from a lovely private garden and off street parking.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High Street. At the mini roundabout turn left and take the first left into Sharps Lane which continues on to Hill Lane. Turn right onto Orchard Close and then left into Woodville Gardens.

Situation

Located on a quiet residential roads, a stones throw from Ruislip High Street and its trendy eateries, shops and transport - Ruislip tube station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) is at the end of the High Street. West Ruislip (Central/br station is also within easy walking distance. For the motorist the A40/M40 and M25 road links offering easy access to London and the Home Counties. For families, it is in the catchment area for excellent local schools bwi, Whiteheath and Sacred Heart and Bishop Ramsey. Highgrove gym and swimming pool are only 10 minutes walk away.

Description

This beautiful semi detached bungalow has been well designed and updated to offer spacious living, dining and entertaining space making an ideal setting for family living. On the ground floor is a kitchen with a wealth of storage and an abundance of space for appliances. There is a large living room which leads to the kitchen and rear dining room at the rear where there is a bright space perfect for additional living and entertaining. There is also access to the outside via patio doors. Two of the bedrooms and a bathroom are also on the ground floor with the larger bedroom benefitting from fitted wardrobes. Stairs rise to the first floor from the hallway where there is an additional two bedrooms and a modern shower room. With a fresh, modern and neutral decor throughout the property creates a ready made home with nothing left to do but move in and enjoy.

Outside

To the front of the house is a paved driveway with space for multiple cars. To the rear there is a private and low maintenance garden laid to lawn and with a decked area towards the rear of the garden.

detailedDescription:
Set in a great location in Ickenham is this immaculately presented two bedroom ground floor maisonette. It comes with a long lease and the benefit of a private rear garden accessed from the living room via bi-fold doors. Ickenham and West Ruislip tube stations are nearby offering easy access into central London via the Central and Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines. The house is a few minutes drive from the A40 with it's access into London and the Home Counties.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham, turn right and proceed to the end of the road. Turn right followed by your second left onto Glebe Avenue. Continue over the bridge and past the station. Take your first left once down the hill onto Crosier Road. The property is located on the right hand side.

Situation

Crosier Road is a popular quiet residential road located only moments away from the heart of Ickenham Village and its selection of shops, cafes and restaurants to offer. The Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station at Ickenham is only a short walk away and provides direct links to the City and Baker Street. West Ruislip Station offers the Central Line and is also within easy reach being only a short walk away. There are a number of bus links into Uxbridge, Hillingdon and Ruislip whilst the M25/A40/M40 road links are also only a short distance away.

Description

As you enter the property you are welcomed by an entrance hall. To your left and located to the front of the property is the second bedroom, a large storage cupboard, and the master bedroom. To the right of the hall is the bathroom and separate kitchen. The kitchen overlooks the garden and comes with ample worktop and storage space, and space for all your required appliances. Completing the accommodation is the living/dining room that has bi-fold doors opening up to the private garden. This property is presented in immaculate condition throughout and is the perfect opportunity for a first time buyer, or someone looking to downsize looking to have the convenience of being able to move straight in and enjoy.

Outside

The property comes with front and rear gardens. The private rear garden is paved and surrounded by eye catching shrubs and greenery and can also be accessed to the side of the property. There is also a separate garage in a block. The the front of the property there is residential parking.

This property also benefits from gas central heating, double glazed windows, allocated parking bay, phone entry system and communal garden.

View Highly Recommended.

First Floor

Hallway

Living Room

17' 8'' x 9' 6'' (5.4m x 2.9m) Laminate flooring, radiator and rear aspect double glazed window.

Kitchen

10' 7'' x 6' 6'' (3.25m x 2m) Ceramic tiled flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, cooker point, gas hob, space for fridge/freezer, wall mounted boiler and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to aspect.

Exterior

Outside

Tenure

Leasehold: Approximately 148 years although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

About Hayes

Hayes is a town in west London. Historically in Middlesex, Hayes became part of the London Borough of Hillingdon in 1965. Hayes has an abundance of retail parks, shopping centres and a modern leisure centre with swimming pool completed in 2010. Stockley Business Park and Championship Golf course, set in 240 acres of rolling countryside, border Hayes to the west.
Hayes adjoins Harlington which borders London Heathrow Airport to the south and shares a railway station with the smaller district on the Great Western mainline to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The Uxbridge Road runs directly through the centre of Hayes to Shepherds Bush and the town offers other excellent transport links with the M4/M25 motorway networks being linked via the Hayes-By-Pass to the A40(M) into Central London and M40 to Birmingham.
Hayes has a long history. The area appears in the Domesday Book of 1086.

Landmarks in the area include the Grade II listed Parish Church, St Mary's - the central portion of the church survives from the twelfth century and it remains in use (the church dates back to 830 A.D.)- and Barra Hall, a Grade II listed manor house. The town's oldest public house - the Adam and Eve, on the Uxbridge Road - though not the original seventeenth-century structure, has remained on the same site since 1665.

Showcasing modern interiors throughout, this well maintained two-bedroom apartment is ideally located in a sought after and convenient location just a short distance from the area's amenities and transport links.

The property also benefits from boarded loft space. Externally, the property benefits from well-maintained communal grounds and allocated parking.

Flowers Avenue is situated off Eastcote Road within close proximity to both Eastcote and Ruislip’s bustling High Streets offering a vast array of shops, restaurants and coffee bars to enjoy. The Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines can be found at both Eastcote and Ruislip providing swift and regular connections to Baker Street and the city.

address: Mill Drive, Ruislip Manor, Ruislip HA4
detailedDescription:
A stylish first floor two double bedroom apartment set within this luxury development is being offered with No Chain. The home is in a highly convenient location in the heart of Ruislip, near to Ruislip High Street and Underground station (Met/Piccadilly Lines). The accommodation includes a fitted kitchen, open plan lounge/diner, two double bedrooms and a white family bathroom as well as an en suite in the master bedroom. The property further benefits from a private balcony and allocated parking.

Direction

From our Ruislip Office turn left and continue to the end of the High Street. At the mini roundabout turn left and take the second left into Mill drive.

Situation

Mallard Court, Mill Drive is located within a new development in the heart of Ruislip and is in a highly convenient location in close proximity to the High Street with its array of restaurants, shops and transport links. Ruislip tube station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines) is at the end of the High Street whilst West Ruislip station (Central/br) is also within easy walking distance. For the motorist the A40/M40 and M25 road links offering easy access to London and the Home Counties. For families, it is well located for some highly regarded schools including bwi, Whiteheath and Sacred Heart, along with a number of leisure facilities including bowls club and Riverside Health Club which has a modern gym, tennis and squash courts and swimming pool. Accross the road you will find a biweekly farmers market with easy access to Pinn Meadows.

Description

Enjoy a contemporary lifestyle of comfort and convenience in this executive apartment ready made for an exceptional lifestyle. Ideally situated on the first floor, it's a short walk to Ruislip station and High Street. The property includes high quality finishes throughout and comprises a spacious hallway with two large storage cupboards, leading from the hallway is a large and light open plan kitchen living room which boasts double doors leading to a private balcony. The modern kitchen includes an integrated cooker, fridge freezer, dishwasher, washer/dryer and eye and low level units. There are two double sized bedrooms both benefitting from built in wardrobes and a modern family bathroom, the master bedroom has an ensuite shower room. The apartment benefits from a fresh décor throughout, boasting a larger than average 730 sq.ft floorplan, lift access in the block and is most conveniently located making it a great investment opportunity with strong rental returns.

Outside

To the front of the building are well maintained landscaped communal gardens. To the rear is an allocated parking space under cover, there is a also a secure bike store at the bottom of the building. The property also benefits from having a private balcony area for enjoying the summer months.

detailedDescription:
A well-presented extended end of terrace house on a corner plot. This two/three bedroom house offers comfortable living accommodation and is located on a quiet residential road in the heart of Ruislip Manor.

From the hallway you have stairs to the first floor, access to a through lounge, kitchen, and downstairs third bedroom and sun lounge. The light filled lounge with a large bay window leads onto the dining room with a row of windows. A door provides direct access to the rear garden.

The kitchen has a range of wall and base units, a good run of work surfaces, space for dishwasher and washing machine and window overlooking the garden.

Upstairs there are two well-proportioned bedrooms. The Master bedroom boasts a wall of built-in cupboards. The first floor is completed with a modern family bathroom comprising of a white three piece suite with overhead shower.

To the rear of the property, there is a large neatly kept garden which is mainly laid to lawn with a patio area. To the front it is block paved providing ample off street parking.

Bessingby Road is a residential road located close to both Ruislip Manor and South Ruislip with their selection of shops and good transport links both the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line and the Central/Main line provide easy access into Central London. For families, the property is close to local parks and falls within the catchment area of many highly regarded schools.

detailedDescription:
Lakin & Co are pleased to offer to the market this rarely available one bedroom ground floor flat situated in the heart of Uxbridge Town Centre. Located off Harefield Road in a quiet cul-de-sac in Bawtree Road which is on one of North Uxbridge's most desirable roads the property is being sold with no onward chain.

Ideal for first time buyers or investors the property briefly comprises communal entrance, entrance hall, large double aspect living room/dining room with access to patio and garden via patio doors, modern fitted kitchen, large double bedroom and a white suite bathroom with shower.

Set amongst well maintained landscaped grounds, with lots of greenery. There is also on street residents permit parking available and the property itself also benefits from electric heating, double glazing and entry phone system.

Conveniently placed just moments from the Town centre with Uxbridge tube station (Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines) and for the motorist the A40/M40/M25 is within close proximity, providing easy and direct access into central London and surrounding Home Counties. Uxbridge not only boasts two shopping centres, local bars/restaurants and transport links, but also offers great sports facilities with Uxbridge sports and leisure complex with an Olympic outdoor pool nearby.

detailedDescription:
Orchard Property Services are delighted to present this imposing and impressive four bedroom detached property boasting a separate self contained annex and situated on a large corner plot location of Edinburgh Drive and Long Lane, Ickenham. Benefiting from being a potential development site (stpp), this detached property offers key features including a spacious double aspect lounge with separate dining room, three well proportioned bedrooms to the main house and a secluded large rear garden with patio area and lawn. The self contained one bedroom annex boasts a double bedroom, shower room, kitchen with access to private garden and a sizeable lounge dining room. Located on Edinburgh Drive, the property also benefits from being within a short distance from local sought after schools, Ickenham Village and accessible transport links including Ickenham & West Ruislip stations, we would recommend an internal inspection to truly appreciate the property and plot size that is on offer.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hall with storage cupboard and W.C, leading on to a triple aspect lounge area with feature fireplace, dining area and kitchen with views across the well maintained rear garden. The first floor boasts two well proportioned bedrooms with fitted storage, family three piece bathroom suite and access to the sizeable loft area. To the side of the property benefits from a larger than average one double bedroom self contained annex which offers kitchen, spacious lounge, shower room, parking and an outside garden space. Outside the main property is a secluded and generously sized rear garden with patio area and two timber sheds, there is a carriage driveway to the front for numerous vehicles and side space.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham's most prestigious areas, Edinburgh Drive is only moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners and Breakspear, walking distance to the scenic views of Swakeleys Park, Swakeleys Tennis Club and Swakeleys House. Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
***shared ownership - 40% share, up to 100% available***

Purplebricks are keen to introduce this spacious first floor apartment, boasting two double bedrooms, a spacious living room, fitted kitchen and family bathroom. The property also has a large private balcony off of the master bedroom and living room, a secure allocated underground parking space and communal garden. The apartment is also presented in a good condition throughout, with mod cons such as gas central heating, double glazing and entry phone system.

Location

The property is located just off Greenway and Kingshill Avenue in Yeading/Hayes. It is nestled on a quiet residential road just moments away from several desirable primary schools, secondary schools, local amenities, several parks and recreational grounds. A small parade of shops are located opposite the property for convenience.

The property is also just seconds away from the nearest bus routes heading towards Hayes and Harlington station, Northolt station, Heathrow, Hatton Cross, Feltham and the Uxbridge Road which connects with an even larger choice of bus routes. Hayes is home to a high street of shops and also boasts several large supermarkets, while Uxbridge town centre serves as the main hub for shopping, dining and entertainment approx 10-12 minutes drive from the property.

Crossrail from Hayes and Harlington station:
When the full route opens, up to ten Elizabeth line services an hour will allow passengers from Hayes & Harlington to travel to Reading or Heathrow in the west or through the central London tunnels to Essex and southeast London. Journey times to Bond Street will be cut from 35 minutes to 20* minutes, Liverpool Street from 47 mins to 27* mins and Canary Wharf from 52 mins 34* mins.

Local schools include the popular Hayes Park School, Grange Park Junior School, St Raphael's Catholic Primary School, Downe Manor Primary School, Viking Primary School and Barnhill Community High School.

Shared Ownership

The property is on sale for £108,000 which is a 40% share of a property worth £270,000.
Future staircasing is possible, meaning additional shares in the property can be purchased, or eventually can be purchased outright.

Popular shared ownership questions;

Q) Who owns the other 60%?
A) Shepherds Bush Housing Association
Q) How long is the lease?
A) Approx 83 years remaining.
Q) How much is the rent?
A) £839 pcm, evaluated yearly.
Q) How much is the service charge?
A) Included with the above rent figure of £839, including buildings insurance and ground rent.
Q) Can I buy more shares?
A) Yes, either now or once you own the property if decided at a later date.
Q) Will the rent go down if I buy more shares?
A) Yes, it is evaluated during the staircasing process and will likely reduce in proportion to the share not owned.
Q) Can anyone buy a shared ownership?
A) Not everybody, the property can not be bought for investment or be rented out and you must not own another property. It is possible to sell your current home and buy this, you do not have to be a first time buyer.
Q) Do I have to earn a certain amount to be eligible?
A) As long as you earn less than £90,000 per annum (solely or jointly if buying alone or with a partner) you will be eligible.
Q) Is it easy to re-sell a shared ownership home?
A) Yes, it's usually very easy as the homes are usually very affordable and realistically priced. There is a little more paperwork involved and it can take a few weeks longer in some cases, but the process in buying/selling a shared ownership isn't very complicated.
Q) Do I need a specific mortgage to buy a shared ownership home?
A) Many lenders offer shared ownership mortgages and they will need to know that it's a shared ownership home that you wish to buy, as the products are different and the rates can vary. It's worth speaking to a whole market mortgage broker, let us know if you wish to speak to one so we can make sure you get the right mortgage advice.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
We present to you this recently refurbished first floor flat! A great opportunity for first-time buyers and investors!

This well presented property comprises of a double bedroom, modern fully fitted kitchen, cozy lounge and a three-piece family bathroom. The recently refurbished property is located in a prime location of west drayton and boasts features such as laminate flooring, gas central heating, double glazing and integrated kitchen appliances.

Local amenities include West Drayton Academy, West Drayton library, Drayton Hall Park, local restaurants, local shops, drayton medical centre and west drayton railway station in close proximity.

Local routes include M4 and M25 allowing easy access to Windsor, Central London, Harrow and Heathrow Airport.

address: Plot 76, The Dice, St Andrew's Park, Uxbridge UB10
detailedDescription:
**£10,000 deposit contribution and ftb stamp duty paid** Plot 76 The Dice is a 742 SqFt ground floor two bedroom apartment in a parkland setting overlooking the 37 acre Dowding Park. The apartment is built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The new state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 37 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge’s town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Specification

- Full height doors and windows
- Contemporary Ideal and Tesino fixtures to bathrooms and ensuites
- Bosch stainless steel appliances
- Oak veneer full height apartment entrance doors
- Oak veneer internal doors
- Chrome heated towel rails in bathrooms and ensuites
- Modern kitchens with handle-less doors and solid silestone worktops
- All homes designed to Lifetime Homes Standards
- Parking space provided

Disclaimer

Some external images are computer generated and the internal images are of other St Modwen Homes developments.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful and charming two bedroom first floor conversion which combines elegant character with a blend of contemporary living, creating a stunning sense of natural light. This period property effortlessly retains some of the original features such as, high pitched ceilings, sash windows, dado and picture rails. The spacious accommodation consists of hallway, living room with a open fireplace, equally spacious master bedroom, fitted kitchen, inner hallway, second bedroom and three piece bathroom suite.

Directions

From our West Drayton office turn right onto Station Road. Take your third right into Swan Road, continue down the road taking the fifth turning on the left into Church Road, then take an immediate right into The Green. Continue down the road and at the end of the road bear left where the property can be found just in front of you on the right hand side.

Situation

Avenue House is a delightful & picturesque Grade ll listed building that has been cleverly converted into four separate dwellings. The property is ideally situated in an idyllic setting being found within the conservation area just a stone's throw from The Green itself in addition to The Closes Park. West Drayton High Street with its range of independent shops, eateries, variety of bus routes and train station (Crossrail) is also just a short distance away.

Description

A wonderful and charming two bedroom first floor conversion which combines elegant character with a blend of contemporary living, creating a stunning sense of natural light. This period property effortlessly retains some of the original features such as, high pitched ceilings, sash windows, dado and picture rails. The spacious accommodation consists of hallway, living room with a open fireplace, equally spacious master bedroom, fitted kitchen, inner hallway, second bedroom and three piece bathroom suite.

Outside

Avenue House is set in wonderful communal gardens that have been carefully manicured.

detailedDescription:
Reserve in June and receive £3,000 in john lewis or ikea vouchers*

£95,000 for a 25% share.

Why buy at padcroft?

  • Own a two-bedroom apartment for as little as £1,000 per month
  • It’s cheaper to own than to rent*
  • High specification homes with integrated appliances
  • Take advantage of all the local amenities and minutes to West Drayton station (Elizabeth Line extension arriving in 2022)
  • No stamp duty to pay*
  • Ready to move into apartments


Reserve in June and receive £3,000 in john lewis or ikea vouchers*

*T&Cs apply - please speak to the Sales Team for further information

Set amongst private landscaped grounds and close to the Grand Union Canal, Padcroft brings one, two and three bedroom apartments to West Drayton. Offering spacious, peaceful homes to complement busy city lifestyles, homes at Padcroft are minutes from West Drayton station so you can spend less time commuting and more time connecting. Pick up everyday essentials from several local supermarkets and takeaways and cafes on Yiewsley High Street, or visit nearby Uxbridge for a fantastic choice of shopping and restaurants.

With homes ready to move in to as standard, you can relax in your new contemporary home. Complete with modern kitchens featuring high-gloss units with an upstand matching the worktop, Zanussi appliances, a contemporary bathroom suite and carpeted living areas and bedrooms. Large terraces and balconies bring the outdoors in, extending your space for entertaining friends and family, or having a quiet morning coffee in the sun. Light and airy bedrooms create quiet spaces to escape to, whilst open plan living spaces are flexible to meet your lifestyle, whether you need a place to work, relax or entertain.

Find peace in the large landscaped private gardens or cycle along the Grand Union Canal as Padcroft offers secure cycle storage to get you out and about. Be rewarded with green open spaces at Colne Valley Regional Park, with its varied greenspaces and lakes.

Padcroft is perfectly positioned to West Drayton train station which serves the Great Western Railway. The area is set to transform with greatly improved transport links on completion of the West Drayton Crossrail station on the Elizabeth line. Heathrow will be only an 8 minute journey and the commute to the West End and the City in under 30 mins travel time, leaving you with more time on your hands. Peak services to destinations west of Paddington will be boosted significantly, with services from Reading doubled from 2 trains per hour to 4 trains per hour, and services to Maidenhead increased from 4 trains per hour to 6 trains per hour. The trains will call at Heathrow Terminal 5 – meaning all Heathrow Terminals will be served by the Elizabeth line.

Now’s the time to be part of something really special, take advantage of the government's stamp duty holiday in addition to the incentives being offered, book your viewing today!

Specification:

Contemporary bright kitchens with integrated appliances.

Karndean flooring in kitchen/living area with grey carpets to the bedrooms.

Fitted mirrored wardrobe to master bedroom.

Patio to the ground floor apartments and balcony to the upper floors.

Video entry phone.

**Non refundable reservation fee. **Taken off total purchase price on completion. For all reservations taken by the end of January 2021.The figure is based on the most expensive service charge on a currently available property. Eligibility and affordability conditions apply

Please note the government has given the go-ahead for property viewings to continue throughout the current lockdown period.

detailedDescription:
Situated in an ultra convenient location this semi detached three bedroom bungalow is a short distance from the shopping amenities and transport links of Ruislip and Ruislip Gardens. Within the catchment area of several highly regarded schools including Ruislip Gardens Primary and Ruislip High School. Huge potential to extend STPP.
This brightly lit throughout the day property is comprised of a through lounge/conservatory with feature fireplace, fitted kitchen/dining room with an original stained glass feature, two double bedrooms and a further single room. Completing the accommodation is a family bathroom with a separate shower cubicle. There is a garden to the front of the property with ample off street parking and access to the garage and the private garden to the rear has a decked patio area ideal for summer entertaining, laid lawn and border with mature shrubs and bushes.

detailedDescription:
Situated in the heart of South Ruislip, this stylish one bedroom first floor apartment is ideal for both first time buyers and buy to let investors. The property, which features underground secure parking and a private balcony, is just a short walk from local supermarkets, restaurants, the cinema and tube links into London. A viewing of this wonderful home is recommend as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left and continue to the end of the High street. Continue on Victoria road continuing straight over two roundabouts. Continue straight over the first set of traffic lights and at the second traffic lights turn right onto Long drive. Continue on Station approach and the property is a short drive on your left.

Situation

Astral court is well located to South Ruislip Train station, shops and local facilities. South Ruislip station is serviced by both Central tube line and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. Whilst Ruislip Manor station is useful for the Metropolitan/Piccadilly line providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Bourne Primary, St Swithun Wells Primary, Ruislip High, Newnham Primary and Queensmead Secondary. This property benefits being minutes away from the new 'Old Dairy' development which is south Ruislip's new town centre that includes popular high street restaurants, supermarkets and a cinema

Description

The communal entrance offers security via the video entry system. Taking the stairs to the first floor, the front door opens onto a welcoming hallway allowing access to all of the properties accommodation. The main living space is open planing, utilising the properties space and offering a great environment to entertain. The living room offers a great seating area to relax in, with a door opening onto the private balcony which over looks communal grounds. The kitchen offers a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. There is also space for a four seater dining table. The master bedroom can house a king size bed comfortably and features a built in wardrobe.. The stylish apartment is complete with a family bathroom, with a white suite and tiled throughout.

Outside

The apartment boasts gated underground parking which gives you a secure space to park your vehicle. The block also benefits from communal gardens which are maintained year round.

detailedDescription:
Set in a conservation area and wildlife corridor, the property benefits from beautiful walks on its doorstep. With Cowley recreational park and Little Britain lakes a stone's throw away.
The property is somewhat of a tardis, a comfortable lock cottage, with a working multi-fuel stove and original features throughout. The property boasts a rural setting within the boundaries of London in close proximity to local amenities.
The Garden, at the rear of the property, is a wildlife haven, with pear, cherry and apple trees, wild flowers, roses, bees and dragonflies. This unique and wonderful place is enriched with birdsong and the sound of water.

The accommodation has been maintained to a high standard by the current owners whilst retaining many original features and briefly comprises entrance hallway, dining room with feature wood burner fireplace, three generous and well proportioned bedrooms, guest cloakroom. The lower floor comprises of a further spacious reception, cottage style fitted kitchen and a modern family bathroom.
The views overlooking the canal are truly stunning and to the rear of the property there is a private secluded garden measuring approximately 70ft.

Location
Iver Lane is situated only minutes from Uxbridge and West Drayton's vast array of shopping and transport facilities. Also close by is Hillingdon Hospital, Brunel University, Stockley park and Heathrow Airport. For the motorist this location gives superb access to the M4/M25 and A40/M40 motor networks offering easy access to London and the Home Counties.

Viewings highly recommended

detailedDescription:
Positioned in a peaceful cul-de-sac setting in North Uxbridge, this 4 bedroom detached residence enjoys a highly sought-after location, and an adjoining 2 bedroom annex split over two floors presents enormous potential and spacious living for a large family.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance porch and hallway, a guest cloakroom, a study, a family room with double doors opening out to the garden, a large utility room with access to the rear, a reception/dining room with sliding doors to the rear, a w/c and a modern fitted kitchen/breakfast room. Following up to the first floor are five good sized bedrooms and two-family bathrooms. The second floor boasts access to the master bedroom. Externally, there is off street parking for multiple cars with access to the garage. To the rear aspect is a large delightful garden perfect for dining and entertaining during the warm summer months.

Maylands Drive is situated off Cambridge Road in North Uxbridge.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate one bedroom ground floor apartment that has been redecorated to a high standard, brought to the market with no chain and in first class order throughout. It is conveniently located to all transport links and amenities however the waterside setting creates a sense of tranquil. This fantastic property is perfect for those looking to move into a ready made home and briefly consists of, hallway, two storage cupboards, 12ft bedroom with built in wardrobes, modern 9ft fitted kitchen, bathroom and 12ft living room with french doors over looking the waterside.

Directions

From our office in West Drayton proceed down Tavistock Road where Merrivale Mews can be found a short distance on the left hand side.

Situation

Merrivale Mews is a popular and sought after waterside development in West Drayton, located close to the High Street with its range of independent shops, train station (Crossrail) providing fast and frequent services in and out of London. Heathrow Airport and Stockley Business Park can be found within easy reach whilst for the motorist the M4 motorway is just a short drive away.

Description

An immaculate one bedroom ground floor apartment that has been redecorated to a high standard, brought to the market with no chain and in first class order throughout. It is conveniently located to all transport links and amenities however the waterside setting creates a sense of tranquil. This fantastic property is perfect for those looking to move into a ready made home and briefly consists of, hallway, two storage cupboards, 12ft bedroom with built in wardrobes, modern 9ft fitted kitchen, bathroom and 12ft living room with french doors over looking the waterside.

Outside

There are well tended communal gardens and there is also an allocated parking space for one car.

detailedDescription:
Property Ref: 8954

A rarely available, beautifully presented two bedroom 2nd floor flat situated in a quiet location close to amenities. Conveniently located between Uxbridge Underground station (2 miles) and West Drayton Railway Station, (2 miles) 24 minutes to Paddington which will be on the Crossrail route (2022- opening). Public transport to Heathrow Airport/ Stockley Park/ Hillingdon Hospital and Brunel university with road links to the M4, M25 and M40.

Within walking distance of local shops and a superstore. There are 3 Primary schools within 1.5 miles (Rated outstanding- ofsted). A few minutes walk brings you to the canal, which offers pleasant walking and cycling routes. Uxbridge is a short drive/ ride away which offers an extensive range of shops, bars, restaurants and a multiplex cinema.

The accommodation comprises of:

Entrance Hall- Laminated flooring, loft hatch, wall mounted Dimplex Heater with built in airing cupboard.

Lounge- Bright and airy, carpeted with wall mounted Dimplex heater.
15'7 ft x 10'11 ft/ 4.75 m x 3.33 m

9'9 ft x 5'4 ft/ 2.97 m x 1.63 m

Bedroom 1- Front aspect window overlooking the communal gardens, with wall mounted heater.
13'5 ft (narrowing to) 11'6 ft X 6'10 ft
4.09 m (narrowing to 3.51 m) X 2.08 m

Bathroom- A modern white suite, comprising of a bath with electric shower unit, pedestal wash basin, WC, fully tiled walls with an integrated cupboard.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Set in a peaceful and private setting within close proximity of Uxbridge town centre this semi detached home combines period charm with stylish modern interiors and benefits from a private driveway and an attractive secluded garden.

Description

A Beautifully presented period property retaining period charm while offering bright modern fresh interiors, with well-proportioned accommodation.

Accommodation

Providing accommodation that briefly comprises, open plan living and dining space with wooden flooring, the living area has an exposed brick chimney breast and a front aspect double glazed sash window, the dining area has a rear aspect double glazed window and stairs to the first floor, the kitchen has been fitted with a range of shaker style units with integrated fridge, freezer, dishwasher, electric oven and inset gas hob with extractor hood above, there are wooden work tops and an inset butler sink, there is a tiled floor, double glazed windows and a double glazed door to the rear, the bathroom is fully tiled and fitted with an enclosed bath with a shower over, pedestal wash basin and w.c.
To the first floor there are three spacious bedrooms.

Outside

There is an attractive enclosed garden to the side of the property which is mainly lawn, there is a paved patio area and a variety of shrubs and trees.
To the front of the house there is a well stocked private garden, to the rear there is a private driveway that provides off street parking along with a detached garage which has been split to create two separate storage areas.

Situation

Positioned within easy reach of Uxbridge town centre with its multiple shopping facilities, restaurants, bars and Metropolitan and Piccadilly line station. For the motorist the A40/M40 is a short drive away giving access to London and the M25.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

Tenure: Freehold
Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon
Council Tax Band: D
EPC rating: D

address: The Mansion, Eastbury Avenue, Northwood HA6
detailedDescription:
I N T R O D U C I N G T H E M A N S I O N

A 2 bedroom 2 bathroom 1st floor apartment in this a unique development of five modern luxury apartments in the heart of Northwood, built by boutique local developer Sterling Rose Homes. The level of detailed execution for a development of this nature is unheard of in this locality. These modern apartments are designed to provide central London style and flair to the suburbs. The Mansion is perfectly located as an outer-city haven, with the ability to drive to numerous local amenities within minutes, also allowing quick access to Central London via Northwood Station which is of very close proximity.
P E R F E C T L Y L O C A T E D


The Mansion is perfectly situated on Eastbury Avenue. It benefits from a short walk to local amenities and the underground station which is of very close proximity. The area displays a village-like atmosphere while allowing quick access to Central London. Northwood has a lot to offer, including a number of restaurants to satisfy all palettes. Embracing the outdoors couldn't be easier. There are various woodlands, nature reserves and golf courses located within a few mile radius of Eastbury Avenue. Also, David Lloyd’s Riverside Health and Racquet Club is an excellent option for their gym and fitness amenities. Add to this a choice of local cricket, bowls, tennis and football clubs and there is something for all sport enthusiasts.
E F F O R T L E S S C O N N E C T I O N S


Under a mile away from The Mansion, Northwood station is within fare Zone 6 and offers speedy connections via the Metropolitan Line to London's various amenities. This allows a quick and easy to commute into Central London, while still displaying a village-like atmosphere. The West End’s diverse bars and restaurants, designer shops and many theatres, museums and galleries are very easily accessible.
L U X U R I O U S I N T E R I O R S


Thoughtful interior design, comprehensive high-quality specifications and attention to the finest of details are all hallmarks of these exclusive homes. Kitchens are beautifully appointed by Halcyon Interiors. Halcyon combine unique design expertise with the highest quality craftsmanship to achieve an unrivalled kitchen experience. Bathrooms and en-suites are luxurious retreats finished in high quality tiling, complimented with Villeroy and Boch appliances, chrome fittings and integrated feature lighting.
Bathrooms & en-suites

• Vitra sanitary ware
• Villeroy and Boch appliances
• Italian Porcelain tiling throughout
• Stylish chrome fittings
Kitchens

• Bespoke kitchen units designed by Halcyon Interior
• Porcelain splashbacks
• Stylish chrome fittings
• Siemens integrated appliances
General

• One confirmed parking space per apartment
• Car turntables
• Secured cycle storage
• Private south facing terraces
• Communal landscaped gardens
• External lighting
• Schindler lift access
• Secure, lockable mail boxes
• Communal bin store
• Sky TV provisions throughout
• Video door entry system
• Smoke detectors throughout
• Recessed LED down lighting throughout
• Aluminium casement windows & doors
• CCTV throughout
• cat 6 data points
• High speed fibre broadband throughout

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This bright and spacious two bedroom first floor apartment offers an ultra-convenient lifestyle opportunity. It is set in a modern complex and enjoys outlooks over the communal gardens. The property is also located within walking distance of tube lines and Ickenham Village . It is the ideal opportunity for investors or first time buyers; a great entry point to a flourishing area.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham proceed right. At the end of the road, turn left on Ickenham High Road. Continue until you reach a set of traffic lights and turn right in to Aylsham Drive, turn right into Thorpland Avenue and left into Tayfield Close. The apartment is situated on the right hand side.

Situation

This property is located close to Ickenham village which offers a superb range of fashionable shops, cafes and restaurants whilst the pleasant open space of Thorpland Avenue public field just a short stroll away. Ickenham Station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines) is within close distance providing reliable links into the City and West End. Closer still is West Ruislip Station which is serviced by both tube (Central line) and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools including Douay Martyrs, Breakspear Infant and Juniors and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Uxbridge Golf Club, Ruislip bowls club and Riverside Health Club.

Description

This stylish two bedroom apartment is offered to the market in immaculate condition throughout and is ready to move straight into. This property comprises a large entrance hallway which leads to the light filled rooms. To the right is the spacious 17'10 x 12'1 lounge which has a juliet balcony to enjoy the views of the communal gardens. Just off the of lounge is the modern fitted kitchen which has ample worktop and storage space, this also overlooks the communal grounds. Moving back to the hallway you have access to the two double bedrooms which both have the benefit of fitted wardrobes. Completing the accommodation is the family bathroom and a separate w/c with its own basin.

Outside

There is allocated parking and communal gardens. Also directly opposite the apartment there is the benefit of a local common and a playground for the children to enjoy.

title: 1 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
** investment opportunity - Buy to let or cash buyers only ** An extended and partially renovated semi-detached period property situated in a no-through road about 0.5 mile from Uxbridge town centre. The property is currently laid out as two separate dwellings and offers potential to officially split the property or to turn back into one large dwelling.

Situation

Tachbrook Road is a no-through road approximately half mile away from Uxbridge town centre with its array of shopping facilities, restaurants, bars, bus links and tube station. The property also has easy access to Brunel University, Hillingdon Hospital and Stockley Park. There are a number of well-regarded schools close by such as St Mary's and Whitehall and the A40/M40 and M4 are just a short drive away, offering links to London, Heathrow and the Home Counties.

Description

The property is split into two dwellings. 5a is on the ground floor and has been modernised within the last couple of years and comprises of a living room, modern kitchen, double bedroom and a modern shower room. No. 5 is split level with a ground floor living room and stairs to the first floor leading to a kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms.

Outside

To the front of the property is a small front garden with double gates leading the rear garden with a large block paved area offering off road parking and/or a patio area. At the rear of the garden is a large storage shed.

Sat Nav

UB8 2QS

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market chain free and a short walk from Uxbridge Town centre in an exclusive development, this light and airy two-bedroom, two-bathroom ground floor apartment is very well kept throughout and offers direct access onto communal garden via its own private patio area.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall with access to storage cupboards and doors leading to all rooms. Leading off the hallway is the spacious reception/dining room with a single door leading to the communal gardens and a fitted kitchen area. There are two double bedrooms with the master bedroom boasting fitted wardrobe and an ensuite. Completing this apartment is a three piece bathroom.

Externally, there are communal gardens surrounding the property and one allocated parking space that belongs to the flat.

Hogarth Close is situated just off the Cowley Road, on the outskirts of Uxbridge Town Centre and within easy reach of the multiple shopping facilities.

detailedDescription:
A delightful two bedroom two bathroom top floor apartment situated on this stunning riverside development. This light filled apartment would make an ideal purchase for those looking to take their first step on the property ladder whilst also representing a sound investment prospect. The accommodation on offer consists of hallway, spacious living/dining room with access to the balcony, modern fitted kitchen, master bedroom with fitted wardrobe and en-suite shower room, second bedroom, recently added family bathroom and the home is fitted with a smart hive system.

Directions

From our West Drayton office turn right onto Station Road. Take your third right into Swan Road and take your second right onto Money Lane. Wren Drive can be found on your right hand side.

Situation

Wren Drive is a luxury waterside development located close to the Green whilst also being only a short distance from West Drayton High Street with its range of independent shops, cafes & restaurants and good public transport links via various bus routes and the train station (Crossrail). Stockley Business Park and Heathrow Airport and the M4 motorway are all within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
3 bedrooms / semi detached house: A 3 bedroom semi detached house located a short distance to the east of the Duke of Northumberland's River in the sought after location of Longford Village with its two local public houses, petrol station and 24hr McDonalds drive through restaurant. Ideal for Terminal 5 and easy access to London Heathrow Airport and is also convenient for the Bath Road and the M4/M25 motorway networks.

The property features a entrance porch, spacious hallway, large living area with additional dining area, fitted kitchen with breakfast bar, utility room, 3 bedrooms and fitted bathroom. Outside is a large private garden with a garage.

A perfect property looking for a family home with a twist.

Viewing Highly Recommended.

Ground Floor

Entrance Porch

5' 2'' x 1' 11'' (1.6m x 0.6m) Tiled Flooring

Lounge

23' 3'' x 12' 0'' (7.1m x 3.68m) Fitted carpet, radiator and double glazed bay window.

Kitchen

10' 2'' x 7' 2'' (3.1m x 2.2m) Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, cooker point, gas, extractor fan hood, gas oven, plumbing for washing machine and tiled walls and splashbacks.

Utility Room

16' 4'' x 4' 5'' (5m x 1.35m) Tiled flooring and part Double Glazed door leading to Garden.

Dining Area

10' 9'' x 7' 6'' (3.3m x 2.3m) Fitted carpet, radiators and double glazed patio doors.

First Floor

Bedroom 1

12' 7'' x 10' 7'' (3.85m x 3.25m) Fitted carpet, radiator and double glazed window.

Bedroom 2

10' 5'' x 10' 4'' (3.2m x 3.15m) Fitted carpet, radiator and double glazed window.

Bedroom 3

7' 2'' x 7' 0'' (2.2m x 2.15m) Fitted carpet, radiator and double glazed window.

Bathroom

7' 6'' x 5' 2'' (2.3m x 1.6m) Tiled flooring and radiator. Three-piece suite including bath with shower. Tiled Walls and double glazed windows.

Exterior

Outside Front

Garden area mainly laid to lawn.

Outside Rear

Exceptionally Large Mature rear garden with a variety of shrubs, bushes and trees.

Garage

Single Garage

About Longford

Longford is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the north western perimeter of London Heathrow Airport. Longford village is a linear development astride the original Bath Road and as such close to the M25/ M4 motorway networks with the newer Junction 14 of the M25 for Terminal 5 airport roads only. There are several hotels, a McDonalds fast food restaurant and a petrol service station just on the outskirts of the Village and two Public Houses within the Village centre. The area is characterized by an historic village core and similar-sized green buffer zones and much of the land surrounding the village of Longford is within the Metropolitan Green Belt.

Located on Bellway's beautiful Bluenote Apartments development we have a range of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, available with Shared Ownership. The development, located in Hayes, is near a wide range of local shops, restaurants, parks and fantastic travel links.
You can reach nearby London in under 25 minutes by train with the Hayes & Harlington train station a 3-minute walk from the development. Heathrow Airport is a 12-minute drive away and you can visit nearby towns of Slough and Reading via the M4 and M25.

About the home
Plot 76 is a two bedroom, fifth floor apartment. The property comprises an open plan kitchen/lounge/ dining area, which opens to a large private balcony. There are two double bedrooms and the apartment also has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway.

Pricing and Affordability
Full Market Value: £405,000
25% Share £101,250 - Rent £696.09 pcm
50% Share £202,500 - Rent £464.06 pcm
75% Share £303,750 - Rent £232.03 pcm
Approximate Service Charges: £140.25 pcm.

Travel
These homes would appeal to commuters and downsizers who would like good proximity to London and the great transport links. Residents will be ideally situated to take advantage of Hayes' excellent road and rail links. Hayes & Harlington train station is under a five-minute walk away, providing direct services to Heathrow Airport, London Paddington and Reading, with Central tube line access available at Ealing Broadway just four stops away. The incoming Elizabeth line will enhance access into the City and Canary Wharf, providing direct services to both and further beyond. Those who travel by car can join either the M4 or M25 in under fifteen minutes, providing links eastbound to Chiswick and westbound to Slough and Reading.

Shared Ownership
The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright.
At the Bluenote Apartments you can buy a minimum 25% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home.

Please note: Floor plans are provided for guidance purposes only and no responsibility is taken for any error, omission, or mis-statement as these floor plans.

* Please note the with regards to viewings at the Shared Ownership apartments at Bluenote Apartments:
- We can only have 2 viewers from the same household view the apartment at any one time
- You will be required to follow Social Distancing at all times
- Please ensure you have your facemasks with you
- You should only arrive at the time of your appointment and wait to the front of the Bluenote apartments, a member of the team will great you and invite you into the building to view the Shared Ownership apartments.

• 2 bedroom Third Floor Apartment
• Integrated oven, hob and hood
• Integrated fridge freezer
• Integrated dishwasher and Washer Dryer
• Private balcony
• En-suite in bedroom 1
• Three piece bathroom with shower over bath
• Storage cupboards• Concierge service
• Lift to all floors
• Estimated Service Charge £143.34 pcm"

Located on Bellway's beautiful Bluenote Apartments development we have a range of 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, available with Shared Ownership. The development, located in Hayes, is near a wide range of local shops, restaurants, parks and fantastic travel links.
You can reach nearby London in under 25 minutes by train with the Hayes & Harlington train station a 3-minute walk from the development. Heathrow Airport is a 12-minute drive away and you can visit nearby towns of Slough and Reading via the M4 and M25.

About the home

Plot 72 is a two bedroom, fifth floor apartment. The property comprises an open plan kitchen/lounge/ dining area, which opens to a large private balcony. There are two double bedrooms and the apartment also has a three piece bathroom with shower over bath and spacious cupboards in the hallway.

Pricing and Affordability

50% Share £192,500 - Rent £441.15 pcm

75% Share £288,750 - Rent £220.57 pcm
