Travel

These homes would appeal to commuters and downsizers who would like good proximity to London and the great transport links. Residents will be ideally situated to take advantage of Hayes' excellent road and rail links. Hayes & Harlington train station is under a five-minute walk away, providing direct services to Heathrow Airport, London Paddington and Reading, with Central tube line access available at Ealing Broadway just four stops away. The incoming Elizabeth line will enhance access into the City and Canary Wharf, providing direct services to both and further beyond. Those who travel by car can join either the M4 or M25 in under fifteen minutes, providing links eastbound to Chiswick and westbound to Slough and Reading.

Shared Ownership

The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you'd expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright.
At the Bluenote Apartments you can buy a minimum 25% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you're ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home.

detailedDescription:
Cleverly designed to optimise space and natural light throughout, this three bedroom family residence boasts bright and spacious interiors throughout. Coleridge Drive is set in a sought after location and is just over half a mile from Eastcote train station and a short walk from a choice of High Streets, shops, restaurants and coffee bars.

This residence comprises an entrance hallway giving access to an under stairs cupboard and all rooms. The modern kitchen has a range of eye and base level units including integrated appliances and a storage cupboard. The sitting room enjoys double doors that open out to the rear patio, ideal for entertaining during the warmer months. Following up to the first floor are two well-presented bedrooms with both enjoying built in wardrobe space and one boasting an en-suite bathroom, this is also accessed via the main hallway as a family bathroom. To the second floor is the large master bedroom with its own en suite bathroom.

Cole Harding presents this four bedroom semi detached house which is situated in North Uxbridge just off of Honeycroft Hill.
This is a great opportunity for an investor looking to increase their portfolio and generate a fantastic rental return.
This property can generate approx £35,400 Per Annum
The property is currently used as an HMO but offers great potential to be a wonderful family home.
On the ground floor the property offers a lounge, dining room which is currently used as a fifth bedroom, kitchen/breakfast room, fourth bedroom and an en-suite shower room. To the first there are two double bedrooms, one single bedroom and a family sized bathroom. title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
This four bedroom detached property in Gilbey Close has been recently fully renovated to a very high standard with a modern kitchen, restored French 1960’s parquet flooring, new carpets for the upstairs, new bathrooms, built-in sliding wardrobes and dimmable spotlights on both floors. This property offers the perfect opportunity for a family to move straight into and enjoy.

Directions

From our Ickenham office turn right and continue to the end of the road. At the zebra crossing turn right onto Long Lane. Continue along the road and take the fifth turning on your right into Gilbey Close. The property is then situated on the left hand side.

Situation

This property is located a short walk from Ickenham village which offers a range of shops, cafés and restaurants. Ickenham Station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly lines) is a short walk away providing reliable links into the City and West End. Alternatively West Ruislip Station is serviced by both tube (Central line) and train lines into Marylebone Station in under 20 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the M40/M25 towards Oxford, Heathrow and Watford. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools including Douay Martyrs, Breakspear Infant and Juniors and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Uxbridge Golf Club, Ruislip Bowls Club and Riverside Health Club.

Description

A ready-to-move-in property that will spare you from the need of tens of thousands in renovation costs. The downstairs accommodation comprises; an entrance hallway, a front facing modern kitchen, a separate utility room, a large full width lounge/diner, and a conservatory overlooking the immaculate rear garden. To the first floor there are four double bedrooms and a tastefully designed modern family bathroom with his and hers sinks. Bedrooms one and two are to the rear and both have the benefit of fitted wardrobes.

Outside

To the front of the property is a paved driveway providing off street parking for three cars. There is access to the garden from both sides of the property. A large and modern >700 sq ft garden completes a stylish living experience. It is cleverly landscaped with an elegant plot of plants along its length. A low-maintenance composite deck surface allows for stylish outdoor living and a smooth surface for children to bike, scooter or engage in inflatable pool activities. A shade sail on top allows for cool and elegant garden gatherings in the summer.

address: Park Lodge Avenue, West Drayton UB7
detailedDescription:
This large bedroom apartment located within the popular "Parkwest" development. The apartment boasts three double bedrooms, two bathrooms, a large reception room boasting an open plan kitchen area with base & eye level units, balcony and audio entry system. The development offers several maintained gardens along with twenty four hour concierge and a residents gym.

Description

A opportunity to purchase a spacious three bedroom, two bathroom apartment positioned on the second floor offering a fully fitted kitchen that opens to a large living room with balcony, 24 hour concierge, residents only gym and gated communal gardens. This would make a great opportunity for an investor or professional commuting into London.

Accommodation

The accommodation comprises of entrance hallway, open plan kitchen/living room with utility area, three good sized bedroom, family bathroom and en- suite shower room.

Outside

This stunning apartment has a balcony overlooking the development and views beyond, also included is residents under croft parking and communal gardens.

Situation

West Drayton's position on the western edge of the Capital means that it is superbly placed to access Central London with ease, with frequent services to London Paddington in less than 25 minutes from the West Drayton Mainline Station. The property is situated in one of the most popular locations and offers the convenience of an excellent local bus service which is accessed on the main road. The station is within walking distance which is due to benefit from Crossrail and offers excellent access to London's Paddington. Other benefits include good access to West Drayton High street, Yiewsley and Uxbridge with their wide range of shopping facilities and amenities. Conveniently located close to Stockley Business Park, local bus routes, London International Heathrow Airport, M4, M40 and M25 motorways.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide priece £800,000 - £825,000 - Orchard Property Services are delighted to market this skilfully extended and well presented four double bedroom, three bathroom detached chalet style bungalow, situated on The Chase, moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners & Breakspear. Located on a tree lined road, this deceptively spacious property benefits from bright and airy accommodation, two reception rooms, own drive and a secluded rear garden. Ideal for all types of clients looking to move in to the local area, The Chase is a short distance from excellent transport links and the vibrant Ickenham Village, the property also offers a double aspect fitted kitchen diner with access to the rear garden. We would recommend an internal inspection to truly appreciate the design and decor that The Chase has to offer.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of a large entrance hall with stairs leading to the first floor, front lounge with bay window, a bright and spacious kitchen diner across the rear with views over the garden, three double bedrooms, two with fitted wardrobes, a four piece bathroom suite and an ensuite off of the second bedroom. The first floor boasts a double aspect master bedroom with walk in wardrobe and a ensuite. Outside the property offers own drive for numerous vehicles and a well maintained rear garden with patio area, timber sheds and lawn.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham’s most prestigious areas, The Chase is only moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners and Breakspear, walking distance to the scenic views of Swakeleys Park, Swakeleys Tennis Club and Swakeleys House. Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

title: 4 bed detached bungalow for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on Three Oaks Close in Ickenham, this detached property is set in a quiet residential cul-de-sac. The property briefly comprises of an entrance hall, living room, dining room, fitted kitchen, guest cloakroom, three bedrooms and a family bathroom. The home also benefits from a garage to the side, off street parking, and a private rear garden. With great potential to extend (STPP), this property can be designed to create the perfect family home.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham, turn left and head up Swakeleys Road. After the traffic lights, take your second left onto Vinlake Avenue, proceeding to take your first right onto Three Oaks Close. The property is located up the top of the road on the left.

Situation

Three Oaks Close is a quiet cul-de-sac in Ickenham located in close proximity to Ickenham High Street and it's selection of shops, cafes, restaurants and schools. Uxbridge Town Centre is also a short drive or bus journey away and offers a choice of retailers, bars and restaurants. West Ruislip and Ickenham tube stations are nearby offering easy access into central London via the Central and Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines. The house is conveniently located to the A40 with it's access into London and the Home Counties.

Description

Offering fantastic potential to extend, enhance and personalise, this superb home is ideal for the large or growing family looking for extra space. Situated in a quiet cul-de-sac, it offers well proportioned rooms and briefly comprises to the ground floor; an entrance hallway, spacious living room, dining room, fitted kitchen and a guest cloakroom. The dining room enjoys views of the rear garden and there are patio doors leading onto the patio area. To the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Bedroom has the benefit of being dual aspect allowing ample natural light.

Outside

To the front of the property is a driveway offering off street parking. There is also a separate garage to the left hand side offering great storage space. To the rear is a secluded secluded garden with good space for the family to enjoy. You can access the garden from both sides of the property.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

address: Wolsey Road, Moor Park Estate, Northwood HA6
detailedDescription:
A magnificent new detached home with a classic exterior, located on a desirable private road within the Moor Park Private Estate. The substantial accommodation is beautifully arranged over 3 floors, designed and built to exacting standards, finished with a stylish interior design and furnished, creating this stunning residence ready for occupation. An impressive entrance hall with oversized Italian porcelain tiled floors and a glass helical staircase finished in stained dark wood, gives access to the fully furnished study, a guest cloakroom and a formal living room. One of the most outstanding feature rooms is the open plan kitchen/dining/family room, which spans the entire width of the house. The beautifully crafted kitchen boasts stone effect cabinets and matching work surfaces with contrasting copper inserts and integrated Miele appliances, whilst floor to ceiling glass sliding doors seamlessly connect the inside and outside. The first floor comprises a principal bedroom with dressing room and ensuite bathroom, three further bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and ensuites, a fifth bedroom and a family bathroom. The versatile second floor could serve as further guest accommodation, a games room, gym, and benefits from a laundry area with Miele washing machine and tumble drier.

Peace and tranquility are never far away, with an abundance of local parks and green open space to choose from Rickmansworth Aquadrome, Ruislip Woods, Common and Lido to name a few. Forming part of the 294 acres of the Moor Park Private Gated Estate, bordering Middlesex and Hertfordshire, surrounded by rolling countryside. There are no less than seven picturesque golf clubs within a few miles, including the esteemed Moor Park Golf Club, with two championship courses and a spectacular 17th century Palladian mansion. David Lloyd’s Riverside Health and Raquet Club is just one option for everyday fitness with excellent gym and fiftness amenities. Renowned Holland & Holland Shooting Grounds provide for clay and rifle shooting in a stunning countryside setting, or head to Stockers Lake for a relaxing spot of fishing. Add to this a choice of local cricket, bowls, tennis and football clubs and there is something for all sport enthusiasts.
Nearby Northwood and Rickmansworth are home to an appealing mix of locally owned shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants, or for more choice Watford is just five miles north with its cosmopolitan shopping district and the extensive Atria shopping centre. Enjoy a night of drama at the Edwardian Palace Theatre, take in a concert at the Colosseum or live music at the Pump House. With Moor Park Station just a short walk away, the West End’s diverse bars and restaurants, designer shops and many theatres, museums and galleries are also easily accessible. The area is exceptionally well served with high achieving state and independent schools, from nursery up to sixth form. The major draw includes St. Helen’s School and Northwood College for girls, Frithwood School and St. Martin’s, St. John’s and Merchant Taylors’ Prep and School for boys. Major motorway links with the M25 (junction 18) at Chorleywood and the M1 and A40 are also accessible.

detailedDescription:
Orchard Property Services are delighted to market this well presented and deceptively spacious two double bedroom first floor maisonette situated on the popular Oak Farm area of Hillingdon, surrounded by local sought after schools and excellent transport links. Located on Petworth Gardens, this ideally located maisonette offers key features including a sizeable rear garden, local to bus routes and amenities. Ideal for investment, first time buyers or downsizes, we would recommend an internal inspection.

The accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall with stairs leading to the first floor landing area, double aspect lounge, well presented kitchen with eye & base level units, two double bedrooms and a family three piece bathroom suite, outside boasts a large rear secluded rear garden.

Location

Located in the popular Oak Farm area of Hillingdon, Petworth Gardens is within walking distance to local sought after schools including Oak Farm Primary, Ryefield & St Bernadette, Oakwood & Swakeleys secondary schools and an array of shops including The Co-Op, the Post Office and restaurants all close by.

Local transports links are also close by including bus routes to Uxbridge, Oxford Bus and Hillingdon Station (Metropolitan & Piccadilly lines), the A40/M25/M40 are within driving distance.

detailedDescription:
This well presented, spacious one bedroom apartment that offers first time buyers and investors alike a fantastic opportunity to those seeking a comfortable home in a convenient location. The accommodation comprises of a modern kitchen with eye and base level units, work surfaces and built in appliances, which is open plan to the large reception room. Completing the apartment is a double bedroom, a storage cupboard and a family bathroom, comprising of a white suite.
The property benefits from allocated parking spaces. Cromwell house is conveniently located on Ruislip High Street and is within walking distance to its array of shops and restaurants, such as Waitrose, Marks and Spencers, Pizza Express and Café Rouge. Transport links include Ruislip train station on the Metropolitan / Piccadilly line, West Ruislip station on the Central line and many bus routes as well as the A40 with its road links into London and the Home Counties.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Westcombe Lodge Drive is situated off Uxbridge Road, Hayes End and is within close proximity to local transport links and amenities. Uxbridge Road provides access to other local areas and the A312/A40/M40 motorway links. Contact Hunters for an appointment to view on .

detailedDescription:
Set on the Second floor this two double bedroom apartment is located in North Ruislip and nearby to Ruislip Woods, Lido and the High Street and Train Station are approximately a mile away. The property comprises a spacious lounge/diner, modern fitted kitchen, two bedrooms and a bathroom. This is the perfect home for those seeking ready made, low key, luxury living with its fresh, crisp and stylish design throughout.

Direction

From our Ruislip office turn left and continue to the mini roundabout at the end of the High Street, turn left into Bury Street. At the roundabout take the first left onto Breakspear road and take the first right onto Withy lane.

Situation

Withy lane is a quiet residential road situated in North Ruislip and nearby to Whiteheath School as well as being in close proximity to a number of amenities including Howletts Lane local shops, Ruislip Woods and Kings College playing fields.
Ruislip High Street is a stroll away for shops, restaurants and transport links to the City and West End via the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. Highgrove gym and swimming pool are only 10 minutes walk away.

Description

This superb apartment boasts space, style and a modern design with high quality features and fittings throughout. Upon entering the home, you are greeted by a spacious hallway providing useful fitted storage cupboards and access into to the living room which presents a generously sized room. The modern kitchen is to the side of the living room and has been delivered to a high specification, boasting a wealth of storage, white worktops. Wooden flooring continues throughout the room and there are two spacious double bedrooms and a modern master bathroom.

Outside

The property benefits from residence parking, well-maintained communal gardens and a private garage

detailedDescription:
Providing a contemporary haven for family living and entertaining this spacious three bedroom home is positioned in a most convenient location.

Description

A extended three bedroom terrace house with three generous size bedrooms, good size reception room which has all been well maintained by the current owner, the property is situated in this popular residential location, with the benefit of a good size rear garden and off street parking for up to two - four cars.

Accommodation

The accommodation compromises of: Porch, entrance hall, separate shower room, good size reception room, the kitchen is fitted with a good range of storage units and drawers, there are ample work surfaces and space for appliances, double doors open out onto the garden room from the dining area that was extended at the rear. To the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Outside

There is a driveway to the front with parking for up to two cars, to the rear is an enclosed garden that is paved for easy maintenance with an area of lawn plus a storage shed. Side access from the front of the property that leads to the rear garden.

Situation

West Drayton's position on the western edge of the Capital means that it is superbly placed to access Central London with ease, with frequent services to London Paddington in less than 25 minutes from the West Drayton mainline station. The property is within walking distance to local shops, local bus routes and a short bus ride to West Drayton Main Line Station which is subject to the Crossrail upgrade, which will bring West Drayton to within a 40 minutes train journey to Canary Wharf and will give excellent regular access to the centre of London. The property also has excellent access to the M25 and M4 motorways.

Terms And Notification Of Sale

detailedDescription:
No chain -Enjoying an elevated position in North Uxbridge, this four-bedroom detached home is situated in a sought-after and highly desirable cul-de-sac location, with the current owner residing in the property since it was built in 1968.

The accommodation comprises an entrance porch, a spacious reception room that flows into the dining room, a fitted kitchen, utility area with back door leading to the rear garden, a w/c and a family room with sliding door opening onto double patio. Following up to the first floor are four good sized bedrooms with two enjoying fitted wardrobes, a shower room and a family bathroom with separate w/c. Externally, there is off street parking with access to the garage. To the rear aspect is a landscaped garden.

Woodhall Close is located only a short distance from Uxbridge Town Centre with its vast array of shops, eateries, coffee houses and bars. The station provides quick access into Central London via the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines.

detailedDescription:
A two bedroom third floor retirement apartment, offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Ruislip.

Directions

From our office on Ruislip High Street, proceed right and continue straight until you reach the set of traffic lights. Proceed straight over the bridge, and take your second exit onto Wood Lane at the mini roundabout. The entrance to Sherleys Court can be located a short distance up on the right hand side.

Situation

Sherleys Court is located a stone's throw from Ruislip High Street and all it has to offer, including Waitrose, The Co-Operative and Tesco supermarkets, a number of coffee shops, bars, Café Rouge, Zaza and The Duck House restaurants. Ruislip Station (Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines) with its links to Baker Street and The City is located within a couple of minutes walk away.

Description

A two bedroom third floor retirement apartment, offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Ruislip. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a light-filled 17ft lounge with a new fitted kitchen. There are two double bedrooms. Both with fitted wardrobes and a contemporary shower room. There are a number of additional benefits, including an on site warden, 24 hour emergency cords in every room, secure entry-phone system, residents lift, communal lounge, laundry rooms and an overnight guest suite.

Outside

The property benefits from beautifully maintained communal grounds, an allocated parking space and ample visitor parking bays.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented luxury apartment with generously proportioned, light filled rooms. The property is located on the second floor and has the added benefit of access to its own private balcony along with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a modern fitted kitchen and a living/dining area.

Directions

From our office on Ruislip High Street proceed left to a mini roundabout and take your first exit left onto Bury Street. Continue to the next mini roundabout and continue straight over. Take the next turning on your right into Reservoir Road.

Situation

Waters Reach is located in a unique development in Reservoir Road just off Ducks Hill Road and close to the Ruislip Lido complex and Ruislip Woods. Ruislip High Street is just over a mile away where there are excellent shopping facilities and a choice of restaurants. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40. Ruislip Station is to the end of Ruislip High Street and provides the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip, serviced by tube (Central) and train lines into Marylebone Station. Ruislip Lido and Ruislip Woods are moments away.

Description

A luxury apartment beautifully presented throughout and boasting light filled rooms and impressively a private balcony, living area, kitchen, two bathrooms and two bedrooms. The property is accessed via a secure video entry phone system which leads to a communal entrance. This apartment is located on the 2nd floor and once inside the apartment, there is a generous hallway with a large storage cupboard. To the right is a generous living room with space for a dining area. This leads seamlessly to the outdoor balcony offering a superb space with pleasant views to retreat to. The kitchen is contemporary and boasts some integrated appliances. There are two double bedrooms both fitted with wardrobes. The master bedroom also benefits from a stylish, fully tiled en-suite bathroom. It also has access directly to the balcony. Finally there is a luxury shower room. This home is ready made for completely relaxed living and set in an ultra convenient location, it is an ideal opportunity for those looking to get into the marketplace for the first time, those looking to downsize or creates a sound investment prospect with strong rental returns.

Outside

The property benefits from a well maintained, landscaped communal garden and secure underground parking with allocated parking.

detailedDescription:
A four bedroom semi detached house located on Three Oaks Close in Ickenham and boasting a modern, stylish interior throughout. Arranged over three floors the property comprises of the entrance hallway, kitchen, dining room, living room, guest cloakroom, three first floor bedrooms and a bathroom, a fantastic size bedroom with en-suite bathroom to the second floor. Further benefits to the property include off street parking, a well maintained rear garden and useful garage.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham, turn left and head up Swakeleys Road. After the traffic lights, take your second left onto Vinlake Avenue, proceeding to take your first right onto Three Oaks Close. The property is located up the top of the road on the left.

Situation

Three Oaks Close is a quiet road in Ickenham located in close proximity to Ickenham High Street and it's selection of shops, cafes, restaurants and schools. West Ruislip and Ickenham tube stations are nearby offering easy access into central London via the Central and Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines. The house is conveniently located to the A40 with it's access into London and the Home Counties.

Description

A wonderful four bedroom residence boasting bright and spacious rooms with a well appointed interior and features. To the ground floor the entrance leads to a larger than average, welcoming hallway with doors to both of the reception rooms, the kitchen and guest cloakroom. To the front of the house is the spacious living room with a large window overlooking the front grounds and filling the room with an abundance of natural light. To the rear of the house is the kitchen and dining room. The kitchen is a good size with a selection of eye and base level cabinets, some integrated appliances, ample worktop space, spotlights to the ceiling and views looking over the garden. To the first floor is a spacious landing providing access to the three bedrooms and family bathroom. On the the second floor you can find the loft bedroom enjoying plenty of light coming from the three sky lights, an en-suite bathroom and eaves storage.

Outside

To the front of the house there is off street parking via own drive and large side access leading to the garage. There is a garage to the rear and pleasant south-facing garden, mainly laid to lawn with a patio area closest to the house.

Description

The rear garden has a large patio surface perfect for entertaining, an area laid to lawn, at the rear has beautiful matured shrubs, flowers and trees.

Outside

The property is within walking distance to local shops, great schools, local bus routes and a short bus ride to West Drayton Town Centre.

address: Woodchester Court, 36 Rickmansworth Road, Northwood, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
Stunning, two bedroom apartment with private garden.

Description

Built in 2019, this beautifully presented ground floor two bedroom apartment with a South facing garden and secure undercroft parking is conveniently located within a sought after development just 0.5 miles from Northwood station and town centre.

The property is accessed through an inviting and well maintained communal hallway which leads in turn to the front door. The spacious entrance hall provides access to all the rooms. There is a large open plan kitchen/dining/sitting room in excess of 27 feet in length with views and access to the private garden and communal gardens beyond. The high specification kitchen is a real feature with plenty of base and cupboard units and attractive stone work surfaces with matching upstand. Appliances are by Siemens and include an oven, microwave and hob. The kitchen is complete with an integrated fridge/freezer, dishwasher and wine cooler.

Bedroom one is a spacious double room with floor to ceiling windows and doors with direct access to the private patio area. This bedroom has fitted wardrobes with plenty of storage.

The second bedroom is currently used as a study but could be changed to a spacious second double bedroom if desired. It has a built in cupboard and again benefits from views over the gardens.

The family bathroom has a light and contemporary finish with mostly tiled floors and walls. Sanitary-ware is by Roca and includes a WC, basin and bath/shower. The apartment is complete with a large and useful storage/utility cupboard located off the hallway with plumbing to house a washing machine/dryer.

To the front, the sunny private garden is a real asset. This is accessed from both the living room and the principal bedroom with low maintenance flagstone paving and a variety of shrubs and small trees providing a large amount of privacy and seclusion. It is has a sunny South facing aspect and views to the beautifully maintained communal gardens beyond.

To the rear of the development are additional professionally landscaped communal gardens that include a combination of artificial grass, lawn grass and flagstone patio bordering the development. There is gated undercroft parking with one allocated space for the apartment and a car charging facility within the parking area.

Square Footage: 728 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 148 years remaining

Chain free. Positioned on a quiet, residential lane within Northwood is this delightful three bedroom detached house. Occupying a discreet position, moments from Highfield Crescent's open space and overlooking Northwood Golf Course this cleverly designed home is set over two spacious floors.

Directions

From our Pinner office, turn right onto Bridge Street and continue to Elm Park Road. At the traffic lights, turn left onto Pinner Road and proceed to the roundabout. At the roundabout, take the second exit and proceed onto Rickmansworth Road. Take a left onto Hills Lane and the property is located a short distance down on the left hand side.

Situation

Description

Positioned on a quiet, residential lane within Northwood is this delightful three bedroom detached house. Occupying a discreet position, moments from Highfield Crescent's open space and overlooking Northwood Golf Course this cleverly designed home is set over two spacious floors. Upon entering the residence, you are immediately greeted by a light-filled, triple-aspect, 18ft living room. With an open-plan them throughout, the lounge seamlessly flows into the kitchen. The kitchen itself benefits from an excellent range of storage, worktop space and a selection of high quality integrated appliances and provides ample room for a large dining table and chairs. The ground floor is completed by a 6ft conservatory overlooking the garden, a utility and useful downstairs shower room. Offering a lifestyle of undeniable charm and possibility with scope to personalise and update to own taste, this opportunity is not to be missed.

Outside

A superb, modern two bedroom luxury apartment located on the second floor of the ever popular Kings Lodge building in the heart of Ruislip, providing a fabulous home for professionals, first time buyers, commuters or investors looking to add to their portfolio.

A secure communal entrance at ground level provides lift and stair access to the upper floors. The apartment comprises an entrance hallway with generous built-in storage cupboards, a spacious open plan living room-diner with electric feature fireplace, attractive hardwood flooring and doors to the Juliette balcony. A new fully fitted kitchen features contemporary wall and base units, integrated appliances and hardwood flooring. There are two double bedrooms with an en-suite shower room off the main bedroom and a three-piece family shower room. Residents also have the added benefit of the communal roof terrace, on-site gym access, concierge service and secure gated parking.

The property is located within walking distance of Ruislip High Street’s wide range of shopping, leisure and transport facilities including Ruislip Underground Station with its Piccadilly and Metropolitan Line services leading into the heart of London and beyond. If you require either the Central or Chiltern Lines, West Ruislip Station is a short drive or bus ride away too. The property is close to Waitrose, Wood Lane Medical Centre, various local parks, several sought after schools and is a short drive to Ruislip Woods and Lido.

detailedDescription:
A two-bedroom, first floor apartment benefiting from well-maintained communal gardens and two parking spaces, perfect for first time buyers or investors alike.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hall with two useful storage cupboards, a bright and welcoming reception room, one double bedroom, a large single bedroom, a kitchen and a fresh family bathroom. Externally the property has access to well-maintained communal grounds and two parking spaces.

Rabournmead Drive is situated off Field End Road just a short distance from the local amenities and transport facilities of South Ruislip and Northolt. For the commuter, the Central Line services are available at Northolt Station, with the Chiltern Line accessible at South Ruislip. The property is also within close proximity to a number of schools as well as Northolt Leisure Centre and local playing fields.

detailedDescription:
A well presented and spacious two double bedroom second floor apartment available to purchase in a highly popular purpose built Development with no onward chain.

The property comprises: Entrance hall, lounge area, kitchen with dining area, two generous sized bedrooms and a family bathroom. The property also comes with the added benefit of a garage and is surrounded by well-maintained grounds.

These properties can be ideal Buy to Let purchases or equally as popular for first-time buyers too.

Available with no onward chain.

Committed Buyer is a new, innovative and pioneering process for buying and selling property. It significantly reduces the risk of gazumping or double-selling by offering security to both parties by gaining a commitment from both parties to buy and sell as agreed.

This property is offered for sale using the Committed Buyer process. When an offer is accepted, the buyer will be required to pay a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £6600 including VAT (in addition to the final negotiated selling price), sign the Reservation Form and agree the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. If you require a copy of these documents, or for further information, please contact the Committed Buyer team on . This will secure the transaction and the property will be taken off the market.

detailedDescription:
A four bedroom end terraced house that has been modernised and updated creating a lovely family home on a popular residential cul-de-sac in Hillingdon close to a variety of amenities. To the ground floor the property benefits from a hallway, 14ft living room and modern 16ft kitchen. To the first floor there is a 12ft second bedroom, 15ft third bedroom and modern family bathroom. To the second floor there is a 14ft master bedroom with en-suite shower room and 11ft fourth bedroom. Outside there is off street parking, rear garden and 15ft garden office.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill, proceed left, at the traffic lights turn right onto Harlington Road, continue down over the two mini roundabouts then at the West Drayton Road traffic lights turn left onto West Drayton Road. Take the second right onto Corwell Lane and then take your first left onto Titmus Close.

Situation

Titmus Close is a quiet residential road situated in Hillingdon which is conveniently located for local shops, schools and within easy reach of Uxbridge Town Centre with its variety of shops, restaurants, bus links and Metropolitan/Piccadilly train station. Heathrow airport, Stockley Park, Brunel University, Hillingdon Hospital and the M4 with its links to London and the Home Counties are a short drive away.

Description

A generously proportioned four bedroom end terraced house that is situated on a popular cul-de-sac in Hillingdon close to shops, schools and bus/road links that has been fully modernised throughout creating a fantastic family home. The ground floor the property benefits from a hallway, 14ft living room and modern 16ft kitchen. To the first floor there is a 12ft second bedroom, 15ft third bedroom and modern family bathroom. To the second floor there is a 14ft master bedroom with en-suite shower room and 11ft fourth bedroom.

Outside

The front of the property, the driveway has been block paved providing off-street parking for three cars and side access to the rear garden. The private rear garden has been mainly paved throughout for low maintenance with a central artificial lawn area in the middle of the garden and a 15ft garden office.

detailedDescription:
Orchard Property Services are proud to market this impressively designed and extended three double bedroom, two bathroom rarely available semi-detached family home situated on the desirable Sussex Road, moments away from local sought after schools including Glebe Primary. Boasting key features including a double storey rear and loft extensions, Sussex Road is immaculately presented throughout and offers kitchen diner to the rear with W.C to the ground floor, a study room which could be utilised as a fourth bedroom, spacious walk in wardrobe and an en-suite to the loft room. Ideally located a short distance from both Ickenham & West Ruislip stations, Sussex Road would benefit all types of purchasers looking for the complete home, we would recommend an internal inspection.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall with W.C leading on to a an open and spacious lounge with family room area and feature wood log burner, the ground floor is complete with a bright and airy kitchen diner with views across the garden. The first floor boasts a large bedroom across the rear of the property with walk in wardrobe, a further double bedroom, family four piece bathroom suite and a study room which could be utilised as a single fourth bedroom, the top floor benefits from a double aspect bedroom with scenic views over the back fields and an ensuite shower room. Outside consists of off street parking and a shared drive which leads down to a garage and pedestrian side access opening on to a spacious and secluded rear garden with patio area, lawn, timber shed and pond area.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham's most prestigious areas, Sussex Road is only moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners and Breakspear, walking distance to the scenic views of Swakeleys Park, Swakeleys Tennis Club and Swakeleys House. Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

Ruislip Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station with its links to Baker Street and The City is located within a couple of minutes walk away.

A one bedroom top floor retirement apartment offering the ideal lifestyle for any potential purchaser looking to downsize and retreat to this conveniently positioned accommodation in the heart of Ruislip. First time / rental investment opportunity : Priced to sell this first floor studio apartment is situated in a popular residential location within easy walking distance of local shops, Packet Boat Marina and the High Road in Cowley with bus routes to both Uxbridge town centre and Tube and West Drayton station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022)

Located on a modern canal side development, this property is well presented and features a fitted kitchen with hob, oven and extractor, fitted bathroom with electric shower and a spacious living area with built in storage cupboards / wardrobes.

Available with no upper chain and ideal for the first time or investment buyer with other benefits to include entryphone system, double glazed windows, Economy 7 heating and residents allocated parking.

Viewing Highly Recommended.

Ground Floor

Entrance

Communal entrance hall with entryphone system and stairs to upper floors

First Floor

Hall

Laminate flooring, entryphone handset and night storage heater.

Studio Area

15' 8'' x 11' 1'' (4.8m x 3.4m) Fitted carpet, night storage heater. Triple glazed window to rear aspect.

Kitchen

8' 6'' x 6' 2'' (2.6m x 1.9m) Ceramic tiled flooring. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, extractor fan hood, electric oven, electric hob, space for fridge, plumbing for washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to rear aspect.

Bathroom

Ceramic tiled flooring, extractor fan and wall mounted electric fan heater. Three-piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed bath with electric shower and screen, pedestal hand basin, low level W.C. And part tiled walls and splashbacks.

Exterior

Outside

Well kept communal gardens and residents allocated parking.

Tenure

Leasehold: 99 years from 16th May 2011 although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

Service Charge: Approximately £105.68 per calendar month to include buildings insurance although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact charges levied.

Ground Rent: £200 per annum (to be confirmed by Vendors solicitor)

About Cowley

Cowley is a village contiguous with the town of Uxbridge in the London Borough of Hillingdon. A largely suburban village with 16 listed buildings, Cowley is within 1 mile of West Drayton station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022) and is bordered to the west by the River Colne and Yiewsley/West Drayton to the south.

St. Laurence Church was in recorded as in the parish of Cowley in the 1086 Domesday Book along with the parish land owned by Westminster Abbey. Historically, in the west, along the main road between Uxbridge and West Drayton, and mostly to the north of the Iver Lane turning, lay the village formerly known as Cowley Street.

The property has a driveway providing ample off road parking, a fully tiled garage for great secured storage and additionally there is a patio area and a metal shed/outbuilding.

Dale Close is situated off Pinner Road, within easy reach of local shops, bars, restaurants and the London Underground Station. This property is located in catchment area for some outstanding schools (Pinnerwood, Haydon, Northwood school as well as private schools).
This property caters for a family in any situation and also offers great scope of extension (STPP).
Viewing advised to avoid disappointment.

Alternatively for the motorist the A40/Western Avenue is just a short drive away providing easy and direct access into Central London and the Home Counties.

address: Heath House, Milton Road, Ickenham UB10
detailedDescription:
Coopers are delighted to market this one bedroom apartment set within Heath House, a sought after location, close to Ickenham High Street shops, transport and amenities. A popular location provide a perfect package for a first homebuyer or downsizer.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn left. Take the next left turning onto Ivy House Road and proceed to the end of the road. Proceed to the end of the road and Heath House is directly in front of you.

Situation

Milton Road is a peaceful tree lined residential road in Ickenham. Located in close proximity to Ickenham High Street which offers a superb range of fashionable shops, cafes and restaurants whilst pleasant open parkland space is only a short stroll away. Ickenham station (Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines) is a short walk away providing reliable links into the City and West End. Alternatively West Ruislip station is serviced by both tube (Central line) and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London and the Home Counties. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including Breakspear and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Uxbridge Golf Club, Ruislip Bowls Club and Riverside Health and Raquets Club.

Description

Heath House is a listed building built in the 1920's that is nestled in a quiet and leafy location in Ickenham Village. It is full of character and displays symmetrical gables, a pavilion type veranda with wood cladding and attractive dormers which add to its grandeur. This apartment in this one off building and would be a great first home or lucrative investment. On entering the property you are greeted with the entrance hall and bedroom located to the left. The bathroom is located to the right and to the end of the hall is access into the spacious living room, offering an abundance of light and character. From the living room is access to the kitchen, again offering excess light and plenty of storage.

Outside

Heath House is in a picturesque setting within Ickenham Village Conservation Area and offers a tranquil communal garden surrounding the property.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market in a fantastic condition, this two bedroom semi detached bungalow has recently been renovated to offer buyers a warm and fresh home ready to move straight into. The property is located on the borders of Eastcote and Ruislip Manor, offering easy access to the local shops, schools and transport links. A viewing of the charming adobe is recommended as soon as possible.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office, turn left on Victoria Road and continue straight over both roundabouts. After the second roundabout take the second turning on the left which takes you into Whitby Road. The property is situated half way down on the right hand side.

Situation

Whitby Road is a residential road enjoying its setting close to parks and local amenities at Ruislip Manor, South Ruislip and Eastcote. Located in close proximity to a number of local schools including St Swithun Wells, Sacred Heart, Newnham, Field End Primary and Queensmead and Bishop Ramsey Secondary Schools. Within easy reach of a number of tube stations offering access to the City and West End on the Metropolitan/Piccadilly and Central lines. For the motorist the A40/M25 and its access into London and the Home Counties is a short drive away.

Description

This charming semi detached bungalow has been renovated in recent years to offer buyers a sleek and stylish home, ready to move straight into. The bungalow starts with a welcoming hallway, offering access to all of the properties accommodation. The living space to the back of the property has been opened up to offer a seating area and dining area with views of the secluded garden. Ideal for those that love to entertain. The room benefits from beautiful wood flooring and a feature fireplace. The living room opens onto the kitchen which offers a range of base and wall units, worktops and space for integrated appliances. The bungalow offers two bedrooms, with the master bedroom to the front of the home boasting a large bay window that floods the room with light. The family bathroom which has underfloor heating is complete with a shower cubicle and bathtub, and finished in stylish white and grey tiles.

Outside

The front of the is wonderful home offers off street parking for multiple vehicles on the driveway. A brick pathway leads up to the front door, with fencing and bedding to the left hand side. A shared drive to the side of the property leads to the rear of the bungalow. The rear garden is secluded and boasts fencing, a large lawned area and block paving for a patio area, ideal for alfresco dining. The garage has been split to offer storage and a utility room with separate access including added worktop space and storage.

detailedDescription:
Summary

For Sale By Online Auction. Starting Bid 250,000. Terms and conditions apply.

Living Room

Double aspect room, wood flooring, radiator, ceiling light, two double glazed windows overlooking front and side.

Kitchen

Matching range wall and base cabinets comprised of built in electric oven with four ring gas hob and extractor fan over, stainless steel sink unit, space for fridge freezer, space for washing machine, ceiling lights and double glazed window.

Bedroom One

Wood flooring, radiator, ceiling light, built in wardrobe, double glazed window.

Bedroom Two

Wood flooring, ceiling light, radiator and double glazed window.

Bathroom

Suite comprised of paneled bath, w/c with low level flush, wash hand basin, tiled flooring, part tiled walls, ceiling light.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

detailedDescription:
Excellently secluded, amazing potential and boasting a lovely family feel this three bedroom detached property provides comfortable living and is perfectly positioned to local amenities at both Ruislip and Ruislip Manor.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High street turn right and then take the first left down Brickwall Lane, the property is a short walk on the right hand side.

Situation

Brickwall Lane is merely footsteps from the bustling High Street of Ruislip where a vast number of shops, restaurants and transports links can be found including Waitrose, Tesco Express, numerous pizza outlets and coffee bars. For the motorist, there are excellent connections to central London via the M25 and the M40. Commuters are well suited with five London Underground stations in the area. Ruislip Station is at the end of the High Street and provides the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines. Other nearby stations include West Ruislip, serviced by both tube and train lines into Marylebone Station in just 25 minutes, with regular trains every 15 minutes. For families, there are a number of highly regarded schools that cater for children of all ages within close proximity including bwi, Whiteheath, Sacred Heart and Bishop Ramsey. Ruislip Woods, Highgrove and Ruislip Bowls club are all also nearby.

Description

Presenting this impressive three bedroom detached residence offered with no upper chain. With a choice of generous living areas, this home will impress those seeking space, scope to enhance as well as a convenient address. Upon entering the home, you are immediately greeted by a spacious hallway with doors leading to all ground floor rooms. To the front, a spacious, light-filled living room with feature bay window. Heading towards the rear, you will find a good sized kitchen with fitted wooden units and a single door providing access to the east-facing rear garden. Completing the ground floor is a separate dining room which enjoys superb views of the garden. Stairs rise to the first floor where a spacious landing provides access to three spacious double bedrooms. Take advantage of this wonderful opportunity to create your dream home in this ideal location, set on a quiet residential road only moments to all amenities.

Outside

The front of the property offers a wealth of off street parking with a long driveway. The rear L shaped garden offers plenty of potential to further enhance this commanding property.

detailedDescription:
An exclusive one bedroom retirement flat on the impressive Heritage Place situated in Ickenham Village. Developed by the awarding winning McCarthy and Stone the homes have been meticulously designed to offer luxury, convenient and independent living with the peace of mind of access to a 24 hour on site management and care team. This stunning apartment enjoys a modern kitchen benefiting integrated appliances, level access shower room and abundant space throughout the bedroom and living area, you are sure to enjoy a relaxing and comfortable lifestyle with a range of further personal care packages available suit your needs.

Directions

From our Ickenham office proceed right and turn left at the end of the road. Continue straight until you reach the second set of traffic lights. Turn right at these and the entrance is located the first turning on the left.

Situation

Heritage Place, Ickenham offers a stunning selection of age exclusive apartments and have been built and designed to offer convenient, luxury retirement living plus with the choice of living life both independently or with help if needed.
Heritage Place boasts a trendy Club Lounge, which is perfect for meeting friends and enjoying a drink. For the ultimate relax and unwind time there is a wellbeing suite for residents offering nails, hair and spa treatments. There are communal gardens to enjoy and the residents benefit from a guest suite, perfect for when family and friends come to stay. For peace of mind 24-hour emergency calls and video entry is available.
Enjoy a selection of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops on your doorstep whilst the nearby tube stations at both West Ruislip and Ickenham provide swift access into the city and Uxbridge Town Centre.

Description

The apartment itself comprises of a entrance hallway, spacious reception/dining room, a lovely modern kitchen with an integrated fridge freezer and a mid-height oven, one impressive sized bedroom with a built-in wardrobe and a shower room complete with tiled flooring, a heated ladder towel rail, assistance rails by toilet and shower, emergency alarm cord and air filtration system.

Outside

For the ultimate peace of mind there is video door entry to all apartments and a 24 hour emergency call system. There is a mobility scooter store with electric charging facility and on site car parking (subject to availability.)
There are landscaped communal gardens with planting, shrubs, central feature and seating.

detailedDescription:
**show home & marketing suite now open**

**new london help to buy available**

**move in for summer 2021**



Fairview New Homes – NewHayes

A collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments and 3 bedroom duplexes in Hayes, UB3.

Plot 11

Plot 11 is a stylish and modern two bedroom, two bathroom, first floor apartment with a private balcony. Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes features landscaped gardens and family-friendly woodland areas and a choice of open green spaces. It comes complete with an open-plan living area and a fully-fitted kitchen with integrated appliances.

Dimensions (Metric)

Kitchen/Living/Dining

5.93m x 3.99m

Master Bedroom

5.86m x 3.25m

Second Bedroom

3.99m x 3.09m

Total floor area

70.5 sq m

Total outside area

7.7 sq m

North facing balcony

The Area

Being able to escape to a choice of open green spaces is what makes NewHayes
a unique place to live. Here youll find a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens with social and quiet areas to a family-friendly woodland area, with plenty of space to play in. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green
oasis for the whole community to enjoy.

Travel Options

Hayes & Harlington Station is just an 8 minute walk away, meaning you can be at London Paddington in 29 minutes. By car, you can be on the M4 in as little as 4 minutes, while quick journeys to Heathrow Airport bring the whole world closer.

Lifestyle

You’ll quickly discover that Hayes offers more than just a new address. Just a short distance away are supermarkets, high street shops, cafes and bars. Plus there are a number of gyms and The Beck theatre is just over a mile away.

For families, there are Ofsted-rated schools for all ages and if you want to step away to somewhere more tranquil, enjoying outdoor space is simple too. Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. Other open spaces within a short drive of NewHayes include Northala Fields, Lake Farm Country Park and Kew Gardens, which is just a 17 minute drive. Plus, the Grand Union Canal is nearby for whenever you want a waterside walk.

The future of Hayes

Hayes & Harlington Station which currently operates Great Western services and is only an 8 minute walk away from NewHayes, will benefit from major improvements in preparation for the new Elizabeth line services.

Once complete, Crossrail will run from Reading in the West to Shenfield in the East and bring journey times for NewHayes residents to a multitude of central London locations down significantly.

Computer generated images depict the interior and exterior at NewHayes and are indicative only. *Travel times sourced from TfL and Google Maps. Your home may be repossessed if you do not keep up repayments on your mortgage or any other debt secured on it. *Terms and conditions apply, please refer to the Fairview New Homes website or speak to a Sales Advisor for full details. Details and prices are correct as of March 2021. Journey times approximate. *Source: National Rail. Source: Google Maps.

Specification

General
  • Amtico Spacia ‘Sun Bleached Oak’ flooring to kitchen/living/dining area and hall
  • Standard hanging pendant to living/dining area, hallway and bedrooms
  • Walls painted in Timeless white and ceilings in white
  • Premium painted doors with polished chrome/satin finish handles
  • Usb charging points in kitchen/living area and all bedrooms
  • Audio video phone handset
  • TV/FM/Sat/Telephone socket to living area with playback connection to master bedroom
  • External balcony/terrace wall mounted stainless steel light fitting (where applicable)
  • Smoke and heat detectors fitted
  • Fully landscaped podium level amenity levels (all secure and only accessible to residents)
  • Extensive character landscaped areas throughout the site
  • A mix of secure under-croft and on-street designated car parking
  • Secure cycle storage
Modern Kitchens
  • Gloss grey handleless wall and base units
  • Soft close doors and drawers
  • Quartz ‘Salt & Pepper‘ worktops
  • Wall units in hob area fitted with surface mounted lights
  • Integrated Zanussi stainless steel electric oven, black frameless induction hob and combi microwave
  • Smeg integrated canopy cooker hood
  • Integrated Zanussi fridge/freezer
  • Integrated Zanussi 450 or 600 dishwasher
  • Free-standing Zanussi washer dryer
  • White downlights with white light LED bulbs
  • Amtico Spacia ‘Sun Bleached Oak‘ flooring to open plan kitchen/living/dining area
  • Separate kitchen, floor tiled – Boulevard Grey
Beautiful Bathrooms

• White sanitaryware by Ideal Standard with chrome finish fittings

• Full height tiling around bath and shower enclosures‡

• Future Stone white porcelain wall tiling and flooring in bathrooms and ensuites (where applicable)

• White downlights with white light LED bulbs

• Chrome heated towel rail

• Shaver socket

Relaxing Bedrooms

• Fitted ‘New Dublin Twist’ grey carpets

• Secondary telephone socket to master bedroom

• TV socket to master bedroom

About Newhayes

A well-connected place to call home

Located at the heart of this vibrant and up-and-coming area of West London, NewHayes is an exciting new development. With a brand new selection of modern, well-designed studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments, including wheelchair accessible apartments and parking. Youll easily find the one youll want to come home to.

Close by are a good range of amenities, Minet Country Park is just a 7 minute drive, with ponds, picnic areas, the River Crane, playgrounds and the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit, all of which makes this a popular place with families and cyclists. For commuters, Hayes & Harlington Station is within an 8 minute walk for journeys to Heathrow Airport (Terminals 2 & 3) in 6 minutes, Ealing Broadway in 9 minutes and London Paddington in 21 minutes.

With much regeneration in Hayes, including an entertainment and leisure complex, our new development offers buyers a home in a well-connected part of West London.

  • Something for everyone with supermarkets, high street shops, cafs and bars within walking distance. There are also a number of gyms if you want to keep fit and healthy, and for live music or comedy fans, The Beck Theatre is just over a mile away.
  • Getting around the Capital and beyond perfect for commuters, you can easily reach Hayes & Harlington Station within an 8 minute walk for journeys to London Paddington in 21 minutes and Heathrow airport is just a 26 minute walk or bus journey.
  • Relax into a new way of life – a number of distinctive areas to enjoy, from lush green podium gardens to a family-friendly woodland area. There is also Chalfont Square, an open public space at the heart of the development that offers a green oasis for the whole community to enjoy.
  • Education for all ages just a short distance away is a range of Ofsted-rated schools, all offering good levels of education for children of all ages.

The modern fitted kitchen flows effortlessly from the dining room, has an array of wall and base units, ample work surfaces and integral appliances. To the first floor are three inviting bedrooms. The master bedroom and second bedroom are doubles both benefitting from fitted wardrobes. The third bedroom being a single. detailedDescription:
Situated within a prestigious gated development, 8 beautifully crafted 2 and 3 bedroom luxury apartments built by renowned local developers Gavacan Homes.

Description

Each apartment is built to a luxurious specification with contemporary kitchens and utility rooms. Underfloor heating, high security doors to apartment entrance and video entry systems. detailedDescription:
Occupying a landmark corner of Randalls, Charleston House features a collection of well planned, spacious 1 & 2 bedroom apartments, each benefitting from the inclusion of a balcony or terrace accessed from the kitchen/living area.

Description

Each new apartment at Randalls has been designed to offer the best of contemporary living, reflecting Inland Homes’ ethos of excellence and intelligent design. Kitchens are thoughtfully appointed with a comprehensive range of integrated appliances,
bathrooms are luxuriously equipped and living spaces are relaxing havens of calm.

Internal Features

Interiors feature, Underfloor heating throughout, contemporary white ladder doors with chrome ironmongery, skirting boards and architraves in white, Internal walls and ceilings finished in smooth white emulsion, downlighters to hall, kitchen, bathroom and en-suite.
Kitchens come complete with contemporary handleless units, slimline quartz worktops with matching upstand & splashback, stainless steel sink and Hansgrohe chrome mixer tap, polished chrome sockets and switches, stainless steel oven, induction hob and integrated extractor hood, integrated appliances to include 70/30 fridge freezer and dishwasher, Microwave (subject to kitchen layout) a washer/dryer will be provided to the hall cupboard.
Bathrooms feature contemporary white sanitary ware with chrome accessories, vanity units under sink to bathroom, fully recessed mirrors to bathroom and en-suite, concealed cistern with soft close seat and chrome push plate, quartz shelves, panelled bath with thermostatic bath tap and full height shower riser over bath, clear glass shower screens to baths, shower cubicle with thermostatic shower and clear glass shower to en suite, full height Porcelanosa will tiling around bath (bathrooms) and
shower cubicle (en suites), Porcelanosa floor tiles to bathroom and en suite, shaver point to bathroom and en suite, chrome ladder style towel rail to bathroom and en suite

Peace Of Mind

10 Year labc warranty. Each home will be independently surveyed during the construction process and a certificate will be issued on completion of the home. Inland Homes will provide a 2 year Customer Service Guarantee on completion of your new home.

Outside

Secure gated development, central courtyard, video entry phone.

Location

Today, Uxbridge has become a desirable destination for modern living with a lively town centre vibe complemented by tranquil award-winning green open spaces and the waterways of the Grand Union Canal. Your new apartment at Randalls will put you within just a few steps of everything Uxbridge has to offer. Intu shopping centre plays host to a plethora of high street names including Debenhams, H&M, Superdry and Waterstones and you’ll also find a multiscreen Odeon here too.
In Windsor Street, part of the Conservation Area, historic buildings are home to a variety of independent retailers. There’s an amazing choice of restaurants in Uxbridge with tastes to suit all palates from all corners of the globe, in addition to coffee shops, pubs and bars. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of town centre living you’ll find green space on your doorstep at Fassnidge Park, winner of the coveted Green Flag Award regularly since 2005. Designed by the same architect responsible for the art deco Randalls building, Fassnidge Park covers 4 acres and was opened in 1926. Today, this tranquil spot is a pleasant retreat and home to a bowling green, tennis courts and the popular Rusty Bike Café.
One of the great advantages to life in Uxbridge is connectivity.

Underground services operate via either Metropolitan or Piccadilly lines to the heart of the capital, with Baker Street accessible within as little as 39 minutes, while sport and music lovers will appreciate services to Wembley with a travel of time of around 25 minutes. The nearest Crossrail station is nearby West Drayton, where forthcoming services will get you to Tottenham Court Road in 25 minutes and Canary Wharf in 38 minutes. For wider world connections, Heathrow is just 6.5 miles away and is
served by bus services from right outside your door on Vine Street.

detailedDescription:
Move Inn Estates presents to market this immaculate three bedroom semi–detached family home situated on a sought-after road in West Drayton.

The ground floor benefits from a storm porch, two spacious reception rooms and a modern fitted kitchen. Additional to the ground floor a conservatory can be found.

The first floor comprises of three spacious bedrooms and a four-piece family bathroom suite.

Externally a driveway for two cars can be found with. The rear of the property consists of a low maintenance rear garden with a sizeable newly constructed outbuilding which has been converted into a studio.

This property has potential to extend (sttp). The property also benefits from a shared alleyway.

Vine Close is situated a short walk from transport links and local amenities. The town centre of West Drayton with mainline railway station which will benefit from Crossrail, town centre of Uxbridge, Stockley Business Park, the motorway network and London Heathrow Airport are all within easy motoring reach.

To admire this home in its greatest light, book in a viewing today.

detailedDescription:
This ground floor maisonette is being sold with no onward chain and is ready to move straight in making an ideal purchase for first time buyers, those looking to down size or a landlord looking to add to their portfolio.

The accommodation comprises of an entrance hall, a lounge, two good sized bedrooms, a family bathroom, and a separate fitted kitchen. Outside, there is a private low maintenance garden to the front and rear garden that is ideal for those summer barbecues and for children to play.

Bury Avenue is situated off of Charville Lane in Hayes and is within walking distance to bus links and schools. In addition Hayes and Harlington Station is a short drive away and with Crossrail due to arrive in the very near future there are excellent rail connections to Paddington, Reading and beyond. Uxbridge town centre with its comprehensive collection of shops, restaurants and transport links is also close by.

Property Description

Being Sold by Purplebricks Online Auction

Starting Bids from £260,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

Purple Bricks Online Auctions is a new, innovative, and pioneering platform for buying and selling property. It provides all the benefits synonymous with traditional auctions, including: Speed and certainty of sale, transparency and zero risk of gazumping or double-selling but with the added advantage of being able to bid pressure-free from the comfort of your own home or office via desktop, tablet or mobile phone. Purplebricks also offer a Buy-it-Now feature which allows you to place an offer and purchase before the Auction end date.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will be required to exchange contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer but will be given 28 days in which to complete the transaction.

The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Contract for exchange on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £5,154 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £600 including VAT, a total of £5,754. 10% of the purchase price will need to be paid in way of a part payment deposit which contributes towards your purchase price. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
Development

High Point Village has been created to meet the needs of 21st Century living, an urban village by the Grand Union Canal - Hayes. The development sets standards for style and quality in urban living with advanced ergonomics and generous space maximising green and open space. It features four interconnected landscaped gardens with raised lawns, a water feature and places to relax, a public square for events, retail and out-door dining, play area for children and canal side walkway. With fine points including a 24hr concierge and gymnasium with swimming pool and dance studio. The apartments itself have the best of contemporary finishes and versatile layouts.

Apartment Specification

• Generous open plan kitchens with integrated appliances.
• Luxury bathrooms.
• Built in wardrobes in bedrooms.
• High quality carpet in bedrooms.
• Wood flooring in living areas.
• Floor to ceiling windows.
• High quality finishes throughout.

Location

High Point Village is situated within the fast-emerging business hub of Hayes. Seamless transport links mean it is equally well-connected to Heathrow Airport, some of the most prosperous business areas, the M4 corridor and Central London. Heathrow Airport can be reached in just 6 minutes via the Heathrow Connect service. London Paddington is only 20 minutes away by rail, where the Crossrail will also operate through Hayes and Harlington station, meaning a direct journey to the West End will take approximately 20 minutes. The High Point Village development is located directly adjacent to Hayes and Harlington Station.

Additional Information

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease: 900 + years
Service Charge: Applicable (tbc)
Ground Rent: Applicable (tbc)
Local Authority: London Borough of Hillingdon

detailedDescription:
Set in a peaceful residential location this fantastic 6 bedroom house offers a open plan reception room, 3 bathrooms, private garden and off-street parking spaces.

Wingfield Way is a peaceful residential street a short distance away from South Ruislip for an excellent array of shops, schooling, parks and of course excellent transport links around the City.
