detailedDescription:
An extended three bedroom detached house that has been modernised and updated creating a lovely family home on a popular residential cul-de-sac close to a variety of amenities that also has the potential to extend (S.T.P). The ground floor of the property comprises of a porch and hallway, 24ft through lounge, 17ft kitchen/diner and downstairs shower room. To the first floor there is a 12ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 11ft second bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 7ft third bedroom and luxury family bathroom. Outside, there is off street parking to the front and rear of the property with side access to the garden and garage.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill, continue to the first set of traffic lights and turn right onto Harlington Road, Southfield Close is the third turning on your left.

Situation

Southfield Close is a sought after residential cul-de-sac located off Harlington Road and just a short walk to Hillingdon Primary School, Bishopshalt senior school, Hillingdon Hospital and Brunel University. There are a number of bus routes close by which provide an easy route into Uxbridge town centre which benefits from a multitude of shops, restaurants, bars and Piccadilly/Metropolitan line train station as well as being a 2 minute walk to the A10 bus route to Stockley Park and Heathrow Airport . The M4/M25 and A40 are a short drive away with their links to central London and The Home Counties.

Description

An extended three bedroom detached house that has been modernised and updated creating a lovely family home on a popular residential cul-de-sac close to a variety of amenities that also has the potential to extend (S.T.P). The ground floor of the property comprises of a porch and hallway, 24ft through lounge, 17ft kitchen/diner and downstairs shower room. To the first floor there is a 12ft master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 11ft second bedroom with fitted wardrobes, 7ft third bedroom and luxury family bathroom.

Outside

The front of the property has been block paved creating off street parking while the rear garden is mainly block paved throughout with a lawn area across the rear of the house . There is side access via a shared driveway that provides access to the brick built 30ft double garage.

detailedDescription:
A stylish one-bedroom contemporary apartment boasting modern interiors throughout, luxury finishes such as boiling water taps and water softeners, wooden flooring throughout and allocated parking.

The accommodation comprises of an entrance hall, an open plan kitchen / reception room boasting a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, one double bedroom with built in storage space and a luxury bathroom.

Rotary House is situated in a popular part of Ruislip just moments from the local amenities of Ruislip High Street which is easily accessible via the H13 Bus. For the commuter, the Metropolitan and Piccadilly line are both available at Ruislip Station and offer regular connections into Baker Street and the City. Ruislip Lido and Ruislip Woods are only a stone’s throw away, perfect for leisurely walks.

address: Plot 97, The Dice, St Andrew's Park, Uxbridge UB10
detailedDescription:
**show apartment available to view, by appointment only** Part of contemporary Dice development that is adjacent to the 37 acre Dowding Park and within walking distance of uxbridge town centre. Plot 97 is a ground floor studio apartment built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings. Please call Coopers for more information.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 37 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge's town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Specification

- Full height doors and windows
- Contemporary Ideal and Tesino fixtures to bathrooms and ensuites
- Bosch stainless steel appliances
- Oak veneer full height apartment entrance doors
- Oak veneer internal doors
- Chrome heated towel rails in bathrooms and ensuites
- Modern kitchens with handle-less doors and solid silestone worktops
- All homes designed to Lifetime Homes Standards
- Parking space provided

detailedDescription: This well maintained five bedroom extended semi detached home offers spacious, light-filled accommodation throughout, ideal for family living and entertaining and boasts a spacious apartment to the side, situated in close proximity to South Ruislip Station which operates both Central Line and National Rail services into London in under thirty minutes.The accommodation comprises a spacious 24’ reception room which leads into a spacious kitchen/dining room with fitted walls and base units, run of worktops and space for appliances leading into a bright and airy dining room.The ground floor benefits a four piece family bathroom and separate WC.The ground floor left hand side of the property has been cleverly designed perfectly as a one bedroom apartment with planning the first floor there are three bedrooms and family the second floor are two further bedrooms and a shower room.The rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with patio area and to the front off street parking.

detailedDescription:
A ground floor studio apartment that would make an ideal home for for first time buyers, downsizers or as an investment opportunity. The accommodation boasts a fantastic location being central to local train stations, shops and transport links. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a spacious studio room with a separate kitchen and family bathroom.

Directions

From our office in Ickenham proceed right and at the end of Swakeleys Road turn left onto Ickenham High Road and take your second left into Oak Avenue and Hightrees is located immediately on the right.

Situation

High trees is set on Oak Avenue which is a quiet residential road where flats rarely come to the market. The property is a short stroll to the village shops, restaurants and Ickenham station (Metropolitan / Piccadilly line) or West Ruislip (Central/br) train stations with direct links to The City and Baker Street. For the motorist, London and the Home Counties are easily accessed via the A40/M25. A number of highly regarded schools are within close proximity including Breakspear Juniors and Vyners Senior School, along with a number of leisure facilities including Ruislip Golf Club, Ickenham Cricket Club and Riverside Health Club which has a modern gym, tennis and squash courts and swimming pool only a short drive away.

Description

A ground floor studio apartment that would make an ideal home for for first time buyers, downsizers or as an investment opportunity. The accommodation boasts a fantastic location being central to local train stations, shops and transport links. Accessed via a well maintained communal entrance, the property offers a spacious studio room with a separate kitchen and family bathroom.

Outdoors

Well-maintained communal gardens and one allocated parking space.

detailedDescription:
High Point Village has been created to meet the needs of 21st Century living, an urban village by the Grand Union Canal - Hayes. The development sets standards for style and quality in urban living with advanced ergonomics and generous space maximising green and open features four interconnected landscaped gardens with raised lawns, a water feature and places to relax, a public square for events, retail and out-door dining, play area for children and canal side walkway. With fine points including a 24hr concierge and gymnasium with swimming pool and dance studio. The apartments itself have the best of contemporary finishes and versatile layouts.

Apartment Specification
• Generous open plan kitchens with integrated appliances.
• Luxury bathrooms.
• Built in wardrobes in bedrooms.
• High quality carpet in bedrooms.
• Wood flooring in living areas.
• Floor to ceiling windows.
• High quality finishes throughout.
• River view apartment

Location
High Point Village is situated within the fast-emerging business hub of Hayes. Seamless transport links mean it is equally well-connected to Heathrow Airport, some of the most prosperous business areas, the M4 corridor and Central London. Heathrow Airport can be reached in just 6 minutes via the Heathrow Connect service. London Paddington is only 20 minutes away by rail, where the Crossrail will also operate through Hayes and Harlington station, expected 2018 meaning a direct journey to the West End will take approximately 20 minutes. The High Point Village development is located directly adjacent to Hayes and Harlington Station.

detailedDescription:
Help to buy available


Just two minutes' walk from zone 5 hayes and harlington train station

A one-bedroom apartment with a private balcony in the exciting new development Bluenote.

Bluenote is a collection of 1,2, and 3 bedroom apartments in Hayes, Greater London.

The West London location means residents are within easy reach of Heathrow Airport, Hayes & Harlington station, as well as the incoming Elizabeth Line taking you into the City and central London with a 20-minute commute. With these convenient transport links, Bluenote Apartments is perfectly positioned to benefit from all elements of London living, from world-class shopping and restaurants to renowned universities and cultural landmarks a short train journey away. Be within walking distance of local hotspots, from restaurants and Beck Hall Theatre, to Barra Hall Park and Botanical Gardens. Residents can also enjoy the local history of Hayes town, with the redevelopment of The Old Vinyl Factory.

In addition to the high specification of design, there is a wealth of residents' amenities including a concierge service, communal gardens, cycle store and some allocated parking.

Register your interest to find your new home at Bluenote Apartments today.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are pleased to present, this spacious and well maintained first floor flat to the market. The property comprises of a spacious living area, a large kitchen with a number of cupboards, a generous bedroom and modern bathroom. This immaculately kept flat also boasts an incredibly long lease of 120 years and an allocated parking space to the front.

Location

Ashwood Avenue can be found just off Colham Green Road, just south of Pield Heath Road and north of Stockley Road. The property has many excellent connections to public transport, parks, shops and supermarkets. An all round ideal location for professionals, landlords and commuters.

Local amenities include; Stockley Park golf course, Brunel University, Heathrow Airport, Stockley Park business centre, Hillingdon Hospital and Uxbridge Town centre, all within a short drive/bus journey. For the motorist, the M4/M25 and M40 are all close by creating easy links to London and The Home Counties. West Drayton high street offers a vibrant choice of supermarkets, shops, banks and more, with a good choice of bus services in operation. Uxbridge town centre/high street offers an even wider choice of shops, entertainment, bars, casual and fine dining restaurants.

Crossrail!
The Crossrail (Elizabeth) Line and will run a fantastic non-stop service to destinations such as Heathrow Airport (8 mins), Bond Street (23 minutes*), Paddington, Canary Wharf, and Liverpool Street just 20 minutes*, 37 minutes* and 31 minutes* respectively, which almost halves their current journey times!
Property along the Crossrail route have already seen huge growth and properties in West Drayton have seen one of the highest growth patterns when compared with other Crossrail sites and are still expected to see further increase when the line becomes fully operational (expected 2021).

Lease Information

Lease Term: 125 years from 2 March 2015 )(120 years remaining).

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A unique one bedroom galleried apartment that offers spacious accommodation throughout and is situated on a sought after gated development in Hillingdon that is one of only a handful that has an extended lease of 182 years. The property benefits from generous storage space, multiple power points, a new boiler with openTherm and Google nest for optimum efficiency (9 year warranty) and a mirrored front window for the privacy. Thd ground floor benefits from a well proportioned living room with a vaulted ceiling and a number of large windows generating a lot of light, and access to the 13ft kitchen. The first floor offers a modern bathroom and a large double bedroom with views over the ground floor and a staircase to a second floor area which is ideal for a home office or dressing area. Outside there is an allocated parking space within the development along with visitor parking located just outside the front gates, along with communal gardens with various seating areas.

Directions

From our office on Hillingdon Hill cross over the road and take the turning opposite onto Royal Lane and Robinwood Grove is the second turning on your right.

Situation

Robinwood Grove is a gated development built in the 1980s situated directly in front of the Hillingdon nature reserve but yet still only a short stroll from Hillingdon Hill and its access to bus/road links, local shops and Hillingdon Golf Course. Uxbridge Town centre is approximately a mile away with its array of shops, restaurants, bars and Metropolitan/Piccadilly line train station with its direct access to Baker Street and the City. The property is conveniently located for Stockley Park, Hillingdon Hospital and Brunel University.

Description

A unique one bedroom galleried apartment that offers spacious accommodation throughout and is situated on a sought after gated development in Hillingdon that is one of only a handful that has an extended lease of 182 years. The property benefits from generous storage space, multiple power points, a new boiler with openTherm and Google nest for optimum efficiency (9 year warranty) and a mirrored front window for the privacy. Thd ground floor benefits from a well proportioned living room with a vaulted ceiling and a number of large windows generating a lot of light, and access to the 13ft kitchen. The first floor offers a modern bathroom and a large double bedroom with views over the ground floor and a staircase to a second floor area which is ideal for a home office or dressing area.

Outside

The property is located within beautifully kept communal grounds with a number of seating areas to relax and enjoy the views of the communal gardens and nature reserve beyond. The apartments are accessed via a well maintained pathway that meanders through the development and is surrounded by a large expanse of lawn, a variety of shrubs, flowers, trees and raised brick built pond. There is an allocated parking space within the development along with visitor parking located just outside the front gates.

detailedDescription:
A luxury modern two bedroom, two bathroom, ground floor apartment that measures in excess of 734sq ft with a generous sized garden. Oak Point Court is a stylish contemporary building that has been architected-designed to maximise its corner setting by Clearview Homes in 2018. A fantastic opportunity for a first time buyer or investor looking for a property in immaculate condition. As you enter the property there is a spacious hallway leading you to all rooms using high quality laminate flooring throughout the property. The open plan lounge, dining and kitchen area provides commodious 22ft area with doors opening onto a private garden, 15ft master bedroom with fitted sliding mirrors wardrobes and en-suite shower room, 11ft second bedroom, family bedroom and large utility room.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left to the second set of traffic lights and turn left onto Long Lane. Take the fifth turning on your right onto Sutton Court Road.

Situation

Oak Point is situated just off Long Lane with its multitude of facilities close at hand. Hillingdon tube station with its Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines offers direct access to Baker Street in approx. 36 minutes and is less than a mile away with buses from close by. Hillingdon’s location just off the A437 means easy access to the M40, M4 and M25 with London Heathrow Airport only six miles away. For everyday convenience, Oak Point excels. Sutton Court Road has a parade of useful shops including a newsagent and pharmacy. There is a library within walking distance, four gp practices and two dentists within about a mile, while Hillingdon Hospital (withA&E) and Uxbridge Town centre with its multitude of bars, restaurants and shopping centres are just over a mile away. There are a number of sought after schools for all ages within walking distance.

Description

A luxury two bedroom, two bathroom, ground floor apartment that measures in excess of 734sq ft with a generous sized garden. Oak Point Court is a stylish contemporary building that has been architected-designed to maximise its corner setting by Clearview Homes in 2018. A fantastic opportunity for a first time buyer or investor looking for a property in immaculate condition. As you enter the property there is a spacious hallway leading you to all rooms using high quality laminate flooring throughout the property. The open plan lounge, dining and kitchen area provides commodious 22ft area with doors opening onto a private garden, 15ft master bedroom with fitted sliding mirrors wardrobes and en-suite shower room, 11ft second bedroom, family bedroom and large utility room.

Outside

There is a communal garden along with an allocated parking space that has direct access from the properties generously sized private garden.

detailedDescription:
An immaculate and stylishly presented first floor one bedroom apartment set within this luxury development. The home is in a highly convenient location in the heart of Eastcote, near to Eastcote Underground Station (Met/Piccadilly Lines) and the extensive shopping facilities at Eastote High Street. The accommodation includes a fitted kitchen, open plan lounge/diner, one double bedroom and a white bathroom suite.

Directions

From our Ruislip Manor office turn left on Victoria Road. At the roundabout turn left into Chelston Road. Continue to the end and turn left onto Field End Road. The property is a short drive on the left hand side.

Situation

Located in close proximity to Eastcote High Street offering trendy eateries, shops and transport. Eastcote tube station (Metropolitan/ Piccadilly) is a short walk away, whilst South Ruislip (Central line/br) station is also a 10 minute drive away. For the motorist the A40/M40 and M25 road links offering easy access to London and the Home Counties. For families, it is in the catchment area for excellent local schools, Newnham and Bishop Ramsey. Highgrove gym and swimming pool are also only 10 minutes walk away.

Description

Ready made for relaxed easy living and superbly convenient, this spacious first floor one bedroom executive apartment has been stylishly designed and immaculately presented throughout, boasting luxury finishes and a fresh, crisp neutral decor. The apartment is a short walk to Eastcote station and High Street. The apartment includes an impressive design with high quality finishes throughout. Briefly the accommodation comprises a hallway, a contemporary open plan lounge/diner with windows that provide lots of natural light and a fitted kitchen which is open plan with the lounge/diner. The kitchen offers a sleek, stylish yet practical space and includes an integrated oven, fridge freezer and dishwasher. Wood flooring runs through the open plan room and there are multiple sockets and television points throughout the accommodation. There is a spacious double bedroom and a modern bathroom fitted with high quality white sanitary ware and with tiled flooring. There are spotlights to the ceiling throughout the kitchen, lounge/diner and also the bathroom. The apartment is ready for immediate occupation. The apartment is all about location and is a fantastic investment opportunity with strong rental returns or a perfect first home.

Outside

To the rear is gated allocated parking, creating piece of mind. The local high street is moments away with zone 5 Eastcote station a stones throw, great for commuters.

detailedDescription:
A well laid out ground floor apartment which is situated on the ever popular Parkwest development and is offered to the market with no further chain. The accommodation on offer is made up of entrance hallway, a 22ft open plan kitchen/living room with French doors that open onto the spacious terrace, there are two well proportioned bedrooms of which the master bedroom has the benefit of an en-suite, lastly there is an addition of a family bathroom suite.

Directions

From West Drayton train station proceed left through West Drayton High Street and take your fourth left into Porters Way. Parkwest will be on your left hand side.

Situation

Burlington House is situated within the highly prized Parkwest development just a short distance from West Drayton High Street with its range of independent shops, various restaurants and local schools. West Drayton train station (Crossrail) can also be found close by as can Stockley Business Park, Brunel University and Heathrow Airport whilst for the motorist the M4 is just a short drive away.

Description

A well laid out ground floor apartment which is situated on the ever popular Parkwest development and is offered to the market with no further chain. The accommodation on offer is made up of entrance hallway, a 22ft open plan kitchen/living room with French doors that open onto the spacious terrace, there are two well proportioned bedrooms of which the master bedroom has the benefit of an en-suite, lastly there is an addition of a family bathroom suite.

Outside

French doors from the living room provide access to the private patioed garden. To the first floor there is a private roof garden that is only accessible for the residents of Burlington House. Park West is the only condominium in West Drayton that offers facilities such as a concierge and gym on the development. There is also a parking space for one car.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located for highly regarded schooling and transport links, this four bedroom, three bathroom family home benefits an open plan kitchen breakfast room, a study and two en suite bedrooms.

The ground floor consits of an entrance hallway, family room, study, downstairs cloakroom, reception, kitchen/breakfast room and a conservatory. The reception through to conservatory enjoys bi-folding doors whilst the open plan kitchen benefits from skylights, integrated appliances and an island breakfast bar. Up to the first floor are three bedrooms, one with a walk in closet and en suite bathroom. A storage room and family bathroom suite complete this floor. The master bedroom is found on the second floor with an en suite as well as access to storage eaves.

Outside to the front of the property is a separate, double garage and off street parking. The rear garden is mostly laid to lawn along with patio area ideal for the warmer months.

Character-enriched interiors with impressive hallmark features, this stunning two double bedroom ground floor maisonette makes a superb choice for anyone seeking convenient low maintenance living, very close to Northwood underground station and high street.

The property is only a short walk from Northwood Town centre and Waitrose Supermarket.

Davidson Gold are very pleased to offer this stunning condition extended three bedroom semi detached house located in the perfect location for families with many schools located within a short walk from the house. The house comprises of large through lounge, a stunning recently fitted very extended modern fitted kitchen with dining area, utility room, downstairs shower room, two double bedrooms, good size single bedroom, large new fitted bathroom, large rear garden with shed and large driveway with off street parking.

Double glazed, gas central heating and wooden flooring throughout. We feel this is a great property with many great features. It gets a lot of natural light, the rooms are spacious and the property has a welcoming feel. Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A two double bedroom, first floor maisonette located in Pinner and set on a peaceful road moments from the high street and local amenities. The property comprises a private entrance leading to two double bedrooms, a lounge, spacious kitchen, bathroom and private balcony.

Directions

From our office in Ruislip High Street, turn left and continue down the high street. At the mini roundabout, turn right onto Eastcote Road and continue all the way to the mini roundabout at the end. Turn left, then at the next mini roundabout turn left again onto Joel Street. Take the fourth left onto Wiltshire Lane and Farmlands is the first right turn.

Situation

Farmlands is conveniently located between Northwood Hills, Eastcote and Ruislip's extensive high streets offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and shopping amenities. The Metropolitan / Piccadilly lines are easily accessible from the property offering swift access into London, as well as many bus routes. Local convenience shops are only a short walk away and The charming village pub 'The Case is Altered' and Eastcote Cricket club are also nearby.

Description

This property offers an exceptional opportunity to enjoy a lifestyle of comfort and convenience in this first floor maisonette. Farmlands is well located to local amenities making it a great choice for first time buyers or as a good investment choice with strong rental returns. The property itself briefly comprises a private entrance on the ground floor leading to the first floor landing area. There is a large living room, fitted kitchen, bathroom and two double bedrooms both of which are spacious.The property further benefits from large loft space for storage as well as a private balcony.

address: Plot 77, The Dice, St Andrew's Park, Uxbridge UB10
detailedDescription:
**show apartment available to view, by appointment only** Part of contemporary Dice development that is adjacent to the 37 acre Dowding Park and within walking distance of uxbridge town centre. Plot 77 is a ground floor studio apartment built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings. Please call Coopers for more information.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 37 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge's town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Specification

- Full height doors and windows
- Contemporary Ideal and Tesino fixtures to bathrooms and ensuites
- Bosch stainless steel appliances
- Oak veneer full height apartment entrance doors
- Oak veneer internal doors
- Chrome heated towel rails in bathrooms and ensuites
- Modern kitchens with handle-less doors and solid silestone worktops
- All homes designed to Lifetime Homes Standards
- Parking space provided

Disclaimer

Some external images are computer generated and the internal images are of other St Modwen Homes developments and do not reflect the actual size of the property.

address: Plot 92 The Dice, St Andrew's Park, Uxbridge UB10
detailedDescription:
This stunning 936 Sq Ft lower ground floor three bedroom apartment is situated in a parkland setting overlooking the 37 acre Dowding Park. The apartment is built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The new state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 40 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge’s town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Specification

- Full height doors and windows
- Contemporary Ideal and Tesino fixtures to bathrooms and ensuites
- Bosch stainless steel appliances
- Oak veneer full height apartment entrance doors
- Oak veneer internal doors
- Chrome heated towel rails in bathrooms and ensuites
- Modern kitchens with handle-less doors and solid silestone worktops
- All homes designed to Lifetime Homes Standards
- Parking space provided

Disclaimer

Some external images are computer generated and the internal images are of other St Modwen Homes developments.

detailedDescription:
Ideally located for the shopping amenities and transport links of both Ruislip Manor and Ruislip Gardens is this three-bedroom terraced family home. Within the catchment area of several excellent school including Ruislip High School.
The property is briefly comprised of an entrance hallway, spacious living room, separate dining room and fitted kitchen on the ground floor. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms both with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom with bath and separate shower cubicle. Externally to the front there is a laid lawn garden with mature bushes and the private garden to the rear has a paved patio ideal for summer entertaining, laid lawn and access to the double garage. There is also access to the garage via a rear service road.
Victoria Road is ideally situated for the Central Line station at Ruislip Gardens and the Metropolitan & Piccadilly Line Station in Ruislip Manor getting commuters into London in less than thirty minutes.

detailedDescription:
Immaculately presented interiors create a haven of light and space in this immaculately presented three bedroom detached house, conveniently located close to South Ruislips shops, schools and Central Line station with national rail connection.

As you enter the property, you are presented with a light and airy spacious porch with storage space, leading to stunning glass doors through to the main reception room. The reception room is freshly presented in crisp neutral tones and boasts wooden flooring which flows into the dining room and links the rooms together. The kitchen which has a range of eye and base level units and a run of worktops with appliances underneath. The ground floor also consists of a WC, ample storage space under the stairs and a conservatory to the side of the property with access from the front and rear.

On the first floor the spacious master bedroom features a run of fitted wardrobes and wood flooring. Bedrooms two and three also feature unique fitted bedroom furniture including, drawers wardrobes and shelving units. The family bathroom is complemented by tiled walls, a white suite and fitted storage cupboards.

Externally the paved driveway leads up to the entrance of the property and provides off street parking for several cars and the rear garden consists of greenery.

Viewings are highly advised for this premium property!

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to own a fantastic one bedroom apartment situated within a quiet residential cul-de-sac in Harefield. This wonderful property would make an ideal starter home for first time buyers or would make a rewarding investment opportunity with it being conveniently located to local amenities and completely ready to move into. The accommodation briefly comprises a spacious lounge, a 8ft fitted kitchen with wooden units and ample worktop space and a large double bedroom with ample space for fitted wardrobes. The property is completed by a fully tiled bathroom.

Directions

From our Ruislip High Street, turn left and continue until you reach the first mini-roundabout. Continue straight on Bury Street for 0.3 miles and at the second mini-roundabout take your first exit on to Breakspear Road. Take the first right onto Fine Bush Lane and then right onto Breakspear Road North. Continue towards Harefield. At the roundabout, take the first exit onto High Street and Morse Close can be located a short distance down on the left hand side.

Situation

Located on Morse Close, which is easily accessible to Harefield Village and Denham Green's array of shops, amenities, trendy eateries and transport connections (Denham station on the Chiltern line into London) or a short drive to local Metropolitan/ Piccadilly/Central line stations. For the motorist the A40/M25 is a short drive away providing access to London and the Home Counties. Morse Close is well within the catchment area for The Harefield Academy, Harefield Infant School & Harefield Junior School.

Description

A rare opportunity to own a fantastic one bedroom apartment situated within a quiet residential cul-de-sac in Harefield. This wonderful property would make an ideal starter home for first time buyers or would make a rewarding investment opportunity with it being conveniently located to local amenities and completely ready to move into. The accommodation briefly comprises a spacious lounge, a 8ft fitted kitchen with wooden units and ample worktop space and a large double bedroom with ample space for fitted wardrobes. The property is completed by a fully tiled bathroom.

Outside

The property is surrounded by well maintained communal grounds and a mass of residential parking spaces.

detailedDescription:
This four double bedroom detached home boasts spacious interiors throughout offering an abundance of space for the growing family to enjoy. This property is situated in a quiet cul-de-sac and is conveniently close to local amenities and a number of primary and secondary schools.

The ground floor comprises of a welcoming entrance hall with downstairs cloakroom, a front aspect reception/family room, a beautifully presented kitchen/dining room with double doors leading out to the rear garden and access to the utility. Completing the ground floor is a living room, also with double door out to the rear, a study and integral door to the garage. Externally, the front provides off street parking for multiple cars with access to the garage and to the rear is a well-manicured garden mostly laid to lawn with a patio area.

detailedDescription:
Bennett Holmes are pleased to present this two double bedroom first floor maisonette nestled in a peaceful and sought after cul de sac location within Pinner. The property is situated within easy reach of Pinner and Northwood Hills shopping and transport facilities including the Metropolitan Tube line. The property further benefits from gas central heating and double glazing. Outside there is off street parking to the front and private rear garden of approximately 70'. The property is offered on to the market with no upper chain.

Accommodation

Accommodation comprises; own front door leading to the staircase to the first floor, two bedrooms, family bathroom, front facing living room and kitchen with its base and eye level units, gas hob, electric oven, extractor hood, plumbed for washer/dryer, space for fridge freezer and splash back tiling throughout. The family bathroom includes panel enclosed bath with mains operated shower, pedestal wash basin, low flush wc and fully tiled walls and flooring. Other benefits include wood laminate flooring in the hallway, kitchen and living room, fully carpeted in both bedrooms and double glazed and gas central heated throughout.
Outside there is off street parking to the front and a private rear garden of approximately 70'.

Additional Information

Approximately 98 years remaining on the lease

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Spacious family home in convenient location.

Location

London is just 16 miles (approx) and is reached by rail from Northwood Metropolitan Line underground railway station (Baker Street 35 minutes approx). The M40 at Uxbridge (5 miles approx). Watford (4 miles approx), and Harrow (6 miles approx) are all accessible by road and offer multiple shopping centres.

Northwood provides a wide range of shops with multiple stores including Waitrose, Boots and Costa Coffee. There is an interesting selection of quality restaurants serving multi-cultural cuisine and several coffee/snack bars.

Sports and fitness enthusiasts are well catered for with clubs for Golf, Tennis, Football, Cricket and extensive facilities within the David Lloyd Sports and Social Club.

Schooling in the area is good with a choice of state and private schools including: St Helen's and Northwood College for girls, St Martin's, St John's and Merchant Taylors' for boys.

Description

An attractive and well presented, three bedroom semi-detached home that offers potential for further enlargement, subject to the usual planning consents, located within approximately 0.3 miles of Northwood Hills Underground station.

The bright and spacious entrance hallway has a staircase with cupboard under, guest cloakroom and access to the kitchen and sitting/dining room. The extended kitchen is separate and located to the rear of the property with a range of base and wall units, plenty of worktop space and views and access onto the rear garden. The double sitting/dining room is of good size with attractive wall and ceiling lights and a large window to the front of the property. This double reception room has benefited from a recent re-plaster and re-paint. The ground floor is complete with a garage adjoining the kitchen with vehicular access from the front and a doorway to the rear garden.

To the first floor a bright and spacious landing provides access to three bedrooms, all with built in wardrobes. The first floor is complete with a bathroom with a large corner bath and a separate toilet.

To the front of the property there is a block paved driveway and gravel area providing off street parking for multiple cars. The rear garden incorporates a two patio areas, one bordering the house another towards the rear of the plot which are bisected by a large lawn area.

Square Footage: 1202 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A four bedroom semi detached house that has been extended both to the rear and into the loft creating a lovely family home on a popular residential road close to a variety of amenities. The property benefits from a porch and entrance hall, 25ft open plan living/dining room with doors leading to the 10t kitchen, utility room and the downstairs W/C. To the first floor there is a 11ft second bedroom, 11ft third bedroom, 8ft fourth bedroom and family bathroom. To the second floor there is a 20ft master bedroom with potential for an en-suite shower. Outside there is off street parking and a private rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left to the second set of traffic lights. Proceed straight over the mini roundabout on to Charville Lane until you arrive at Langdale Drive and Ullswater close is the second turning on your left.

Situation

Ullswater Close is a popular residential cul-de-sac in Hayes End that is situated on the Hayes/Hillingdon borders. The property is just a stone's throw away from farmland and greenery while offering easy access to the Uxbridge Road with its variety of local shops and schools. Uxbridge Town Centre with its more extensive range of shops, restaurants and tube station is just a short drive away along with Heathrow airport, Stockley Park, Brunel University and the M4 with its links to London and the Home Counties.

Description

A four bedroom semi detached house that has been extended both to the rear and into the loft creating a lovely and spacious family home on a popular residential cul-de-sac. The property benefits from a porch and entrance hall, 25ft open plan living/dining room with doors leading to the 10t kitchen, utility room and the downstairs W/C. To the first floor there is a 11ft second bedroom, 11ft third bedroom, 8ft fourth bedroom and family bathroom. To the second floor there is a 20ft master bedroom with potential for an en-suite shower room.

Outside

The front of the property has been blocked paved creating off street parking to the rear is the private low maintenance garden along with a shared driveway leading to a brick built garage.

detailedDescription:
Carriages by Patrick Ruddy Homes is an exclusive and contemporary collection of just 22 one and two bedroom apartments all built to exacting standards designed to suit the modern lifestyle. Exceptionally well placed being found only moments from West Drayton station which will benefit from the soon to be launched Crossrail network providing fast & frequent services in and out of London. The High Street with its wide variety of shops & independent eateries is just a stone's throw whilst the vibrancy of Uxbridge town centre with its two shopping centres & multi screen cinema is only 3 miles away.

Patrick Ruddy Homes

Patrick Ruddy Homes is a leading, well-established, independent NHBC-registered housebuilder. A financially strong, family-owned and run development company, Patrick Ruddy Homes specialises in bespoke, residential developments and operates primarily in South East England.

Attention to detail is of paramount importance. Experienced and talented teams of architects, construction professionals and sales agents are hand picked to deliver development, carefully managing every scheme to a bespoke design, embracing 'The Ruddy Way' in their approach. By taking pride throughout the entire process.

Situation

Carriages by Patrick Ruddy Homes is an exclusive and contemporary collection of just 22 one and two bedroom apartments all built to exacting standards designed to suit the modern lifestyle. Exceptionally well placed being found only moments from West Drayton station which will benefit from the soon to be launched Crossrail network providing fast & frequent services in and out of London. The High Street with its wide variety of shops & independent eateries is just a stone's throw whilst the vibrancy of Uxbridge town centre with its two shopping centres & multi screen cinema is only 3 miles away.

Description

Flat 27, An exceptionally spacious and light filled third floor two bedroom apartment set over 835 sq ft. This fantastic apartment briefly consists of entrance hallway, an open plan fitted kitchen/living/dining room that opens onto the private balcony area, two well proportioned bedrooms, master with en-suite and family bathroom.

Outside

There is a communal roof garden accessible to all residents whilst each apartment will have their own private outside space via a balcony and there is also an allocated parking bay for one car.

Directions

From West Drayton Train Station turn left onto Station Road, proceed under the railway bridge and take the first turning into Warwick Road. Follow the road as it bears left and you will find the entrance to the development right in front of you.

detailedDescription:
Orchard Property Services are delighted to present this rarely available and deceptively spacious four/five bedroom Town House situated in a gated development built by the reputable builder CALA homes, moments away from Ickenham Village. Located on Storey Close, this immaculately presented property boasts key features including a modern kitchen diner, three bathrooms (including two en-suites) and a converted garage which is currently being utilised as a home office although it could be a fifth bedroom. Within a short distance to local sought after schools and accessible transport links, Storey Close would be an ideal purchase for all types of purchasers looking to move straight into an already made up home, we would recommend an internal inspection.

The ground floor accommodation briefly comprises of an entrance hall with plenty of storage and downstairs W.C, bight and airy kitchen diner with access to the rear garden. The ground floor is complete with a home office/ fifth bedroom and storage. The first boasts two well proportioned bedrooms, four piece family bathroom with shower and a sun lit lounge with two Juliette balconies over looking the garden, on the third floor the property features two double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes and en-suites. Outside boasts own drive for two vehicles and secluded rear garden with patio area, lawn and rear pedestrian access.

Location

Located on one of Ickenham's most prestigious developments, Storey Close is only moments away from local sought after schools including Vyners and Breakspear. Ickenham Village is also a short distance away with its array of local shops, restaurants and public houses. Bus routes are scattered across the Ickenham area with easy access to Ruislip & Uxbridge with the added benefit of Ickenham & West Ruislip Stations (Metropolitan, Piccadilly, Central & Chiltern lines), A40/M40/M25 access is also close by.

address: Brackenhill Close, Oxhey Drive South, Northwood, Middlesex HA6
detailedDescription:
Brackenhill Close comprises six elegant and spacious homes that will provide private and peaceful seclusion within a mature woodland setting and is approached only through controlled access gates. Each home provides up to 4,104 square feet of luxury internal space and most of the homes come with a substantial garden, stone patios and an impressive entrance courtyard.

Two of the homes occupy an Edwardian Manor House, a locally listed building, which has been meticulously restored to its former splendour with the retention of many fine architectural features. Here, the introduction of contemporary elements is sensitively balanced within the classic context
to give rise to highly individual living spaces with graceful proportions.
The four detached houses are newly built in traditional style to blend with their natural surroundings and to conform to the local architectural vernacular. The sumptuous and spacious interiors have been designed and crafted to uncompromising standards that will inspire and delight through many generations.

Location
The idyllic rural setting extends far beyond Brackenhill’s boundaries. Just across the road, is a wonderfully diverse and mature woodland, with a variety of wildlife, woodland paths and a sculpture trail. Northwood has long been regarded as one of the most desirable neighbourhoods within the M25
and has retained a charming ambience. With the coming of the Metropolitan Railway in 1887, Northwood naturally evolved into a choice residential location for those with business in the city, and little has changed since.

This green pocket of Hertfordshire reigns supreme within the golfing fraternity - prestigious Moor Park with its beautiful 17th century Palladian mansion. Northwood, Haste Hill, Pinner Hill, Sandy Lodge and Batchworth golf clubs are among the many that scatter the region. Other sports also find favour with local cricket, tennis and football clubs, leisure and equestrian centres as well as clay shooting at the Holland and Holland Shooting Grounds.

N.B. Photos taken prior to a recent let.

detailedDescription:
A stunning detached three double bedroom bungalow situated in rarely available 'Frays Avenue' boasting impressive generous room sizes, glorious gardens with extensive outbuildings, river frontage, impressive driveway with ample parking, and tremendous potential for further development on a quiet cul-de-sac.

Occupying a prestigious address in the sought after “Garden City” estate and boasting a mature plot with beautifully tended gardens and additional outbuildings is this most attractive three double bedroom detached bungalow ideal for immediate family living with immense potential for further development.

The extended and roomy accommodation has been exceptionally well cared for and is well worthy of your early inspection. Any discerning purchaser will be impressed with the living/dining room which is the hub of the house and a perfect space for entertaining, comprising of a wonderful dining area with French patio doors leading to the side garden. The living area is wide and spacious with a stunning brick fireplace and multiple windows providing views of the greenery in the scenic garden. Oakwood flooring runs from the entrance, all the way through to the bedrooms and living room creating a beautiful sense of flow. The kitchen/breakfast room has a range of country-style solid oak fitted units and features exposed brick detailing throughout. The luxurious modern family bathroom has a double sink basin, large corner jacuzzi bath and spacious walk-in shower, along with stylish bathroom storage and underfloor heating. A second sleek bathroom contains an additional shower. The bedrooms are all of generous proportion, boasting fitted wardrobes. The master bedroom leads to a separate dressing area with floor-to-ceiling fitted wardrobes and generous storage.

Outside

The property is located in a tranquil setting with stunning surroundings.

The front garden features a large area of block paved surface providing parking for up to five vehicles with an area laid to lawn and attractive planting. The rear garden boasts stunning views of the Frays River. The garden has been tastefully screened creating privacy and seclusion and includes an area laid to lawn and crazy paving ideal for entertaining in the summer months.

An extensive purpose-built outhouse to the rear provides additional amenity space, currently divided into a utility room (with separate W.C.), office, store and workshop. The outhouse benefits from mains water, drainage, electricity supply and UPVC double glazed doors and windows.

Heating & Hot Water – An upgraded condensing gas boiler provides heating and hot water via an unvented mains pressure hot water cylinder. Upgraded double panel radiators. Electric underfloor heating is provided for the bathrooms. Loft insulated to reduce heat waste.

Windows – UPVC double glazed windows with leaded glass. Modern composite front door.

Services - Mains gas, electricity, water, and drainage.

detailedDescription:
Chain free - This three bedroom detached bungalow will immediately impress with an ideal, secluded location offering peaceful living in one of North Ruislip's most desirable cul-de-sacs.

Directions

From leaving our Ruislip office turn left and continue to the end of the High Street. Turn left at the mini roundabout onto Bury Street. Turn left at Ladygate Lane and take the third turning on the left to Whiteheath Avenue. Take the first left turning into Grasmere Avenue and the property is located a short distance down on the right.

Situation

Located on a quiet residential road in close proximity to Ruislip High Street offering trendy eateries, shops and transport. Ruislip tube station (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) is at the end of the High Street whilst West Ruislip (Central line/br) station is also within easy walking distance. For the motorist the A40/M40 and M25 road links offering easy access to London and the Home Counties. For families there are a selection of excellent local schools to include bwi, Whiteheath, Sacred Heart and Bishop Ramsey. Highgrove gym and swimming pool are a short walk away.

Description

Upon entering the home through the side of the property, the hallway splits off into all rooms. The the left side and the front of the property are two bedrooms, both benefiting of built in wardrobes. Bedroom three is accessed through the dining room in the centre of the home which also leads to the sitting room at the rear with views of the garden. The middle of the property boasts a large living room that is in excess of 21ft, with access to the garden. Completing the home is the family bathroom, kitchen and breakfast room.

Outside

The front of property is laid to lawn with side access to the front door and to the worksop. The rear garden has a patio area towards the property and the rest in laid to lawn with a storage shed and a greenhouse.

The apartment is accessed via a secure communal entrance and comprises a hallway with two built in storage cupboards, two bedrooms, a three-piece family bathroom, a spacious open plan living room-diner and a modern fully fitted kitchen. Recently built in 2019, this apartment is well maintained and includes the added benefit of 8.5 years remaining on the NHBC certificate and an allocated parking bay.

The property is located within walking distance of Uxbridge Town Centre’s wide range of shopping, leisure and transport facilities including Uxbridge Underground Station with its Piccadilly and Metropolitan Line services leading into the heart of London and beyond. The property is also close to Hillingdon Sports and Leisure Complex, Brunel University, Hillingdon Hospital, Uxbridge College and various local parks and popular schools.

detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment situated in a highly sought after development in North Ruislip. This superb property briefly comprises, hall, open plan kitchen and lounge leading to a private balcony, two double bedrooms one with an en suite shower room and a contemporary bathroom. Further benefits include one secure allocated parking space, bike storage area in underground car park, communal lift to all floors, security alarm, gas central heating, double glazing and video entry phone system. Ruislip Lido and Woods are moments away making this the perfect setting for relaxed yet luxury living.

Direction

From our office on Ruislip High Street proceed left to a mini roundabout and take your first exit left onto Bury Street. Continue to the next mini roundabout and continue straight. Take the next turning on your right into Reservoir Road. Park Wood Court apartments can be located a short way up on the left hand side.

Situation

Park Wood Court is located in a unique development in Reservoir Road just off Ducks Hill Road and close to the Ruislip Lido complex and Ruislip Woods. Ruislip High Street located 1.4 miles away offers an array of shops, restaurants and coffee houses as well as excellent transport links via the bus station and Metropolitan and Piccadilly line station at Ruislip. Nearby West Ruislip station offers services by Chiltern Railways and the Central line on the London Underground. The location is within easy reach of the M25 and M40. There are also a number of highly regarded schools for all age groups in the local vicinity.

Description

Retreat to Park Wood court, a luxury and ultra stylish development positioned perfectly amongst peaceful surroundings and enjoying a great location being moments from open woodland and park space. This luxury, executive style apartment boasts light and airy rooms and a private balcony. Once inside, the accommodation boasts a contemporary open kitchen living room where there are patio doors leading to a private balcony creating a great space for relaxing with its stunning views. The modern kitchen includes an integrated cooker, fridge freezer, dishwasher and unit mounted lighting. There are two bedrooms, the large master room includes an en-suite shower room with both rooms having built in wardrobes. The family bathroom is to the front of the apartment. This superb residence benefits from strong rental returns making it an ideal investment opportunity.

Outside

Well maintained communal grounds and one allocated, underground parking space. The property has a private balcony.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Malt Works is a stunning collection of contemporary 1 and 2 bedroom apartments in the heart of Eastcote and available with Help to Buy. The development is now ready to move into, and buyers who act quickly can still take advantage of the government Stamp Duty incentive.

The apartments have a high specification throughout which includes premium matt white handless German Häcker kitchens complimented by black Bosch appliances, matt black fixtures and finished with acrylic 'stone' worktops and full-height splashbacks.

The bathrooms and en suites, finished in large grey Vitra porcelain tiles, are beautifully crafted with crisp white sanitary ware, integrated Vitra wall cabinets and trending matt black fixtures by Crosswater.

The residents will also benefit from a striking interior designed entrance lobby, colour video door entry system to all apartments, residents lift, communal garden and private gated parking.

Eastcote Overground station is located within a 2-minute walk of the development providing journeys to Baker Street and Kings Cross in only 28 and 37 minutes, respectively.

Eastcote is a popular North West London suburb and has an eclectic mix of cafes, brunch spots, charming pubs and green space. For nature lovers Ruislip Lido, which boasts a 60-acre lake and its own sandy beach, and Colne Valley Regional Park, with an abundance of natural lakes and woodland are just minutes away.

At Life Less Ordinary our foremost concern continues to be for the safety of our clients, prospective buyers and our staff. We know that many of you will still want to move home and we are here to help make that possible in a safe and responsible environment.

Adhering to government guidelines at all times, we are pleased to still be able to carry out viewings and both in person or virtually - whichever suits you best.

Images shown are of the Show Home and CGIs for indicative purposes only.
For full availability and specific floorplans please enquire.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from: £250,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

A particulalry spacious one bedroom top floor apartment presented in very good condition throughout. This property would make a perfect starter home or a solid investment opportunity. Close to bus routes, easy access to Ruislip High Street - including Met/Picc line station and no onward chain.

The property has a communal entrance with stairs to all floors, video entry-phone system, use of communal garden and residents parking.

Once inside the apartment, a welcoming hallway has doors to all rooms. The spacious living room has attractive wood flooring and has ample space for both dining and relaxing and there is a large bay window flooding the room with plenty of natural light. The kitchen has a range of fitted units, ample work surfaces and appliance space. The spacious double bedroom benefits from fitted wardrobes and completing the apartment is a fresh modern bathroom comprising of a white three-piece suite.

Rental Yield approx 3.6% gross

Situated only a short distance from Ruislip’s bustling high street which offers a wide variety of shops, bras, restaurants and coffee shops. For the commuter the Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line Station offers a swift and regular service into Central London and The City.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A superbly appointed Victorian residence, offering generous four bedroom accommodation which boasts ample character with many original features throughout. The property is positioned in a very convenient location for Northwood’s amenities including three schools, two golf courses and Ruislip Lido all within a 10-minute walk. There are two Metropolitan line stations within a 10-minute walk, both providing swift and regular connections into London.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway, front aspect reception room with a bay window ( used as a formal dining room), an open plan split level kitchen/breakfast room and a second reception room with an attractive original fireplace. Completing the ground floor is a conservatory addition and guest cloakroom. The first floor showcases two double bedrooms with fitted wardrobes, followed by two further well-sized bedrooms and a stunningly presented family bathroom ( with walk in shower).

detailedDescription:
Spacious 2 double bed maisonette / investment property: A much larger than average and extremely well presented 2 bedroom maisonette very conveniently located near bus routes to the Bath Road, Hayes & Harlington mainline station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022) and London Heathrow Airport.

Offering real spacious accommodation this split level property is also within easy walking distance of Harlington's shopping facilities and William Byrd school. The M4/M25 networks only a short drive away.

Features include a spacious lounge with private balcony, fitted kitchen with some appliances, superb fully tiled bathroom and good size double bedrooms.

Other benefits include residents permit parking, private garden, double glazed windows and gas central heating.

Ground Floor

Entrance

uPVC door.

Stairs to first floor

First Floor

First Floor Landing

Wood laminate flooring, built in cupboard and a radiator.

Bathroom

7' 6'' x 4' 7'' (2.3m x 1.4m) Tiled floor and a towel radiator. Three piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed bath with mixer tap, back to wall low level W.C. And a hand basin on storage unit. Frosted double glazed window.

Kitchen

10' 5'' x 6' 6'' (3.2m x 2m) Wood laminate flooring, radiator and wall mounted gas central heating boiler. Fitted wall and base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit, gas hob, electric oven, integrated fridge/freezer, washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to rear aspect

Lounge

12' 9'' x 10' 5'' (3.9m x 3.2m) Parquet flooring and radiator. Two double glazed windows to rear aspect

Exterior

Private garden and residents permit parking

Tenure

Leasehold: Approximately 117 years although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

Service Charge: Vendors solicitor will confirm exact charges levied.

Ground Rent: To be confirmed by Vendors solicitor

About Harlington

Harlington is a district of the London Borough of Hillingdon, on the northern perimeter of London Heathrow Airport. The district adjoins Hayes to the north and shares a railway station with the larger district, which is its post town, on the Great Western Main Line to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking the Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The village is surrounded by Green Belt land and open fields and also contains a parade of shops to include a Pharmacy, Co-operative Convenience store, Newsagents, a variety of restaurants and fast food outlets and a Post Office. There are also four public houses: The Great Western, The Pheasant, The Wheatsheaf, and The White Hart. The village also boasts two churches, a Baptist church and a Church of England church, St Peter & St Paul's and William Byrd School. The village High Street is also home to the Harlington Locomotive Society and West London Models.

The earliest surviving mention of Harlington appears to be in a 9th-century charter in which land at Botwell in Hayes was said to be bounded on the west by "Hygeredington" and "Lullinges" tree. The first of these must be Harlington; the second has not been identified. The boundary between Hayes and Harlington, which may have been defined by the date of this charter, was later marked by North Hyde Road and Dawley Road.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
14 Brompton House, Harefield Place, The Drive, Ickenham

A luxurious three bedroom, three bathroom second floor penthouse apartment in the new contemporary collection. Boasting an impressive wrap around terrace which offers views of the Colne Valley Regional Park. The large Master Bedroom features a luxury en-suite bathroom and dressing area.

Harefield Place is an exquisite ensemble of just 25 two and three bedroom luxury apartments, nestling amidst 8.5 acres of verdant greenbelt countryside, yet within easy reach of central London. Ideally located in Ickenham, off one of the most desirable private roads in Middlesex, this magnificent development offers nine spectacular homes in an original Georgian mansion house, with a further 16 superb apartments in an adjacent purpose-designed new building. These exceptional apartments sit within extensive, beautifully landscaped grounds, enjoying the exclusive use of private leisure facilities and a secluded lake, with unparalleled views over South Buckinghamshire and beyond.

Residents leisure amenities - At Harefield Place, you can take the time to truly look after yourself, with exclusive access to luxury wellness facilities including an indoor pool, fully-equipped gym, sauna & steam room and hot tub. Plus, with a tennis court within the grounds you can polish up your serve or take a relaxing stroll around the beautiful gardens and relax by the lake.

Once a gentleman's stately country residence, Harefield Place is a historic Grade II listed house that has been lovingly restored to its former glory. Behind the elegant Georgian façade, original features abound, from the imposing entrance hall to the high ceilings and tall sash windows that every apartment offers. Complementing this understated grandeur is an exquisite modern masterpiece, which offers more contemporary open-plan layouts along with private balconies and terraces. Whether modern or traditional, each space has been creatively conceived as a perfect backdrop to your lifestyle.

Despite its tranquil setting and old world charm, Harefield Place is surprisingly well connected: Whether heading to the West End, the City, Europe or further afield, road, rail and air travel are all easily accessible. With three of the ten most in-demand Tube stops all within less than 3 miles, travelling into central London is speedy and direct, taking just over 30 minutes. Ickenham station (6 minutes), Hillingdon station (8 minutes) and Ruislip station (9 minutes) are on the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines, while West Ruislip station (8 minutes) is on the Central line. West Ruislip station also provides rail travel into London. By car, the M40, M25 and M4 are each a short drive; the proximity of Stockley Park and Uxbridge Business Park (both within a 15 minute drive) enhance the prospect of a work-life balance.

Covid-19 update: March 2021
While we continue in lockdown, the housing market remains open for business. We continue to take customer calls and our Marketing Suite and Show Homes remain open. The safety of both our staff and our customers remains paramount. As a result, we have strict measures in place and viewings are available on an appointment only basis. Social distancing measures must be adhered to at all times.

If you prefer not to visit, we are also available over the phone and we can offer virtual tours of many of our homes.

address: Plot 102 The Dice, St Andrew's Park, Uxbridge UB10
detailedDescription:
This stunning 936 Sq Ft first floor three bedroom apartment is situated in a parkland setting overlooking the 37 acre Dowding Park. The apartment is built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The new state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 40 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge’s town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

Specification

**£10,000 deposit contribution and ftb stamp duty paid** Plot 78 is a stunning 753 Sq Ft first floor two bedroom apartment in a parkland setting overlooking the 37 acre Dowding Park. The apartment is built to a high specification by St Modwen Homes and boasts contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings. Please call Coopers for more information.

Situation

The Dice is within close proximity of Uxbridge Station in the High Street, which is on both the Metropolitan and Piccadilly Lines. Central London is approximately 45 minutes away with Oxford Circus being reachable in 44 minutes and St Pancras in 49 minutes. Uxbridge town centre has two shopping centres, a bustling High Street and a choice of cafes, bars and restaurants. Just outside the development in Hillingdon Road is a bus stop, providing excellent links to the local area. The new state of the art 720 pupil primary school, the John Locke Academy, is an integral part of St. Andrew’s Park, as is the 37 acre new public park. The museum, theatre, restaurants and leisure facilities at St. Andrew’s Park will build on the contribution that the scheme brings to the increased vitality of Uxbridge’s town centre. The Dice is also a short distance from the outstanding Brunel University.

Development

The Dice is the latest phase by St Modwen Homes in its superb St Andrews Park development that offers 'Help To Buy'. The Dice is a collection of seven beautifully considered pavilions nestling above 37 acres of parkland with 105 exceptional apartments. There are 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments with contemporary interiors and streamlined spaces featuring high quality worktops, fixtures and fittings.

detailedDescription:
Thoughtfully designed to optimise every inch, this beautiful extensive 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom detached home boasts beauty, comfort and stylish interiors.

Set on a peaceful cul de sac this property resides close to local shops, restaurants, schools and transport links in Northwood. From bespoke designs to its impressive layout across 3 floors, this magnificent home offers impeccable living to the highest standard.

As you enter this property you will be impressed with its versatility. The ground floor consists of an incredible open plan area merging the kitchen, breakfast and main living zone.

This well-lit space benefits from bi folding doors and skylights that let in natural light and open up to the outdoors. With custom built cupboards, built in appliances, an island, and contemporary taps, the kitchen blends well with the rest of the space. There is also a family room with an ensuite which could be used as an additional bedroom, a large dining room, and a good-sized play room.

The first floor boasts 3 well-proportioned bedrooms with fitted cupboards and a large bathroom. The second floor is home to the generous master bedroom with ensuites and a study.

Outside to the rear the private garden is the perfect haven to relax in. With a patio area and elevated lawn space the garden also boasts an outhouse with WC, perfect for a home office or gym.

At the front, the gated driveway can easily accommodate multiple cars and benefit from being parked in the garage too.

This is a rare opportunity not to be missed. For more info, contact infinity today.

detailedDescription:
A spacious five bedroom semi-detached bungalow located in The Greenway, which is a popular residential road in Ickenham. The property offers an abundance of space, a flexible floor plan and a fantastic sized garden. This property is the perfect choice with it's convenient location, within close proximity to local transport links, West Ruislip/ Ickenham (Central line) tube stations, (Metropolitan/Piccadilly) providing reliable links into the City and West End. For the motorist the A40 is a short drive away providing access to Central London.

Directions

From our Ickenham office, turn right and then left at the end of the road. Proceed up Ickenham high road until you reach the second set of traffic lights, directly after this take the left turning onto The Greenway. The property is located a few houses down on the left hand side.

Situation

The Greenway is a quiet road in a great location in Ickenham. Its a bungalow filled road with transport links and shops a short walk away. West Ruislip train station is approximately a 5 minute walk away and this is serviced by the Central Line and Chiltern Line, servicing London and the home counties. Ickenham station is approximately a 15 minute walk away and you have access there to the Metropolitan Line and Piccadilly Line. Local shops and restaurants are close by aswell. The A40 and M25 are in short driving distance providing excellent access into London and the surrounding area.

Description

This attractive home boasts five bedrooms, a large reception, fitted kitchen and two bathrooms arranged over two floors, making it ideal for the large or growing family looking for extra space. On entering the property there is a hallway leading to both bedrooms at the front of the property which benefit from modern decor and large windows filling the rooms with natural light. Heading towards the rear of the home is the well equipped fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, space for a breakfast table and direct access into the garden. The property also benefits from a further downstairs bedroom, a well-presented downstairs bathroom with a four piece suite and a separate reception room offering a large, versatile space. To the first floor you find the spacious master bedroom with a good sized dressing room, bedroom four and the second modern family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property is large paved driveway, providing plenty of off-street parking. To the rear is a spacious, well presented garden benefiting from a perfectly manicured lawn area and a patio area to enjoy dining al fresco and summer entertaining. To the rear of the garden is a timber built summerhouse with power and electric.
