detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £395,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

Property Description

*property market remains open for viewings & valuations in person or by virtual appointment*

A stunning, modern and rarely available three bedroom first floor apartment in West Drayton, providing a fabulous home for young professional couples, commuters or investors looking to add to their portfolio. Recently built in 2018, this immaculate apartment is well maintained and includes the benefit of 7 years remaining on the NHBC certificate.

The apartment is accessed via a secure communal entrance at ground level with a lift and stairs leading to the upper floors. The property comprises an entrance hallway with spacious built in storage cupboards, a spacious open plan living room, dining room and fully fitted modern kitchen, three double bedrooms, en-suite shower room off the master bedroom and a three-piece family bathroom. Externally, there is a balcony accessed from the living room, communal gardens and an allocated underground parking bay.

Constabulary Close is located just off of Station Road moments from Yiewsley High street with its excellent selection of shops, restaurants, bars and transport links including West Drayton's Main Line Station and future Crossrail link. The M4, M25, Heathrow Airport, Hillingdon Hospital and Stockley Business Park are also just a short drive away. Book your viewing today to avoid missing out.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
2 bedroom first floor flat / near crossrail: This well presented 2 bedroom first floor flat is situated perfectly for Hayes & Harlington mainline station to Paddington (Crossrail due 2022) and offers easy access to The Parkway, the M4/M25 motorway network and London Heathrow Airport.

This property features accommodation to include kitchen / reception room, fitted bathroom and 2 bedrooms.

Ideal for the first time or investment buyer.

First Floor

Entrance Hall

Tiled flooring.

Reception/Kitchen

Base units with worktops to include a single drainer sink unit with mixer tap, electric oven with hob and extractor fan, space for fridge/freezer, plumbing for washing machine and part tiled walls and splashbacks. Double glazed window to aspect

Bedroom 1

Laminate flooring and double glazed window.

Bedroom 2

Laminate flooring, electric heater and double glazed window.

Bathroom

Vinyl flooring. Three-piece bathroom suite to include a panel enclosed bath, wall mounted hand basin with storage under, low level W.C. And part tiled walls and splashbacks.

Exterior

Tenure

Leasehold: 125 years from 29 December 2005 although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact term remaining.

Service Charge: Approximately £920.00 per annum to include buildings insurance although Vendors solicitor will confirm exact charges levied.

Ground Rent: £175.00 per annum (to be confirmed by Vendors solicitor)

About Hayes

Hayes is a town in west London. Historically in Middlesex, Hayes became part of the London Borough of Hillingdon in 1965. Hayes has an abundance of retail parks, shopping centres and a modern leisure centre with swimming pool completed in 2010. Stockley Business Park and Championship Golf course, set in 240 acres of rolling countryside, border Hayes to the west.
Hayes adjoins Harlington which borders London Heathrow Airport to the south and shares a railway station with the smaller district on the Great Western mainline to Paddington. The Crossrail project linking Hayes and Harlington station to Canary Wharf is due to complete in 2022. The journey time to Canary Wharf will be just 34 minutes. Other London stations will include Bond Street, Tottenham Court Road, Farringdon and Liverpool Street.

The Uxbridge Road runs directly through the centre of Hayes to Shepherds Bush and the town offers other excellent transport links with the M4/M25 motorway networks being linked via the Hayes-By-Pass to the A40(M) into Central London and M40 to Birmingham.
Hayes has a long history. The area appears in the Domesday Book of 1086.

Landmarks in the area include the Grade II listed Parish Church, St Mary's - the central portion of the church survives from the twelfth century and it remains in use (the church dates back to 830 A.D.)- and Barra Hall, a Grade II listed manor house. The town's oldest public house - the Adam and Eve, on the Uxbridge Road - though not the original seventeenth-century structure, has remained on the same site since 1665.

address: Bury Street, Ruislip, Greater London HA4
detailedDescription:
This excellent four bedroom detached property comprises of; entrance hallway leading to a spacious lounge with and large double glazed windows to the front; a separate dining room with double doors leading to the rear garden; fully fitted kitchen with all appliances included; a third reception room/office with double glazed window and Velux windows to allow extra natural light; stairway leading to the master bedroom with three piece on-suite shower room; a further 3 double bedrooms with double glazed windows; three piece family bathroom with shower over bath. The property has a large driveway for at least three cars, as well as a generously sized rear garden.

Bury Street is located in a peaceful residential area that is ideally located in Ruislip. This property has fantastic transport links with both South and West Harrow Underground stations, as well as Harrow on the Hill train station - all of which are within walking distance from this property. This enables residents to easily access the Greater London area - including central London which is only a 25 minute journey away, making it ideal for commuters. Harrow's town centre is only a 20 minute walk away from this property, offering a wide range of high street and independent shops, cafe's, restaurants and bars. Harrow has plenty of amenities to enjoy, including tours of the famous Harrow School, lots of different museums and a golf course which offers a full course for experts, lessons and even a mini-golf course.

Ruislips close proximity to London ensures that rental demand is always high in this area as more people want a small town or village feel away from the city, whilst still being close to the centre of London. Harrow benefits from property prices which are 30.1% lower than the London average and yet prices have grown by over £100,000 in the last 5 years alone. This incredible property is sure to have a lot of interest so enquire today!

Offering to the market this luxurious three-bedroom top floor duplex apartment in immaculate condition throughout. The luxury apartment comprises of three double bedrooms, one bedroom being an en-suite shower and w/c, spacious open plan lounge to fully fitted kitchen with all integrated appliances, two large private wooden decked balconies overlooking the Grand Union Canal. Other benefits are allocated underground parking, entry phone system, double glazing throughout, underfloor heating, two separate entrances, ample storage spread across two floors, high level of natural light throughout the property. Didcot House is a luxury development of apartments, with far reaching views across the river Frays and yet still set within a short walk of West Drayton High Street with its variety of shops and British Rail train station. detailedDescription:
A well presented three bedroom family home that is offered to the market with no onward chain and the potential to extend subject to the usual planning consents. The property comprises an entrance hallway, downstairs W/C, 13ft kitchen/breakfast room, 15ft lounge, 13ft master bedroom with en-suite shower room, 9ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom and family bathroom. Outside of the property there is an allocated parking space and private rear garden.

Directions

From leaving our office on Hillingdon Hill proceed left and at the first set of traffic lights turn right onto Harlington Road. Proceed straight over the mini roundabout and at your first set of lights proceed straight over. Turn left onto Corwell Gardens and follow the road onto Corwell Lane. Appleby Close is the first turning on your right.

Situation

Appleby Close is situated close to the Harlington Road offering easy access to local shops and schools, bus/road links including the M4/M40 with its links to London and the Home Counties along with Stockley Park and Heathrow Airport. Uxbridge town centre with its multitude of shops, bars, restaurants and Metropolitan/Piccadilly line station is a short drive away.

Description

A spacious and lovely three bedroom family home that is offered to the market with no onward chain and the potential to extend subject to the usual planning consents. The ground floor of the house comprises of an entrance hallway, downstairs W/C, 13ft kitchen/breakfast room and 15ft lounge. To the first floor you have the 13ft master bedroom with en-suite shower room, 9ft second bedroom, 8ft third bedroom and family bathroom.

Outside

To the front of the property, there is a paved driveway creating off-street parking for multiple vehicles. To the rear is a private garden that is mainly laid to artificial lawn and bordered with a variety of shrubs and plants along a large garage at the rear.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Perfectly positioned moments away from Ruislip High street this stunning 3 bedroom semi-detached chain free house will impress those seeking space, style, and luxury. Finished to an exceptionally high standard throughout the home boasts expansive indoor and outdoor living and a beautifully appointed interior. Once entered the property on the ground floor there is the hallway with doors leading to the front living room which also has a large window filling the room with natural light and overlooking the front garden along with a nice feature fire place. Heading towards the rear is the impressive kitchen/family/dining area which has been cleverly designed to offer spacious open plan living. The large room boasts a 29ft space with modern underfloor heating and enjoys a well fitted high specification German kitchen where there is a excellent range of storage, worktop space and a selection of high quality integrated appliances. There is also a large built in island with further storage space and a large sky light. Modern bi- folding doors have been added to the family area to offer wonderful views and further maximize the indoor/outdoor space which is great for spring/summer months. There is use of a separate utility room which is accessed from the kitchen making a great useful space for further storage and appliances. Also the property incorporates a large shower room with a w.c on the ground floor. The ground level is made up of engineered wood floor and porcelain tiles. On the first floor are three impressive bedrooms all of which have been thoughtfully designed to offer comfortable well proportioned spaces. Completing the first floor is a large, stylish bathroom with use of both a shower and bath along with seperate w/c. The property can be further expanded and enhanced in the loft under permitted development or obtaining planning.

This really is a most impressive home with its stunning interior, high specification and spacious light filled rooms all ready to offer for the ultimate luxury lifestyle.

Outside - The front of the house offers off street parking via the paved driveway and there is a garage to the side. To the rear is a private garden laid to lawn and with a large patio made with porcelain tiles. The rear also incorporates a large shed which is functional for storage and also houses the 1.33kWp solar system that provides up to £500 per a year cash back on your energy bills for another 17 years.

Agents Note: Please note the solar panels are solely owned by the vendor and ownership will be transferred on completion.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market chain free and 0.1 Miles from Uxbridge Town Centre, this 582sq ft one bedroom maisonette offers light filled rooms, perfectly arranged on the first floor. With clean and fresh interiors, this property has been maintained by the current owners and comes with a brand new lease upon completion.

The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway with built in cupboards and access to all rooms. The reception room is spacious with a window overlooking the grounds and the kitchen is fitted with modern units and a large storage cupboard.

The bedroom is a good size double room and the bathroom comprises a three piece suite including a panel enclosed bath, wash basin and WC.

Outside, there are small communal grounds and residents parking.

Iffley Close is situated off Montague Road in the heart of the Town Centre and within very easy reach of the multiple shopping facilities, restaurants and bars and the Metropolitan/Piccadilly Line Tube Station.
